exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: Once I've completed a session of a yank and drag while barking I look around to make sure the cheap seats enjoyed their time (eye twitching) and then I'll settle down for a much needed nap. Sometimes I'll do another round of a biscuit dance or I'll slip off to another room to bark at nothing, my best advice is to never leave your audience wanting more. It's important to be able to read your audience, what is their tolerance level, should you ramp it up or call it a night, usually the number of hey heys is a good indicator for when to take your curtain call. Be the best that you can be, bark until you hear the hey heys or the fridge door opens, Ancient Basset Saying.

I've developed neat and tidy tendencies, that's what happens when you live with someone who has issues, I ate most of my biscuit crumbs but left a few for The Warden, it's the right thing to do, it gives her a purpose. I also don't like someone watching over me while I eat a meal, I developed this tendency from The Warden, she doesn't like it when I stare at her, inch forward, beg and drool while she eats, she has issues. It's alright if someone watches me when I eat a treat that way they'll know when it's time to give me another one, they call this forward thinking. We all have differences that's what makes us unique but in the end we all want the same thing, quality treats and a platter of cheese, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: I found that if you scratch a certain door on the treat cabinet it will magically open, now I have to wait for the staff to get the hint (they are easily distracted by other things besides me). After looking at this picture The Warden decided to make a few changes, get rid of the anything that's not treat related and categorize the treats for easy access to the good stuff (it's important to be efficient during a treat crisis). As a side note the treat cabinet is made in a distressed motif which allows for scratching without anyone getting riled up and distressed. Sometimes you have to ask for what you want, so go ahead and do what you gotta do to achieve your goal, if scratching doesn't work then try barking, Ancient Basset Saying.

There was a noise violation and it wasn't against me, it was directed at The Warden for yelling hey heys. When I bark everyone listens and pays attention, they look around to see what I'm barking at (usually nothing), there's excitement in the air, maybe I'll chase something but chances are it's just to get The Warden riled up (easy to do). It's not a criminal offense to bark at nothing during the day (I sleep through the night) but what is criminal is to hear Shimmy Shaking Momma sing, as a side note she has a shady past and has been arrested for doing the shimmy (public disturbance, some things you can't unsee). If you need to be heard bark loud and proud, if you need to be seen get front and center and if you deserve a treat let someone know, Ancient Basset Saying.

When security shows up just walk away and try not to make eye contact, if confronted go on the defense and say your rights have been violated by not having access to the garden. However, since there's surveillance evidence showing that you did dig a hole, there was a heaping pile of dirt all over and you were covered in dirt (minor details), it's best at this point to admit nothing and call in your legal team. In life things happen but don't let that stop you from moving on, bark loud and proud, dig deeper and sniff like no one's waiting, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to Miss Lilly as a baby, one of the few pictures ever taken of this slip of a girl. When we went to choose our new family member she was running with a pack of nine, she was the runt of the litter who was tripping over her ears trying to keep up with everyone else, it only took a few minutes for her to be scooped up and declare that she was the chosen one. It took no time at all for Miss Lilly to realize that she had her work cut out for her and she started training them as soon as they reached their forever home. Having a forever home is one of the greatest gifts you can give, also having an adaptable family who are easy to train and offer treats is an added bonus, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: The hospital corners didn't hold up to the last dig, bury and bark but the good news is I buried my biscuit and I had no problem napping after an eventful eye twitching moment. The Warden see's this as an opportunity to wash the blankets and re-establish some order, she will make another attempt to tighten up the hospital corners before the next round of a yank and drag while barking, something to look forward to. Without me The Warden would be lost, have no purpose or locked up, the community should be thanking me. Count your blessings every day and be thankful for those who take the time to tuck in your corners and share their treats, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Some will say I'm possessed when I'm burying my biscuit, I'll dig, bury and bark, similar to the yank and drag while barking except my focus is on the biscuit, also this ritual can be referred to as the biscuit dance. There's no sense in trying to distract me until my mission is completed because I won't be able to hear anything you say from all the noise but there is an exception to every rule, dangle a piece of cheese mid yank and you'll have my full attention. Rituals are a part of who you are, you be you, so go ahead and dig, bury and bark or do your yank and drag while barking, if someone wants your attention they'll know what to do, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: I was helping out in the garden, pointing out areas that were being neglected, that's exactly how I was feeling, the weeds were getting more attention than I was. So I decided to do something about it, I watched The Warden closely and anticipated her next move, when she turned around to her surprise I was ready to be weeded and given some attention. A word of caution while waiting for your turn to get a little attention, pick a comfortable spot, somewhere that'll get them motivated to choose you next. As a side note no plants were harmed, I found a soft place to wait and not all the weeds were removed (time constraints). If you need something then do something about it, bark until you are heard, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: The Warden came running into the room, she was armed and with that look in her eyes she was taking no prisoners (she had a fly swatter). It looked like she was in a sword fight, she was ducking and weaving, swatting at the air and creating a nice breeze. Then the fly landed on the front door glass, she slowly stalked the enemy, her weapon poised to eliminate, that's when I reached up and snatched the fly right out of the air, and that my friends is how it's done. Don't send in someone with a flair for the theatrics if you want a job done quickly, send in a basset who has fly snatching experience. Take pride in all the little things you do because that's who you are, if you shine bright others will notice, Ancient Basset Saying.

When you have the status of an amateur gardener you have to become creative with the names of plants in your garden, this particular plant is called the barking hostas, it's a hardy plant that can sustain a basset intrusion and it stays below the height of the basset tail. Other varmints will use this plant as a hiding place away from the prying eyes of its predators and the surveillance cameras. After the rain or morning dew the leaves are heavy with water and if you run through it you'll get wet, good news bad news scenario, you are wet but your bath schedule moves to the next season. Embrace what nature has provided, even if you get wet you'll enjoy the thought of making someone's eye twitch, bark loud and proud, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8
iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: One of these things don't belong but I'm willing to share my space, at least this plant travels upwards and leaves me more room to stretch out. Some plants take up a lot of space, some are lumpy if you lay on them and there are a few that are easy to dig up (that's why there are no flowers in this garden). I especially enjoy when The Warden weeds the garden, it's encouraging and gives me the incentive to help dig and if a weed happens to get dug up all the better. Helping each other out is a great way to spend time together plus it saves you from having to hunt them down when it's time for a treat, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to when I became one with the plants, a day when there were no little ugly fences keeping me out of the garden, those were the days. Yes I might've kicked up a little dirt but who wouldn't, it was there for the digging. I also got my line tangled around a bush so The Warden had to come to my rescue, it was a bit of a scene but well worth the excitement. That was the day the little ugly fences were installed, strategically placed to eliminate anyone from having fun. If you don't try something you'll never know what fun you'll have, sniffing leads to good things, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: Yes I have a few expectations while I'm lounging outside stretched out on my blanket beside The Warden, she has this long reach backscratcher which gives her easy access to scratch me while she's reading, wouldn't want her to be uncomfortable. There are a few times when she suddenly stops (turning a page) and she loses her focus so I have to remind her, just a bit of whining will set her back on course. It took awhile to get used to the backscratcher but now when I see it I immediately get in the scratching position. Scratching someone else's back can be rewarding, it's all about teamwork and being part of the team is living the dream, Ancient Basset Saying.

media.title: I just got told that it's time to go back inside, I don't mind but it's important that I give a little attitude, if I immediately start to follow their commands it'll raise their expectations and besides I'm not a follower unless there's cheese and then I will follow you anywhere. Giving a little attitude helps build a stronger relationship and sometimes can be rewarding, especially when they aren't flexible and expect you to do things on their first request, I like to hold out for the negotiations, that's usually when you hear key words like treat. Being patient pays off, take your time and continue sniffing until they start bribing you, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Do you ever get the feeling you're being watched, I do, because every time I open my eyes someone is hovering over me watching, not that I mind, it saves me from hunting them down wondering what they're doing. It's also a way of giving back to the community, if The Warden is focused on me it keeps her off the streets and out of trouble. It can also be considered as a form of therapy, watching me breathe helps calm her nerves and gives her something to focus on besides the Dyson. Even when you're doing nothing it can be something to someone else, just being you is a gift that keeps on giving, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: While out on our walk we meet this lady and a small fluffy one handed pickup dog, while I was sniffing I unknowingly stepped on her toes (she was wearing sandals), she said I had some weight behind my step. The air temperature shifted slightly and The Warden said I was heavier than I looked and quickly pointed out that she was in my path of a great smell, she also added that the intensity and adrenaline of the sniff will add weight if you happen to be in its path. Now The Warden said all this with some confidence and no one seemed to doubt her, actually marveled at her tidbit of knowledge, some would call this spinning a tale. Do not step in the path of a great scent if you don't want to get stepped on, Ancient Basset Saying.

Not to worry, this line I'm attached to is carefully calculated to allow me to stay within the perimeter of my domain, except for the neighbours driveway but I've been programmed to avoid this area with a lot of hey heys. Do I try to stretch the limits, of course, the only thing holding me back is the snowblower, it's the one thing that I can't drag down the street, if I was tied up to the lawnmower I'd be down the street offering my services. Even though I have a little bit of freedom I'm under constant surveillance, it's a long story but one day The Warden found only my line with an empty collar, I was found at the neighbours and medics were called in to revive The Warden. Sniffing outside the lines can be exciting but always remember where you came from and what's waiting for you at home, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: Yes, it's true, I will often stare intensely (relentlessly) into The Wardens eyes trying to get a read on her next move, I know exactly when it's my time to go for a walk and sniff and after that I get my front yard time, it's all scheduled according to my internal time system. She will try avoiding all eye contact but I will trail after her and hunt her down, everything else can wait, that dust isn't going anywhere and the laundry can be done during my nap. She's probably worried if I stare hard enough I'll put her in a trance and then she'll start trailing after me and giving me cheese whenever I want (worth investigating). You want what you want when you want it, don't let a little thing like no stop you, all good things happen to those who are relentless, Ancient Basset Saying.

Today we celebrate Canada Day, in Basset Style, there will be platters of cheese, Canadian bacon and plenty of fresh filtered water with ice, everyone is welcome to stop by, I'll be the one tethered to the snowblower. There won't be any fireworks but everyone will get a chance to fuss over me, I'll be on full display either on the front lawn under the tree or laying out on the driveway. Don't be surprised if you see a hockey net set up for a game of shinny or hear someone repeatedly say 'eh', it's all normal. It's important to celebrate where you come from and all the traditions that surround you, today I will dig deeper, bark louder and sniff longer, Ancient Basset Saying. Happy Canada Day ð¨ð¦

My adventures through the Urban Jungle are really only for a brief moment, first off there isn't the freedom of movement under the foliage, it's dark, quiet and as The Warden discovered there's icky crawly things under there. I also want to make sure I'm not missing out on anything, what if someone yelled I have a cheese platter or I couldn't smell the roast simmering in gravy or heaven forbid company showed up. Another reason is The Warden can't be left alone for long periods of time, she's a wild card and trouble seems to follow her, it's my job to stay close, keep her grounded and give her a purpose. We all have a purpose we just have to discover what that purpose is, sometimes if you bark that purpose shows up and you are rewarded, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Due to the heat our outdoor activities have been shortened and I brought the entertainment indoors, this was my limited edition of a yank and drag while barking because I was tired. I didn't have the strength to back into the chair using my whole body (a trick I use to try and move furniture) so I just sat down while barking, it had the same effect with the cheap seats, I got their attention. After this watered down version of a yank and drag while barking I had a lengthy nap, I had to recharge before the next performance. Sometimes you gotta shake things up, don't be predictable, do the unexpected and maybe just maybe you'll be rewarded, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: Before The Warden entered the room dad yelled out to her 'you better get some cheese', she immediately knew that I had stolen her chair and there was only one way to get me out, a piece of cheese or a small crane. I had heard her fussing around getting ready to start the day so I rushed ahead of her and took the seat of opportunity, she didn't even bother to confirm I was there, I heard the fridge door open, second shelf on the left, she was trying to save time so she immediately went to the end game, it was a win win for everyone. Once I vacated the chair The Warden quickly slithered in it and thanked me for the warm seat, it's about giving back when you can. If you're going to play the game then play it to win, hold firm until you smell the good stuff and the trophy is handed over to you, Ancient Basset Saying.

When you're tethered to a snowblower and bored what do you do, well I make a little noise, that always gets the cheap seats riled up and I get the attention I deserve. Yes there's the hey heys and threats of going back inside but if you bark loud enough you can't hear a word they're saying, so that's a win win. As soon as I saw The Warden put her book down and make a move to get up I immediately went over to the grass, started sniffing and avoided all eye contact, she was attempting to make good on her threats. You can overcome almost all obstacles if you are determined and make the effort, you just gotta believe, bark like no one's listening and sniff like no one's waiting, Ancient Basset Saying.

There was a state of emergency, a crisis, we ran out of cheese, the second shelf on the left was empty and my cheese levels were getting low. So dad drove the truck to the store and backed up at the door, he was on a mission to stock up with the finest aged cheese they had before there was a medical emergency of a cheese deficiency. I was excited when he finally arrived back home and it was worth sticking my head in the bags, The Warden decided to slice up the cheese and put it in easy accessible bags, I was helping by eating the end pieces and licking the cutting board (sanitized after). In a crisis situation it's easier if everyone gets involved and helps each other out especially if a cheese emergency, Ancient Basset Saying.

There's this one section of the garden that doesn't grow as well as the others, I believe it's because it's too close to rabbit alley and they are chewing the plants or maybe the squirrels, birds and chipmunks are messing around in there. The Warden has a different viewpoint, she says it lacks sun and there are clear signs of digging (confirmed by video surveillance) but I still think it's overrun with varmints. A few years ago The Warden tried planting flowers, that's about the time I started burying biscuits, it wasn't a good mix. Having the freedom to do what you do can't be denied, dig like no one's watching and bark like no one's listening, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to when my brother came home to visit, the good ole days when a roast would be simmering in gravy, it was a time when we'd share snacks and no one ever said 'no you can't have that'. Things were free and easy when he was around, there was hair in the air and not a care in the world, The Warden was discreet with the Dyson (she was trying to act normal). I'd do a crash and bang in the morning to get him up and he let me take him for a walk and sniff without any yanking, those were the days. You know you are special when after each visit you are covered in hair and slobber, it's a gift that just keeps on giving, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: Why do I bark outside, there are many reasons and all are valid but after each barking session there's always a threat of being taken back inside, now that's where the real problem is. First off I bark when someone comes close to the house, it's a barking notification that we could potentially have company so start planning snacks. I also bark when I get bored which is a symptom of neglect, easy solution, drop everything and spend more time with me. If the weather is not ideal, if it's cold or wet, I'll bark to go back inside, I have a preference for sunny warm weather. Don't let others dampen your spirit, express yourself loud and proud, bark like no one's listening, Ancient Basset Saying.

media.title: There was a dead bird found in the grass along rabbit alley, after a thorough investigation the crime scene  area was reopened and I have been cleared of all charges. The deceased was quickly bagged and tagged (condolences to family) but this location was kept under surveillance in case the perpetrators came back to revisit their handiwork. It was determined that because I smelled lovely I did not roll in the taped off area and chances that I even noticed it are slim because there was no barking notification. It feels great not to have a cloud of suspicion hanging over you, this is the one time that smelling lovely pays off, my sniffing defense was upheld by a jury of those who have smell issues, Ancient Basset Saying.

Not every yank and drag requires barking but isn't it so much better when you do, the cheap seats come alive and begin to interact, they'll start in with the hey heys but you can't hear anything from all the noise (unless it's the opening of a cheese bag). There's no sense in doing a grand performance if you don't have an audience, you might better nap and wait until everyone gets seated and comfy, that's when you can really light up the room and get the hey heys flowing. Don't be fooled by the naysayers or party-poopers, everyone loves to have fun and be entertained, so keep on barking even if you hear the hey heys, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: Today I will help dad celebrate a very special day, we will snack and nap together and maybe later tonight he will sneak me some extra cheese because that's what dad's do. I'll lay beside his chair as he reaches over to give me rubs and scratches and he'll never once complain about hair in the air because dad's never do. Dad likes it when I yank the blanket off him, if I hear a scary noise I run to him for comfort and he thinks I smell lovely, these are only a few reasons why dad's are so special. Today is the day to let someone else think they are leader of the pack, give them a moment to shine because we all benefit when they do, Ancient Basset Saying. Happy Father's Day to all dad's on their special day.

When you've had a busy day and need to recharge your batteries then it's time to block out all distractions and enter the snooze zone. I've successfully done a yank and drag while barking which elevated the adrenaline, I stayed on the heels of The Warden until it was time to go outside (had several naps while waiting), I went into another room and barked at nothing (always a crowd pleaser) and of course I sat by the treat cabinet waiting for the good stuff and snubbing all else. Make sure you take the time to rest and snooze, barking, sniffing, begging and snooping can lead to low energy or even worse a cheese deficiency, so remember to nap every chance you get, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: I'm comfortable, thank you for asking, if you could possibly top up my fresh filtered water with some more ice it would be greatly appreciated. I'd ask for a platter of cheese but I know that's not going to happen, the outdoor service does not provide snacks or food of any kind, she has eating outside issues. When I get up to sniff or tinkle I'll come back to my blanket that's been all straightened and aligned, did I happen to mention that she has issues. Be thankful for all the little things that others do for you and be hopeful that your platter of cheese will one day show up, you just gotta believe, Ancient Basset Saying.

When you're on a mission it's important to stay focused even if you hear someone yelling 'hey hey get out of there', ignore all distractions and keep on digging, your goal is to bury your biscuit. Once you've completed your task walk away from the burial site and focus your attention on something else, in this case sniff at the weeds, that'll get the yard staff all worked up, they'll start pulling the weeds out and forget about what they were fussing over, mission accomplished. It's easy to get distracted when there's a lot of noise around you, stay focused on the goals you have set for yourself, dig like no one's watching, bark like no one's listening and be proud of all your accomplishments, Ancient Basset Saying.

Burying your gravy coated biscuit inside may come with some challenges, my lounger is usually covered with blankets which helps with the burial process but I yanked them off, not to worry, I can do this, you just gotta believe. Now the cheap seats like to keep the lounger covered in blankets in order to help keep it clean, avoid gravy stains, to prevent any rips or tearing and if it's washed too many times the lounger becomes lumpy and I won't sleep on lumps. None of this is a concern when burying a biscuit, I don't have a laundry list of issues, my ultimate goal is to bury and eat my biscuit, nothing more nothing less. When you are on a mission and have a goal to achieve it's important to stay focused and avoid any distractions, keep your head down unless you hear the fridge door open, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

I'm thinking of asking for an amendment to my bath schedule, I just felt a few drops of morning dew as I walked under the plants, which means I got wet so I'm thinking this qualifies as a bath. If you don't ask and stand up for your rights then nothing changes, so bark loud until there's change or you wear them down. Not that I need a bath, I'm just planning ahead, my next official bath is scheduled in the summer of 2026 and if in the meantime I get wet it could alter the date, I'll have to wait for an official ruling on the level of wetness to see if it qualifies. If you don't stand up for yourself no one else will, bark until you are heard and keep on barking until there's change, with change comes cheese (if you're lucky), Ancient Basset Saying.

I almost took flight with my helicopter tail spin when my brother stopped by for a visit, it was a short visit, outside at a distance and he came with a special guest named Benny who had to stay in the horse trailer but he was given a carrot treat. I was so excited to see my brother, it was a short visit but we are hoping in a few months we will finally be able to have everyone get together and share a roast simmering in gravy with a platter of cheese. The Warden wasn't worried about me flying off somewhere, she says I'm heavier than I look. Enjoy the time you have together even it's only for a brief visit, make it a special moment so they'll want to come back again, Ancient Basset Saying.

Do you find barking gets on your nerves, it's probably because you have issues or a cheese deficiency. Barking is a form of expression, a lot like singing, if you don't find joy then you are listening to a different beat. I think I can relate, when shimmy shaking momma belts out a tune I want to leave the room but I endure because it's the polite thing to do (she'll stop eventually when she notices something needs cleaning). Barking isn't for everyone but you have the right to express yourself, bark like no one's listening or until they give you cheese, Ancient Basset Saying.

Someone dropped a nut from up above and it landed on me, well it might've grazed me, I feel it was intentional but I'm prepared to ignore it due to lack of interest in pursuing something that's unattainable, I don't do heights. Now if they (probably a squirrel) were to come down to my level I might consider giving chase, maybe, depends on how much effort it would take. It's certainly something that would be bark worthy, which would get the cheap seats all riled up with a couple of hey heys. Assess what your input is before you give chase, is it worth the effort and is there a reward for your efforts, notable things to consider, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: While out on our walk we saw this man with a small fluffy white dog so naturally I went over for a meet and greet, he looks at my under belly and immediately determined I was a 'he', he mistook my belly flaps for something else. The Warden then introduced me as 'Miss Lilly', he apologized for the mistaken identity (he sneaked another peek) then he asked if I could have a treat, The Warden said I could but I probably wouldn't eat it, which I didn't. Overall it was a warm reception, the fluffy white dog ignored me, my belly flaps were a distraction and I spit out the treat. Not every encounter will be positive but it's up to you to make the best of what you are given, keep on sniffing and good things will happen, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to the time when The Warden discovered that I wouldn't eat broken biscuits, they must be whole and intact in order to do a yank and drag while barking and after that I'll eat it. There was this one box that had a lot of broken biscuits, which I wouldn't eat, so as a concerned consumer The Warden contacted the company, they said 'and what kind of dog wouldn't eat a broken biscuit, was that a hound', yes and yes, for our distress we received two coupons and all the broken biscuits were given to others who were less fussy. Stand up for what you feel is right and bark until you're heard, don't except less than what you are entitled to, today it's a whole biscuit tomorrow it could be the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

There has been some talk lately about my fresh linen smell not being so fresh, it may have faded slightly in the warmer weather or I might have done a bit of rolling and had a few extra dabs to the neck area. Of course we are all overlooking the obvious here, I live with smell sensitive people, it happens when they are over-sniffing their cleaning products. They need to get outside of their comfort zone and roll in the dirt and grass, take advantage of worm rolling season or other lovely seasonal smells. You know you smell lovely when they can smell you before they see you, if their eyes water or their nose wrinkles you are at the top of your smell game, Ancient Basset Saying.

Dad happens to think this blanket is his, that is until I yanked it off him, now it becomes my blanket. He also made a critical error (or opportunity) by dangling his pjs off the bed, while I was snooping around I happen to notice this and yanked them off the bed (as one does), which started a series of events. I immediately ran to get a biscuit, came back to do a yank and drag while barking and I ended up in another room, that's when security showed up (she has issues). If you ever want to know where anyone in the house is all you have to do is start doing a yank and drag while barking, that always gathers the troops. Sometimes to be heard or seen you have to make a little noise, bark until you hear the hey heys or they come running with cheese, Ancient Basset Saying.

Some things can give you nightmares, like when the critters eat your buried biscuits or the rabbit that ate my chicken strip or if one day the second shelf on the left is empty or if maybe there were no visitors to jump up on. Even though some dreams will lead you down a path of the unthinkable that's when you should immediately do a stretch and rotate and start dreaming of all the good things to come, a small roast simmering in gravy, large platters of cheese and a visitor knocking at the door waiting to get jumped up on. All it takes is a stretch and rotate to turn the ugly nightmares into a dream of good things to come, you just gotta believe, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: All I heard was someone muttering, wait wait, get back, come over here, it was only a distraction to keep me from doing what I was going to do which was to follow the sunny spot and stretch out on the floor. Does laying on a freshly washed floor add to the ambiance of the moment while soaking up the sun, I think so, who doesn't love a little extra attention. Yes I might've added a couple of paw prints or a few pools of drool but I've also given someone a purpose. Don't sweat the small stuff, paw prints and drool pools are reminders that you've been given a purpose and it's you that reaps the rewards, Ancient Basset Saying.

If you live with someone who has control issues or separation anxiety it's advisable to keep your tail pointed up and visible while wandering through the urban jungle, it helps prevent any frantic outbursts and neighbour complaints about a crazy lady (this happens after one escape). Even though I'm only undercover for a brief moment it's nice to know that I'm missed, at least when I pop out I don't see her bent over breathing into a paper bag. Take the time to show others how much you care about them and that they are special, nothing says love more than a cheese platter or a small roast simmering in gravy, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: I'm on the move, it's critical that I relocate my chicken strip after there's been reports that a bunny was seen lurking in the garden. If you recall the mother rabbit once ate my chicken strip that I buried near her nest and now the family has become addicted and are searching for my buried treats. I've moved this chicken strip several times, it's a tactical move to throw off the scent, this time I may bury it in plain sight, the area where dad just reseeded the lawn looks like the perfect location. All precautions are necessary when burying your treats, dig deeper and bark louder, Ancient Basset Saying.

media.title: Throwback to when The Warden came home from picking up a few groceries, I was waiting just inside the door, excited to see her and to see what was in the bags. Now here's where the problem started, she couldn't get into the house because I was in the way so she had to set the bags down which became an invitation to investigate, that's when I got my head stuck in the bag plus I was blocking the way from getting inside. Eventually The Warden got my head out of the bag, I moved out of the way and the door could be closed. As a side note take a treat out of the shopping bag first and toss at a safe distance in order to clear the area for a safe entry, Ancient Basset Saying.

When burying a biscuit it's important to pick a spot where it can be easily retrieved and it's secure. This location is an excellent choice, it's the area that dad has been working on, there's lots of extra dirt with just a hint of grass seed which makes it easier to dig and bury, plus as a bonus it's close to the house. This area is quite familiar, it's the preferred winter pee place, a few steps from the house where the snow is guaranteed to be shovelled, unfortunately the grass turns yellow in the spring.  Don't hesitate to relocate something you buried if you feel you've been compromised, especially if you are surrounded by varmints or someone lurking with a rake, Ancient Basset Saying.

It started out like any other day, I was sniffing around in the backyard, The Warden was working in the garden when all of a sudden the gate magically opened, it was calling my name so I ran like the wind, I was free. I had only gotten two houses up the street when I heard someone calling my name, it was dad running up the street in his slippers and pjs with a piece of cheese in his hand. I ran around in circles, visited a couple of neighbours and eventually made my way back home, that's when I got my cheese. The Warden is doing much better now, almost speaking in complete sentences, breathing into a paper bag helped and the latch on the gate has been repaired. When you get the chance at freedom take it, sniff like no one is chasing you but if someone is offering you cheese make the right choice and go home, Ancient Basset Saying.

It all started when I was inside, I had just received a chicken strip when all of a sudden I noticed the door open, so I took a chance and bolted passed security. I went in search for the perfect spot to bury it, which isn't easy when you are surrounded by varmints and surveillance watching your every move, but there it was, an open spot in the garden with just enough loose dirt to dig and bury. As a side note, after you bury something just walk away, avoid all eye contact, start sniffing and hopefully they'll forget about the chicken strip. Burying one of your treats can be lifesaving when times become lean and the treat givers become stingy, Ancient Basset Saying.

A word of caution if you are roaming through the Urban Jungle in the early morning hours, the leaves on the plants might be wet and I don't do wet. On the other hand if I do get wet it could be considered a bath which would ultimately reset my official bath schedule, of course there are legal implications every time I get wet (next bath scheduled in the summer of 2026), there are some who disagree about the amount of wetness and if it qualifies as a bath, it becomes a legal battle. Stand up for your rights, all baths should be banned, bark in protest, you have the right to smell exactly like what you rolled in, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: How close is too close, you can never be too close, you should always be within breath smelling distance, it's a great way to detect snack sneakers. I personally like to nudge in as close as I can, it helps to encourage scratches and rubs while at the same time offering my ear to be caressed without straining one's wrist. If you discover that there's no possibility of treats you might as well settle in and rest until there's movement towards the kitchen. Just because you're napping doesn't mean you'll miss out on a snack, once your eyes are closed your ears and nose will pick up the slack, if there's a crinkle of a bag you'll know, Ancient Basset Saying.

In ancient times us bassets were sent out in advance of the hunters to track down dinner for the family and once we had them cornered or trapped we would alert the hunters by barking (loud barking frightens the main course). Now in modern days things have changed, we are tethered to a snowblower and not allowed to wander  free, we lounge around waiting for dinner (praying it's a small roast simmering in gravy), barking is used when excited, for all visitors or it's a sign of a cheese deficiency and treats come in bags or located on the second shelf on the left. With change comes new beginnings, be thankful for where you came from and where you're going, keep on barking because that's who you are, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to all those times when I would do a slobber shake and The Warden would yell out 'incoming', which was a warning to duck. When out on our walks you will often hear 'careful about the slobber' especially when someone was giving me a chin rub, most did not seem to mind but legally The Warden felt obligated to issue a warning, she's prohibited from chasing after people with a wet cloth to clean up after a slobber shake hence the verbal warning. Know your rights, slobber shaking is justified, barking is encouraged and getting treats is a requirement, Ancient Basset Saying.

It started out like any other day, I was preparing to yank the blankets off my lounger when all of a sudden dad dangled the blanket from his chair, which caught my attention and I started yanking, he was making the ultimate sacrifice. I then proceeded to do the yank and drag while barking, fortunately I had my biscuit waiting in the wings, timing was everything. It all worked out well, it saved The Warden from remaking the lounger and the eye twitch was on a slow flicker. Sometimes you have to make small sacrifices along the way in order to make others happy and with that happiness comes great rewards, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Sometimes you gotta give a little attitude to get what you want, you don't always have to bark to be heard, look them in the eyes and tell them exactly what you need, in this case I feel I deserve a little more attention. To some this may look like I have a cheese deficiency or a case of neglect but it's that time of day where I need a belly rub or a deep dive into my neck folds. It's that time of day when after you get the attention you deserve they walk away covered in hair and looking for a wet cloth to wipe off the slobber. If you want something ask for it, flavour it up with a little sass and a lot of attitude, you don't always have to bark to be heard, Ancient Basset Saying.

This is my secondary lounging area which of course was covered with a blanket, after a successful yank and drag while barking I settled in to eat my gravy coated biscuit. The cheap seats made a comment about my lounger area having an unpleasant smell and this comment didn't come from The Warden (who has issues), it came from dad who is not as smell sensitive. It could be that it was a warm day and not a lot of air flow, sometimes the air becomes stagnant when you're positioned at a lower level, this theory was obtained by a basset research support group. Not everyone embraces the lovely smells that you enjoy, that's okay, what's important is that you be you and continue to sniff the sniffable, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: I got caught once licking the arm of the couch and now it's covered in a blanket, first off I've licked the couch more than once and it's not something I was trying to hide, eagle eyes just didn't notice. Yes the blanket was all tucked in using the hospital corners method except for the end piece, it's free style'n and not in a yankable position. Apparently the therapy method is not working for someone (she has issues) and before you know it everything will covered with blankets, I hope we don't get to where all guests will be offered a complimentary blanket upon arrival. You gotta lighten up, adjust your attitude, hair in the air just don't care and dropping drool is cool, Ancient Basset Saying.

First off I've been cleared of any wrongdoing, my good name and reputation remains intact, I can't say the same for someone else who is clouded by a haze from their shady past, here's what happened. The Warden was checking the front gardens when she stumbled upon a recent crime scene, feathers were scattered all over and partial remains of a baby bird were tossed about, so before I was allowed near the taped off area a deposit bag was used to clean up all remains. There was also a loud ruckus being made in the tree and The Warden made a public statement that she was just the cleanup crew and had no involvement in the actual crime, condolences were issued to the family. Do the right thing, keep your nose clean, keep your head down sniffing and bark if anyone moves, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: The final touches of the yard work was to add the little ugly fences between the bushes in order to avoid my line getting tangled around the shrubs and needing an emergency rescue team to untangle me. It's bad enough to be tethered to a snowblower but to install these little ugly fences is unconscionable, it now limits my digging opportunities. There's only one solution to all of this, unhook the line and take off the collar, free Miss Lilly. Make the best of what you're given and remember all good things lead to the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to the attack of the furminator, it was a quiet day when all of a sudden I noticed The Warden had placed the furminator on the ground, that's when I sprang into action, at least until I landed on the grass which can be a distraction during worm rolling season. Now I can explain the bite marks on the handle, I was testing the grip on the rubbery substance, it was rather smooth and slippery when covered with slobber so I added a few indentations for a better grip, helping out in any way I can. Any time you get to show off your creative side do it, bark like no one's listening, sniff like no one's waiting and slobber shake like you just don't care, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: Stealing a chair is a badge of honour, it's a moment of celebration, especially when they walk in the room and look at you knowing there's only two things that'll get you to move, it's either a piece of cheese or a small crane. At a moment like this you can expect some huffing and puffing or maybe an eye twitch but don't feel you have to give into the appearance of distress, wait for it, hold on, there it is, the decision to turn around and go to the fridge. Some things are worth waiting for, don't feel the urge to move with the first nudge or one pleading request, give them time to make the right decision, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Luck was shining down on me, I entered the room just as The Warden was flicking the blanket in the air in preparation to remake my lounger, I rushed over (as one does), grabbed a corner and started yanking. I was expecting a little more resistance but The Warden submitted and let me have the blanket, her dreams of doing the perfect hospital corner will have to wait. Good things come to those who do the yank and drag while barking, keep on barking until you hear the hey heys or the fridge door opens, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: It was a perfect day, the sun was shining, I had a bowl of fresh filtered water with ice sitting close by in the shade while fresh dirt was being spread over the lawn, once it was raked into the grass I decided to pick a spot to become one with the earth, giving back a little at a time. I'm hoping that with my time spent outside I will have that fresh linen scent that everyone loves with just a hint of worm. As a side note this is how you avoid baths, let the soft breeze wash over you which gives you that fresh linen smell, they will be lining up to sniff you. These are the best days ever, soaking up the sun under a tree while everyone else works around you. Being in the middle of all the action is a good thing, you are within sight and they are available if you need anything, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: Tap tap, tap tap tap, something was at the door trying to get in and then there was this fluttering sound, I tentatively got up and stood behind dad in case he needed backup, we saw a baby bird trying to break into our house. The next thing that happened was the mother bird swooping in, said something in bird talk which made the baby turn around and fly to the step and then the mother dropped a worm in its mouth. More than likely it was a worm I had previously rolled on and the baby bird had probably been chatting with the bunny rabbits about a great place to get chicken strips, word gets around. You don't always have to be first for everything, wait until you know it's safe or the work is done but if the fridge door opens being first in line is essential, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2
iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: This is where I need to be, outside in the front yard, centre stage for all meet and greets, if you don't notice me at first don't worry I'll be the one barking and howling. I've had two deliveries dropped off, the first guy was tentative, asked if I was friendly but took a wide berth around me, apparently he wasn't friendly. The next guy asked if he could approach me as I was straining on my line to get closer, he gave me lots of back scratches and walked away covered in hair, The Warden mumbled something about shedding but the fellow said no problem he was used to that. Everyone likes to feel special, so go ahead and make some noise and be generous with all newcomers, who doesn't love to be covered in hair and slobber, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: I will often return to where the Bunny-Gate saga took place, it's a great opportunity to close my eyes and relive how I uncovered a bunny nest, I was in the middle of burying my chicken strip, dirt was flying all over and that's when I saw a little head pop up. Of course this prompted a round of barking which alerted security and that's when a flurry of events took place. The little ugly fences were installed, I was evacuated from the area (due to excessive barking) and my chicken strip disappeared (stolen by the mother rabbit). As a side note the two bushes in this garden had to be removed, weren't hardy enough to endure excessive digging. Take time to reflect on those special moments and how it made you feel, if you barked excessively then it was truly a special moment, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to a pondering moment. As I sit back and think I sometimes wonder did I get everything I barked, whined and whimpered about, was it worth all my efforts. That time when I was filled with anticipation over a small roast simmering in gravy and rewarded with a large plate so my gravy dippers could slide all over it, yes it was worth the extra effort. Even though there may be dark days and a roast is seldom seen you must remember the good times, even if it comes with someone chasing after you with a wet cloth, keep the faith that there will be a roast once again, Ancient Basset Saying.

Worm rolling season is now fully upon us, every time The Warden pulls out a weed a worm pops up, so take advantage of these opportunities, bend your knees slightly, do a dab on the neck and if it's a special smell go for the full body roll. You can afford to be selective and don't worry about a bath, at least I don't because my next bath is scheduled for the summer of 2026. Once you've had a full body worm roll every one on your walk will want to stop and sniff you. Take pride in who you are, walk the walk, bark to be heard and roll until you come up smelling lovely, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: Just a slip of a girl tethered to a snowblower waiting for someone to pass by, you may not notice me at first (it happens when you're tiny) but not to worry I'll bark or howl to get your attention, so please feel free to stop and say hello. Don't feel threatened by the person lurking in the shadows holding a broom or a garden tool, she's one of the staff and currently does not have an outstanding arrest warrant. If you approach you may hear 'brace yourself, she's heavier than she looks' or 'watch out for the slobber', it's her way to trying to get attention. Stop what you're doing and take the time to say hello, it's not all about you all the time, it's about me all the time, Ancient Basset Saying.

Sniffing out the varmints down Rabbit Alley, after a thorough sniffing investigation it was concluded that there was a traffic pattern of hop prints along this stretch of the house. The Warden returned to the scene to do an additional sweep of the area to see if any incriminating evidence was left, apparently this was used as an escape route and they didn't have time to drop any deposits. I was also on high alert, whenever I bark along this stretch, excessively bark, someone will tap on the window which scares the heck out of me and I go running to my protector, which in this case is The Warden. If you're going to throw caution to the wind and live on the wild side make sure you always have someone who's got your back, bark loud and run for cover, Ancient Basset Saying.

It's a special day to honour all those who do the little things that never get noticed each and every day. It's never mentioned when I walk across the floor leaving paw prints, they just somehow magically disappear or when I get up each morning and there's a selection of treats nicely displayed to start my day. The backyard has become my sanctuary, free to sniff and roam and in the gardens I'm allowed to dig and bury my biscuits. I may get chased around the room while trying to clean my gravy dippers or I get tied up to the snowblower so I don't wander away, all this is done with love because this is what mothers do. On this special day offer your ear to be caressed and know that when you do a yank and drag while barking you are giving someone a purpose, Ancient Basset Saying. Happy Mother's Day to everyone that fills this role.

After a successful yank and drag while barking you need to take the time to recharge, here's my story that required a recharge. The Warden was attempting to remake my lounger with fresh clean blankets, first the light green, next the red and finally the bright blue, which were meticulously laid out while she started tucking in using her hospital corners method, that's when I made my move. I grabbed a mouthful, firmly planted myself and started yanking, there was constant muttering all of which I ignored, my focus was doing a three blanket yank. Due to the incomplete tucking in all three slid off which enabled me to yank the blankets across the room while barking, not just any barking it was a victory dance bark. After any major achievement you should take the time to celebrate and if you bark loud enough you may even be rewarded, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: This has never happened to me before, while out on our walk some lady said I was a big girl, The Warden bristled, she was unusually quiet. I like to think I fall into the small fur-baby category, somewhat dainty with lots of personality, shortish legs, cute gravy dippers and firm abs (when not in resting mode). I've always been referred to as a slip of a girl and yes there's been times when The Warden will say 'brace yourself, she's heavier than she looks' but that's for legal liability in case someone loses their balance and falls over. Now I admit you may not be able to pick me up with one hand but that's my choice, I rather you didn't, it would be awkward for both of us. Embrace who you are, you be you, be proud and stand your ground no matter how different you are, just keep on sniffing and ignore those who don't recognize your greatness, Ancient Basset Saying.

media.title: Throwback to when the Urban Jungle was in full bloom, just a slip of a girl defending her territory against all varmints and critters. Going deep into the jungle is not for the faint of heart, it's dark and full of creepy crawlers, it's also used as an escape route for those who tremble in fear when they hear the call of the wild (excessive barking). The Warden also had a meltdown once when she was attacked by a spider when she was pulling out a weed, you would've thought she was directing traffic on a freeway with all the hand motions. Step out of your comfort zone and take a walk on the wild side, enter the jungle, go ahead, be brave and keep on barking, Ancient Basset Saying.

The Urban Jungle is starting to come alive, there's new growth starting so I've been advised not to dig in this area, I'll try my best but there are times when the digging spirit just overtakes you, I can't be held responsible if this happens. There was something else about not laying on the new growth, which I wouldn't do anyway because it's not comfortable with the spike-like plants, so I heard (word gets around). The excessive barking is to give notice to all varmints that this is a restricted area and all violators will face the wrath of The Warden (if you bark loud enough all you hear is mutterings). Rules such as no digging or no barking are just ways to try to control you, ignore them, dig like you just don't care and bark like no one's listening, Ancient Basset Saying.

After seeing this clip from the surveillance camera questions were raised about another covering on the arm of the couch, I voted yes because it'll give me more yanking opportunities, plus I'd like to see if it's possible to do hospital corners on this without anything dangling. This is my established corner of the couch, at least this is where I start out, eventually I do a complete takeover, so there may or may not be remnants of past treats, just saying. Rules about not getting on the furniture are only recommendations or suggestions, eventually it'll be yours for the taking, all in good time, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: My first preference is to be in the front yard where all the action is, where the neighbours are moving around or with any luck a delivery truck stops by, where there's always something to bark at. In the backyard it's quiet and the only thing moving around is The Warden, I'll trail around after her and bark at her but it's boring and predictable, I prefer the element of surprise, something new to bark at. Sometimes I'll just peek under the fence looking at the world going on without me and wonder what I'm missing and what barking opportunities have passed me by. Take advantage of the opportunities you are given, even if you have to bark a little louder to make things happen, Ancient Basset Saying.

When helping out in the garden it's important to stay focused, critical decisions are being made in the early stages of development. It was noted there were a few low lying areas where the dirt had shifted due to excessive digging and burying, the only solution would be to add more dirt and I'll help spread it around, many paws make light work. In order to help motivate the yard crew barking is highly recommended, they have a tendency to work faster in order to avoid making eye contact with the neighbours.  Offer help when you can, it's important to encourage others, so go ahead and bark, be their cheerleader, Ancient Basset Saying.

There were a few concerns over my barking in the garden, not by me of course, I heard a couple of hey heys and several threats about going inside, all of this was ignored (I couldn't hear over the barking). Barking outside can be caused by several things, it could be a sign of neglect, you aren't getting the attention you deserve or it's a symptom of a cheese deficiency, both are manageable and shouldn't cause any fretting or concern. In order to get attention you bark out, if you are ignored you bark continuously and louder which usually gets results, now the cheese deficiency is a more serious problem, the symptoms will vary depending on your cheese levels, barking is a cry for help and a slice of aged cheese will help control any outbursts but keep in mind that a platter of cheese will make everyone happy (pairs nicely with evening juices). If you notice something isn't right then do something about it and barking can lead to the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: I was having a little me time, The Warden was devoting all her time to fussing over me with scratches, rubs and a little sweet talk when all of a sudden she frantically jumps up in a panic. A large spider with razor sharp tentacles in the attack position was scurrying across the floor, keep in mind that fear has a way of exaggerating the tiniest things into a life threatening situation, she grabbed a weapon (lens cleaner) and immediately eliminated the threat. I raised my head slightly wondering why the scratches stopped and why the heavy breathing, eventually everything calmed down, The Warden regained her composure and returned to what really matters, me. If there's a crisis or if someone is upset or out of sorts, it's important to offer some comfort, let them caress your ear and give you scratches, everyone needs to feel special, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to one of the most rewarding days ever, the day I yanked the housecoat out of the closet, tore the shelving unit off the wall, almost got hit by the flying antique iron and was saved by the rescue team. Due to all the confusion I was allowed to keep the housecoat for a few days while the repairs were being made, who knew that yanking a dangling housecoat could cause so much trouble. Since this incident a new rule was established, the wine cellar door (aka closet) must remain closed at all times. If you don't want things yanked then don't let them dangle, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: I'm now considered an empty nester, my bunny nest is empty and the kids have moved on. I still sit close to their nest and wonder if I'll ever hear from them again, I remember the good ole days of barking at them as they toddled out, I would often try to crash through the fences just to be close to them. Nowadays I just bark at nothing (as one does), sniff where the kids once nested and as a tribute I buried a chicken strip because that's the last meal they had while living here. It's important to find your own path in life but remember those who helped you along the way, if you listen closely you may even hear them howl, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: There's a lot of excitement this year while planning out what goes in the garden, at the top of the list is having a Basset Feature, it comes with a warning though, there's a tendency to move around while following the sun so it's important to leave a little extra room for the stretch and rotate. The Warden has become quite spiritual while planning the garden, she prays a lot that the garden feature won't lay on the budding plants or dig up any new growth. This year new soil will need to be added where there's low lying areas  which were created due to excessive digging and burying biscuits. Look no further, stop the search, if you need someone to be the main feature of your garden then I'm your gal, with a couple of conditions, I'll require a bowl of fresh filtered water with ice and a platter of cheese, working for free is overrated, Ancient Basset Saying.

This is the final episode of the Bunny-Gate saga. The Warden and I went out to checkup on the bunny nest and they were gone, the 'hare' hatch was empty. The Warden got a stick to make sure there were no surprises and there weren't, so down came the little ugly fences. I decided to check to see if my chicken strip was left behind and it wasn't, after that I sniffed the whole yard and couldn't find even a tuft of bunny hair in sight. Hopefully they had a safe journey to a wonderful garden patch and when they look up at the sky at night and hear a lonesome howl they'll think of me, Miss Lilly. Wherever your journey takes you remember to think back where you came from and the gifts it provided you, especially the chicken strip and the sweet melody of the continuous barking, Ancient Basset Saying.

The Bunny-Gate saga has now reached another level, there's anticipation, drama, sniffing, barking and howling. It used to be I'd go in the backyard, wander around sniffing, do my business and watch for someone lurking out the window, now there's invaders in my biscuit burying garden and The Warden is having heart palpitations. I'm not sure if my barking is making a difference but I think that bunny just got dragged back into the safety of the nest. All the research suggests the family will be leaving shortly and The Warden is considering the possibility of me spending more time in the front yard until the squatters vacate. If something is not right then bark, if you feel you're not being heard then howl, make some noise until all that's wrong can be made right again, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: I saw movement from the bunny nest and I was told to get away, which really means I'm on full alert waiting for the varmints to make an appearance, the Bunny-Gate saga continues. Now every time I go outside I have a security detail shadowing my every move, it's not about me it's about them and their control issues, what could possibly happen. I continue to bark at the nest just so they know I'm here and awaiting their arrival, first thing I'm going to check out is if they have my chicken strip. You can trust me but it would certainly help if you encouraged me, a little cheese goes a long way, Ancient Basset Saying.

media.title: Desperate times calls for desperate measures, due to the garden being taken over by Bunny-Gate I have limited places to bury my biscuit. I suppose I could use the other garden but I'm making a point, it's a protest, I should have first burying rights and the bunny nest should not be allowed to take over an established area where I bury my biscuits and one chicken strip (which they ate). I brought my biscuit outside and immediately went to the garden hoping to bury it and that's when I remembered it was blocked off with the little ugly fences, it's just not fair, so I faked buried it in the grass. Bark your truth, if something isn't right let it be known, if you hear the hey heys bark louder, if you hear the fridge door open it's a win win, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to my younger years when I was carefree and would eat almost any treat I was given, almost. Nowadays I'm more selective, there isn't a sense of urgency, I like to wait to see what my options are, as a point of clarification cheese and real meat are not classified as treats, they fall under the category of essential necessities. Every day The Warden will present to me several options, I will sit and look somewhat disinterested until they are all nicely displayed, the trick is to wait until she throws her hands up and declares that's it, no more, that's when you make your move. As a side note, all uneaten treats will be given away to others who aren't so fussy. Don't be pressured into feeling you have to please others, you do what's right for you, sometimes you gotta wait for the good stuff, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: A few adjustments had to be made after the Bunny-Gate incident, the security wall of little ugly fences had to be reinforced.  There was a concern that I was sticking my head under the fence and lifting up in order to try to break down the wall of fences, it's just a big mess now and impossible to reach the bunny nest. The mother rabbit can easily manoeuvre through this maze of ugly fences and even though I'm a tiny slip of a girl I can't get past the barriers, but not to worry I'll keep trying. Don't let the little things get in your way, keep trying until you succeed and remember when all else fails start barking, Ancient Basset Saying.

Update on Bunny-Gate. After digging up a nest of bunnies I have been under constant surveillance and warned to stay away from the area, I ignore all threats. My original reason for digging in the area was to bury a chicken strip which got left behind during the flurry of activity, after the little ugly fences were installed the chicken strip has since disappeared and the area looks cleaned up, the mother rabbit is the prime suspect. The Warden has issued an eviction notice as soon as the babies are mobile before any unforeseen incidents occur, in the meantime security will be in full force until the area is deemed safe to return to. There are going to be times when you do what you instinctively feel is right but you are held back, if this happens make sure they do the right thing, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

media.title: It was just another day, I had taken my chicken strip outside to bury in the garden (as one does) when all of a sudden I noticed something moving, I dug a little more and then a head popped out, that's about the same time security showed up to investigate. A nest of bunnies was discovered under the dirt, the area was immediately secured, I was marched inside while the little ugly fences were installed around the area. Even though it was my discovery I wasn't allowed anywhere near the area, yes I tried but more fences were put up. There will be disappointments along the way but don't let that get in the way of trying again, keep trying until you succeed, Ancient Basset Saying.

Sometimes you gotta try something different even if it gets an eye twitch, so I decided to eat my chicken tender on the chair which should be no big deal because it's covered with a blanket and tucked in with hospital corners. Please ignore the piece that dropped to the floor, the cleaning service will make their rounds after I'm finished and not to worry about the blanket it's on a regular cleaning rotation. Yes the staff around here have lots of issues but it's something I've learned to live with, they provide great service and have an assortment of treats which sometimes requires barking, begging or whining. You gotta do what you gotta do to get results, don't let the word no stop you from getting what you deserve, bark until the fridge door opens, Ancient Basset Saying.

Why is it with all good things you get the yank, while out on my sniff and walk I came across a dead mouse laying just off the sidewalk, I call this my lucky day. I went over to investigate, as one does, it may have taken a few seconds of sniffing before I got the yank, there was also a constant flow of mutterings, something about gross and icky (technical term for unpleasant). It's not like I was thinking about bending my knees slightly and going in for a neck roll, if only I didn't get the yank. Take advantage of those lucky moments when they happened, go for the roll before you get the yank, Ancient Basset Saying.

Now you may think I'm in the sleeping zone totally oblivious to anything around me but make no mistake you make a move I'll know, trust me I'll know. You can quietly ease out of your chair, tiptoe into the kitchen, open the fridge door and reach for the second shelf on the left, try to camouflage the opening of the cheese bag and then you look down, there I am sitting pretty by your side. Yes I have a cheese detector built in, it's a sensitivity mechanism which is able to sense movement and or smell the good stuff even if it's on your breath. Trust your instincts, you don't have to make a move with every sound only the ones that are suspicious and smell delicious, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: Throwback to the early years when I arrived at my forever home, it didn't take me long before I realized that I had a lot of work to do before this family could be trained, they were rookies. Initially they just sat around and stared at me waiting to see if I wanted anything, which I thought was a great but then the nighttime came when I was put in a cage and left alone to cry. It wasn't long before someone came to rescue me and I never had to sleep alone again, it turns out she has many issues, a shady past and is difficult to train but it's all manageable with a little barking or whining. It's about making the best of what you have even if you have to bark to get what you want, Ancient Basset Saying.

media.title: Exciting day, one of my favourite delivery guys honked his horn and waved to me, we had no deliveries but he took the time to shout out the window. Whenever we are out on our sniff and walk he makes a point of waving and yelling out a hello, I like to respond with a bark and a helicopter tail spin. The Warden thinks he's waving at her, so she waves back, he's not but it helps build her self esteem, she has issues. It matters, take the time to call out to others, bark louder if they don't hear you, everybody wins, Ancient Basset Saying.

Total chaos and I had nothing to do with it, I might have added to it by barking but it was a barkable moment. All the furniture was moved, a foreign object was used (step stool) and a whole lotta cleaning supplies were all over, it appears that The Warden has gone over the edge. It's that time of year where some people get a little squirrelly and start cleaning, in order to combat this crazy behaviour might I suggest some alternatives, digging in the garden, it's worm rolling season so start rolling and definitely spend more time in the kitchen (small roast simmering in gravy). Stay true to yourself and stay on course, keep barking until you get results, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8
iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: There was an eyewitness account that I had a senior moment while I was out on my sniff and walk, here's what really happened and I have no regrets. I was sniffing the usual corners while out walking, getting the occasional yank, I had crossed the street, took a sniff and then dropped to have a pee. The eyewitness claims that my front end was sniffing and my back end was situated 'off' the grassy area and on the curb, which created a nice flow and no harm intended. I remained totally unaware and unaffected but I did hear a few comments from the cheap seats that I missed my mark. It's about creating your own path and leaving your mark, doing the unexpected will get you noticed and above all else that's exactly what you strive for, Ancient Basset Saying.

The Warden has issues with the barking but how can you properly do a biscuit dance without barking, that's like doing the yank and drag while barking without the barking, it's not possible, who wants a yank and drag while quietly yanking and dragging without the cheap seats yelling hey heys. This is considered an interactive sport, audience participation which leads to belly rubs, scratches in the neck folds and eventually to the second shelf on the left. Keep your head down, continue to bark and good things will happen, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2
iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: All was quiet, there was no movement anywhere but I'm ready to bark at anything, it's just a matter of being patient but if nothing happens soon I'll have to bark anyway. Barking always gets some attention, first off The Warden comes running with the hey heys and then there might be shadows bobbing in the neighbours window, at least I'm being heard. I can always choose option two which is to stretch out and nap but make no mistake if there's any movement I'll know and you'll be the first to hear me. Sometimes getting noticed takes a little extra effort, it's that never give up attitude that makes you a winner, bark loud and proud, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: The Warden went shopping for some essentials, treats for me, while she was at the checkout the lady asked how many dogs she had, she said she had only one but wanted to make sure we were well stocked, plus I was cute and sometimes fussy. We are under a Stay-At-Home Order except for essentials so The Warden was well within her rights to stock up (upon legal advice). It was noted that we can go on our daily sniff and walk but no lingering in groups so I'm expecting to get the yank if I linger too long. As a reminder, especially during captivity, it's important to sprinkle a garnish of cheese over each meal, it's uplifting and gives you hope, Ancient Basset Saying.

Big time of year for The Warden, she was cleaning out window wells, washing windows and I was barking at her, very busy and somewhat exhausting. She found a dead mouse which would normally create a frenzy of activity but it was business as usual, no screeching, no chalk outline around the mouse, just a call to the removal team (aka dad) to bag and tag the deceased. I was kept at a distance while this all happened, no onlookers permitted. Don't get caught up in the busyness of others, sometimes it's best to watch from the sidelines and make your move when there's more time devoted to you, Ancient Basset Saying.

While managing the spring cleanup I noticed a permanent fixture in the garden, a tennis ball which gets used every year to inspire me to play fetch, I don't do fetch. The Wardens hopes and dreams of tossing the ball and me chasing after it have faded away, it's now a conversation piece but it does inspire me to bark. Give me something to dig up or bury, I'll bark until I hear the hey heys or roll on anything that smells lovely but to chase after a ball and retrieve it, well that's not my thing. Do what you do best, be true to yourself, bark like no one's listening, sniff like no one's is waiting and continue the pursuit of what you deserve, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: I was helping The Warden with the yard work, I spent a little time in the garden aerating the soil or commonly known as digging in the dirt, just trying to do my part with the spring cleanup. Yes there was a chunk of dirt on my nose, The Warden called this evidence but I call it hard work for a job well done. I also like to trail after her and lay down in her path, it gives her a chance to focus on the important things like me. Everyone gets busy but it's important to make time for others, reach out and give someone a belly rub or a back scratch and more than anything say a few kind words (eg. she's a good girl who deserves cheese), Ancient Basset Saying.

Every month I get my tick and flea pill, it comes wrapped in meat and as a chaser there's another dangling piece of meat to distract me from the first piece. Well I caught on to the first piece and spit out the pill and snubbed the second piece of meat, I felt betrayed, so The Warden had to change tactics. So here's where it got interesting, the aged cheese was brought into play as a distraction and somewhere in between all the meat and cheese I swallowed my pill, it was a process. If something seems too good to be true it probably means you're being tricked but if it gets you what you want go ahead and be tricked, Ancient Basset Saying.

This is the one side of the house that's considered a blind spot for the surveillance stalker and also what is referred to as rabbit alley, a place where rabbits can sneak into the backyard. The stalker (aka The Warden) heard barking and decided to investigate, she found me warning off all predators who sneak under the gate, as a side note, digging can be used as a technique to ward off a potential threat. This warning was issued to unknown stray rabbits it does not include the Easter Bunny who will be carrying a fairly large basket filled with cheese, if it doesn't fit under the gate please use the front door entrance. All visitors are welcome but be sure to brace yourself when entering, you may get knocked over from all the excitement, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: Do something special this weekend, especially for those who take care of you and do all those little things that sometimes get overlooked.
