I'm saving dad's chair for him, keeping it warm and sprinkling it with basset glitter, even if I have to get up before he sits down there will be all the signs I was here and it smells lovely. I haven't forgotten about The Warden, I'll follow her around, wait for her to fix the hospital corners on my lounger and then I'll do a yank and drag while barking until I hear the hey heys, one of her favourites and it gives her a purpose. Sometimes you don't have to do anything except be there for them, something they can count on and look forward to, that's you being you, Ancient Basset Saying.

I was checking out the backyard and sniffing when all of a sudden I heard a frantic voice calling my name, I raised my head, saw it was The Warden and then went back to sniffing.  Apparently I was out of sight for a short period of time and she started having heart palpitations, normally I see shadows in the window bobbing from room to room watching my every move but there's a small stretch alongside the house where there's no window or surveillance and she panicked. She was having visions of the gate being left open and me escaping, that's when dad would be called in to save the day, he would be chasing after me in his slippers yelling cheese cheese, did I happen to mention that she has issues. If someone is chasing after you yelling cheese cheese it might be time to stop running, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to that time when all was quiet, it was early morning and I wasn't quite ready to start the day when all of a sudden I heard this commotion, The Warden was at the window pointing at something, she was seeing a parade of wild animals, bears, wolves and rabbits, I flew off my lounger all excited ready to bark at whatever was out there. When I got to the window there was nothing to bark at, I kept looking, waiting and that's when I heard the giggling and I heard The Warden say April Fools (I only saw one fool who interrupted my nap for nothing). There will be times when you've got nothing to bark at but don't let that stop you, keep barking until you hear the hey heys and if you bark even louder you won't even hear that, Ancient Basset Saying.

Not every moment is a yank and drag while barking, there has to be a recovery time built into the day, you play hard you snooze harder. I start off each day with a nap, it can be very taxing after a full night of sleep, the morning nap is one of the most important naps of the day. After my morning nap I'll start to sniff around and check out what everyone is doing, The Warden is cleaning, no big surprise there (she has issues), so then I'll head outside to sniff and catch up on any overnight activity and of course I'll exercise my vocal cords by barking which usually gets the party started. It's important to have a routine, predictability, to know when and where to sniff and who to bark at but most of all the never ending pursuit of the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

The snow and ice have finally disappeared, there's plenty of dead grass to roll on and me and my shadow refuse to play fetch with The Wardens spring mitts. Every season The Warden try's to engage me with chasing after something and then returning it over and over again, I don't do fetch, it interferes with my sniffing. I don't mind being chased a few times until I pick up a scent then it's game over. There's nothing wrong with playing by your own rules, if you want to play toss the cheese then it's game on, you toss I eat, repeat and eat, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: While out on our walk we ran into a long legged puppy, he was jumping all over and out of control, I ignored him and continued sniffing. He was restrained from jumping up on me, for that The Warden was thankful because she knows I would issue a warning if anyone jumps in my face. Then the conversation turned to how much the puppy weighed, my ears weighed more than he did, that's when The Warden mentioned that I weighed substantially more 'she's heavier than she looks', fortunately she didn't mention that if I jump up on someone she'll yell out 'brace yourself', it's for legal liability (she has a shady past). Don't let others define who you are, bark like no one is listening, sniff like no one is waiting and continue your endless pursuit of the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: Sometimes you just get lucky and that's what happened to me, here's my story. I was wandering from room to room checking things out when I happened to notice dad had a blanket and he was just about to cover himself with it, that's when I sprang into action, I immediately ran over, grabbed one end and started yanking, as one does. All I could hear was hey hey, the family has a limited vocabulary when under siege, but I continued to yank until the blanket was completely pulled  off. Once I had full possession I did a yank and drag while barking across the room, it was a memorable moment. When opportunity presents itself seize the moment, do what you gotta do to make this a win, bark louder and yank harder, Ancient Basset Saying.

It's important to set the stage for your biscuit dance, this is the same as the yank and drag while barking except you add a little drama by placing your biscuit on the blanket. The cheap seats will be at the edge of their seat watching to see if the biscuit takes the full ride or will it get yanked off, as the anticipation is building it's important to keep barking as it draws them in. Keep your focus and don't get distracted by the hey heys, one trick to help block out any interference is to bark louder. Whenever you set out to do something worthwhile do it to the best of your ability, don't let others dampen your spirit, just bark louder, Ancient Basset Saying.

Spring is in the air and you can almost smell the plants coming alive, this moment was dampened by The Warden as she yelled at me to get out of the dirt, isn't she fun to have around. I still have a hint of lavender on me from my recent bath so I'm trying really hard to reclaim my true essence, a little earthy smell with a hint of worm. The good news for The Warden is I didn't dig up the dirt I just laid on it, apparently she was accessing the cleanup when we went back inside, no harm was done only a couple of paw prints. Never hide who you truly are, if that means you have to dig in dirt or roll on a worm then that's what you do, smelling lovely will be your reward, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to when my brother came home for a visit, back then it was customary for all to honour and praise the one who would steal your chair, there was no forcing you to move, yes there was the occasional bribe and with the right incentive I would move. The ultimate steal would always be the couch, it provided more room to stretch and rotate, I loved the look I got when they would come back to claim their seat, sorry, you move you lose, your seat is now my retreat. The cheap seats would also yell out 'you better get some cheese' and you thought they couldn't be trained. Never give up, keep trying until you achieved what you set out to do, the reward will be worth the effort, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

I was all excited expecting to go outside when all of a sudden dad changed course and lifted me into the bath tub, which was horrifying and a total surprise because my next official bath was scheduled in the summer of 2025. But due to extenuating circumstances according to the perpetrators they felt emergency action had to be taken, I stunk to high heaven (according to someone with issues). After this torturous event The Warden kept sniffing me and saying I smelled lovely, I found this offensive but not to worry before you know it I'll be smelling of lavender with just a hint of worm. Stand proud and as tall as you can, be who you are, you know you've accomplished your goal if they can smell you before they see you, Ancient Basset Saying.

All the signs of spring are here, I've got my bowl of fresh filtered water with ice, my line is tethered to the snowblower, the little ugly fences are up, The Warden is sweeping the street in front of the house (fortunately no one was around to witness this odd behaviour) and the best of all I was stretched out soaking up the sun. There wasn't much to bark at but I did see a friend who stopped by for a short visit, I was so excited that I jumped up, that's when The Warden yelled over 'brace yourself, she's heavier than she looks'. Take the time to welcome everyone, make them feel special even if you have to knock them over, Ancient Basset Saying.

My name is Miss Lilly and I will steal your seat if you dare to move, I have no shame, what's yours is now mine. There's nothing more exciting than a fresh steal, the seat is all warm and then I wait for the 'look back', will they notice right away or do I nap and wait for them to return before they notice. Sometimes they'll go to another chair and sometimes not, if the stars are all aligned The Warden will come back with a piece of cheese in her hand, she says it's that or a small crane (she thinks she's funny) because that's the only way to get me to move. If doing something gets you what you want then that's what you do but make it worth your while, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

It's now officially spring and welcome to worm rolling season, the birds are pecking at the lawn which is a good sign that the ground is starting to come alive. While we wait for the worms to pop up through the frozen ground we can certainly go ahead and roll on the dead grass, it provides a lovely fragrance with just a hint of pee. Not to worry I'll be laying on the driveway soaking up the sun and by the time I go back inside I'll smell like fresh linen. Spring is in the air and my sniffing is on double duty, so be the first to roll on a worm or dig in the dirt or just soak up the sun, Ancient Basset Saying.

Most days after one of my afternoon naps I'll get up and walk over to the closet door, then I'll start barking at the floor vent and the door, this will go on until I hear hey hey or the eye twitch is out of control. Make no mistake, this is a symptom of a cheese deficiency, after a long nap you wake up feeling sluggish so you do a few leg stretches to get you going, this is clearly an indication that your cheese levels are low and the reason you feel compelled to bark excessively at nothing. In order to prevent this unwanted noise (usually by someone with issues) it is highly recommended that a small platter of aged cheese be made available, your barking problems will be solved. Get the help you need, bark until you are heard, the miracle cure can be as close as the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Flashback because we missed throwback to the time I was caught hoarding mini biscuits, it was a new product The Warden thought I'd like. As it turned out I didn't like to eat them but they were great for burying them by the mouth full, I filled The Wardens winter boot, I stuffed them behind all the cushions in the couch and dad's chair. Every day The Warden would praise me for eating these new biscuits until the day she discovered her pillow felt lumpy, she stuck her hand behind the pillow and jumped up, that's when all the furniture was quickly dismantled and the hunt for biscuits began. The biscuits were given away and over time The Warden recovered and is having fewer flashbacks. Never be afraid to try new things because you'll never know what great adventures you will have, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2
iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: Creeping around and spying on those in the house is not a shameful thing to do, it should be encouraged and you should be proud that you were able to prevent any snack sneaking. It may be hard to be present at all times especially during frequent naps but it's worth the effort to move when they're in the kitchen. It's extremely rewarding when they don't except to see you staring up at them as they open the fridge door, it's an endearing moment especially if they reach for the second shelf on the left. Make the effort to be present in someone's life, it can be rewarding for you and them, Ancient Basset Saying.

One last look at the snow mountains before they all disappear, The Warden is preparing to switch from a snow shovel to a rake and I'm preparing to soak up the sun. As the snow melts there's some serious sniffing to be done, it's exciting to discover all the hidden treasures under the snow, so far I've found a biscuit, a surprise deposit and lots of rabbit droppings (which will be bagged and tagged). While others are working it's important to offer your support and encouragement, so bark loud and proud until you hear the hey heys, Ancient Basset Saying.

Another fan favourite, I learned a new trick and it's getting rave reviews, I found if you get under your lounger and bark up a storm everyone gathers around with excitement yelling out hey heys, if this is what the audience wants then I'm your gal. I discovered this new act when I was trying to yank the blanket off the lounger, the hospital corners were holding firm so I went deeper under the lounger and suddenly realized that this was an eye twitching moment. Don't be afraid to try new things, get out of your comfort zone, it could lead to great things, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Usually when I do a yank and drag while barking I can backup into the furniture and it'll move, but(t) not this time and not for the lack of trying. I think the cheap seats were pleased that the stage didn't get rearranged, less cleanup after the performance. Not to worry, after an extended nap I'll try again and backup into the little table which always slides out of the way. If at first you don't succeed try barking louder and if that doesn't work then try napping, Ancient Basset Saying.

We've been busy dismantling the snow mountains, The Warden has been chipping away at the frozen mountain and I've been encouraging her by barking. I'm not sure she appreciates all my efforts and kept telling me to be quiet and yelling out 'hey hey'. Well I did what I thought was the right thing to do and kept on barking, that's when she marched me back inside, did I happen to mention she has issues. The good news is we found the biscuit I buried in the snow, it was bagged and tagged never to be seen again. It's important to take the time to help others, even if the reward is a kind word or a reach for the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Some have wondered why I have multiple blankets on my lounger, there are conflicting reasons, The Warden says it's to protect the lounger and she can easily strip one blanket off to wash while the others remain, now the real reason is to help with the burial process of burying a gravy coated biscuit.  It's true that I never just eat a biscuit without first doing one of two things, either I do a biscuit dance which is similar to the yank and drag while barking or I have to bury the biscuit before I eat it. Of course all of this is done in the same location as the cheap seats, it helps the process if you have audience participation. Follow your instincts, do what is right for you, bury your biscuit, dig deeper and bark louder, Ancient Basset Saying.

The snow is slowly disappearing and before you know it I'll be rolling on worms. I've only noticed the occasional person walking around outside so of course I barked to let them know I'm now available for all meet and greets, treats are optional but would be greatly appreciated. If the sun is shining you'll find me laid out on the pavement soaking up the sun but don't let that stop you from stopping by, I look forward to jumping up on you. Sometimes all it takes is a hello or a treat from someone to make them feel special, take a moment to reach out to those around you, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to those many times I've offered an ear to caress, to those shattered souls who need to calm their nerves. It's a service I provide with some expectations that I will be compensated for extending an ear for those in need, a small platter of cheese would be greatly appreciated. If cheese is not readily available then of course a small roast simmering in gravy would be a great substitute or something comparable would do, I'm not begging, yet. There are those who you just know need a little extra attention so take a moment and offer an ear to caress, Ancient Basset Saying.

I finally got to lay outside on the driveway soaking up the sun, it was only +6 but enough to feel the heat steaming off the pavement. The Warden said something about airing out and hoping the stink will blow off and when I go back inside I'll smell like fresh linen. First off, I smell lovely, she has ongoing issues especially in the spring, she can't look out a window without wanting to wash it. When you go out for a walk and meet others it's important to give them something to sniff at, be proud of who you are, Ancient Basset Saying.

A lawsuit has been filed for taking me, against my will, to get my nails clipped, here's my story. I heard the word 'car' and got all wound up, as one does, we were leaving confinement and going on a road trip. I got all dressed up in my harness and off we went with high expectations of a great adventure, that's when we stopped at the vets. I was allowed to sniff around outside before someone came to get me, there was the handoff and I was taken into the dungeon of horror where I was tortured until all my nails were clipped. There will be disappointments along the way but everything wrong can be made right again, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Every day we are getting closer to soaking up the sun, the snow is slowly melting with the bright sun but it's still very cold -15. Even though the ground is still frozen I've been placing a lot of biscuits on top of the dirt, I can hardly wait to start digging once again. The good news is when I bring the biscuit back inside for a biscuit dance no one chases after me to clean off the dirt. Don't worry about the little things like dirt on your biscuit, do your biscuit dance like no one's watching and bark like no one's listening, Ancient Basset Saying.

I just finished doing a yank and drag while barking but I feel the cheap seats are looking for more. I tried yanking the remaining blankets off the lounger but the hospital corners are holding firm. Can't a girl just walk in the room and be presented with a platter of cheese without having to perform, life would be so much simpler and we would all be happier. Don't try to complicate things, take the easy road, open up the fridge door, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: Just a slip of a girl finding her sun spot which highlights her tiny frame and toned abs. This is a restricted area so please avoid at all costs, the floors were just cleaned so there should be no excuse to disturb, if you want to sit on the sidelines and admire that's fine by me. A word of caution though to those with issues, there will be drool marks and hair left on the floor, **it happens. There's always going to be a lot of stuff swirling around you so take a moment for yourself to stretch out and enjoy some quiet time, you can always bark after, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: Please tell me this is the last snow storm of the year, I'm ready to soak up the sun and start rolling on worms. I decided that the best thing I could do was to go back inside and wait for this mess to be cleaned up.  I prefer a clean canvas in order to be creative, it enhances my sniffing and there's more options for site selection while doing your business. Don't be pressured into doing something on someone else's schedule, it's always best to nap until the right time presents itself, then scratch the door or bark, Ancient Basset Saying.

media.title: Throwback to the early years.  There was a time when I first started to bark and howl where everyone would gather around thinking how cute and adorable this was. As time went on something changed, it was no longer as cute anymore, it started causing eye twitches and then came the hey heys. I also learned very quickly how barking could be used for a good cause, it could get me what I wanted, it's been working out well. Don't let others define who you are, barking is a time honoured tradition, so continue to bark like no one is listening, loud and proud, Ancient Basset Saying.

In the Wonderful World of Miss Lilly there will be no begging, whimpering or whining for cheese, the fridge door will have an open door policy with easy access to all the good stuff. This is not a place for those who like to take tiny delicate bites and savour their food with no one watching and drooling, this is a place for sharing bite for bite. In my world your gravy dippers will hang heavy and no one will chase you with a wet cloth, you will be free from all baths and encouraged to keep on rolling especially during worm rolling season. It's important to be able to dream about what could be and each day try to make those dreams come true, Ancient Basset Saying.

There was a bit of an incident while The Warden was doing her 'no poop left behind' mission, her hand accidentally touched a sample during a deposit pickup, there was unsavory language used that was very unbecoming, I'm sure the neighbours would've preferred to hear me barking. She tried sticking her hand in the snow to clean it off but it was solid ice so she let loose again (no injuries were reported). To me there was a lot of fuss about nothing, not every mission is a success, there will be casualties and hand washing is highly recommended after each mission. Not everything will be perfect all the time, so go with the flow, take a little extra time sniffing and have some cheese (it helps calm the nerves), Ancient Basset Saying.

You ever get this feeling that something isn't right, trust your instincts, if it doesn't feel right don't do it. I was looking for a place to bury my biscuit in the garden, as one does, when I got this feeling I was being watched, I was compromised and had to abort my biscuit burying mission. As many of you know I'm under constant surveillance but there are times when you need a little privacy, a little space to sniff and bury stuff and maybe to even roll on something that smells lovely. I lack that privacy, when you live with someone who doesn't have other social contacts you become their focus, I suppose this could be considered a community service, protecting others from my fate. There are times when you need to keep your nose to the ground, sniff like no one's watching, bark like no one's listening and be front and center when the fridge door opens, Ancient Basset Saying.

I almost don't even react anymore when someone comes to the door and does a drop and dash, no one lingers around to see if anyone needs a kind word or to hear someone yelling 'brace yourself, she's heavier than she looks'. Used to be I'd welcome everyone by jumping up on the door, barking and howling, The Warden would try to crack the door open an inch while I tried to get out, those were the good ole days when everyone felt special especially if they got jumped up on. Some day soon you'll hear the faint voice of someone yelling 'get back get back' as they try to open the door to greet you and if you're real lucky you might even get jumped up on, Ancient Basset Saying.

You don't always have to do a yank and drag while barking to get the attention you deserve, sometimes all you need is a little attitude. First off you need to get their attention, look deeply into their eyes, try to draw them in, if they start to get distracted or lose focus then you need to ramp it up and start barking. What you want is for them to call you over, give you lots of scratches and rubs, do a deep dive into your neck folds while giving you little kisses on the forehead with lots of sweet talk. What this hopefully does is break down their hardened exterior and makes them want to go immediately to the fridge, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

At the time I thought this was a good idea, I always wanted to explore the gardens, which is normally fenced off and forbidden, so I thought what the heck and climbed that mountain. Onward and upward I went into the great unknown, that's when with each step I started sinking, this might not be the greatest idea I've ever had. In order to save what dignity I had left I decided to retreat, I did notice that security was getting ready to either yell 'hey hey' or come to my rescue, to make a long story short I saved myself and felt I should be rewarded. Be the hero in your own story, if at first you don't succeed keep trying until you get the reward you deserve, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to another attack of the furminator, no harm was done to the furminator while filming this video, it can still be used. The good news is I did make a few improvements to the handle, it was slippery due to the slobber but the chew marks gave it a better grip therefore making it easier to handle. All these improvements were made while The Warden stepped away briefly to refresh my water with ice, one good turn deserves another. Doing the right thing makes others appreciate you more and could lead to the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

It's a good day when you've done a successful yank and drag while barking, all three blankets were yanked off at once, you had audience participation (hey hey) and you made someone smile, that's what it's all about.  There's always the question about how far you push your performance, do you continue until you see the eye twitch or do you just keep your head down and bark like no one's listening. Do I ever worry that I've gone too far, naw, my job is to entertain and get attention, if they stop everything they're doing and call you over for a neck rub then you've succeeded. You do what works and if it leads to the second shelf on the left then chalk this up as a win, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: It's above freezing which means spring is in the air and sunny days are coming our way but for now we have to keep digging ourselves out of these constant snow storms. I went out briefly to join the snow crew but soon realized it was better to watch all this from the inside. There was no walk today due to the amount of snow and nothing was plowed, the snow was over my knee and no where to pee. Even though the days look bleak it's important to stay optimistic, sunny days are just around the corner and we can once again start barking at everyone, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: I think I've been brainwashed or under hypnosis, whenever I come back from my walk my underbelly needs to be wiped down and all they have to do is say 'Lilly wait' and I do it, I must be in a trance to obey on command. It used to be a choreographed event with two people, one holding me on the leash, confined in one room while the other person gets a warm cloth and then getting wiped down while I'm chomping at the bit to escape. Now I'm listening, I know the routine and I'm compliant, who am I, what's happened to me and all this is done without any expectations of a pay off. Yes there's the sweet talk, lots of rubs and kisses, also a few comments about not smelling like fresh linen but I ignore anything I don't like to hear (I smell lovely). There will come a time when you realize that resisting takes too much effort and you'll discover that things aren't too bad if you just listen and enjoy the moment, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: There's some good news, while The Warden was out in the backyard she found the reported missing deposit, she bagged and tagged it to complete her 'no poop left behind' mission. Of course she found a few other surprises buried in the snow in uncharted territory that the surveillance team missed. I've also included a picture of my missing biscuit that unfortunately was lost during the snow storm, I'm offering a reward for its return to anyone that recovers it unharmed and intact. We all have our own unique ways of expressing ourselves, some of us bark, sniff, bury or seek undivided attention and we all deserve to be loved, nothing says love more than cheese, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: Are you ever afraid that you'll miss out on someone sneaking around, that you're not getting all the attention you deserve or that your cheese levels are getting low, have no fear, I have a plan for you. First off make sure you get noticed, if that means they have to walk over you, so be it, it's important to always be aware of where they are at all times, you might have to make a move but it'll be in your best interest, my motto, they move I move. This could cause some disruptions to your napping schedule so keep your ears open and know your sounds, especially kitchen activity. Don't miss out on any opportunity that will get you what you want, keep your ears fine tuned and be ready to pounce when the fridge door opens, Ancient Basset Saying.

I would like to file an official complaint during this latest snowstorm, I had buried a biscuit along the edges of the snow mountain and during the cleanup it somehow got lost, could be the spring before it's found. The Warden also has concerns, she had cautioned dad about a deposit pickup before he used the snowblower, it was all mapped out on her pickup chart (confirmed by surveillance), apparently it wasn't found in time and the deposit is now relocated in the garden or in the snow mountain, this messes up the whole recovery plan of 'no poop left behind'. Adapt and move forward, what's done is done, other biscuits can be buried and there's lots of deposits for your recovery mission, your main concern should be about your next piece of cheese, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to a time when my brother was able to come home for a visit, where every morning I'd be excited to do a crash and bang into his room to start the day, I would get to take him on a walk where he let me sniff with no yanking, there would be the smell of a roast simmering in gravy and he wouldn't chase after me trying to clean my gravy dippers. We'd stretch out on the couch together to watch hockey and have snacks, I'd wake up when there was hooting and hollering if someone scored a goal, there would be hair in the air from all the scratches and rubs and The Warden wouldn't vacuum until we were done. Remember to stay in touch even if it's not possible to be physically there, you can still make sure that everyone is doing alright and that they are getting enough cheese, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: As I was strolling around the house, room by room, I noticed something was out of place, I approached hesitantly while keeping at a safe distance, with my head down in the attack position I inched and sniffed closer, I was left with no other choice but to issue an alarm, so I barked, as one does. As expected that brought the house security running to see what danger I've encountered, apparently they were in the midst of dusting and had stepped out of the room for a second, their version of events, I recall a foreign object ready to attack. Trust your instincts, approach with caution, unless of course you smell cheese then feel free to barge forward, Ancient Basset Saying.

media.title: My name is Miss Lilly and I freely admit I am a barker, I stand tall(ish) as I represent my people, I bark without shame and have no regrets. There are some who will try to dampen your spirit by calling out hey heys and they do not take joy in your freedom to express, I will not name names, you know who you are, you will carry the shame of intolerance. Barking is encouraged, it leads to good things, if you need attention or cheese then you do what works, bark loud and proud, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: All of a sudden it got so quiet I became alarmed, not a creature was stirring not even The Warden, that's why I stopped barking so I could focus on what was happening upstairs. Normally there's cleaning noises, dishes rattling, vacuuming, shimmy shaking music but never is it so eerily quiet that the hairs on my back stood up. This could mean a couple of things, she was reading which I ruled out because it wasn't her reading time so it could only mean one other thing, she's sneaking snacks which is a violation against all human decency, I must be present for all food consumption. Fool me once shame on you, because I'll hunt you down and find whatever snack you sneak, I'm coming for you, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: I was trapped, I couldn't see anything, I could almost hear time ticking away wondering if I'll ever get another belly rub or a piece of cheese, these were the harrowing moments of being locked behind the door of the wine cellar (aka closet). It started out as an opportunity, I noticed the door open and decided to bark in the corner (as one does), one thing lead to another and by backing into the door it suddenly locked. That's when I decided to stop barking so I could focus on hearing the rescue team searching for me, called out my name, they would be panicking and have tears in their eyes and cheese in their hands, but no, they just opened the door and told me to get out. It wasn't the great reunion I was hoping for but I was free to bark another day. Never let fear stop you from doing what you think is the right, trust your instincts and bark until they offer you cheese, Ancient Basset Saying.

This is me, Miss Lilly, reporting in, letting you know we are still under lockdown due to the weather (-18), The Warden says I need to curtail my barking inside because it's fraying her nerves, so I decided to let loose outside, and as we all know barking is a symptom of a cheese deficiency.  Also during any and all confinement it helps ease the tension if you expand the menu options to include a small roast simmering in gravy. It is highly recommended by top researchers, to prepare a cheese platter at the first signs of barking, it's an instant cure and it makes everyone happy. It's important to let science guide us through difficult barking times, barking can be cured with cheese and lots of undivided attention, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: I was asking to go outside but it wasn't deemed as an emergency by someone else's standards, first I needed a little encouragement, a belly rub, some sweet talk and then I was 'almost' ready. Once the door was opened I needed to do my stretches, one leg at a time, first the front then the back legs, didn't want to cramp up on the way out. The Warden was mumbling about the cold (-18) while I was preparing to go out, apparently she wasn't dressed in winter attire while she waited for me to go out, of course I didn't stay out too long because it was freezing cold. Some things can't be rushed but if the right incentive is offered I could be persuaded, choose wisely, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to another addition of my Escape Series, this harrowing event advanced the aging process of The Warden. I used to be allowed outside hooked up to the snowblower, every several minutes someone would do a welfare check until this happened, this my side of the story. During one checkup The Warden came out and all she saw was an empty collar attached to my line, she panicked (as one does), she grabbed the leash and headed up the street calling my name, there I was two houses up, my sniffing on overload, with relief she called my name. I was excited to be free so I started running in circles, I didn't hear anyone pleading, that's when a neighbour came to the rescue, fussed over me until my leash was attached, I think I heard The Warden say brace yourself. Enjoy the freedom you have because it can lead to undivided attention, great adventures and the greatest reward, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

The Warden thought it'd be fun to play fetch after all the snow was cleared, I don't do fetch so she had to retrieve her own mitts, I prefer a more interactive sport where I bark and she yells hey hey. Concerns have also been raised by the surveillance technician (The Warden), who has reported several blind spots which now allows me 'free' time without prying eyes and now she can't record any deposit sites for her pickup schedule, these are just a few of our winter hardships. It's about making the best of what you are given, no mountain is too high if you just wait for someone to meander around it, let those who bark be heard and be generous because it's the right thing to do, Ancient Basset Saying.

Another busy day, I successfully did a yank and drag while barking followed by a biscuit burying ritual, during lockdown it's important to keep the cheap seats entertained, we are all in this together, so do your part. Some wonder why I have several blankets on my lounger, it started off to protect my lounger from getting dirty (as if) and over time I started yanking off my blankets, it was the challenge of the hospital corners and then it was used to bury my biscuit, it's a great multi purpose lounger. Use your time wisely while you're indoors, try to stay active in between your naps, this gives you a chance to bond with those held in captivity and remember barking can lead to the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

I like to wait until the snow crew has finished the cleanup of the yard before I give the official once over and the sniff inspection. It's important that the rock ledges are cleared for easy access to the garden and that the snow mountains don't obstruct access to frequently used areas, it's a bonus if they obstruct the view from prying eyes. If there's anymore snow I'm worried where the snow will be tossed next without charges be laid. All good deeds need to be acknowledged and rewarded, so bark loud and sniff long and you may also reap the rewards, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Burying a biscuit can be complicated, first you have a biscuit dance ritual followed by a yank and drag while barking and then you have to bury it. At first it might seem impossible but if you keep your head down and focus the impossible can be achieved. You may ask, does the biscuit taste better after each ritual, of course it does, it's the taste of success, accomplishment and the eye twitch. Don't let others tell you it can't be done, anything can be achieved with the right amount of barking and digging, even the most sought after prize, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Instructional video:  How To Successfully Untuck Hospital Corners. The first step is to show confidence, it's that 'can do' attitude that you need exude and show you mean business. Of course they are feeling confident that their tucking skills are top notch and their new technique will hold off any yank and drag while barking.  Next you need to get your head completely under your lounger, grab onto the blanket and yank it out and that my friends is how it's done. Once you've successfully mastered the untuck you can now walk away with pride, try not to gloat, the cheap seats can be fragile. It's that never give up attitude that gets results, if at first you don't succeed try again until you do, Ancient Basset Saying.

Do I ever get used to things being out of place, the simple answer is no but there are varying degrees of letting others know how I feel. Every month The Warden cleans the Dyson filter (manufacture recommended) and sets it out to dry, when she first started doing this the whole neighbourhood knew I was unsettled, nowadays the alert is toned down but I'm still making my point of displeasure. It's important to let others know if you have issues with what they're doing, bark until you are heard and with a little luck get compensated, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to the fun in the sun days where I had the good fortune to attack the furminator, it was an opportunity I couldn't pass up, The Warden unknowingly set it down for just a second and I sprang into action. That was of course until I landed on the grass, keep in mind that this was during worm rolling season and it's hard to pass up the sweet scent of a worm (just a little dab on the neck will do). Sometimes luck happens to shine on you and you have to seize the moment, bark out your good fortune and never miss an opportunity to roll, Ancient Basset Saying.

I'm looking for some lockdown relief, the unthinkable was done, The Warden washed the cover on my lounger, that was my sanctuary, the lingering smell where I found comfort, it was home. When the cover was put back on the bed it became lumpy and I refused to lay on it, my favourite spot was now raised, visually disturbing, so after a lot of coaxing The Warden decided to place a piece of cheese on the lounger, reluctantly I climbed aboard and eventually laid down, it may take some time before the lumps are all flattened out. There are some things that don't need to be changed especially if they give comfort and smell lovely, Ancient Basset Saying.

Do not, I repeat, do not make eye contact while burying your gravy coated biscuit, just continue on and block out all distractions because you know and I know where I go she goes, it's like a shadow that never disappears. Later that day I retrieved my biscuit and brought it back inside, the good news for The Warden was she didn't have to chase after me to clean the dirt off the biscuit. Find a way to except those that follow your every move, lead them to the fridge, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Another day for cold weather lockdown (-17), only allowed outside for a brief sniff and essential business, yanking is the new normal. Dad decided to switch our mailbox route to walking around our street, which was exciting, got to sniff the neighbours snow banks and also let everyone know I'm out and about, except no one was outside. Yes I was under constant surveillance, which was perfectly legal as long as she didn't infringe on anyone's privacy (statement from The Wardens lawyer). Make the best of what you are given, sniff when you can, bark until you're heard, whine and whimper until the fridge door opens, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

After several rounds of doing a yank and drag while barking I decided to change things up and try to get behind the chairs and bark (the forbidden zone), a favourite selected by the cheap seats. At this point The Warden decided it was time for me to get dressed up (harness and leash) and go outside for a walk, it was now -18 and dad was to be the designated lead yanker, so off we went to the mailbox and back. Minimal sniffing was permitted and one brief stop for essential business was allowed followed by the yank and back home we went, I felt I was being watched the whole time, there were shadows in the window (she has issues). Following a routine becomes so important each day, if not excessive barking may occur, if this happens the best remedy is the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

More time is spent inside due to the severe cold weather so I'm obligated to do several yank and drag while barking sessions per day, it's in my contract (don't stop barking until you see the eye twitch). While we were out for a brief walk The Warden noticed that I lifted my back leg and she panicked (as one does) so we had to rush home, no sniffing or stopping allowed (it was -14). Fortunately we were close to home, I had visions of The Warden trying to lift me up and carrying me home, I've heard you can do enormous things while under duress but as The Warden often says she'd need a small crane to lift me (isn't she fun to have around). Make the best out of what you are given or keep barking until they open the fridge door, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

There was an incident while out on our walk and sniff, my reputation and dignity remain intact, The Warden went home feeling ashamed and mortified, here's what happened. Due to the high snow banks along the sidewalks it was difficult to find the appropriate spot to do my business, so you adapt to the situation and take advantage of any low spot you can find.  Along the way we meet a gentleman who was shoveling his sidewalk, we stopped to talk about the weather and that's when I found my low spot and peed right in front of his shovel. Apologies were offered, eyes were averted and we scurried off, the man said it was no problem as he continued to shovel off the yellow spot. Whenever you encounter extreme difficulties you deal with it as best as you can and know that you gave someone else a memorable moment, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to one of the most exciting adrenaline filled days I've ever experienced, here's my story. While out on patrol I noticed movement in the window well so I decided to take a closer look and jumped in, that's when the circus started. The Warden briefly lost sight of me and sent out a search team (my brothers) to find me, they of course were enjoying the chase and someone else was in a crisis mode. The Warden was yelling 'get her out, get her out', she thought the mouse was going to attack, of course I was totally unaware of anything happening around me. My brothers eventually got me out, they rescued the mouse by using a bucket (live release), The Warden had a mild meltdown but recovered within a few hours and I continued to search every corner of the yard looking for the mouse.  Enjoy the ride while you can because eventually everything will calm down and you'll once again be sitting pretty waiting to be rewarded, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

No need to be alarmed, I've secured the area and not a creature was stirring not even a mouse, except for the rabbits who lurk under the cover of darkness, there are signs they've been running wild in our yard which is covered with hop prints and droppings. The Warden has been kept busy during her daily deposit pickups which now includes rabbit droppings plus the regular deposits, fortunately everything is frozen which limits the icky mutterings. Everyone has a job to do and should be rewarded for their efforts, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Calling surveillance room, come in, come in, this is The Warden, I've lost visual contact with the target (Miss Lilly), can you confirm her last known location?  This is the surveillance room, please be advised that we do not respond to reports of visual issues if under a minute, the subject is currently sniffing so please use your emergency breathing techniques and relax, she should be heading your way by the time you take two deep breaths into the paper bag. Update, the subject (Miss Lilly) unaware of the distress call, came out from behind the snow mountain sniffing and headed towards the door looking for a treat. If you notice someone who is a little jagged around the edges or wired out of shape, take a moment and offer a belly rub or an ear caress, it's considered a community service, Ancient Basset Saying.

The lonesome howl heard the world over in a desperate plea for someone to stop by, warning issued, will be jumped up on due to extreme excitement, brace yourself. At the mere suggestion or the slightest hint of movement outside brings on the cry for company, please stop by, snacks will be provided, depending on the length of the stay there could be a small roast simmering in gravy, if it's a brief visit a platter of cheese will be made available and each guest will have an opportunity for endless belly rubs and as a special parting gift will be covered in hair. Take the time to reach out to others that howl behind close doors, if you can't stop by to get jumped up on then a small snack would be greatly appreciated, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: Another rule added on our sniff and walk, when the temperature is -13 you can only stop for short periods of sniffing and a quick bit of business. So if someone left an extended pee-mail I may not be able to sniff the whole message before I get the yank. There are lots of encouraging phrases to try to keep me moving along (I didn't hear cheese), go to the park, the mailbox, who is it who is it (chanting), there's a doggie and the ever popular, wanna go home. This of course is all just a bunch of chatter to justify the constant yank and as you know sniffing each and every footprint in the snow takes time. There are some things that can't be rushed and sniffing is one of them, keep on sniffing at least until you get the yank, Ancient Basset Saying.

There's a rule in our house, well there are many rules but this one particular rule is 'do not get behind the furniture and bark'. The furniture is strategically placed so I can't do this unless of course the table happens to slide out of the way in which case it becomes an open barking invitation. Some of you will wonder why I'm not allowed to bark, the simple answer is they have issues. Barking is your right and can be used in many different ways, there's danger, there's company at the door, something is out of order, your cheese levels are low, you have a cheese deficiency and you need and deserve attention, use your barking wisely, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2
iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: I've completed my snooping mission around the house and I'm confident that nothing is out of place, the kitchen activity has ceased to exist, my daily ration of gravy coated biscuits are laid out for the day and the sounds of The Warden cleaning gives me comfort because I know exactly where she is, if it gets quiet that's when it's time to get up. When nothing is stirring not even The Warden that's when trouble is brewing, she could be planning to escape, maybe she's going outside without me or the worst possible reason she could be sneaking a snack. The safety and security of your home is very important that's why you need to do a regular snooping mission, especially if there's kitchen activity, my motto, the fridge door opens be up front and in the way, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to a number of years ago when I made my first escape from confinement, I managed to slip out of my collar and I immediately headed for the hills (neighbours front lawn under the tree). The neighbour knocked on the door and asked The Warden if she knew I was up the street, that's when all hell broke loose and panic set in. The neighbour got my leash and brought me home, The Warden wanted a full investigation and those who were responsible be charged and sent to prison, after a few deep breath's into a paper bag she settled down. After this event I was put under constant surveillance, The Warden continues with her separation anxieties but is showing progress with her therapy and I got a new collar that's harder to slip out of. An act of kindness comes in many forms, be gracious to those who reach out, you can bark, howl, jump up on or whimper and whine your thanks, Ancient Basset Saying.

During our walk, sniff and yank this little fella no bigger than my hind leg started running up to us, free as a bird, no restraints, no one yelling hey heys, we did a quick meet and greet and then he was off again enjoying his new found freedom. This of course drew a small crowd of people, socially distancing, someone followed his footprints (fresh snow) and found an open gate. When the homeowner came out she started yelling hey hey and Joey (new friend) quickly went back home, he wasn't a barker so that's probably why he heard the hey heys (never underestimate the power of the word hey hey). Enjoy the freedoms that you have, even if you are surrounded by fences or walls, you are still able to bark freely, dig deeper, have fresh filtered water with ice and get lots of snacks, Ancient Basset Saying.

With this video I present to you evidence that I do eat my gravy coated biscuits, this will also be used as evidence if required that I am neat and tidy while eating. Before I begin eating I go through a burial ritual where I'll dig up the blankets, spit out my biscuit and then cover up the biscuit with my nose, now in this particular case the hospital corners held tight so I had to fake bury. This ritual is not to be confused with the yank and drag while barking, it's a separate ritual used when I can yank off the blankets. Let your instincts guide your creativity, do what gets results, bark louder, dig deeper or whine and whimper till the fridge door opens, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Bark until you get results, while doing a yank and drag while barking it's important to stay focused, keep your head down and stay in the zone, also be aware that if you haven't heard any hey heys after a nerve rattling barking session you better take a moment to see what the cheap seats are doing. I think they're trying to psych me out, it's radio silence and very unnerving, maybe my barking is losing some of it's bluster, there's only one surefire way to find out, it's time to ramp it up. Never give up, that's the easy way out, give it all you got until you hear the fridge door open, Ancient Basset Saying.

Tips on how to avoid a bath during the off season, as many of you know bath season starts in May and ends in September, weather permitting, must be a sunny day with ample time for rolling post bath and restricted to one bath per season. To begin with it's important to do spot cleaning within view of those who have 'smell sensitivity' (you know who you are), this shows you are aware of their concerns and it gives them hope. Signs that it's time for spot cleaning, frequent blanket washing, wrinkling of nose, eyes tearing up, they smell you before they see you and whispering unpleasant comments. It's important to be aware of those around you who have issues, offer them an ear to caress or a belly to rub, make them realize that it's doesn't matter how you smell just as long as you are happy.

Do you ever get the feeling that you are being watched all the time, that's probably because you are, I think the hairs on the back of my neck are permanently standing up. Once we get another snow storm and these snow piles turn into snow mountains I should be able to find a few moments of freedom from prying eyes but only until my butt starts to freeze. As soon as I'm out of sight I start to get a sense of panic inside, head bobbing from room to room, a search and rescue mission in development, that's about the time I decide to meander back inside before her plans get out of control. Having quiet time alone is important, it gives others time to reflect on how special you are which could lead to the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

In Ancient times us Bassets were used to chase down small varmints as they burrowed into tiny places, our tail with the white tip was like a flagpole to help locate the captured animal. In modern times the raised white tip tail is to help calm the nerves of The Warden as she monitors your whereabouts with surveillance equipment. In Ancient times they didn't have recording devices, night vision goggles, daily deposit pickup missions or a selection of the finest cheeses and deli meats. Remember where you came from so you can appreciate where you are, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to the urban jungle where I had a place to escape from the cold winter weather, prying eyes and the surveillance cameras monitoring my every move. It was also a place where I could bark freely without hearing someone yelling hey hey, while under the foliage all barking was muffled and you could barely hear me, of course I couldn't hear much over all the barking. Don't let barking block out what you really want to hear, even if they whisper the words you've been waiting to hear be ready to receive, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Abort abort, my biscuit burying mission has been compromised so a decision was made to cancel all burials until my privacy has been restored. The Warden had me under surveillance as soon as I went outside, I could see shadows bobbing in the window, so I decided to take my biscuit back inside and do a yank and drag while barking. I made one tactical error, I made eye contact which interfered with my concentration so I had to relocate my burial mission. Trust your instincts and if something doesn't seem right then change your strategy, you can always bark or dig somewhere else, Ancient Basset Saying.

Don't give up, even if you lose sight of your biscuit during a yank and drag while barking, keep searching until you find it. While I was doing a search and rescue mission for my biscuit The Warden was assessing the state of my blanket, which by the way smells lovely, she noticed a few scattered hairs and one biscuit crumb, which was no reason to get bent out of shape and want to wash it. One way to prevent your blanket from being removed is to firmly plant yourself and do not, I repeat, do not make eye contact. It's important to protect what is yours especially from those with cleaning issues unless of course they make you an offer you can't refuse, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

It's still possible to bury your biscuit outside when there's snow but here's an important tip, don't dig or bury too deep in case you need to relocate or retrieve. Once you've covered your biscuit with a light dusting of snow just walk away without making eye contact with anyone lurking in the shadows. If you choose to retrieve your frozen biscuit it's important to be able to see a shadowed outline in case you can't find it by sniffing, the good news is when you bring it back inside it won't be covered in dirt and someone won't be chasing after you to clean it off. It's important to find a way to overcome all obstacles that you encounter along the way, sometimes you may have to dig deeper or bark louder, sometimes not, you assess the situation and adapt to the moment, Ancient Basset Saying.

I was helping The Warden with her 'no poop left behind' mission, she was armed with her pre-opened deposit bags and a shovel. In the cold weather you do not want to take off your mitts and start licking your fingers to open deposit bags, important rule to remember, also a shovel is required for those embedded deposits that are a struggle to remove, be prepared with the necessary tools during your mission. I'm an advance scout and I will bark out the next location for The Warden, she almost missed one and this could've created flashbacks or nightmares, as a bonus she found a stray leaf under the snow. Helping others is about doing the right thing, barking has a tendency to speed things along and can be rewarding, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Calling on all barkers and howlers to join in on the songs of our people, make it loud and proud so all can hear, if you don't hear a couple of hey heys then it's not loud enough. Sometimes it only takes one barking out to start a melody of others to follow, if you can't see them at least you can connect by hearing them, later when you go on your walk you can give thanks by leaving a pee-mail message. Be a leader, don't always wait to follow others, be the first to bark or howl and you will reap the rewards, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

One fatal mistake lead to the capture and takeover of The Wardens sweater, she hesitated for a brief moment and I immediately sprang into action, I grabbed onto a sleeve and started yanking, she surrendered the sweater. This is the second time I've gained full control of her sweater, usually she puts it on in an undisclosed location, there's just something enticing about a dangling sleeve that I can't resist. Full disclosure, no harm was done while yanking the sweater and it now smells lovely. If an opportunity presents itself then grab on and start yanking, this could lead to a negotiated truce, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to yesterday when I was outside exploring the barren wasteland when all of a sudden I spotted movement, it was a neighbour getting out of his car so I started barking and howling, as one does, just to let him know I was outside tethered to the snowblower. It was wonderful when he yelled over a greeting and acknowledged that he saw me, I guess he didn't see The Warden who was trying to tidy up the curb edges that were covered in snow (she has issues). It's important to be friendly and exchange pleasantries with others even if you have to bark and howl, it makes others feel special and want to give back, especially if they offer treats, Ancient Basset Saying.

The history of how the yank and drag while barking began, it originally started off as the Biscuit Dance and over time evolved into more of a yanking, dragging and barking ceremony (biscuit optional). Before eating a gravy coated biscuit a ritual has to be performed, usually in the evening while everyone is resting and watching TV, important to have their undivided attention. The most frequently asked question is do I eat the biscuit, after the ritual and a round of hey heys from the cheap seats I will eat the biscuit. It's important that you follow your instincts and do what's right for you, if it means you yank, drag and bark then do it and hope this leads to a positive outcome, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: As I sit and watch I notice how some things change with the season's while other things remain the same. There's less movement of people during the winter season so there's not a lot of reasons to bark but that doesn't mean you let your guard down, you never want to miss an opportunity to bark. The warmer weather brings people out and about which means there's more opportunities to bark and let's not forget that it's also worm rolling season. It's your duty and your right to bark at anything that moves, it shows your attention to detail and hopefully all this movement can be scheduled around your naps and snooze time, Ancient Basset Saying.

media.title: If something isn't the way you like it then do something about it, don't settle for tucked in hospital corners all neat and tidy, sometimes having your blankets all messed up is the way to go, make the change you need and want, you do you. Not to worry, every time I leave the room and come back the lounger is made up and ready for me to do as I please and yes there are moments where I just nap and not a corner is yanked out. Every yank and drag while barking has meaning, it gives someone else a purpose and makes them feel valued so don't hesitate to yank and bark if it gives back, Ancient Basset Saying.

My work down here is done, I went downstairs with a gravy coated biscuit looking for a burial site, barked in several rooms, checked in with dad to make sure he knew I was in the area and after a few minutes of rubs and scratches I decided to head back upstairs and see if The Warden needed attention. As you all are aware climbing stairs depletes your cheese levels so as a precautionary measure I insisted on a piece of medicinal cheese. The Warden understands the value of hard work and had a piece of aged cheese waiting for me, my cheese mission is now complete. Sometimes you have to work a little harder for the things you want and need but in the end it is well worth the effort, Ancient Basset Saying.

I officially became a pack leader, dad took me to the golf course for a sniff and walk off leash, that's when I met up with four others who were running around so I joined in, I of course stuck to the inside lane.  After a bit of a run we all stopped to sniff and then I decided to rally the gang up and led the troops around the 15th hole, everyone started following me, I was showing off moves they've probably never seen before, at least until it was time to stop for another sniff. Sometimes you need to be a leader and not always follow, you need to bark louder and sniff longer and others will join in, Ancient Basset Saying.

Starting the new year off right with a yank and drag while barking, some things shouldn't change if it lifts the spirits of others. This new year I will make a commitment to beg and whine for as much roast and gravy as I can, my gravy dippers are made to be dipped in gravy. It's a year for making healthy choices and I vow to make my pursuit of cheese my number one priority. I will offer my ear to caress to those that need a moment of calm reflection, especially those who have issues. We have great hopes and expectations for the new year, to be surrounded by friends and family, to once again have someone who I can bark at and slobber on, Ancient Basset Saying. Happy New Year my friends.

Looking back over the past year I noticed a few things, there weren't as many visitors who I could bark at or jump up on, fewer people at the dinner table so less roast simmering in gravy, dad started hoarding my gravy coated biscuits and The Warden needed to rub my ear more (soothing mechanism). We are hopeful that the new year will bring us all together so we can give and receive lots of hugs and slobbery kisses. May each person get the opportunity to be jumped up on in excitement and leave covered in hair and slobber, Ancient Basset Saying.

I stand behind dad even if he's convicted of hoarding, here's what happened. Dad went to the store for essential provisions, which included my gravy coated biscuits, there were five boxes left on the shelf and he decided to take them all. He kept looking over his shoulder to see if he was being followed or reported, he scurried through checkout, then ran out of the store yelling 'start the car, start the car' (he was alone). I'm thankful he wasn't arrested or publicly scorned, these biscuits are essential for my daily yank and drag while barking. Stand behind those who stand up for you, for they are the ones who will cross the line to make sure you get what you need, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: Sharing is caring, that's what having a couch is all about, after awhile teetering on the edge becomes comfortable, I'm assuming that's what The Warden is muttering about. I usually start out at the end of the couch, tucked and cramped in the corner but eventually I need to stretch and rotate, as one does, it's not healthy if you don't move around, it can lead to a cheese deficiency. As time ticks on it may seem like a complete takeover but that's only because someone decides to relocate, I'm not responsible for their own personal choices of comfort. Sharing comes in many forms, your time, your space and most importantly what you eat, choose wisely when you share, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

media.title: A lesson in how to get what you want and break down barriers. For some reason I'm not allowed to get in behind the chairs and bark at nothing, so they strategically placed the furniture to restrict access, until one day I figured out how to get what I want. While doing a yank and drag while barking I found if I backed into the table it slid easily out of the way, bingo, room to manoeuvre behind the chair. If there's a will there's a way, you just have to figure out a way to overcome all obstacles, barking is encouraged and will open doors, hopefully the fridge door, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

After the snow blizzard incident where I had to fight the elements to do the right thing, stop drop and go, The Warden and her shovel decided to clear the yard so I'd have the freedom to sniff and wander. Of course she expects me to choose wisely and do my business within the designated areas, that's about the time I stepped over the line into a restricted area, it's called living on the edge, doing your business outside the lines. There are times when you need to poke your nose over the line, sniffing has no boundaries and sometimes it can be rewarding, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

I woke up to snow squalls this morning and there was a lot of speculation about whether or not I would 'stop drop and go' on the deck, side bets were exchanged, I surprised everyone and went down the stairs into the blizzard (two feet) and fortunately found my way back (maybe exposed for one minute). I'm lucky they didn't have to send a search party to help with the rescue but with the help of the search lights and someone watching my every move I was able to locate the house. There will be hardships along the way but if you keep your nose to the ground and sniff a little bit at a time you will prevail, good things will happen to those that sniff and bark, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

This Christmas is going to be a little different this year, there will be no crash and bang to get my brother up in the morning, there will be less people at the dinner table to beg for a small morsel and there won't be tons of hair in the air from all the extra rubs and scratches. What there will be is hope that everyone stays safe and that soon we can all celebrate together. My mission today will be 'no turkey and gravy left behind'. Not everything stays the same so you make the best of what you have and there will always hope for the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying. Merry Christmas my friends!

Throwback to the day someone thought it was a good idea to bring a balloon into the house. Warning Issued - some may find this continuous barking disturbing and others may be just as disturbed by the balloon, as a side note all floating objects are permanently banned from entering our house. Due to this traumatic event emergency medicinal cheese had to be given to calm the nerves, The Warden also required an extra evening juice. If you encounter an unknown don't hesitate to bark and keep on barking until everything is made right again, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

It's not impossible to bury your biscuit during the winter season you just have to be creative, if you are close to the fence line the dirt is usually softer, easier on the nose. Word of caution though, if the ground is completely frozen it's best to avoid an underground burial, best to look for shrubbery or foliage to tuck it under and if there's snow then go ahead and dig deep and drop and bury. There will be obstacles to overcome during each season but the good news is that it's not bath season so go ahead and dig deep and keep on rolling, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: It's all about the preparation when planning a yank and drag while barking, first of all be well rested then start looking for a weakness in the hospital corners. Once you found a weak corner then grab on and start yanking, followed by some continuous barking, which is expected by the response from the cheap seats. Adding a gravy coated biscuit is optional but it does add a dramatic flair and it inspires you to bark louder, it will sometimes block out the audience response as they cheer you on but that's the price you pay for attention. Getting attention is not always a given, sometimes you have to bark louder, yank harder or dig deeper, you do what's necessary to get the result you deserve, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

media.title: The Warden was trying to organize a game of fetch by throwing snowballs at me, I don't play organized sports but I did participate in a bark-off, it's considered a free spirited activity that gets a party of one all riled up. Credit must be given to The Warden for once again trying to get me to fetch something, I don't do fetch. After I completed a round of barking I went back inside while The Warden shoveled an area for me, which wasn't necessary because the snow melted but I appreciate the gesture. When someone reaches out with kindness it's important to pay it forward, it's the gesture that counts and you will be rewarded, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

The hospital corners have been reinstated on my lounger which made burying my biscuit somewhat of a challenge, not to worry, once I've had a nap I'll be planning a yank and drag while barking. The Warden is taking a victory lap and her self esteem is at an all time high, there is a down side though, with this boost to her confidence she's considering a revival of her No Talent Tour, it was short lived due to her restraining order and the blinking red light on the ankle bracelet. When life gives you a challenge you figure out a way to succeed, most of the time barking will work, sometimes you have to yank harder or dig deeper but whatever you do don't give up, eventually you will succeed, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

There's a chubby black squirrel that is taunting me, running along the fence line, jumping up in the trees and calling me on. When I was younger I used to chase squirrels until finally I figured out that it was a useless activity, similar to playing fetch or listening to someone blather on about following some rules (blah blah blah). Now I know better, I just watch him do all the work while I sit and sometimes watch but most of the time I ignore him. When you know better you do better, make it worth your while, barking is also encouraged to get what you want, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Apparently there was some concern about me barking while dad was having a meeting on the computer but no flags were raised about The Warden yelling 'hey hey'. The situation could've been handled easily by someone holding a piece of aged cheese at the top of the stairs, no need to yell out and cause a big fuss. If the basement door is left open and dad is down there then I have an obligation to snoop in each room and bark until security shows up. If an opportunity presents itself then it's your right to bark and be rewarded, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: Throwback to the day I freed The Wardens housecoat from captivity, here's my story. On one of my snooping missions I happened to wander into the wine cellar (aka closet) when I noticed a dangling blanket (aka housecoat), I grabbed on and started yanking (as one does), that's when things turned ugly. The shelving system broke loose from the wall, an antique iron flew off the shelf and nearly hit me and that's about the time security showed up. It was a mess, a bunch of clothes were taken out in order to make repairs, dad had to go out to get supplies but there was an upside, The Warden got to reorganize and I got to keep the housecoat for a couple of days (as a reward for yanking). No matter what others say snooping and yanking can pay off, free the housecoat and reap the rewards, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

media.title: Tip of the day, how to bury a biscuit when your burial site is frozen, not to worry, even though the dirt is not diggable (technical term) you should look for a plant where you can nose the biscuit under the foliage. While you are on your mission of 'no biscuit left unburied' it's important to stay focused and try not to make eye contact with outside distractions (lurkers who watch your every move). Speaking of The Warden she has once again completed her mission of 'no leaf left behind and no poop left behind', it's a proud moment for the family. It's important to have something to do every day that is meaningful, bark louder, dig deeper (weather permitting) and beg endlessly until you reap the rewards, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Rarely seen and from out of nowhere comes a visitor to the door, technically it's a drop and run, not to be confused by a snatch and grab, it's a delivery person who rings the doorbell and then runs away. I'm beginning to wonder if they've heard about The Warden and her shady past or her No Talent Tour, why else would a professional delivery service do a drop and run. No matter who it is that comes to visit they deserve the same greeting complete with barking, howling and someone yelling 'brace yourself', the kind of greeting that can only be calmed down by the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Don't judge, I'm sleeping on my lounger without the protective three blanket cover, I had previously done a successful yank and drag while barking and The Warden didn't have time to remake the lounger before I fell asleep. I don't consider this a failure, quite the opposite, it's a win for me, it was a battle of the hospital corners versus the yank. Unfortunately The Warden is taking this personally, her technique of square blankets on a round lounger has fallen short of its goal. Don't ponder over past failures, think about all your successes, especially those where you were rewarded, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Take pride in all your accomplishments, whether it's burying a gravy coated biscuit in the garden or barking in a restricted area or making someone's eye twitch, be proud you created these special moments. When you think back on each day did you get a hey hey or did you get to do a yank and drag while barking or simply steal someone's chair, if you did all this then you succeeded in making this day special. All these special moments will someday create memories that will last a lifetime, embrace the moment, be kind and make someone smile, Ancient Basset Saying.

I cannot stress enough the importance of following up on the yard maintenance staff, living with people who have issues will bring out the crazy in you. The Warden has done a final sweep of the yard on her 'no leaf/poop left behind' mission and I can confirm everything has been removed and now we can all sleep better at night. There was a discussion about a class action suit against the neighbours tree dropping its leaves in our yard but we talked her out of it and we also felt she didn't need more trouble with the law. Getting more attention is a good thing if it leads to the right stuff, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Another successful yank and drag while barking, it was a glorious moment when all three blankets slid off the lounger in unison, it was clearly a hospital corner failure, The Warden must've been off her game. The Warden is in the planning stages of a comeback, her reputation took a hit but she's been down this road before, her No Talent Tour taught her never to give up and she's determined to come back with tighter corners that'll be tough to yank. Never give up, when faced with adversity you bark louder and yank harder, all good things will be rewarded, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to the day when the family made a trip to pick up the newest member of their family, there were 9 bassets all running around looking for attention but there was this one who stood out. She was just a slip of a girl (the runt of the litter), tripping over her ears, constantly getting run over but she continued to get up and fight her way to the front. She was immediately scooped up to prevent being trampled over again, her new brother decided she was the chosen one.
