It was a quiet ride home, everyone nervous about what was going to happen, that's when I decided that I needed to take charge, I was going home to a bunch of rookies who needed to be trained. Don't hesitate to be a leader, if you have to whimper, beg or bark then do it, that's what leaders do, Ancient Basset Saying.

There doesn't have to be a reason to bark, sometimes I just like to see The Warden run outside in her slippers yelling hey hey, getting all riled up about the noise level. When you have a criminal past you worry about the little things but I assured her they don't lock you up for a noise violation unless of course she starts singing, that'll get you taken away in cuffs. Barking does not have set hours between two and four, barking is your right, bark loud and proud, it could lead to good things, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

I joined The Warden on her 'no poop left behind' mission, she circled the yard charting out each area, it's a tactical maneuver to ensure one hundred percent of the deposit pickup. Apparently there are lots of decisions to be made this time of year, do you wait for the overnight freeze or do a case by case pickup, after carefully monitoring the weather it was decided on an overnight freeze, for easier handling and less yucky pickups (technical term). Be a team player, if someone is taking the time to pickup after you then it's important that you give 100%, make it worth their while, Ancient Basset Saying.

One small victory for me when I moved my lounger to center stage and one small victory for The Warden for her hospital corners holding firm. Not every yank and drag while barking is the same so you have to adapt to your circumstances, if you get a few hey heys or an eye twitch caulk it up as a win. The Warden is also taking a win on this one, by moving the lounger it exposed a small pile of hair which gives her a purpose (she has issues). Some things don't turn out as planned but it's up to you to find the good in every situation, it could lead to the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Seat selection shouldn't be controversial and all seats should be accessible, there should be no right or wrong when making this decision. I don't decide on a chair because it's covered with a protective blanket, most of the time I'll make a selection because it's still warm and freshly vacated. The most sought after chair is close to the kitchen, it's all about the view, a chair where you can snooze and still be aware of all movements. The choices you make should be the right choice for you, don't make decisions that you'll regret, you can never go wrong if you're close to the kitchen, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

I'm preparing myself to make a quick exit in case I hear food related activity, I'm listening intently and ready to spring into action at a moment's notice, some would say I'm in the starting blocks. Now please refrain from any references about my belly while it's in the relaxed mode, no udder jokes, it's utterly distasteful, underneath the belly flap is a well defined six pack. Don't let others define who you are, you do you, bark your own truth and good things will happen, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

You don't always have to have a reason to do a yank and drag while barking, it can be just because it felt right at the moment and of course the eye twitch is certainly a motivator. Some call it witching hour where you do crazy stuff for no reason or you have a cheese deficiency, medical experts will say you are barking out for help. Others will say that you are looking for attention, which is another symptom of low cheese levels, but I say that I do what I gotta do to stay healthy. Ignore what everyone else says, trust your own instincts and bark until you get what you need, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to the early years when I followed all the rules and listened intently to a detailed list of instructions on how to behave. Well I wasn't really listening and I didn't quite follow all the rules, I'm more of a free spirit with good intentions, it's more important to sniff your own path and bark out your own truth. The Warden tried doing her own thing once, it was her No Talent Tour, it wasn't considered a success but at least she tried. Be a leader, follow your own path, don't hesitate to circle around and sniff it again, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: Sometimes my level of urgency is not the same as yours and when you try to coax me to go out or to come back in I may or may not feel compelled to do so. If you stand in the doorway freezing, uttering a bunch of nonsense (blah blah blah) it's not my problem, I'll eventually decide what I'm gonna do when I wanna do it, all in good time. Now I'm not saying I can't be convinced either way (in or out), choose your words wisely, if you want results make it worth my while, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: I was fortunate enough to finally see the sun popping out through the clouds so I seized the moment, it was only +6, but the grass was warm and smelled lovely. The Warden was on her  extended final tour of 'no leaf left behind', under all that winter gear I knew it was her because I don't know anyone else who picks up stray leaves (she has issues). We only stayed out for a short time, The Warden fingers were numb from the cold and I started barking, this lead to a few hey heys and being marched back inside. Remember, barking pays off, never pass up an opportunity to be rewarded, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

One of my greatest assets is the ability to multitask, while capturing the scents floating through the air or sniffing each blade of grass, I can still detect the lurking shadows watching my every move. When you're constantly on display you develop a screen which can block those annoying prying eyes, it's a temporary block because eventually they become vital to getting you what you want. You do what you gotta do, but don't hesitate to bark out what you need, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Be prepared to adapt to any situation, I found a chew stick on my lounger so I did what needed to be done, I performed a yank and drag while barking. All it took was one yank and the blanket was free of its hospital corners, the stage was now set to perform as the cheap seats watched on in anticipation. There was excitement in the air, the crowd was chanting more more, at least that's what I heard, when you're a performer you some times get caught up in the moment. Be the star in your own life, bark loud and proud, if it's loud enough you may reap the rewards, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Warning, this video may contain some disturbing images for those who have issues, I'm digging into a damp garden, often referred to as muddy dirt, as a side note, it's easier to toss around if it's a little wet. As you might have guessed there were a few hey heys and The Warden threatened putting up the little ugly fences, she was being overdramatic which is a symptom of having issues. I have no concerns about getting a bath, my next official bath is scheduled for the summer of 2025, any violation of this agreement will involve criminal charges and possibly an extension of her ankle bracelet. Don't be burdened with rules, dig deep and bark loud, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: There are some mornings where I have to be alert and make sudden decisions, it's a challenge when you haven't had your full compliment of sleep but it's well worth the effort. I'll hear The Warden fussing about getting ready to settle in her chair, that's when I make my move and steal her chair. She'll round the corner, see me snuggled in, start huffing and puffing, go to the fridge and get some emergency cheese to free her chair (she doesn't have quick access to a small crane to remove me). Her negotiating tactics don't work anymore so she takes the path of least resistance. If your cheese levels are getting low then do whatever you can to avoid the onset of a cheese deficiency, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to yesterday when I decided to take my yank and drag while barking on tour, first stop, outside in the snow. There was no blanket to yank and drag so I had to paw at the snow and bark at my gravy coated biscuit, I had to adapt to the situation. The cheap seats didn't disappoint, there was the usual yelling of hey hey and lots of threats of going back inside if I didn't keep the noise level down, I couldn't hear that whiny plea over the barking. Make the best of what you have and bark out your thanks, it could lead to the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

I'm the lead scout on this mission for The Warden, she's doing her 'no poop left behind' tour but there was concern about a surprise under the snow. The good news is it's probably frozen which should bring the anxiety level down and a shovel nudge should help with the extraction. A portion of the yard has been cleared for my sniffing pleasure with the hopes I'll choose carefully when making a deposit, I choose outside the preferred area.  When making choices do what's right for you, trust your sniffing, it may lead you to the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Don't think for one second that I won't hear you if you try to sneak a piece of cheese or open that bag of roast beef, I'm an athlete at the starting blocks and will sprint to the kitchen in record time. Go ahead and grab an apple, don't care and will make no attempt to investigate, try to sneak the cheese bag into another room and quietly try to open the bag, turn around, that's me sitting pretty waiting for my share (it's been tried and it's considered criminal behaviour). It's important to consider others when making critical decisions, think twice before you reach for the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Audience participation can make or break how your yank and drag while barking performance turns out, if it's the second or third time in a row they have a tendency to give up. With the first performance they come running yelling hey hey, the eye is twitching and they start assessing the cleanup after. The cheap seats can be fickle but you get what you pay for, if you don't want the loud continuous barking included in the package then that'll cost extra. Always have a backup plan, if you don't want the barking then pay the price, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: My brother stopped by for a social distancing visit, I was granted an exemption from the no contact rule as long as everyone wore a mask, used hand sanitizer and signed a non disclosure (standard procedure when living with shady people). It was a wonderful visit, constant rubs and scratches, I only moaned when he stopped and he only stopped due to wrist fatigue. The Warden pointed out that his socks were covered in hair, which was hard to avoid when the floor was covered, he was offered a complimentary brushing to remove the hair but he declined (he doesn't have issues). Embrace the moment when someone offers you a helping hand, it means they really care especially if they get wrist fatigue, Ancient Basset Saying.

media.title: There was an incident, it was unsavory and not very ladylike and I felt compelled to share my version of events, here's my story. The Warden was completing her mission of no leaf left behind and at the same time she was doing her no poop left behind, it's a long complicated story but she somehow got something nasty on her hand, the air turned blue from the language being spewed, very unbecoming and overly dramatic (drama queen). After sterilizing the rake handle and multiple hand washes she calmed down, her theatrical display was noteworthy. Keep calm, take a deep breath and eat cheese, Ancient Basset Saying.

Even though you're snoozing it's important to be ready to spring into action in case someone makes a move, but be selective of course. Now there's no point in moving if they're just fussing around (non food related), if you're gonna move make it worth your while especially if there's kitchen noises, if the fridge door opens you bounce up and sprint. Being an athlete helps you achieve your ultimate goal, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to the day I got caught hoarding mini biscuits (they weren't gravy coated). Every day The Warden would lay out a handful of mini biscuits and by the evening they would all be gone, she was happy that finally she found something I liked. That was until she went to put on her winter boot and discovered it was packed full of mini biscuits. Some things have changed since that day, no more mini biscuits and all boots are now stored in a secure area. If you want to be successful then don't mess around with what you know works, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: There was an incident, my reputation remains intact, here's my version of what happened.  I was strolling through the house, as one does, when something caught my eye, a dangling sleeve was draped over the laundry basket, now here's where some decisions had to be made, I could ignore and continue snooping, I could get in the attack position and start barking or I could do a yank and drag while barking, all good options so I decided to yank the sleeve. This created a whole series of events, the basket fell over spilling all the clothes, The Warden came running in yelling hey hey and I got the attention I deserved, not bad for a stroll while snooping. Spend your time wisely, it may get you the results you deserve, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: I'm waiting, still waiting, would someone, anyone, please stop by and visit, treats are optional, I'm not usually one to beg but during these lean days of visitors I'll resort to begging. Now if by chance you do stop by I must issue a warning, liability reasons, I will bark, howl, get a little excited (extremely excited) and have jumping up tendencies (can't help it). Please ignore the shady lady that will come running out of the shadows yelling 'brace yourself', she has issues. Everyone needs to be treated with the same level of enthusiasm, no matter who they are, even if they don't carry treats, Ancient Basset Saying.

media.title: I'm accessing the threat level in the urban jungle, predators have been known to lurk in the shadows, somewhat like The Warden but without having a shady past. We had a wind warning with very little damage to our area except for the odd stray leaf which the maintenance staff are attending to. I've identified several predators, rabbits, squirrels, chipmunks and birds, that's all I can report because if there's anything larger than that there will be a threat of moving to a high rise. Be aware of your surroundings, sniff out those that lurk in the shadows and those who offer you the good stuff, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

The Warden had to release custody of her sweater when I started yanking on the sleeve, in my defense it was dangling in front of me as though she wanted to play tug-of-war. I don't normally play organized sports, I'm more of a free style in the moment type of a girl but there was something about that dangling sleeve I couldn't resist, maybe it was that look of fear in her eyes. Full disclosure, the sweater remained intact with only a tiny bit of slobber, a few stray hairs and it smelled lovely, no harm done. Sometimes having a little fun pays off, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

When you're just a slip of a girl you can easily blend into the garden and security will hardy know you're there, except for the dainty bark, keeping it real. The Warden is finishing up her fall chores before the snow flies (Ancient Warden Saying), she's in the window wells removing leaves and washing windows, I'm making sure she doesn't cut any corners, if you're gonna do something do it right. We need to keep an eye on each other and keep in touch, bark to let them know you're there and hopefully they'll reach out for the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: It was a great ending to Leaf Week, as soon as I saw the Leaf Truck I ran to greet them, also The Warden scurried over with a small bucket of stray leaves to add to the collection. They asked if I was friendly and could they say hello, permission was granted as I howled and attempted to jump up, if it wasn't for my line holding me back and choking me I might have succeeded. I thought it was unnecessary for the cheap seats to yell out 'brace yourself, she's heavier than she looks', that was a cheap shot. It's important to recognize those that continue to go to work during this time, so take advantage of the moment and howl out your thanks, Ancient Basset Saying.

media.title: Throwback to when The Warden launched an investigation into why the furminator was covered in chew marks, I plead the fifth as advised by my attorney. In my defence (if charges are laid), someone was negligent and left the Furminator on the ground within easy reach for someone who likes to chew (which is a sign of a cheese deficiency), therefore the guilty party who left things laying around is fully responsible, I rest my case. Take responsibility, own up to your shortcomings and make amends, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: Today we take a moment to honour those who have helped to defend and protect us all, for this we give thanks. For those we have lost and for those who continue to give us our freedom, we will remember you. I have a brother who is an Officer in the Canadian Forces who we are so proud of and he gives the best ear rubs. Take a moment to remember and to give thanks, they have our backs and stand ready to fight for our rights and freedom. ð¨ð¦

It's a big week around here, it's Leaf Week, this is where we get to display all the leaves which were collected, I'm hoping it doesn't distract from everyone noticing me. The Warden was a little concerned about the alignment and presentation of the bags but no points were deducted, of course this is not a competition because we are the only ones on the street with bags. Also it's not considered a community service endeavor and she can't claim hours to be deducted from time owed (court ruling). As a side note these bags were sniffed at but not barked at, so no hey heys were necessary. It's important to recognize the achievements of others, all hard work should be rewarded, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: Beep beep beep, beep beep beep, that's what The Warden keeps saying to get me to move, after a series of beeping I move due to a lack of tolerance, but not today.  Today I'm laying on one stray leaf, the last one to be picked up before The Warden can end her mission of 'no leaf left behind' (she has issues). I'm calling this a win for me, at least for the moment, she's lurking in the garden formulating a plan to get me to move, I can be persuaded with the right incentives, for example, lots of attention sugared with sweet talk, of course cheese or if I see her wheeling in a small crane. It's not always about you, there are others to consider, especially me, do the right thing, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

I often hear 'hey hey' whenever I bark outside, sometimes there are threats about going back inside if I don't stop barking, I ignore all this (sometimes I can't hear from all the barking), these are idol threats, it's to make the neighbours think she has control over the situation. Eventually The Warden will stop whatever she's doing and give me the attention I deserve, the solution to the barking problem is quite simple, focus on your priorities (me) or carry cheese. Barking is a symptom of a cheese deficiency which can be easily managed, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: There was an incident which I was barred from witnessing, a large granddaddy rabbit was found deceased in our front garden. No crime scene photos were taken due to a meltdown of the photographer, a specialty team (dad) was brought in to remove the deceased, he was giving a detailed evidence account as if he was on the witness stand, he was asked to stop his testimony by one of the witnesses (The Warden), she was in mid meltdown and trying to shield me from seeing the disposal of the victim (condolences to family). It was a traumatic event for someone but a full recovery is expected, in lieu of flowers please send cheese. Meltdowns are a symptom of a cheese deficiency, Ancient Basset Saying.

Can it be true, is someone finally coming to our house, a car is parked out front, the person gets out and with great disappointment they go to the neighbours house. Two things are happening here, first there's the isolation and fewer people come around, even the delivery people scurry off and don't wait for me to jump up on them and secondly my cheese levels are getting low which affects my howling and it ends up sounding more like a whimper, definitely a symptom of a cheese deficiency. Never let your guard down, be ready to howl at a moment's notice because chances are it'll lead to the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to the good ole days when we would all be together watching a hockey game, there would be hooting and hollering especially if our team just scored and was winning, there would be an assortment of snacks, a couple of pops (liquid courage), evening juices, lots of laughter and trash talking and I would be front and center in the middle of all the excitement. My brother would be wearing his team jersey, as one does, he would be rattling off game statistics, talking about his hockey pool and with a couple more wins he'd be in the money (assuming this is legal if not please disregard). If you can't be together then take a moment to share those good times, when there was lots of laughter and plenty of snacks, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: As foreperson of the leaf management team, our motto is, leave no leaf behind, I noticed that one of the workers failed to bring a leaf bag and was relying on only a small bucket, rookie mistake. She had several solutions, rake remaining leaves close to the fence and bag at a later date, go get a leaf bag and finish the job, fill up your pockets with leaves or toss the remaining leaves over the fence (evenly distributed) and hope the wind scatters them. Obviously it was daylight and tossing them over the fence would be a risk so The Warden decided to get a leaf bag but not surprised that considerable thought was given to deviant behaviour. It may take a little more time and effort but at the end of the day it's about doing the right thing, Ancient Basset Saying.

It's important to make others feel special and at this moment I felt special, The Warden had just washed the cover for the couch, she spent time tucking in all the corners, using her hospital corners technique, she stood back assessing a job well done and that's when I jumped up with my biscuit. Are there rules about eating on the furniture, probably, but I'm sure it was a decision made in haste and doesn't apply to me. I'm doing this to make The Warden feel special, she has this need to do things for others (she has issues) and I'm fulfilling that need. Do what you can each day to make others feel special, if they feel special they will want to give back, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

How to prepare for the winter season and still maintain your fitness level, as reported by a slip of a girl, Miss Lilly. With every nap you can still get a full body workout by jerking and twitching, it helps build your core and tighten your abs, snoring helps keep you in a rhythm so you can pace yourself, it's important not to do anything too strenuous which might wake you up. Be sure to stretch and rotate on a regular basis, this activity is equivalent to doing a series of sit-ups and pushups. There is a word of caution though, all this napping exercise can lead to a cheese deficiency so make sure you hydrate with cheese on a regular basis. Be prepared for the long winter season, continue to exercise and stock up, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: Just a slip of a girl catching a few sun rays before the colder weather creeps in.  Now I could say we had a very windy day and all the leaves on our lawn were blown away but we all know what this is about, the person living here has issues. If it was socially acceptable The Warden might have ventured over the line to rake a few leaves claiming that they were ours but our tree has no leaves so that theory doesn't work (I'm not going to mention the restraining order). What's important is we help each other out, reach out to others and offer cheese, it's considered an act of kindness, Ancient Basset Saying.

I pledge to you this Halloween that I will not bark or howl at the trick or treaters, I will not stand up on the glass door and frighten all the kids, you will not need security to restrain me from trying to escape, The Warden will not have to yell out 'brace yourself', I will be a complete Angel and deserving of aged cheese each time the door bell rings, this I pledge to you. If this was any other year we would honour and welcome this pledge but this is not like any other year, if the kids do show up it'll be from a safe distance and self serve. When there's uncertainty try to be prepared as best you can, make sure the treats you have are the ones you like, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Burying your gravy coated biscuit is a personal choice and you have the right to change your mind at any time, if you feel your burial site has been compromised then immediately remove the biscuit and relocate. If you get that feeling you are being watched it's probably because you are, take a glance and if you happen to see shadows bobbing in the window it's a sign your personal space is being invaded. The lurker is probably assessing the dirt that's going to be tracked inside, not your problem, continue your mission and bury on. Make the decisions that are right for you but leave the door open to other options, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to the good ole days when the urban jungle was in full bloom instead of its current state which is a barren wasteland. Winter is slowly creeping in and testing us to see if we are ready to hibernate for months, similar to what we are doing now which is isolating due to the virus. I'm ready as long as the fridge is stocked, the treats are plentiful (the good stuff), that I have at least three blankets on my lounger and finally, the cheap seats are all geared up for some indoor entertainment. Always be prepared for the unexpected and hope that the unexpected is what you expect, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: So I take it soaking up the sun and laying out on the driveway is off the schedule, I wasn't prepared for the snow, I'd like a do-over if possible and a little more lead time before we have to settle in for the winter. The Warden of course is ready, the snow shovel is lined up, winter tires are on, mitts, scarves and boots at the ready but what about me. In order to prepare for winter I'll need a small roast simmering in gravy, a platter of aged cheese and my lounger beside the fireplace with someone constantly caressing me. It's the little things that make the difference, stock up and be prepared, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: I'm definitely feeling better and getting lots of attention, I'm once again stealing seats, as one does, and I even did a yank and drag while barking, it was a crowd pleaser, the cheap seats were yelling hey hey. I'm taking my medicine as prescribed by health professionals, each pill wrapped in meat while dangling another piece of meat as an enticement to gobble the first piece, The Warden will sometimes use cheese to ensure my cheese levels are up during recovery. I'm sticking close to The Warden and offering her my ear to caress, it helps calm her nerves when things go off the rails. Along the way there will be bumps in the road but cheese makes the journey worth traveling, Ancient Basset Saying.

This is me waiting outside the Vets for a personal assistant to escort me inside, they knew I was there by the howling, she said I was singing the song of my people. I was diagnosed with a UTI and was also in the beginning stages of a cheese deficiency, I were given medication with clear instructions for it to be wrapped in meat when administering, The Warden wasn't allowed inside so I had to give her the instructions. It was also recommended that my cheese intake be increased to help with my cheese levels. The Warden is also recovering from this event now that she sees I'm on the mend, her cheese levels are probably low. Not everything always goes the way we planned, sometimes there's a slight detour along the way but we will get through this, adding a little cheese makes everything feel better, Ancient Basset Saying.

I've been accused of inappropriately sniffing someone (as if), in my defence it was a casual whiff, nothing prolonged or offensive, here's what happened. I was standing on the steps deciding whether to go inside or follow The Warden, she was heading down the stairs, I leaned over and took a whiff, as one does, she said hey hey and moved on, totalling innocent exchange. Even if it was a full contact sniff that's no reason to rewrite the hound rules, I know my sniffing rights, if you are close you will be sniffed. Sniffing someone is a sign of acceptance, it also helps to know if they have a pocket full of treats, Ancient Basset Saying.

I have goals and aspirations, every day I try to achieve the ultimate goal of getting what I want, I may have to beg, whine or bark but at least I'm trying. There are times I'll bark a little louder or whine a little longer but I never give up or have any regrets, the end result is to get what I want when I want it. The Warden once had dreams to travel the world singing and dancing, it failed due to a lack of talent but at least she tried (she's still trying but it's harder with the restraining order). Never give up on trying, you just gotta believe, sometimes all you have to do is bark and the fridge door will open, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: Dad likes to speak to me in full paragraph form using the correct punctuation while The Warden prefers short choppy sentences with a somewhat dramatic flair, sing-song lilting voice with catchphrases, she has a background in stage performances (her No Talent Tour). Save your time and energy, I'm listening for key words, all I hear is blah blah blah until it's the one word that finally spills out that gets me excited and motivated. There are times I don't mind the endless chatter, it can be soothing and at times revealing which I can't repeat because of the non disclosure agreement (The Warden has issues). Listening skills are important, it can lead to the one thing you've been waiting for, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: Throwback to the day my brother came home to help celebrate International Share Your Plate Day, it's a day where there's no shame in licking another's plate and it's freedom day for your gravy dippers where it would be considered in poor taste to chase someone around with a wet cloth. It's a day not celebrated by everyone especially if they have issues but we ignore them and use this day to spend time together, to be inclusive and share our bounty (cream cheese icing). Show you care and share your plate, it's about doing the right thing, Ancient Basset Saying.

media.title: Important reminder during the fall season, rake your leaves on a regular basis in the deposit drop zone in order to avoid any unfortunate incidents, another tidbit, always rake going forward and do not, I repeat, do not blindly step backwards into uncharted territory. This may or may not have happened, the victim is still unable to verbalize what was on her shoe. Always take the path going forward unless of course you are sniffing, in that case you can circle around and re-sniff, some things just need to be sniffed over and over again, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: During a rainy day it's important to stretch and rotate on a regular basis, this can be done as you move from chair to chair or to your day lounger.  This can also be considered as part of your daily fitness routine, gotta keep those abs in their six pack formation, it can be exhausting especially if you are seat stealing but it'll keep you limber in case you have to make a sudden move towards the kitchen. It's important to remember that inactivity can lead to a cheese deficiency so regular barking is encouraged, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

When it's time to go inside I'll let you know, usually I'll start barking which gets The Warden riled up, probably worried about her restraining order, so she gives me a couple of hey heys and starts packing things up. We have now officially joined those who like to sit in the garage and look out at the neighbours, the weather has gotten colder, The Warden is bundled up in winter attire, I'm laying on a blanket beside her as she constantly caresses me and once the hand is removed I start barking, that's your sign to go inside. It's about spending quality time together no matter where you are but sometimes it's better when you're closer to the fridge, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Here's a sign, if I'm quietly in another room from where the family is and all of a sudden I come running into the room it'll be because I have a biscuit in my mouth, now the cheap seats will say I sound like a herd of elephants, she's trying to be funny, did I happen to mention that she has issues. Most times I'm preparing to do a yank and drag while barking but if I've already entertained several times I may choose to settle in and rest a spell, you want to build the anticipation and keeping the audience begging for more, like they do by withholding the good treats. Entertaining the family can be rewarding, when you start to hear the hey heys you know you are close to getting your just reward, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

There I was running up the street free as a bird, no leash or line hooked up to the snowblower, crowds of people started to surround me, I was jumping up on everyone and barking, most of them were offering me large pieces of aged cheese and some had a small roast simmering in gravy (harder to carry), these are what dreams are made of. Not every dream goes to your happy place, some dreams takes you on a sniffing journey with nothing to chase or those dreams where the cheap seats tries out a new routine for her comeback No Talent Tour (shimmy shaking takes a wrong turn). If you're gonna dream, dream big, don't limit yourself to accepting dry biscuits, dream the good stuff, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: There's a saying if you snooze you lose, in this case if you move you lose, The Warden got up to fuss around and lost her spot on the couch, I happen to be in the right place at the right time, as the old saying goes 'sorry about your luck'. I had no plans on moving unless of course I was presented with the right incentive or you hooked me up to a small crane. There was the usual huffing and puffing, I heard mumbling and 'oh for heaven sakes', nothing of course that inspired me to move, no movement towards the fridge or the smell of sweet success (aged cheese). If you want results then do the right thing, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to one of the few times I was granted access to the front gardens, sort of, security was distracted and I seized the moment. It was a memorable day, I slipped behind the bushes, dug a slight hole, got tangled up around a plant and laid on a flower, that's also what helped make the decision to tether me to the snowblower to limit my garden access (someone has control issues). Don't let others determine your destiny, if you are presented with an opportunity seize the moment, if they want to change your course there's always the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: How to get the attention you deserve during the fall cleanup, while someone is raking the leaves try laying on a few, most people will ignore the odd leaf here and there, and then there's the one who can't. They'll circle around you, try to get you to move, pretend that someone is coming, try to bribe you and finally the begging starts. If they come over to give a belly rub then go ahead and roll off the leaf, it was probably time to stretch and rotate anyway. It's important to be accommodating, so roll over and except the belly rub, it helps calm their nerves and makes them feel special, Ancient Basset Saying.

The fun thing about a two blanket yank and drag while barking is losing your gravy coated biscuit under the blankets, it adds a little mystery and drama while you sniff it out, where oh where could it be. Barking helps build suspense while the cheap seats look on waiting to see if they have to be called in on a rescue mission, sometimes the biscuit gets stuck to the blanket and needs to be unstuck (technical term). Bark like no one is listening, sniff like no one is waiting and be accessible for all the attention you deserve, Ancient Basset Saying.

Nothing to see here, move along or in this case destroy the surveillance evidence, all I was doing was hiding a gravy coated biscuit in the grass, found a nice smelling spot and dropped it in. There were lots of questions about why I choose this particular spot when I had the whole garden at my disposal to dig and bury, I just had a feeling and I have no regrets. Forget about trying to analyze every decision you make, it could be it smells lovely or something in my past history giving me a nudge, whatever it is just do what you feel is the right thing to do, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: Just a teeny tiny slip of a girl quietly soaking up the last bit of sunny warm weather until the clouds rolled in and it was no longer pleasant, this is where the story begins. Once I was no longer lulled by the sun rays I got bored and started barking at The Warden, she issued a few 'hey heys' but in my defence I didn't hear her over the barking, dad came outside to see what all the fuss was about and then I was marched inside for a timeout. After about five minutes and troublemaker (The Warden) learned her lesson I was allowed back outside, she sat in her chair while I laid beside her on my outside blanket and she rubbed my belly, she was trying to atone for her behaviour. Forgiveness can be given without saying anything, it could be a belly rub or reaching for the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: In my defence, in case I need one, I was only looking at what The Warden was destroying in the garden and besides, even if I did try to snoop around I couldn't get past the little ugly fences. These fences were installed to prevent me from getting my line tangled up around the bushes and also so I won't dig up or lay on the flowers, at least that's what my attorney has revealed from the court documents. Have I in the past done what they have accused me of, of course, but that's all past history, would I do it again, all I'm asking for is another chance, it's time to move on, tear down the fence. Take off the leashes and tear down those barriers, it's time to bring back the freedom to dig without consequences, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: While on my sniff and walk we came across a little dog who was standing up on his hind legs snapping at the air, barking to beat the band and had to be restrained. The man on the other end of the leash said he's harmless, once he does a greeting he'll settle down, so I laid down, he inched closer, gave me a sniff (I smelled lovely) and then he was fine. The Warden was taking deep breaths and preparing to enter the battle if things turned ugly, fortunately for everyone we were spared from witnessing an unleashed Warden. Sometimes if you have a big personality you will get overlooked that's why you need to slow it down, be the reason they want to stop, slow walking pays off, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to when my brother was home and took me for a yank-free walk, notice the loose grip on the leash and the meandering route to maximize the sniffing. We didn't go too far but that's beside the point, I was in total control, I got my sniffing exercise while at the same time keeping the final destination in sight at all times. Once we finally arrived back home after several long minutes I got a great reception and my brother was interrogated about who we saw, did I do any business and how I behaved, the usual browbeating. It's not the length of the journey it's the quality of time spent with loved ones, Ancient Basset Saying.

Don't be afraid to add a little sass to your yank and drag while barking, it adds a little flavour and gets the cheap seats begging for more. They will be chanting 'hey hey' which means 'more more' so at this point go yank off another blanket. There are only two reasons to stop, total exhaustion due to low cheese levels or they are left with no choice but to get up and go to the fridge. Be the reason they have to get up and make your day, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: It's a barren wasteland, the urban jungle is no more, unless you count spiders and worms and this is where the story begins. I was ignoring The Warden, as one does, while she was slaughtering the garden until all of a sudden I heard this shrieking noise and she started slapping herself, apparently a wild beast of a spider dangled too close to her, her version it was in the attack position baring teeth and was prepared to take no prisoners, her theatrical display comes with no formal training unless you count her No Talent Tour. After a while you become accustomed to these outbursts so you keep your distance and try to be nonjudgmental, she has self esteem issues. Always try to be supportive and you will hopefully be rewarded, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: There are a few catch phrases that I'll respond to when I want to, let's be clear about this, I understand everything you said the first time even though you continue to repeat it over and over again in this high lilting voice. Here's the top three, 'want a treat', it's frequently used to try to lure me into doing something I may or may not want to do, 'wanna go pee', here's a hint, if I'm not scratching at the door then I don't wanna pee, now lastly, 'wanna go for a walk', this is when the voice gets elevated and a tinge of excitement is added, my snoring levels are an indication of my response. Now my favourite and least heard is 'cheese cheese cheese' this has been used by dad while he is chasing after me (in his slippers) while I'm running up the street (a rare escape from confinement), I will eventually respond but I love the taste of freedom. If you want an immediate response lead with the cheese, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: While out on my sniff and walk I found something worth investigating, it was small, grey, flat as a pancake, smelled lovely and as I was going in for a neck roll I heard this screeching noise, that's when I got the yank. In all the confusion I grabbed my treasure, as one does, and made an attempt to flee the scene but got nowhere due to the stranglehold on my leash, so I conceded and dropped the dead squashed mouse. It's not every day you get this lucky, the only unfortunate thing is I travel with someone who has ongoing issues, it's the burden I bear. If you smell something lovely don't hesitate, seize the moment and roll on it, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: The Warden decided that I could choose the route for our walk, I went directly to the corner, sniffed every blade of grass, left a message and was ready to go back home. Apparently that wasn't the route she had in mind so I got the yank and we proceeded to the next corner where I put the brakes on, corners are my specialty. After that she did a lot of jabbering (blah blah blah) trying to coax me on, it's probably a good time to mention that when my head is down and sniffing I'm not focused on the external noise but if it makes you feel better then blabber on. My walk is a journey, a gathering of intel, sniffing out messages sent and received, sending out my own inspirational messages for those that follow in my path, so please allow us time to pause on our daily journey, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: Word of advice, it's probably not a great idea to rake leaves in windy weather but The Warden doesn't follow the norm. Her theory is she's taking responsibility for our leaves, at times like this it's probably best not to make direct eye contact and also the reason why no one is stopping by to see me. I offer my support because she's family and as family we stick together, once she's inside she acts normal, she'll refresh my ice water, offer me a treat and will give me lots of undivided attention. Even though your support staff may have Proud Mary Moments, this to can be overlooked if they reach for the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to the early years when I was learning to fit in with my new family, I had to get used to someone hovering over me at all times but overall they've become more manageable. Of course there were lots of rules which had to be fine tuned but eventually the family saw things my way, The Warden is a little harder to train because of all her ongoing issues, she's a work in progress. Be thankful for the efforts that others make on your behalf and with time and proper training they'll become more generous, especially with the good stuff, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

A teeny tiny delicate slip of a girl basking in her sunspot, it started out I was surrounded by the full glow of the sun which also allowed my halo to shine brightly, over time I was left in the shadows but my halo will forever shine on. Now it should be noted that my abs are in their rest mode therefore you will not see the definition, rest assured under the belly flaps there is a fully developed six pack. I may also appear to be extra fully but this is my winter coat preparing for the long cold winter season so please withhold any and all judgment. Don't let others define who you are, you be you, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: A great discovery was made while The Warden was dusting under the furniture, she found the blanket I used while doing a yank and drag while barking, it has been missing for a few weeks which brings up a lot of unanswered questions I'd rather not get into as she is the treat distributor. The recovered blanket had a couple of dust bunnies on it along with the expected hair and slobber, perfectly fine and definitely can be used again, it did not need to be washed, which it was because she has ongoing issues. Don't waste valuable time doing things that don't need to be done, use your time where it will benefit others and they will be grateful when you reach for the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

It's the beginning of a new week and a continuation of dad's journey down the no sugar road, I'm here to offer my support by encouraging him to eat more cheese and meat, bite for bite, it's easier when you have a support buddy to motivate you along the way. There was a bump in the road when he felt the urge to eat dozens of cookies but The Warden assured him that was the sugar talking, I recommended a small shared piece of cheese to calm the waters (cravings). There was also a cease and desist order issued to The Warden to prevent her from baking, we all have to be supportive. Stick close to those that need our support, sharing is caring bite for bite, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: Someone lost this ball and I was lucky enough to have found it, for a small fee it will be returned no questions asked. Full disclosure, due to quality time spent with the ball in my urban jungle it may be covered in slobber, hair and have an acquired smell (hint of worm). Please contact me directly so we can discuss the terms of return, upon the initial greeting you will be barked at and jumped up on, standard greeting, the fee as indicated will be in the form of aged cheese and/or small roast simmering in gravy, nothing less and possibly more but I'm open to negotiations. There are times where at the first sniff of an offering you'll jump at it, if you can hold off and wait until they give you several options to choose from, then you take them all, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: Helpful Hints on how to avoid getting a bath, brought to you by Miss Lilly. The most popular method of avoiding the dreadful bath is airing out, this requires full exposure of all confined areas, the underbelly, neck folds and ear canal. It's preferable to do this with a slight breeze washing over you in order to guarantee full coverage and this will also give you that fresh linen smell that everyone loves. Another helpful hint is to avoid rolling on worm remnants during this process, it defeats the purpose of airing out, your goal is to get that fresh linen smell not a hint of worm smell. If you live with smell sensitive people try airing out on a regular basis, it'll help take the focus off of you when in confined areas, Ancient Basset Saying.

I've issued a formal complaint and I'm waiting for a judge to rule in my favour, there may be serious consequences, possibly an arrest, here's what happened.  The Warden and I were getting ready to go outside, she was gathering some essentials, her book, phone, sweater and my bowl of fresh filtered water with ice, as we stepped outside I felt cold drops of water splash on my back, she spilt my water, I looked up at her in horror, I got wet. Okay, once could be considered an accident but this happened three times and it makes me think this was criminal intent. Accidents happen and can be forgiven if you do the right thing, make amends, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to when I first arrived to my forever home, when everyone hovered over me waiting to see if I needed anything, the service was exceptional. I didn't need to bark or howl because there was no need, there was no shortage of food, treats or attention, I had round the clock lift service, I'd open my eyes and there they'd be, starring at me, eventually you get used to your lack of personal space. When you start out with this much power it's difficult to change or shift to someone else trying to control you, unless they use the ultimate controller, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: I'm just a slip of a girl laying on a freshly raked lawn with no blanket or lounger, tethered to a snow blower and no ice in my water. I'm not complaining, I'm just keeping it real, it was my choice to lay on the grass because it smells lovely with a hint of worm, I'm tied up to the snow blower because I can't yank it around and the ice melted in my water. It's about choosing to look on the bright side and good things will happen, you just gotta believe, Ancient Basset Saying. As a side note the scattered leaf was removed after it was noticed during the photo shoot.

When actively listening it's important to make eye contact, what you are listening for are a few key words, the rest of the stuff is filler words, it's all blah blah blah. When outside the chances of hearing the word cheese or roast are slim, they are verging into the lying zone so don't jump up and get all excited, you're wasting energy. Sometimes they just like to hear themselves babble on about their glory years, it's an act of kindness to listen.  It's important to pay attention to others, who knows where it could lead, if you're a good listener you will be rewarded, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

I was being presented with several options all of which I declined, if you want a better outcome than make the offer something you know I'll respond to, it's that simple. The Warden was wanting me to go back inside, so I decided to wait and see if she was going to bribe me, it's a tactic she often uses when she wants results. Apparently she was getting tired of swatting at bees, at a distance it looked like one of her performances from her No Talent Tour. If you want results without any fuss then do the right thing, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: How do you measure success, to me it was a yank and drag while barking with three blankets and a throw, the hospital corners were a bit of a challenge but with a good yank and an upward tug they slipped right off. The cheap seats were fully engaged yelling 'hey hey' which only motivated me to keep on yanking, I couldn't have succeeded without their continued support and for that I am grateful. It's about appreciating what others do for you every day (even if you can't hear them from all the barking), embrace their kindness which could also lead to the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Worm rolling season is slowly coming to an end, the frost is now creeping into the ground and the lovely smell of worms is going underground. Therefore it's my duty and responsibility as a basset to keep rolling until I smell lovely with a hint of worm. Ignore the onlookers lurking in the bushes and tune out the hey heys, keep on rolling. Take pride in who you are, walk with confidence, bark like no one's listening and hopefully you will reap the rewards, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

I caught The Warden sniffing all my blankets after they were freshly washed and she said they smelled lovely, the sniffing before they were washed wrinkled her nose and she used unsavory language. To each his own I say, I prefer my blankets to have an earthy scent with just a hint of worm, it's a comforting feeling to be able to smell your blankets before you see them. Apparently the amount of hair on the blankets was distorting the colour, she's obviously looking at all things negative and doesn't share my sunny disposition. It's important to look at the positive, the stronger the smell the more you get sniffed, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to Ancient Times when treats were scarce and you had to hunt down your gravy coated biscuits and bury them in anticipation for those lean and stingy days.  Those were the days when you had to almost beg for a treat, at times you were too weak to even bark, much like it is in these modern times except the biscuits are laid out for you but growing up in those lean years you still resort to old habits of burying your biscuits. Never forget where you came from and celebrate how far you've come, yesteryears were dry biscuits, today it's second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: I got yelled at last night for being expressive, first The Warden yelled my name but I couldn't hear her over the noise then dad yelled at me, it was devastating. I was doing a yank and drag while barking, going from one room to another, really getting into it, head down and barking up a storm, apparently it was their quiet time, like whatever. Then dad yelled at me, I slinked over to my lounger which was beside his chair and let him pet me with some soothing sweet talk, he needed to be forgiven for raising his voice. There are going to be times when everything doesn't go according to plan, that's when you change direction and hope for a better outcome, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: There was an incident, I snapped at a wasp and was potentially stung, as reported by The Warden, which put her on full alert and we had to retreat inside. After I snapped at the wasp I immediately ran to the grass and started rubbing my face, this was about the time The Warden started to panic, I was given a full body rubdown and visually monitored for hours (no swelling reported), I didn't mind the attention, a cheese platter would've been nice though. The Warden made sure the carcass of the wasp was discarded in the bushes and she also made sure it couldn't reoffend.  If someone wants to hover over you and give you lots of attention it's best to submit, it helps to reassure them and could potentially lead to the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: I made this long journey downstairs to help dad teach while he held a video class session, I was going to be the motivator, to help stimulate everyone so they wouldn't nod off and lose focus. I usually go downstairs to bark and seek attention but not today, while maybe I'll bark a little, just enough to get The Warden riled up and then I'll have to go back upstairs to see what she's doing to control the situation, hopefully she'll do the right thing and go to the fridge. Be aware of your surroundings, know when to bark and when you're in the right place at the right time, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: If anyone had any doubts about me yanking my lounger out of its tightly tucked in new location, think again, I went above and beyond all expectations. It's that never give up attitude, keep yanking and inch by inch the lounger will slowly start moving, but we have to give credit where credit is due, fine job on the hospital corners. Yes there was a lot of barking after I freed some of the blankets, it was a song of victory and the yanking of the blankets was a dance of freedom.  Take time to celebrate your accomplishments, bark like no one is listening and yank like you just don't care, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: After a long night of sleeping I get up in the morning, have a drink of fresh filtered water with ice and then go to my day lounger for a morning nap, sleeping all night is exhausting.  I usually don't have one of my gravy coated biscuits until later in the day but I needed a little reassurance that when I woke up I would have a snack for sustenance, just in case I became weak after sleeping so long. Once I finally start my day (around brunch) I'll make a quick trip outside for business, come back inside to get my reward treats, maybe eat my breakfast, it's a process. After a busy morning I'll probably have a nap before I start following The Warden around and before we go on a walk, it's a busy schedule. Be sure to stay hydrated and eat regular snacks, bark if necessary to ensure you get what is required, Ancient Basset Saying.

Flashback because we forgot throwback, to remind us that the colder weather is slowly creeping in, so before the snow blows in I'm going to be soaking up the sun as much as possible. The maintenance staff are preparing for a transitional change, getting the winter gear on standby and waiting to yank out all the gardens, I say all in good time but they have issues and feel the need to plan ahead. Enjoy the moment, lay out and soak up the sun, everything will happen when it happens but also be prepared, stock up on cheese, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: I made a slight miscalculation while doing my business, it happens, my intentions were good, I just fell short of the mark while sniffing. Let's focus on the positive, there'll be one less yellow spot on the grass, the drainage is good, no one noticed except The Warden and the surveillance cameras, I feel much better and have a clear conscious. Always focus on the positive side of things, if you hear barking embrace it and think about reaching for the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: Did I happen to mention that I don't like change, with any change comes an adjustment period plus to complicate things it's also been known to lower your cheese levels, tragic situation. The Warden decided to move my lounger which inched over a small table which ultimately created a barking session, all was warranted and I have no regrets. She also has this theory that if my lounger is wedged in tight between two chairs it'll be harder to drag the lounger across the floor, we'll see, where there's a will there's a way. If there has to be change then make that change work for you, bark until they do the right thing, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Another successful yank and drag while barking, this time I managed to drag the lounger across the room, happens when the hospital corners are tightly tucked. How do I measure success, by getting two and a half blankets yanked off while at the same time dragging the lounger, by keeping my biscuit exposed so I don't have to go digging for it and finally by the level of flutter of the eye twitch. Don't always take the easy road, going the extra mile with yanking and barking could ultimately lead to the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

The things I have to do for attention but sometimes a girls gotta do what a girls gotta do. I wouldn't make this strenuous climb up and down the stairs if I didn't get results, when I feel my cheese levels are getting low I go down the stairs and start barking, that's when everyone stops what they're doing to find out what's going on, otherwise I wouldn't be doing this crazy stuff. It's about self preservation and doing what you can to stay healthy, keep your cheese levels up in order to prevent any sort of deficiency, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: This is one of my daytime loungers which is conveniently located beside dad's chair, it gives him easy access for rubs and scratches while he's watching TV, it's considered therapeutic for both of us. I usually end up here after my session on the couch with The Warden, she's more needy so I start with her, she caresses my ears and does a deep dive into my neck folds to help calm her nerves. Of course in between these two stops I've had my witching hour where I bark at nothing until everyone's nerves are frayed. When everything seems to be out of balance take some time to slow it down, spend some quality time together and share cheese, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: Every month The Warden cleans the vacuum filter and every month I bark at it, first of all it doesn't belong here, no matter where it sits to dry it doesn't belong. I don't like change, it's invading my personal space and it qualifies under the rules of order to be barked at, so it had to be moved in order to maintain the tranquility that was required for napping and that the neighbours don't see what crazy stuff happens at our house. If you see something wrong bark at it, make the change you want, don't except crazy stuff, Ancient Basset Saying.

I've been waiting for hours, possibly days for someone to stop by, I've been here so long the season is starting to change, if someone doesn't stop by soon I'll be buried in snow or even worse I'll develop a cheese deficiency.  Well it sure seems like a long time, the only movement was The Warden, she was watching me watching her, if something doesn't happen soon I'll have to start barking, that usually gets things fired up. There are times when you have to be a leader and create your own distraction, bark loud and proud until they reach for the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

media.title: Throwback to the day I decided I was a leader not a follower, I learned if I applied the brakes everyone would stop in their tracks, check me over to ensure I was alright and allow me to continue to set the pace. There was a little huffing and puffing from up above  but nothing to be concerned about, they adjusted their stride to accommodate my sniffing. When training to be a leader you have to be firm (stubborn) and not give in to the yank or sweet talk, eventually they'll submit your your demands. There are a few exceptions to this leadership rule, you must follow if it leads to the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: After being heavily influenced by watching others The Warden decided to try offering me bite size treats while out on our walk, the theory was it would distract me from sniffing and I would move along.  What distracted me most was the crinkle of the bag, that got my attention, I was curious when she handed me the salmon treat, I gently accepted the offering then very quickly spit it out and continued sniffing. The salmon treat was left on the sidewalk for those that are inclined to be manipulated by offerings of a substandard token. Don't mess around with fake motivational tools, if you want results use what you know gets results, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: There was a slight incident on our walk, here's my version.  I was sniffing each individual blade of grass when I noticed a newcomer coming towards us, I immediately laid down as one does and waited for them to get closer, as soon as the small dog was within sniffing distance he started snapping at the air and had to be restrained. That's when the cold front settled over us, The Warden raised up, stepped in front of me and shielded me from the snapping teeth.  It was a quick exchange, there was no meet and greet, little to no conversation, I returned to my sniffing and The Warden started to thaw out. Every meet and greet may not be what we expect but we move on and continue our journey, Ancient Basset Saying.

Big day, I got to meet a new delivery guy in training, it was his first day and he wasn't sure what the procedures were when confronted with someone tethered to a line and howling. The regular guy, who knew me, showed him the ropes, all you have to do is walk over to the howler, bend down slightly (to prevent being jumped up on), say hello with a head pat or neck rub and Skip To My Lou you've graduated the Meet and Greet 101. The new guy was still nervous, the howling probably scared him or maybe it was The Warden lurking in the shadows, she has that affect on people. Whether you're tethered to a line or free styling it's important that you greet everyone with the same enthusiasm, everyone counts, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: It's been pointed out that I'm not the easiest to walk with, emphasis given to walk, I like to give special sniffing attention to every corner and every single blade of grass (not true, I've glossed over a few blades). I also think it's important to stop and rest, check to see if anyone is getting close and sniff anything that is shoulder height. It's a journey not a marathon, I'm collecting memories along the way and sending a few of my own, a message for all those sniffers behind me, if my message seemed short it's because I got the yank. The second half of our journey I pick up the pace when I realize I'm heading home, that's when everyone can relax and stop complaining about shoulder discomfort. Home is where the heart is, it's also a fridge that is well stocked, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

There's been rumors, hints, suggestions and a lot of crazy talk about cutting back on my treats, who are these people. May I present to you exhibit A, one gravy coated biscuit, examine closely the effort it takes before it gets eaten, this is a full body workout just to prepare the ambience required and please note this is only one biscuit of five. Now imagine the effort used in having to beg for the good stuff such as cheese, there's built up intensity, drooling and at times barking, all this for a small nugget to prevent a cheese deficiency. Never stop begging for your rights to be given treats, you've earned them, bark until they reach for the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: A Code Red was issued and security was brought in to assess my collar status, it was felt with one good tug the collar would slip off, therefore an immediate adjustment had to be made.  The collar is purposely loose in order for my neck folds to drape naturally and be on full display but there are times when the collar gets in front of the folds and security is called in.  I suppose you're wondering why I have full time security, it's because I live with someone who has a shady past and likes to live on the edge, if her ankle bracelet was loose she'd be on the run, similar circumstances with a loose collar. In order to prevent thoughts of escaping provide a reason to stay, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to that fateful day when someone thought it was a good idea for me to wear a hat, it was not one of my most memorable moments. As you might have guessed this moment didn't last long and there was no joy or happiness expressed by anyone. There are times when you have to tolerate a bad idea because you are being lured by shady characters holding cheese, I admit now it was a weak moment to let this display go on for so long. Don't let your past define you, what you need to do is take the cheese and move on and forget about it, Ancient Basset Saying.

There are times when I need and deserve more attention, don't be afraid to ask for what you deserve, a little attention goes a long way.  It also helps prevent barking because there are those who have issues with barking, they get all tied up in knots and start saying 'hey hey' which you can't really hear when you're barking, so they drop what they're doing and give you the attention you deserve. You do what works, you've spent a lot of time training those around you and you should be rewarded, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

All I heard was this chanting squeaky little voice, rabbit rabbit rabbit, so to stop all the noise I went outside to investigate, apparently all the fuss to get me outside scared off every living creature, they must've heard about her No Talent Tour. I felt obligated to check out the yard, here a sniff there a sniff everywhere a sniff sniff, I found nothing even though the hysterical cheap seats say they saw a rabbit. Every attempt to uncover a predator on your turf should be considered a heroic event and needs to be rewarded, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: Questions were raised about how I got dirt all over my paw area, answers were realized when they saw the dirt scattered in the garden (questioner has issues). I admit it, I'm not ashamed of what I've done, my name is Miss Lilly and I have dirt digging tendencies, it's something I have to live with and I'm proud of each mound of dirt I've scattered. After each dig the staff are quick with their garage tools, broom and dustpan, and before you know it each grain of dirt is smoothed over ready for when the dirt digging urge strikes again. It's important to be able to express yourself and be creative, uncover your true self and dig deep, Ancient Basset Saying.

This additional blanket added to my lounger was a gift, well actually it took a yank and drag off of dad to get a complete takeover. Whenever dad uses this throw it's like he's challenging me to yank it off him and I accept the challenge every time, The Warden claims he's inciting me so it's his loss and my gain. The good news is this stray blanket isn't tucked in with hospital corners which makes it easier to do a biscuit dance, as part of this performance barking is encouraged, the cheap seats love it that's why they yell out hey hey. Seize the moment if an opportunity presents itself, bark loud and proud because it could lead to someone reaching for the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: Good news bad news story, while out on my sniff and walk it started to rain which means I got wet, now for the good news, my next official bath has been moved up to the early summer of 2025. On the walk home I had to stop twice to shake off the rain which is hard to do when you keep getting wet, catch 22.  When we finally got home I was given a paper towel pat down, a murmur of an apology and two treats, I would have preferred, softly patted down with a warm towel, begging for forgiveness and a platter of cheese. When faced with adversity you accept forgiveness and you move on, with acceptance comes your reward, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

I'm fortunate in many ways, I currently have three day loungers, all are different sizes, covered with blankets and all can be used while doing a yank and drag while barking. The main lounger is located in the reading room, it's covered with three blankets and this is the preferred napping station, my secondary lounger is located beside dad's chair in the TV room, it's the right height for him to give me scratches and the third lounger is mostly used as a toss station for The Warden to give me treats, it's strategically placed so I can watch if there's a lot of movement, it's small and not meant for extended naps. Loungers are meant for day napping, dragging around or watching staff, while sleeping through the night you need at least a queen bed so you can monitor all movements, it's for safety concerns. Be thankful that you have choices as you are one of the lucky ones, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to my early experimental phase when I was into droolery art, also known as slobber slinging, it can stimulate conversation but there is also a downside, it can cause others to chase you with a wet cloth. Droolery (aka slobber) is a reaction to excitement, when you're out on a walk and you stop to meet someone it's exciting so you give them a slobber shake, that's usually when someone yells out 'incoming' and this is automatically followed by apologies. Excepting others as they are is important, embrace their slobber slings and admire their creative droolery, it's who we are, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: You would think napping outside wouldn't be a problem with a slight cool breeze whispering over you but then you hear movement and you definitely gotta check it out. Of course if The Wardens fussing around in the garden I have to be positioned in her sight line, she has attachment issues and with the restraining order I'm liable if she wanders off the property.  After three hours of outdoor time I find it exhausting, I've spent most of the time watching, listening, sniffing and the occasional roll and bark, that's why when I go back inside I spend the rest of the day napping. Never pass up an opportunity to get noticed, if it means you have to bark then bark loud and proud, it's your right, Ancient Basset Saying.

There's something lurking in the shadows and this time it's not The Warden, with the slight breeze I'm picking up an unfamiliar scent, could it be a local varmint or is someone having a mid day BBQ. Usually I don't see varmints wandering around, there's the occasional squirrel, chipmunk or rabbit but they keep their distance. Maybe someone is slow cooking a roast simmering in gravy and they'll have too much and will be looking for someone to share it with. Be seen and be available for those opportunities that happen when you least expect them, Ancient Basset Saying.

I'm still in recovery after the dreadful bath episode, probably will be until the hint of lavender fades and the two offenders make amends. There are several things that can help make a traumatic memory fade, first thing, give me a large plate of roast simmering in gravy and let my gravy dippers hang heavy dripping in gravy and no one chasing after me with a wet cloth, secondly, offer me a platter of aged cheese, I'm flexible on reversing the order of amendments because I'm kind and thoughtful. When you've been deprived of your true scent you must sniff out a new beginning and start rolling, you'll know you've succeeded when they start wrinkling their nose, Ancient Basset Saying.

Be on the lookout for one shady lady and her accomplice who have violated the bath agreement of Miss Lilly, a warrant for their arrest has been issued. The two have been spotted trying to walk her as she struggles to sniff out a strong smell to roll on and to reclaim her former glorious scent. What's humiliating is whenever they pass by someone they express delight about a torturous bath and a lovely hint of lavender, these people need to be taken off the streets. When bad things happen all you have to do is get back out there and start rolling, before you know it you'll have a smell that everyone can't stop talking about, Ancient Basset Saying.

Today's helpful hint if you are being told your barking is too loud and annoying, stick your head under a blanket, it helps muffle the sound. It also helps if you are doing a three blanket yank and drag while barking, that way you have options and if you are blindly barking the blankets are readily available. There are those who will say they can still hear you (you know who you are), they'll yell out hey hey and other muffled noises, and will try to dampen your spirit, but I say to you, bark like no one is listening.
