Know your rights when it comes to barking, if someone has a problem offer them a blanket to stick their head under, helps muffle the sound, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: The Warden has one job after our sniff and walk and that's to give me two different types of treats, I wait patiently as she tosses the selection onto my remote day lounger before I give my final approval. Her toss fell short of its mark this time which is an indication that she's lacking in her focus to detail, she's losing it or it's a cheese deficiency. As a side note the duck tenders are thin so I get several and they only count as one choice. If you make a mistake or a bad decision it can be corrected and made right again, turn a bad toss into the right move, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to a social distancing visit with family where I was given an exemption to the hockey stick distance rule, also there was no way anyone could stop me from getting the attention I deserve. I made my rounds so everyone had an opportunity to spend time with me and yes there were several times where my line got all tangled up around the chairs, that's one of the hazards of social distancing but the coordinator of the event sorted this out and also warned everyone about the hair in the air (she can't help herself, it's a control thing). It's the little things that matter, getting lots of undivided attention with scratches and rubs, a couple of good girls and sharing snacks, Ancient Basset Saying.  Due to ongoing issues snacks were not provided at this gathering, a formal complaint was registered with the proper authorities.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: It was a day like any other day until panic set in, there was this wild screeching noise that sent shivers down your spine and The Warden had a momentary loss of dignity, here's what happened. Dad was heading out in the truck to pick up supplies, The Warden decided to sort recycling so she hooked me up to my line so I could sniff around outside, as I was leaving the garage dad hit the remote control to the garage door and it slowly started to close, that's when the screeching started and I froze as the guillotine was lowering, fortunately it had a sensor and reversed its direction, no emergency services were required for The Warden and I happily meandered outside. Be grateful for the little things, be kind and don't hesitate to reach out for the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

I was having a much needed nap, dreaming about the good ole days when I didn't have to beg or bark for cheese when all of a sudden I heard this noise, the garage door was opening. It had to be dad because the only other person in the house was sitting in the same chair and was watching my every move, she has attachment issues. I'm the official greeter in the house, if they come in through the garage I don't need to bark, now if someone came to the front door, different story, that's when I ramp it up. You have an obligation to greet everyone that comes to your house, barking and jumping up on them are optional depending on the situation, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: Is she looking, tell me she's not looking, all I want is a private moment in the garden laying in the dirt that I just dug up.  Who doesn't love the smell of freshly turned over earth, commonly known as dirt, it has that lingering smell that stays with you for hours, a lovely scent with just a hint of worm. I trail around behind The Warden as she weeds the garden, she's constantly turning over the dirt which leads me to believe she's doing this deliberately to entice me, so if there's a problem it's not my fault, I'm just reaping the rewards by smelling lovely.  It's important to enhance your smell, the best smells always gets sniffed, Ancient Basset Saying.

My next mission is to ban all hospital corners from day loungers, it puts a crimp in my style while doing the yank and drag while barking. I came running into the room with my gravy coated biscuit in my mouth, dropped it on the lounger and started yanking off the blanket, that's where things turned ugly and I had to change my strategy.  No matter what happens keep on barking, the cheap seats are expecting a show and the show must go on, even though I was unable to yank the blanket across the room I still received rave reviews and a few hey heys. Do not disappoint, bark until you can bark no more, eventually they'll give in and reach for the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

These plants have a little spring in them, they bounce right back up after stepping on them, it's important to plant a hardy crop to avoid the need for little ugly fences. It's not the best place to dig or bury biscuits because it's too cramped and hard to get at the dirt, also security is really tight, they're ready to pounce all over you if the plants get dug up. Apparently digging up the plants is frowned upon so I'll abide by following all rules and regulations while I'm being watched. In life things happen, if the plants get dug up and no one saw who did it then you are cleared of all charges, legally speaking, Ancient Basset Saying.

They say that after living with someone for an extended period of time you start to develop similar traits, while this morning dad got up and was sniffing the air which led him to the kitchen, he detected freshly made muffins. I also have an enhanced sniffer but my sniff choices are more refined, I do a lot of outside sniffing, every corner on our walk, every pee spot, fresh worms, questionable droppings or anyone who passes by. Now inside it all comes from the kitchen, that lingering smell of a small roast simmering in gravy or when the fridge door opens and they reach for the second shelf on the left, it's a memorable smell that keeps me coming back for more. Always follow the smell that leads to the things you beg for, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to some fun in the snow and my version of playing fetch. I play by my own rules, if you want someone to fetch and retrieve in an orderly fashion then I'm not your gal, I don't go back and forth, not my thing. I like to keep it fresh, add a little mystery, will she or will she not and once I get that feeling stand back and brace yourself (bend knees slightly in case I skid out of control). You be you, sniff like no one's waiting, bark at nothing or everything and whine until they reach for the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

I was given a rainy day chewy to help prevent a yank and drag while barking session, emphasis on the barking. It provided those with noise issues a brief moment of quiet time and reflection, until about half way through the chew I decided to put my dancing paws to work. I successfully yanked all three blankets off the lounger, the chewy got hidden under the blankets which incited more barking and created a bit of chaos, The Wardens nerves were slightly frayed but overall it was a fun afternoon. Don't let others dampen your enthusiasm, if they want a different outcome it's up to them to make the next move, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

I'm plotting a complete takeover of the couch, my mission is to convince The Warden that it's in her best interest to concede, teetering on the edge can be hazardous especially during a stretch and rotate. I usually start off at the end of couch with her slippers nudging my head and in time I start nuzzling my way up on the inside track, that's when she shifts over to accommodate me, it's not too much of a shift because I'm so tiny. She'll dive into my neck folds and wiggle her fingers at least until her wrist seizes up, that's about the time I need to stretch out, it's a process but eventually she'll make the right choice and move. When planning a complete takeover of a shared space make sure you do it in small stages so they're convinced it's their idea to leave, also leave the door open for negotiations, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Every sound you make every step you take I'll be watching you, it's all about opportunity, one step one move could lead to the second shelf on the left, you just gotta believe. That's why you don't gobble down your treats, around the corner or in just another moment they could be reaching for the good stuff that's kept locked up and guarded with stingy security. If you show you're not interested they start to think something's wrong and panic will set in so they will offer you alternatives, it's a theory I'm still ironing out. Discover their weak spots and learn how to get what you want, sometimes you gotta up your game to get what you want, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: It's suppose to rain all day so I'm planning today's inside activities which will all be scheduled in between naps, so please submit your requests and I'll try to accommodate everyone. All yank and drag while barking events will be scheduled in the late afternoon and early evening, time permitting, I like to host this event when the cheap seats are seated and trying to relax. During the late morning I'll be trailing around after The Warden, she needs constant monitoring at least that's what the court order stipulates. If you're having to spend more time inside please take care and ensure your cheese levels are topped up, bark, beg or whine if required, all medicinal cheese can be found, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Barking outside usually gets the attention of The Warden, she immediately looks my way, the nostrils flair, slight eye twitch and let's not forget a couple of hey heys. There are several reasons to bark, I need attention, there's someone new on the street, I'm bored, it's time to go inside or a feeling just came over me. One thing that is proven to be true, barking will never be ignored, it's like sending up the Bat Signal (Batman), the barking needs attention so send in the fixer which in this case is The Warden. One thing you quickly learn, do what works, what gets results and barking has never failed to get results, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: I'm a sniffer, no doubt about it, sometimes I'll sniff out a good smell and roll on it, it shows my appreciation.  Now here's where it gets controversial, The Warden was bending over to pick something up and I leaned over and took a sniff, as one does, she felt violated, in my defense all I did was sniff I did not touch. Who doesn't like to be sniffed, on all my walks when greeting someone we all sniff each other, front back upper lower, that's what you do. I've sniffed The Warden many times over the years and oh the things I could tell you but due to the non disclosure agreement I can't.  Lean in and take a sniff, it's what you do, it's like wrapping your arms around someone and giving them a hug, everyone needs to be sniffed, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to the good ole days when my brother would visit and stay overnight then in the morning I'd wake him up with a crash and bang. He would let me take him for a walk wherever I wanted to go, we would just wander around and sniff, no rules or yanking. There would always be a roast simmering in gravy and I'd get a large plate to clean, it was a proud moment to have my gravy dippers all slick and shiny with no judgement or chasing me around with a wet cloth. Even though there is distance it's important to stay connected, check in and make sure everyone is okay or ask if they need anything, especially for the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

ð¶Crusty ears, crusty ears, my little lady has crusty ears ð¶, this little ditty was being sung while chasing me around with a wet cloth. If the truth be told it was the singing that was offensive to my ears, it was an up close and personal Proud Mary Moment.  Having crusty gravy dippers is natural and expected especially during the summer months, all those slobber slings and dangling drool lines end up on your ears and than it dries and becomes crusty. Don't fuss over crusty ears, it'll all suddenly disappear by wiping them off on the blanket or the furniture and they can also make a nice light snack by licking them clean, Ancient Basset Saying.

Like clockwork every morning when I get up I check to see if my daily ration of five gravy coated biscuits are laid out for the day along with my two wake up treats. The first thing I'll do is eat my two treats, it gives me enough strength so I can make it to my bowl of fresh filtered water with ice, then I go greet the staff (it helps build their self esteem) and then settle in for a nap (sleeping all night is exhausting). The gravy coated biscuits are at my disposal throughout the day, later in the day I'll do a yank and drag while barking for the cheap seats (always a popular event), of course there's the biscuit dance and let's not forget the burying ritual before eating my biscuit. It makes for a busy day while at the same time it's a great source of exercise, all this activity helps with ab definition and keeping your body toned. When you have an active lifestyle it's important to keep a regular nap schedule, after each treat it is recommended that you nap at least one hour, Ancient Basset Saying.

Not every moment is a yank and drag while barking kinda moment, there are times when you just want to climb up on your lounger and take a raincheck on entertaining the cheap seats. Forget about yanking out the hospital corners or those leftover crumbs scattered all over the blanket, nothing else matters in this moment, so take a load off, even if you're just a slip of a girl and rest up before your next big adventure. Remember naps are important, they are fuel for yank and drag while barking and right along beside naps is your nutrition and keeping your cheese levels up, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

We had a social distancing family visit where I was given an exemption to the hockey stick distance rule, it was obvious that I was lacking attention so I received emergency scratches and rubs. After all the extra attention I was several pounds lighter, you could see the evidence as tumbleweeds of hair floated all over the driveway, also this exposed my ribs, it was revealed that I had a cheese deficiency and so there were accusations and questions about my wellbeing, they plead the fifth. They wanted to know the status of the second shelf on the left and if I was receiving my daily requirements, I laid still while trying to look weak and frail. There are times when it's best not to say anything, let others choose your destiny, second shelf on the shelf, Ancient Basset Saying.

Lately dad has started taking me for a late night sniff and walk, even though I don't like the dark I'm happy to get the invite. Due to the darkness dad can justify wearing his slippers, we only go a couple of blocks so I can do a little extra sniffing and there's only the occasional person walking by at a safe distance so they don't notice what he's wearing. At home the slipper police are sleeping and are not aware that we just don't care, we are free and easy, breaking all the rules, at least for a few minutes. When we get back home dad sneaks me a piece of aged cheese and even though he's under intense interrogation the next day and admits to sneaking cheese he will continue with our nightly routine, he's a repeat offender. Stick close to those that live on the edge and dare to be different for they are the ones who will reap the rewards, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: Helpful Tips:  On hot sunny days it's advisable to keep your bowl of fresh filtered water with ice in a shady location, it helps the staff from constantly having to refresh your bowl.  Also the placement of your blanket should be neatly spread out directly under the tree where it's shaded with a nice constant breeze and as close to The Wardens (your own Warden) chair as possible so it's easier for her to reach all of you while giving you scratches and rubs. It would be nice if you had snacks but because of ongoing issues I don't have this service, The Warden doesn't eat outside and it's got nothing to do with her restraining order. There may be small inconveniences along the way but take the time to enjoy the moment with those that give you scratches and rubs, that may also lead to the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

media.title: Throwback to the day this little slip of a girl was found barking for attention, she was tethered to a snowblower and being watched by someone lurking behind the bushes. It was discovered that she had only a bowl of fresh filtered water with ice placed discretely in the shade and no snacks, that's probably why she was barking.  As a Community Service initiative if you happen to be passing by this little girl please take the time to give her some much needed attention, just ignore the person hiding in the bushes. All wrongs can be made right again, bark your truth, it could lead to the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

I was letting all my dreams come true, there I was wandering into the great unknown, nose to the ground, nobody lurking in the shadows, nobody chasing after me in their slippers. In this dream I followed my nose to a wonderland of aged cheese, the end of the rainbow treasure chest of cheese, no begging or barking required, no performing for the cheap seats, I had been granted full access to the second shelf on the left. Sometimes you just gotta believe that all your dreams will come true, even if it's only during nap time, Ancient Basset Saying.

If you're not getting the attention you deserve while doing the yank and drag while barking then take a moment to think about another approach and then give it another go, it could be they're trying to ignore you. Usually I get a few hey heys or a penetrating glare and with any luck and good fortune I'll get an eye twitch, this time I got nothing, she must be trying a new tactic. The Warden is always searching for better ways to control my personal freedom and I'm trying to get her to lighten up, round and round we go.  If your freedom of expression is not being appreciated it's not because of you it's because of them, keep on barking, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: I like to consider myself low maintenance, easy to get along with, very few requirements and loves to meet and greet anyone anywhere. Give me a bowl of fresh filtered water with ice and I'm good to go, toss me a blanket on the ground under a shade tree and someone to constantly give me attention and belly rubs I'm good to go. I'm not fancy but I do have a preference for aged cheese, second shelf on the left, or a small roast simmering in gravy and of course the occasional treat for no reason. Once in awhile I'll bark but who doesn't, no big deal, it's a warning bark to indicate my cheese levels are getting low, it's considered a preventative measure. Embrace you being you and others will follow in your path, Ancient Basset Saying.

media.title: One of the greatest feelings you can get is stealing someone's chair while it's still warm and then when they turn around and get that I can't believe you just did that look. It's a feeling like none other especially when the other person in the room yells out 'sorry about your luck', that's when you know you've sealed the deal. There'll probably be some eye twitching, some mumbling and regret that they didn't reserve their spot with a book, yes I'll hear 'oh for heaven sakes' but nothing short of a small crane will get me to move. Yes some of us will savour our small victories while others will have to admit defeat, unless of course they make the decision to right the wrong, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: I was told I had to go back inside but I felt I had a good reason not to, because I didn't want to, I rest my case.  The Warden packed everything up except my blanket and announced it was time to go in, that's when the bribery started, I vaguely recall hearing water, treats, someone's coming, who is it who is it (regularly used to peak my interest, didn't work), I wasn't moving so move along.  Which she did, she left me stranded all alone on the blanket, in the middle of the front lawn, except I felt her lurking in the shadows. Eventually I decided I better go see what she was up to, trouble has a tendency to follow her if not properly supervised and she has attachment issues. If you want immediate results then don't mess around with false promises, what you need to do is crinkle that bag, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

media.title: In between naps I usually follow The Warden around, it builds her self esteem (she has issues), she takes this freshly laundered blanket out of the dryer and quickly puts it back on the couch, heaven forbid I lay on a naked couch.  It was the perfect opportunity to get a gravy coated biscuit and christen the blanket, not to worry the gravy stains from the biscuit blend in nicely and I cleaned up all the crumbs, as one does when getting rid of the evidence. This no longer gets The Warden riled up, no eye twitching, no huffing puffing mumbling or grumbling, she's evolved, she's now in a good place and we are thankful. There will come a time when no one chases after you with a wet cloth to clean your gravy dippers or grabs a wet mop to wipe up paw prints, it's that time when you realize what matters most is just being together and accepting others as they are, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to the early years when I never knew you were entitled to a treat after you went outside to do your business, yes I got a lot of praise and good girl stuff but not one treat. Over time the rookie staff realized they had broken a basic principle in my overall development, all good deeds need to be rewarded. It was a learning curve and now today I'm happy to report I get a treat before I go outside, the theory behind this is it would avoid any fake outings, more research is required after this theory was proven false. Being rewarded for good deeds is a win win for everyone, I get what I deserve and the one handing out the reward feels empowered, at least in that moment let them feel they have full control, Ancient Basset Saying.

The yank and drag while barking, extended version, warning issued, may cause eye twitching if viewed more than once. The Warden was preparing to cover the chair with this blanket when I saw an opportunity and made a move, I quickly ran to get a biscuit, dropped it on the blanket and now the stage is set. Nothing can stop me once I get started so I saw no problem with making direct eye contact, I'm making sure the cheap seats are thoroughly engaged, eyes are twitching and they're chanting hey hey, it's a special moment. It's about setting yourself up for success, never pass up an opportunity where you can be the star of your own show, create those memorable moments and with a little bit of luck and a few prayers you hopefully will be rewarded, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

There I was just walking and sniffing when all of a sudden a cat with an animal dangling out of his mouth ran across my path, I put on the brakes and got in the attack position, the only thing holding me back was at the end of my leash (gasping for air). The cat quickly understood I was a threat, he drop his prey, arched his back and gave me the death stare, that's when I felt the yank, it's never a good thing to mess with nature during meal time. We continued our walk with sympathy given to the victim and not a word was mentioned over my heroic gesture. Be the hero of your own story, walk with confidence, sniff like you just don't care and hope at the end of each journey you'll be rewarded, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: On our walk we met a little one, 3 years old, who asked if she could pet me, I of course had no problem granting someone's lifelong dream. Once everyone established boundaries, a hockey stick length apart except me, the little one and her mom, a brief warning that I was heavier than I looked and a caution about slobber. Everything went well, all four paws remained on the ground (no jumping up), in all the excitement I do a slobber sling which got giggles and rave reviews and there was no eye twitching from the nervous bystanders.  It's important to make yourself accessible, you could be fulfilling someone else's dream to rub your long silky ears and if all the stars are aligned it could also lead to a belly rub, Ancient Basset Saying.

Recently dad started taking me out for a short walk later in the evening, he used to do this solo while I napped but he started to invite me.  It's important to be included, to be the one that gets invited to the party, I would get all dressed up in my harness and leash, I would dance around with my tail going at full speed all because I got the invitation. Then we would step outside, it was dark and eerie, who knows what lurks in the shadows, so I'd put my nose to the ground and off we'd go. Every time I would stop to sniff dad would be slapping himself (lots of night bugs) but off we would go on our journey, at least to the corner and then I was ready to come back home. It's not about how far you went, who you met or what corner you sniffed, it's about the journey you took together and what's also important after each journey is when someone reaches for the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: At first I wasn't sure what was going on, I inched closer and then barked, as one does when something is new or out of place, The Warden was standing in the window well washing windows.  Of course I had to walk over all the plants to get a closer look, you never know what you'll find in the deep dark crevices of a window well, I've once encountered a live mouse which I chased and I also barked at dead leaves. She did take time out of her busy schedule to reassure me that this was normal behaviour, I had my doubts so I barked anyways which made the job go a lot quicker. When encountering anything that doesn't seem right it's best to bark first and question later, there will always be those that try to hush you with hey heys, they are the ones who also try to bury the evidence, it's about doing the right thing, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: After my daily sniff and walk I wait patiently by the treat cabinet, as one does, it's my reward for being a good girl.  The Warden selects one treat and tosses it on my small day lounger, I look up at her and wait for another selection, after my outing I prefer to have a choice of options, so she tosses another treat. Once the two treats are displayed I'll then decide which one to eat first, that's also when The Warden can move on to stage two, refreshing my filtered water with ice. As a side note cheese is not considered a treat, it's a necessity to be used daily as a medical treatment against a cheese deficiency. Make sure you are rewarded for your daily exercise outings and above all else ensure you keep your cheese levels up, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to my very first appearance on IG, this was almost six years ago when I was just a slip of a girl and I had a little more bounce to my step. Back in those days I didn't require the lift service for getting up on the bed, even though I can't jump up on the bed anymore I can still hop up on all the other furniture, there might be a slight hesitation and a few extra bounces but I can still manage. I now have my own lounger on the floor so I can easily walk right on for a nap, back in the early years loungers were used for yanking and dragging not for sleeping. Don't hesitate if you need help to get up to the next level, just do a little bouncing motion and look over your shoulder, chances are someone is hovering in the shadows waiting to assist, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: I've made a mistake or two along the way but I own it and move on, for example, while out on my walk I was sniffing for a perfect spot as one does, I found it and peed, unfortunately my backend was at the edge of the sidewalk, accidents happen.  My nose was in the grass and totally unaware of the misfortune, I was able to move on without feeling any shame unlike someone else with issues who is guilt ridden.  There was no one around as the little river of pee cascaded along the sidewalk, making this theory if no one saw it did it happen, this type of thinking happens while in isolation.  The theory of 'if I think about cheese I'll get it' unfortunately doesn't work, in order to make things happen you have to sometimes bark, beg or whine, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: Voices were raised and a stern look was given (a little distracting with the eye twitch) all this fuss during my nightly barking session. It all starts when everyone sits down to relax and watch a bit of TV, that's when I'll go to another room to bark at nothing and try to nose the door closed so a rescue team will have to save me from being in a locked room. The Warden is reaching out to experts in the field of barking issues about why this occurs, reach no further, I know why, it's the onset of a cheese deficiency, by the end of the day my cheese levels have depleted. All your issues can be resolved and peace restored by reaching for the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: We are now into the heat of the summer and a few new restrictions have been added but that's okay, I'm used to complying with all rules and regulations when it suits me. I must lay in the shade and avoid direct sun especially from laying on the pavement, my fresh filtered water with ice is to be monitored and replenished when the ice melts, no strenuous activity such as digging or barking and the occasional worm roll is allowed in moderation. I'm being closely watched which isn't unusual and if they looked a little closer they could see my ribs protruding which is probably due to a cheese deficiency. Whether it's the blistering cold or the scorching heat remember to abide by the rules and go inside when asked, this could lead to the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

I have a supportive role whenever it's laundry day, I'm not sure it's totally appreciated but nonetheless I do my part to help where I can. The Warden has a system where she lays out the bed covering and blanket in an orderly fashion, neat and tidy, so it's easier to remake the bed, this is where I come in. I first of all run to get a biscuit, bury it in the organized mess on the floor and then I start barking, that's about the time The Warden shows up with her hey heys, which is an indication that my job here is done. It's about the gesture of offering to help, when you see someone doing chores show up, whether it's to bark or do a yank and drag it's all about being supportive, you've done your part by showing up, Ancient Basset Saying.

After a successful yank and drag while barking I can now relax and claim my victory biscuit. I conquered all hospital corners, ignored all hey heys, avoided all eye contact and now that my mission is completed I can savour the sweet moment I created the double eye twitch. In order to help her frayed nerves The Warden will remake my lounger by tucking in each blanket and making sure there are no loose corners (yes, she's convinced everyone that a round lounger has corners). With each accomplishment it's important to acknowledge your success, one small step to the fridge, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Rabbit rabbit rabbit, the cheap seats were chanting, panting and pointing so I had to investigate, it smelled like a varmint but I didn't see anything.  Once I cleared the area and the threat was contained I continued my search looking for what caused The Warden to get all stirred up. She says there was a rabbit but she didn't have a deposit bag looking for evidence so I'm not convinced. I think being in isolation has a tendency to enhance one's creative and dramatic flair, maybe once we're back inside she'll shimmy shake to the fridge, second shelf on the left, you just gotta believe.

Throwback to yesterday when we thought it felt like Saturday but it was only Wednesday and eventually realized it was Canada Day ð¨ð¦ (this can happen in isolation). We celebrated by going for a social distancing walk, lounging outside, barked for no reason and had a few extra treats, for all of this we are thankful.  Even though there is a heaviness felt everywhere we feel fortunate to live in Canada where we can bark free and live in hope for the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: I was lounging on the driveway when I heard the car keys rattling, The Warden was going on a road trip, I started prancing around the car, we were setting out to see the world. For some reason she was huffing and puffing saying 'oh for heaven sakes', but putting that aside she opened the car door and I hopped in. She finally got in, turned the car on and backed up approximately a foot and a half, then turned the car off, that was it, the end of our road trip, no trip around the world. All she wanted was a little more room in the garage for easier access to the garden tools and in that brief moment all my hopes and dreams of seeing the world were gone. Never stop believing, one day the rattling of keys will lead to great things, you just gotta believe, have the same faith when someone opens the fridge door, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: All alone on a sea of grass, not a delivery truck in sight, no one cutting their lawn, not one person to bark at, yes there was the yard maintenance crew sweeping the driveway but not worth the energy to bark at (yet). I'll occasionally move around on my outdoor blanket so I can keep an eye on the staff, after awhile I'll move to the sun so I can air out and of course I'll sniff out a spot to do a worm roll, when I go back inside I want to have that fresh linen smell with a hint of worm. Take advantage of those lazy hazy days of summer, capture those lingering scents with each roll, make each moment memorable, Ancient Basset Saying.

media.title: Start your day off right, block out all the chaos in your life and take a moment to reflect and remember that biscuit you buried, that hole you dug, sniffing the tracks of a varmint through the urban jungle and the endless pursuit of cheese.  While you are deep in thought give your abs a light workout, nothing strenuous, you don't want to bulk up. Ignore what's going on around you, the constant fussing, the endless noise from the vacuum and laundry machines, block out those cleaning smells but be ready to pounce if you hear the fridge door open. Take the time you need to be a better you, that means staying hydrated, getting plenty of naps and keeping your cheese levels up, Ancient Basset Saying.

Into the deep dark recesses of the urban jungle one brave basset wanders in all alone sniffing, hot on the trail of an unknown predator facing danger with each step and sniff. The biggest fear comes off the plant leaves, dripping water, but the basset sniffs on remembering the famous last words from someone with a shady past, in order to move forward you must face your fears. After each great adventure into the great unknown your reward will be you bravely faced your fears and maybe be rewarded with the kindness of someone reaching for the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Every yank and drag while barking has a purpose, it's the ultimate thrill of being in the crosshairs of the eye twitch, it means they are watching you and value your presence. It does come with a little sweet talk if the barking is prolonged, the cheap seats will be chanting hey hey which is really a motivator to continue. During the beginning stages it's best not to make direct eye contact, save your satisfied look until the end after you finished your barking session. When you pour your heart and soul into each performance you must have patience, give them time to get up and go to the fridge, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: How to get the attention you deserve without having to bark, almost impossible but I've come up with a few ways (most of my creative ideas happen while napping). When you're outside and you see someone weeding the lawn try to anticipate their next move and then lay on the next weed that needs to be removed, they have no choice but to stop what they're doing and start fussing over you, here's a tip, roll over for a belly rub, they won't be able to resist. Of course there's the old standby, the yank and drag while barking but that does require you to bark, can't be helped but it does get results. Don't hold back when you need the attention you deserve, if it means barking so be it, if all the stars are aligned it could lead to the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: Throwback to when my brother came to visit and I also got to meet my distant cousin Mikey (another mother). He liked to roll in some of my favourite spots and he didn't seem to mind when I barked at him the whole time, unlike someone else who was yanking on my line and constantly saying hey hey. Unfortunately no snacks were served but water bottles were offered and I shared my bowl of fresh filtered water with ice and everyone stayed at least a hockey stick apart (uncut length). Make the most of the time you have together even if no snacks are offered, it's about being present and getting noticed, Ancient Basset Saying.

They resurfaced my driveway and I've been hesitant about walking on it, might take a little more time to adjust to this new change, did I happen to mention that I don't like change. I've been trying to avoid walking on the driveway, I'm not too sure if it's safe yet, I'll skirt along the edges and walk through the garden, I'd like to report that no plants were harmed and digging along the edges doesn't count. I've been doing my sunning on the grass and hopefully in a few days I'll be back on the driveway soaking up the sun. Sometimes you have to accept change because you wake up one day and there it is, in order to deal with any change it's important to keep your cheese levels up, Ancient Basset Saying.

media.title: I've been busy, I've done the yank and drag while barking with two of my three blankets and now I'm on to the biscuit burying portion of today's entertainment. The cheap seats need to be stimulated or else they would become bored which could lead to them getting in trouble or being arrested, if not for me who knows what life path they would choose. I do my best to keep them distracted, there's the constant pursuit of treats, the scratches and rubs, several changes to refresh my water with ice and constantly watching their every move, all this makes for a busy day. Watching and waiting could lead to great things, there's always hope it'll lead to the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Beware, I'm surrounded by danger, my getting wet detector is on high alert, the urban jungle is dripping with water, I'm taking no chances and keeping clear of the ugly side effects of water. I usually don't go outside this early because of the sprinkler system but as I was sleeping I could hear this constant chanting noise, rabbit rabbit, so I somewhat ran to the door, stretched a few times and meandered outside. By the time I got outside the rabbit was nowhere in sight, probably heard all the chanting. Never rush into a wet bush, you'll come out feeling like you just had a bath, it's your mission to avoid all baths at all times, maintain your dignity and know that you naturally smell lovely, Ancient Basset Saying.

It's great to have someone who let's me yank off his blanket while he snoozes so I can do a yank and drag while barking, he cheers me on.  Someone who gives me large pieces of meat off his fork and doesn't feel compelled to cut it up in microscopic pieces. Someone who doesn't care if I use his pjs to do a biscuit dance and drag them all over the room.  Someone who sneaks me cheese at night when The Warden isn't around, to help prevent a cheese deficiency. These are the little things that makes my dad special, Happy Father's Day Dad.

I've circled this lounger and yanked my blankets from every angle and still the hospital corners held up but I did manage to slide the lounger a few feet. I suppose you're wondering why I go to such lengths, what is it I'm lacking, yes my cheese levels are low but what I really need is undivided attention, as one does when not napping. Not just a casual glance or the occasional good girl stuff, I need drop everything, two hands on deck (back, belly and neck) rubbing and scratching until your wrists give out or until you're covered in hair you can't tell who's who. Don't be afraid to ask for what you need, it could be closer than what you think, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: I've tried everything and I mean everything to get another treat, not just any dry stale treat, I mean one of the good treats. I've scratched at the treat cabinet, whined some, barked until I could bark no more, sniffed around everyone to make sure they weren't sneaking snacks, had to listen to a few hey heys and still I came up empty. I'm now in a weakened state, probably the onset of a cheese deficiency, I can't even lift my head unless of course someone makes a move to the fridge, second shelf on the left, it'll be a miracle, if only they will make the move. Never give up hope, you just gotta believe and it will come true, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to the day dad decided to do a plumbing repair, it was very unsettling, he was laying on the floor, tools everywhere, The Warden hovering close by ready to assist and assessing the cleanup. It all started with a pep rally (how to video), a massive search for tools and all hands (paws) on deck. I considered myself the team motivator, the cheap seats were yelling hey hey (from what I could hear), there were a few tense moments, especially when dad couldn't hear himself think from all the noise (probably The Warden saying hey hey). If you see that someone needs a helping hand (paw) then step up and do the right thing, doing a good deed could possibly lead to the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: I tried a new treat, sweet potato wrapped in duck, it takes a little extra work to get the duck off but it's definitely worth the effort. I'm a little confused why they would even mention sweet potato if it's just being used to display the yummy duck, that's like displaying aged cheese on a bed of lettuce, all nonsense. I suppose there are those who eat fruit and veggies, to each his own, live and let live and all that other stuff, blah blah blah. Don't be swayed by fancy packaging or by those who highly recommend, stick with what you like, especially second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: How to understand the signs that you aren't quite ready to go outside, yet. If when you arrive at the door and I'm laying down, that's a sign. If I'm standing back from the door more than a few steps, that's a sign. If you hear only one faint scratch on the door, could be a teaser, that's a sign. All of this doesn't mean you shouldn't show up, you just gotta lower your expectations, take a deep breath and spend a little extra time for a belly rub.  It could also be the early stages of a cheese deficiency, immediately turn around, go directly to the fridge, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Bark loud and proud to help wish Miss Lilly a Happy 8th Birthday!  This little slip of a girl has a tiny wish list for her birthday, world peace, a virus vaccine, a small roast simmering in gravy with a side order of cheese and lots of undivided attention. Today will be spent soaking up the sun, sniffing and rolling on the grass, afterwards with no encouragement she'll do the ever popular yank and drag while barking. What started out as 'let's see where this goes' has turned into 'where would we be without her', love this little girl â¤ï¸

title: As part of my recovery regime I'm airing out, plus it helps prevent baths, which as I'm sure you know, baths are overrated, serve no purpose and in some cases cause medical issues. When you enter a room and someone immediately points out that you don't smell lovely, first off they are being rude, secondly you didn't spend enough time airing out, after a proper airing out you should smell like fresh linen and a hint of worm. Sniff the ground you roll on, take advantage of what Mother Nature has to offer, your smell is your identity, embrace who you are, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: We are all recovering nicely now, I was taken to the emergency Vet on Thursday night with a UT infection, we were up all night and once I was on my meds I started to improve. After a thorough investigation it was determined that the infection started because I had a bath, need I say more. My medical team are also recovering, when dad took me to the Vets he was in his pjs and slippers, thankfully no one around to notice.  The Warden wasn't able to vacuum, which was deemed an essential service, due to the traumatic event, she spent most of the day outside hovering over me. Dad learned a valuable lesson in how to give me my meds, wrap pill in a thinly sliced piece of ham and have a second piece dangling as an incentive for when you swallow the first piece. During any stressful situation it's important that you focus on what really matters, that's when you pull together and continue to hope someone reaches for the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to the one time I buried a moist gravy coated biscuit in the sheets, The Warden wasn't pleased, at least I think that's what she was babbling on about, all I heard was blah blah blah (in a sweet lilting voice). I dug up the bed cover until I got to the first layer of sheets, laid my biscuit down and covered it back up, apparently this left a gravy stain but once the bed was made up again nobody will ever notice. Life is made up of little stains, chew marks, lots of hair, some slobber and with a whole lotta luck it could lead to the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

There are those that love the sound of silence, the chirping of birds, the rustling of leaves, the soft gentle breeze blowing or perhaps the sweet barking sounds of Miss Lilly.  It's a personal choice, those quiet sounds aren't for everyone, if there was a survey paws down the vote would be to hear a little howling, it's stimulating, gets the blood flowing, causes some people to yell out hey hey. So sit back and ponder on what would put a smile on your face, the quiet sounds of nothing or Miss Lilly barking to get attention. Free yourself, live and let live, bark loud and proud, it may lead to the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Biscuit Burying 101. The first step is to get your biscuit past security, keep it hidden under your lip flap until you're outside. Next is choosing a location, it's helpful if the yard maintenance crew are in the garden and fluffing up the dirt with a rake, that makes the dirt easier to move around and less friction on the nose. It's not necessary to bury the biscuit too deep, try to keep the area as neat and tidy as possible, you don't want anyone making a big fuss about making a mess. If possible avoid all eye contact, once you've completed your mission just walk away, even if you hear some mumbling keep on moving. There are some things that you need to do because that's who you are, so bark loud and dig deep, Ancient Basset Saying.

BREAKING NEWS:  be on the lookout for a tiny basset, often referred to as a slip of a girl, last known location was in the urban jungle lurking behind the plants and digging in the garden. Use caution if approached and bend your knees slightly, has a tendency to jump up when excited, it's been reported by an unknown source (who has issues) that she's heavier than she looks. This suspect is known to slobber and could be suffering from a cheese deficiency, if found please offer cheese immediately, it the right thing to do. Be prepared to offer assistance in a time of need, be kind to each other and remember, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

I had a driveway social visit and according to all rules and regulations everyone stayed a least the length of a hockey stick apart, except me, I was deemed essential services, belly rubs help with social interaction and calms the nerves. As a hostess to the gathering I made sure everyone was greeted with a round of howling and naturally I jumped up on everyone, it's important to be inclusive so no one feels left out. As per instructions everyone brought their own chair and refreshments, it would've been nice to offer each guest individual cheese platters but The Warden doesn't snack outside, she has issues. Take the time to make others feel special, be the shining light at every gathering by accepting all belly rubs and scratches, Ancient Basset Saying.

Reinforcements had to be called in, I discovered a mouse in the window well and it was in the attack position whenever I got close to it. The Warden was all in a flap and called dad to handle the situation, on his way to the scene of the invasion she handed him a dustpan and broom (she did offer a bucket but he declined). After a bit of a chase dad managed to fling the mouse out onto the grass, I was barred from any contact and eventually the mouse scurried off. During this heroic moment of saving the family from rodents The Warden noticed the muddy dirt I was pawing at, unbelievable, she has issues.

An arrest warrant has been issued to The Warden and her accomplice (dad) for violating my bath agreement and ... and then ... they had the nerve to say I smelled lovely, I stunk to high heaven, there wasn't even a hint of worm. I believe it was peer pressure from seeing all the bath pictures posted on social media and after this indignity, you're not going to believe this, they took me to get my nails clipped, worst day ever. It was a traumatic and exhausting day, yes there was a lot of sweet talk and generous offerings but the smell will linger for days. All that is wrong can be made right again, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to the attack of the furminator, it was due, that gadget has been rubbing me the wrong way and therefore deserved a yank and drag while barking. In certain circumstances it's acceptable to bark outside, let's rephrase that, in most circumstances it's your right to bark, for example, if the spirit moves you, if you see anyone, there's a delivery truck, you get bored, you require attention or your cheese levels are low.  Whatever the reason go ahead and do what you gotta do, it's about doing the right thing at the right time and it may lead to the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

All was quiet, not a sound to be heard throughout the house, that was until I decided to do a yank and drag while barking, which apparently got a few people riled up.  It was quiet because dad was running a zoom math exam and he didn't have a backup contingency plan for barking, all due to a lack of planning. All of a sudden I heard the fridge door open and the crinkling of the cheese bag, second shelf on the left, The Warden had jumped into action and saved the day, dad could resume his zoom. There are times when you need to have a backup plan for the unexpected, not every moment is considered bark free, be prepared with a plan, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

If you find yourself under constant surveillance and sometimes have to witness someone in a state of panic whenever you are not in full view, here's a tip for you when exploring the urban jungle, keep the tip of your tail above the foliage, it helps keep the anxiety level down. There are lots of times when you just want to get away and explore without someone lurking in the shadows, a place you can kick up a little dirt without the constant hey heys, only to discover once you pop out there's reality staring right at you. It's important to have a little me time so you can express yourself without judgement, so dig deep and bark loud, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: There's a debate over who's the hero of this story so I'll let you decide.  I immediately saw an intruder in our house so I started barking (as one does) I was in the attack position, head down, pawing at the floor, it was a dangerous situation and caution was advised. That's when The Warden showed up and immediately pounced into action, she recognized the threat and squashed it with her index finger, it was a bug. In the retelling of this story the bug grew to be as long as my ear but if that were true the first responders would still be trying to talk her down off the dresser or we'd be moving. If my barking hadn't altered the family we'd be in a fine mess, be the hero of your own story, bark until you're heard and hopefully you'll be rewarded, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Another biscuit buried in the garden, fortunately this section isn't totally overgrown with plants, flowers and other stuff. I did find a little extra room to do some free style digging, it's part of my daily exercise routine which helps build ab definition, also a regular barking session provides an overall core workout. In between naps you must maintain a healthy lifestyle, that includes digging and barking, these activities are often overlooked as being essential and in some circles frowned upon. Surround yourself with supportive people and fur friends, let's hope that every time they make a move it's towards the second shelf on the left, bark loud and proud, Ancient Basset Saying.

Word of caution when walking under large leaf plants in the urban jungle especially in the morning, you may get wet. It's advisable to wait until after brunch if possible that way the foliage has time to dry out, otherwise you'll have to just shake it off. Now the good news is if you do get wet this can be considered as part of your yearly bath schedule, so looking ahead my next official bath is in the late spring of 2024. Yes I can hear the ongoing debates about a few droplets of water not counting as a bath but keep in mind I'm the one keeping track. Sometimes small inconveniences can work out in your favour especially if you're keeping track, Ancient Basset Saying.

I'm helping out with the lawn maintenance, The Warden has gathered up all the branches that were littered on the lawn from the seed violators and stacked them into a neat and tidy pile. This is where I come in and break them down into teeny tiny pieces, it may take a little extra time to gather up all the pieces when I'm done but she has her gardening tools (dustpan and broom) close by which will help the process. It's all about teamwork, helping paws may not lighten the load but it will enhance the time spent together, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to my early years when chewing on furniture legs wasn't a big deal unless someone saw you doing it, that's also when all the 'hey heys'  started. Today our furniture is considered vintage with distressed legs, in some circles it provides stimulating conversation and a bit of nervous laughter. I'm proud of my early work, I spent many hours chewing those legs and then getting chased around the house, good times had by all. Take pride in all your accomplishments, these are the chew marks that hold a family together, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: If you want to know where all the grass seed went, you can now stop looking at me after I just rolled on the grass, video surveillance has finally caught the seed eating offenders. Have I rolled on the grass, of course I have (who wouldn't) but the evidence shows that I squash the seeds into the dirt and little to no seeds end up on my back, the only thing that happens after I roll is there's a slight hint of worm, I smell lovely. The seed eating offenders are in my shade tree and each day The Warden checks the ground to make sure no one has fallen from the nest before she spreads my blanket. Stand up for your rolling rights, especially if there's a lovely smell, Ancient Basset Saying.

media.title: Urban jungle update, everything is growing like a weed especially these plants that I like to lay on, which by the way were not planted by our yard maintenance crew. These plants snuck under the fence and are starting to take over the garden, that's probably why nobody gets riled up when I walk all over them. The hostas on the other hand will soon provide me with full coverage and will become a safe haven from the surveillance cameras and from those who lurk in the shadows. In just a week the plants are as tall as me and there's plenty of room to manoeuvre underneath them when they are in full bloom. There are times when you need to escape into the great unknown and be able to bark without judgement, it's called the Urban Jungle, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: Most mornings I'm forced to get up before my time, which is usually mid morning, this morning was no different. From my queen size bed I could hear the rain pelting the house and the wind blowing, it was dark outside and all was quiet except for the sound of the treat bag being opened up, every morning The Warden sets out two treats for me to start the day, so I had to get up. While I'm eating my treats I could hear my fresh filtered water with ice being prepared, once I've had my drink I head into the front room, climb up on my lounger and go back to sleep (there were no warm seats to steal). Due to the early hour and rain I make the obvious decision to forgo an outside visit, I don't do wet and I'm exhausted after a long night of sleeping. Never pass up an opportunity, especially if you hear the crinkling of a bag, it just might lead to the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: There's been some unusual ground disturbances, large paw prints found in local gardens, possibly a cougar, wolf, maybe a bear, we're still waiting for the CSI lab reports, The Warden seems unusually calm as if she knows or has inside information. I'll wait for the results before I cast a stone, if there was a sizable animal lurking in our yard I'd know, there's only one person I know that has lurking tendencies, she shall remain nameless. Have I occasionally walked through the garden, maybe, am I a suspect, probably, am I worried, never. If there's any doubt admit nothing, if you stay silent you remain innocent, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: There was a slight incident, one I'm quite proud of, I noticed the backyard gate open when The Warden was struggling with a ladder, I inched closer then burst out to freedom at full speed, I did not look back but I heard a lot of muttering. I was hitting every yard, zigzagging all over, nose down and feeling the rush, until I heard a commotion. Looking over my shoulder I could see reinforcements had been called in, dad was running up the street in his slippers and pjs and yelling cheese cheese. I eventually made my way back home where I met up with dad who rewarded me with cheese. We expect The Warden to have a full recovery and hopefully be using full sentences in a few days, in lieu of flowers please send cheese.

title: I've been busy helping with the gardens, while actually it's more of a management position where I'm overseeing the yard maintenance crew (helps prevent laziness). Also my tethered line has been shortened (hooked up to the snowblower) and I can't quite reach the flowers, not sure if this was intentional or an oversight. I was still able to bark from a safe distance at anyone that came close to the yard or if I got bored or if I required a little extra attention. I'm dividing my time between laying on the driveway soaking up the sun and under the tree to cool off, busy day. It's okay to bark outside if you have a reason, you have barking rights to express yourself, Ancient Basset Saying.

media.title: Throwback to the early years when I first arrived to my new family, I was introduced to two brothers, my dad and someone called mom who stood off in the shadows, she was the one who wasn't sure about adding to the family. She was always watching, it was obvious she had issues, if I cried she was first on the scene, if I needed a lift she made sure I got it, I always had fresh filtered water with ice, lots to eat and extra blankets to drag around. I had a fairly large cage to sleep in but I was all alone and scared so I cried, that's when The Warden (mom) rescued me and I never slept alone again, this was the beginning of a wonderful life with my forever family. Sometimes you have to go outside your comfort zone to experience what true happiness is, Ancient Basset Saying.

After a thorough investigation by a local CSI team (party of one with issues) it was discovered (surveillance evidence) that I was dabbing my neck in bird droppings (poop), of course I did a full body roll earlier so most of the evidence was on my back. There are days where you just get lucky and this was one of them, I happened to be sniffing around, as one does, then suddenly I came upon this lovely smell (local bird found chirping in the tree) and I figured why not, so I indulged. When life gives you gifts from above you embrace it, no matter how many hey heys you hear, block out all the noise and just keep on rolling, Ancient Basset Saying.

Busy busy morning, buried two biscuits in a row, security left the door open so I was able to avoid getting frisked on my way out. When you're in the middle of a burial mission it's important to keep your focus and avoid all eye contact, not that it matters because it's all being captured on the surveillance cameras anyway. If the dirt is a little moist you may end up with evidence on your face and paws, not to worry just shake it off and pray that most of it falls off, if not you may have someone chasing after you with a wet cloth. If you used up your daily ration of biscuits to bury them then they should be replenished, it's the right thing to do, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: The urban jungle is coming along nicely, so far plenty of room to sniff and explore, as a word of caution, do not lay on these hosta plants because they have hard spikes growing out of the ground and will stick into you which is very uncomfortable, so I've been told, just a bit of news I picked up while sniffing. Also security has tightened up since the new plants are starting to grow, apparently laying on new growth is frowned upon by management, they brought their indoor issues outside. Restricting access to one's own personal domain should be outlawed, consideration should be given to year round occupants, Ancient Basset Saying.

media.title: Why do I require lots of naps throughout the day, it's because sleeping can be exhausting. Imagine a full night of stretching, rotating and dreaming about the endless pursuit of cheese, I'm surprised that I have the energy to get up from my queen size bed and make it to my day lounger. Even though I have a busy sleeping schedule I've still been able to maintain a vigorous exercise routine, that's why I have abs of steel which are located under the belly flaps. In order to maintain a healthy and active lifestyle it is highly recommended that you add cheese supplements to your daily diet (all my research supports these findings), Ancient Basset Saying.

We proudly announce that this year's feature garden accessory is the one and only little slip of a girl with long flowing gravy dippers, Miss Lilly, for added comfort she lounges on the new growth of plants. She is like a gentle breeze whispering through the garden, her delicate paws barely brushing against the freshly turned over earth where she was previously digging. These gardens are specially designed to withstand whatever Mother Nature can throw our way or even the slightest disturbance of a tiny basset. When planning your outdoor gardens it's important to make them accessible and at costs avoid using little ugly fences, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: One word of caution, when laying on a freshly seeded lawn be sure to shake off any of the grass seed that accidentally stuck to your tiny frame. The lawn maintenance crew gets a little riled up if you move their seeds around and don't even try digging up their precious dirt that's when the 'hey heys' start up, it's embarrassing. After a sunning session I went over to The Warden to check up on her, she's needy, she started rubbing me down, I wasn't sure if she was checking for grass seed or if she was calming her nerves. For those of you who are a little out of balance these days and need to calm your nerves there's one quick easy solution, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

media.title: Throwback to when it was a little colder because it still feels like winter in the middle of May. The Warden needs warmer weather in order to reduce my alleged barking, her theory is I get bored when I'm not soaking up the sun and start barking for attention, you know, I know, we all know it's because my cheese levels are low. Do I require lots of undivided attention when bored, maybe, but could it be that someone else is trying to grab the spotlight and encourages me to bark excessively or another theory is someone is negligent in giving me my daily dose of medicinal cheese. Before you start looking at others to blame for your out of balance issues, maybe you should look at yourself and do the right thing, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: A dream come true, fresh dirt is being spread all over the yard, the possibilities are endless, laying on it, digging, burying and my personal favourite worm rolling. Above all else try to be helpful during the process, I expressed encouragement by barking at The Warden, which got her riled up and made her work faster. There were threats about going back inside if I didn't stop barking but she knew and I knew that wasn't going to happen until the job was done. Please take note that barking is a sign of a cheese deficiency and a lack of attention, immediately stop what you're doing and take care of this medical emergency, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: I woke up like this with someone staring at me and whispering sweet nothings, what they really wanted was for me to get up so they could make the bed. I wasn't quite ready which meant I wasn't moving any time soon, would I respond to a back scratch, a belly rub and an ear caress, yes you're getting my attention. During this negotiation I can see your eyes scanning the bed sheets looking at the scattered hairs and slobber marks, your lack of focus is noted and shows you still need therapy. If you want immediate results there's one sure way to get it, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Did I happen to mention that the last few days have been cold, but there is one good piece of news, with the snow covering the grass it hides the pee stains which The Warden has been concerned about, trying to find the bright side of snowy situation. I've put my worm rolling on hold until the warmer weather which is hopefully around the corner, after the snow comes the rain and before you know it I'll be soaking up the sun in the driveway, these are my goals and aspirations. Even though the weather isn't cooperating you can still keep things exciting on the inside, there's the yank and drag while barking, thinking of different ways to get a treat, catch up on your naps and of course let's not forget keeping an eye on The Warden. With every step she takes you can only hope it leads to the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Happy Mother's Day to all the moms who try their best each day to make the world a better place for those they love. Now for The Warden I try to give her a purpose to make her feel valued, she cleans and chases after a few stray hairs, wipes up muddy footprints and slobber, constantly fixes my lounger with hospital corners after a yank and drag while barking, without all this she'd feel lost or locked up somewhere wearing an ankle bracelet. Today is about giving back and showing your appreciation, offer your ear for her to caress (calms the nerves) and make her smile as you stare into her eyes as she reaches into the fridge, second shelf on the left.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: Now I can only assume that this load of dirt has been dropped off for my own personal use, it does use up a portion of the driveway but I can work with this. The Warden has been busy sweeping around the edges trying to make it look neat, at times like this it's best not to make eye contact, have I mentioned that she has issues.  Apparently this dirt will get spread over the grass and gardens which will make it easier to roll on, also it'll be spread over the pee areas and sprinkled with grass seed, not to worry, one good shake and the dirt and grass seed will fall right off. With it being worm rolling season you now can get the added bonus of extra dirt and grass seed to roll on, you'll smell lovely, everyone from all over will want to sniff you, it's the price of being popular.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: I've been busy watching the yard crew do yard stuff, there's been a lot of special attention given to raking the pee areas, which only enhances the smell from the dirt which encourages more pee, catch 22 scenario. Also a little raking in the garden, two biscuits were discovered which were bagged and tagged, apparently they were covered in dirt because they were buried, catch 22 once again. While you're helping out with chores it's important to stick close to the help, for moral support, they need your encouragement and someone to scratch and rub while bending over to weed, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: Throwback to when dad was doing a zoom math class, my eyes went beyond glazing over. If you want to keep everyone's attention you gotta jazz it up, use more visuals or props, if you say words like squared or cubed why not show a piece of cheese that's been cut up according to the formula. Think outside the box, grab their attention, use incentives, this usually works for me, every time you eat something who's looking you directly in the eye waiting for the next bite, you have my full attention. Your goal should be to inspire, motivate and above all else achieve, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

media.title: When doing an investigation into something new, different or out of place, take your time, do not rush into the path of danger, always sniff forward, if something moves be ready to retreat and above all else know where your security detail is located in case of an attack. Once I made contact and neutralized the threat, I could hear the cheap seats saying 'oh for heaven sakes', you can't expect me to run up to something unknown, I need a little time to assess the threat level. After such a harrowing event you need to take a some time to calm your nerves, the best medicine is located on the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

While preparing for a yank and drag while barking I discovered that my gravy coated biscuit got stuck to the blanket which forced me to have a change in plans. There are times when I do advanced planning and set a moist biscuit on the blanket because I'm waiting for the audience to settle down in their seats to have a quiet moment, that's the perfect time to perform, I have their full attention, the stage is all set only to discover that my biscuit is now stuck to the blanket which unfortunately changes everything. Even though things don't work out according to plan you learn to adapt, this doesn't mean you can't bark for attention, the show must go on, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: It's officially National Airing Out season, go grab your sun spot and enjoy the gentle breeze wash over your body, don't forget to rotate. By doing this it helps eliminate all baths, you'll start to smell like fresh linen and who doesn't love smelling that. The nice weather also encourages you to roll around on the grass so besides smelling like fresh linen there may also be a hint of worm, an added bonus but it's an acquired smell and not be suitable for everyone. You may notice people leaning in to get a whiff of your natural outdoor fragrance, embrace the moment, if they can smell you from a social distance then you know you're doing something right. It's important to do what you can to avoid all baths and airing out is highly recommended, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: I'd like to address those people who have issues about being watched while you eat, you gotta lighten up. When you eat it's an open invitation, be prepared to be stared at, will I inch in with every bite, of course who wouldn't, yes there's gonna be some whining if it's not a bite for bite exchange and let's not forget lots of drool and slobber, can't be helped it's bound to happen. There are some who will resort to sneaking snacks (you know who you are) or will only eat while you're napping and the worst offenders of all will avoid eating anything in your presence (unforgivable). There's an old saying, sharing is caring, take that step and deal with your issues, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

When eating your gravy coated biscuit at a remote location it's important to make sure you cleanup all the scattered crumbs, if a few fall on the floor not to worry, the staff are standing close by ready to be useful (it helps build self esteem). As for any slobber remnants, ignore, it blends in and no one will ever know, don't sweat the small stuff. Is eating food on the furniture allowed, no it's not, that was a rule established since the beginning of time, it's an ancient rule that didn't age well. You do what you do because you can and sometimes you even get rewarded, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Why do I bark, lots of reasons, all good ones, first off I love to hear The Warden say hey hey, which means I'm getting the attention I deserve. There's also the pile of dead leaves in the window well (on the list for the cleanup crew), there's a hint of rabbit in the air which is a barkable moment and finally barking is considered an outdoor activity because there are restrictions inside (limited restrictions) so I'm bringing it outside. Who doesn't love to hear a little barking, it's like music to your ears floating in the breeze, people look up and say oh that's just Miss Lilly giving The Warden some attention. Embrace what comes naturally and if you're really lucky it comes with benefits, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to every time I steal a chair, it's a badge of honour which I wear proudly, it's all about the eye twitching and of course the dramatic huffing and puffing. The best chair stolen is when someone stands up, they take a couple of steps, I'm quietly inching forward and before they have time to reserve their spot with a book I've pounced and landed in the warm seat, it's a cheese worthy moment. Once I'm firmly planted I'm not moving except for maybe two things, the first is a crane and secondly the opening of the fridge door, second shelf on the left. Take pride in all your accomplishments even if they don't come with rewards because when they do it's that much sweeter, Ancient Basset Saying.

Always use caution when entering the great unknown or in this case into the familiar backyard known as your turf (aka barren wasteland). Be sure to sniff for predators lurking in the shadows, you can eliminate The Warden because she's a known criminal who has a history of lurking, in some circles it's called stalking but the charges were dropped. With a little breeze I can detect a rabbit, light in colour about 18 months, a black squirrel with a skittish disorder and several birds with unknown heritage, all local varmints. Take your time, no need to rush, unless of course you see movement in the kitchen, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Maintaining your fitness level during isolation should remain a top priority, along with keeping your cheese levels up (goes without saying). Even while napping or sleeping you can still get a full body workout, that's why it important to receive a snack when you wake up, those abs don't ripple by themselves. Having numerous naps per day keeps the lifestyle critics away, someone somewhere is always ready to judge you on your fluffiness, not that I care, it's about doing the right thing, getting lots of naps, barking for attention and most of all your pursuit of cheese (in order to prevent a cheese deficiency). Don't let others define you, you do you, make your own choices, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

It's officially worm rolling season, it's my favourite time of the year, bend your knees, shoulder down, lean in with your neck and start rolling. Make sure your legs are wiggling in the air and you're rotating back and forth, finally you jump back up, shake off the dead grass and hopefully there will be a hint of worm wafting from you for the pleasure of those close by. If you get lucky worms will be crawling out of the ground after the rain and laying spread out on the sidewalk or the driveway, it's a visual delight, of course you might get a few hey heys or the yank but it's well worth it. Don't be deterred by a few naysayers, lean in and savour the moment, Ancient Basset Saying.

Busy time of the year, this is the third biscuit I've buried today. The plants are starting to sprout up so there's a little competition for space, the only thing I'm worried about is the little ugly fences and of course the constant surveillance cameras. Full disclosure, I have never disturbed, misplaced or dug up any plants, if you don't count that one time where I accidentally moved a couple of freshly planted flowers, it was the newly turned over dirt that was hard to resist. Now that I think about it, since that one incident there has never been another flower planted in the backyard garden, wonder why, just as well, it gives me more room to bury my biscuits.
