When planning your garden be sure to leave room for the unexpected and the expected, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: There might be good news on the horizon, dad was asking about muffins, wondering if The Warden was thinking of making some soon. If she was he will only have a couple and the others will have to go into isolation, never to be seen again. This is good news for me, it'll be like old times, dad and I sharing snacks, it's like when the bathroom door is open just a smidge and then I burst in, that's how snacking starts, just a little tidbit, tastes sooo good, maybe just one more bite. It's never a good idea when there's a no snacking rule, it's not just about you, think of those who share your snacks, we are a team, open the fridge, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: It's been several days now without any garnish on my meals and I'm in a weakened state, probably the early stages of a cheese deficiency. My brother was deeply concerned and requested a Zoom session to see how I was doing and was surprised from all reports that I was still able to do the yank and drag while barking.  The Warden assured him I was still getting all my meals, treats and a morsel of cheese in the evening and have only eliminated the garnish. There was a brief discussion about my winter weight (blah blah blah) and The Warden said with the warmer weather we'll be getting outside more and the extra barking and sniffing will help.  It's important to have others check up on your wellbeing and ensure the fridge is well stocked, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to the other day while out on our walk we noticed a lady frantically patting herself down, she forgot to bring a pickup deposit bag. From a safe distance dad quickly seized the moment and asked if he could offer assistance and provide her with an extra bag, she was grateful and excepted the help, that's when dad tossed a roll of bags and hit her in the forehead. Hard to tell if it was the toss or the catch that failed but no injuries were reported and dad came out as a hero. To avoid being in a similar situation always be prepared, carry extra rolls of deposit bags, be sure to have several opened up and ready to use in order to avoid licking your fingers in polite society while trying to open the bag, Ancient Basset Saying.

This is the reason why having more than one blanket on your lounger is essential, how else can you properly bury your biscuit. There was a time when I only had one blanket (these were dark days), someone was decluttering and determined that I didn't need 5 blankets, I went public with this outrageous decision and we came to an agreement that I could have a minimum of 3 blankets. Don't except less than what is rightfully yours, take it to the streets and bark loud and proud, hopefully those who have issues will see that they made a mistake and will right the wrong. Making amends is the right thing to do also going to the fridge, second shelf on the left, makes everything better, Ancient Basset Saying.

Not everything goes according to plan, I was planning on a yank and drag while barking but the hospital corners wouldn't budge. I placed my gravy coated biscuit on the blanket and during the yank it somehow got lost under the lounger but when all else fails you just keep on trying. I eventually rescued my biscuit but the cheap seats didn't get the pleasure of my barking, they were looking rather smug that their hospital corners remained intact during the yank. After a snack and nap I'll try another round of the yank and drag while barking, this time I'll approach the lounger from different angle, with any luck I'll get to bark this time and maybe get a few hey heys.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: After The Warden provided me with a lift service I've been noticing a few changes, which is very troubling and may be considered a chargeable offence.  For my breakfast and dinner I was receiving a garnish of chicken, ham or cheese, evenly spread over my food, lately there's been no garnish, just a lump of food. Now in protest I should've glanced at the bowl,  snubbed it and walked away but I was starving and before I realized my options I had eaten everything. I'm preparing to send a clear message about the change in menu options and as soon as I can regain my full strength I'll continue with my protest, I'm feeling a little weak from a lack of garnish.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: Apparently I'm being told that social distancing applies when someone is in the bathroom, now this has gone too far. I was trailing along behind The Warden as one does, sometimes bumping into her as she stops or is too slow and then she enters the bathroom and closes the door, it's the worst sound ever to hear that little click as the door closes. I try whining and when that doesn't get any results I try scratching the door, that's when I get a couple of hey heys, it's a somewhat comforting sound knowing you're not alone but I'm left with no choice but to bark, that's when I hear 'oh for heaven sakes' and the door opens. Finally we are reunited, it's a joyous happy moment when the door opens up and I'm reassured that we'll be together again once more. It's important to reassure your loved ones that you are never really far away, just close enough to reach the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

It's that time of year where the yard maintenance crew are exposed for their lack of care over the winter months, now others may argue that the dry grass areas indicate pee sites, the colder the weather the closer to the house one pees, that's one theory. When I sniff the area I don't feel threatened, it's comforting to know this is my turf, it might be a little off colour but it's all mine. Now there's someone (no names but she has issues) that is bothered by this and is putting together a yard maintenance plan when the weather allows (now she follows the rules, go figure). Everyone has their little bit of quirkinesses (some more than others) but that's what gives us the spice of life, as long as they know where there's cheese we'll all get along, Ancient Basset Saying.

Every once in awhile when the staff are fussing around I'll grab a gravy coated biscuit and request the lift service up on the bed, it happened but there was some excessive grunting and groaning during the lift. This is not good sign, over the winter I might've become a little extra fluffy or The Warden is in a weakened state, both are a cause for concern. If I've gained a few, as we all do over the winter months, that could lead someone to re-examine my daily intake, which is never a good thing. Now if The Warden is in a weakened state it could affect my daily intake, she needs energy to react every time I bark, can she reach the second shelf on the left, yes this is a cause for concern. Make sure you stay strong, healthy and safe during lockdown, the family depends on you and your ability to reach the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to the urban jungle to remind us that spring is on its way, just around the corner, any day now, maybe a few more snow flurries but after that it'll be here. I need to get out in the front yard and start barking at the neighbours, I'm feeling the need to roll on worms and stretch out on the driveway with the sun beating down on me. I'm also sensing it's time to get outside and air out to get that fresh linen smell, it's a preventative measure to help ward off any bath thoughts from evil bystanders. Am I worried about a bath, not really, it's not officially bath season but when you live with people who don't follow the rules, it's like living on the edge, there's a creeping uncertainty, I need cheese to calm my nerves.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: While doing a site patrol I happened to notice my blue lounger blanket in the laundry basket, well what was I to do other than rescue it, so I yanked it out which led to a yank and drag while barking which alerted the barking police. First of all the blanket didn't need to be cleaned, it smelled lovely, only a portion of it was covered in hair and there were a few scattered biscuit crumbs, it was weeks away from needing a wash. I hereby declare that all blankets or coverings be exempt from being washed during the isolation period. Blankets are a source of comfort and it helps if you can locate it (by smell) during any blackout. Please plan responsibly, stay home, stay safe and keep your cheese levels up, Ancient Basset Saying.

I was given a chewy as a distraction to be used to prevent barking during the witching hour, The Warden is convinced she has the power to change what nature has given. She smugly looked on believing she solved the barking issue and has now created a new path forward, there was peace and harmony at least until the final chew. I slowly got up off the lounger, did a few leg stretches and headed over to the mat by the door, I was suddenly overcome with this incredible urge to bark, I was a few minutes off my regular schedule but I'll make up for any time lost by barking louder and prouder. It's important to recognize and understand your true calling, this is who you are, be true to yourself, can change happen, yes, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: I got in a bit of trouble for fraying someone's nerves but in my own defence she has a long history of having issues. It all started around the witching hour, it's that time when I get this overwhelming need to bark at absolutely nothing, it's like I'm in a trance, my head is down and I paw at the floor, I really don't know because I'm overtaken by the barking spirit. Finally the evil naysayer rises up from her comfy couch, approaches me with a look that can cower most people, except me, I keep barking until she uses that voice where I know I've crossed her sanity line. I stop barking, peace and harmony is restored, someone feels shame and regret, not me because I was in a trance. Everything wrong can be made right again, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: Today we raise our gravy dippers and wish everyone a safe and Happy Easter. According to all sources it's been deemed that the Easter Bunny is an essential worker and will provide the long awaited for cheese basket. I'm hopeful to drag my gravy dippers across a large dinner plate covered with roast simmering in gravy and not have someone chasing after me with a wet cloth to wipe me down. I can take care of my own cleanup, there's the carpet or couch I can run my head along and if there's any leftovers it'll be a nice snack later when the gravy gets crusty. Today we are grateful for the time we spend together even if it's by phone or computer, stay home and stay safe, this message brought to you by Miss Lilly and The Warden.

Rarely captured on film is the true grace of athleticism featured by the one and only Miss Lilly, at the top of this mountain (stairs) is what made all her barking worthwhile, cheese. Notice how each step is carefully calculated, the eyes remain focused on the prize, the muscles working at full capacity and all this after a full round of barking, this is what being an athlete is all about. If you want something you have to work hard for it, don't back down after a few hey heys, go for the Gold, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Every day (almost) I get up from my nap, go downstairs and start barking, why you ask, some say it's for attention but the latest research shows it's due to a cheese deficiency, who are you going to believe, someone from the cheap seats or a scientific proven study. When your cheese levels are low you start acting out, it's a cry for help or a bark for cheese, the simple solution is to go to the fridge, second shelf on the left, and peace will be restored, the prolonged solution is to allow the barking to continue which creates frayed nerves and eye twitching until they finally cave and go to the fridge. It's your choice, it's either peace and harmony or some extra medicinal evening juices.

Throwback to the day I yanked The Wardens housecoat out of the wine cellar and broke the whole shelving system, it was a memorable yank. I nearly got hit by an antique iron (hasn't been used in years) as it fell of the shelf, this brought the troops running, not sure if it was out of concern for me or the wine. After this event the door is to be closed at all times, several reminders have been issued to dad and all dangling housecoats have been relocated to a secure unnamed location. While the closet was under repair I was allowed to use the housecoat for a yank and drag while barking, funny thing though I haven't seen it for a couple of years, I'm putting in a formal request to release the housecoat from captivity, it's time.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: The Warden came to my defense when two neighbours thought I had gained weight over the winter, of course this is not true, I'm just fluffy, especially during the winter season. The Warden explained that my new collar was loose fitting to allow my neck folds to drape naturally and that the bright yellow colour gives a visual perception of depth which makes one think there's more of me, she didn't stop there, also with shorter legs there's the illusion of a fuller girth and chest area. Not to mention that my abs were in the relaxed mode, she had a lot more to say but their eyes were starting to glaze over and they had to get going.

Had to make a few adjustments to my lounger, don't settle for something if it's not up to your standards, all it takes is a little yank here and a little yank there.  Maybe the next time I'll want the lounger to be tucked in with hospital corners, maybe not, depends on the moment, if I'm not getting enough attention I'll start yanking a blanket off or maybe all three blankets, all depends if the cheap seats are watching. Another reason why I do what I do, you guessed it, I'm suffering from a cheese deficiency, do the right thing, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Having vivid dreams is a form of exercise, at times it can be quite strenuous which leads to longer naps, it enhances your overall core and defines your abs. A word of caution though it can lead to a cheese deficiency, the more you dream the lower your cheese levels go, therefore it's advisable to top up after every nap, safety first.  If for some reason, god forbid, you ever run out of cheese a great substitute is a small roast simmering in gravy, taken within at least 30 minutes after you get up and definitely before you do a yank and drag while barking. Do not, I repeat, do not ever run short of cheese, immediately go to your fridge and do an inventory, there should be at least a 6 month supply. It's reassuring and comforting to constantly open the fridge door and look at the second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Biscuit burying season is in full swing so grab your biscuit, head outside and let the dirt fly. Totally ignore all lurkers, they have too much time on their hands and have a tendency to be judgemental. Speaking of The Warden, she had a foreign substance stuck in the tread of her shoe, talk about making a fuss, she refused to smell it, I volunteered but wasn't granted the privilege, so she laid out paper towel, extracted the substance and threw it out without knowing what it was. If you need to identify a brown dirt covered substance I'm your gal, after a few sniffs I'll be able to tell you the date, the who and what they had for dinner. If you need a sniff identification don't mess around with amateurs, send in the experts, we are at your service, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: During lockdown some great discoveries have been made, of course I have first hand knowledge because I shadow The Warden in between my naps. It's no mystery how the bed gets made or the tossed clothes on the floor get picked up or the tin goods in the pantry are all aligned according to expiry date with labels facing out or how the towels are all hanging at the appropriate height, you'd be surprised what I see while bumping into the legs of someone. Do not ask why you need to vacuum everyday, you'll get the death stare that'll give you nightmares that will haunt you. Sometimes it's best to be thankful and appreciative for the little things that often go unnoticed, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

Setting the tone for the day, of course this all starts around mid morning closer to brunch. When I first get up in the wee hours of the morning I'll go outside briefly, then have a snack and a drink of fresh filtered water with ice, after that gruelling routine I'll settle in for my morning nap. After several hours of napping I'll wake up to a prepared breakfast, that's also when the staff starts fussing around, they'll remake my lounger with hospital corners and clean up the drool marks on the floor, busy busy day. Depending on what they're doing I'll follow them around closely sometimes bumping into them (if they stop suddenly), it's a method used as a reminder that I'm close by and require lots of attention and the occasional treat. When you get that close encounter feeling go to the fridge, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

What we need is a feel good story so this is my throwback to when the back scratcher was tested on me, it feels good!  Of course there was a period of adjustment to first get acquainted with the foreign object, yes that required some sniffing and a whole lotta barking. Once I decided it was non threatening I allowed the staff to gently rake over my tiny frame, now let's be clear I wasn't about to be lulled into thinking that at any moment this could turn ugly and attack so I was alert and ready to pounce. There are times when you have to let your guard down if it means letting others get comfort from giving you comfort, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: We are doomed, dad issued a cease and desist order effective immediately to The Warden, no more baked goods. His workouts versus his muffin intake is out of wack, he did a calculation and the numbers were way off. He was expecting some resistance and had prepared an impact statement but The Warden just said okay no problem, he didn't even have to threaten the removal of the muffin tins. There's to be no hiding any goodies within the house, he will hunt them down, this threat was issued even though there was no resistance. If there was ever a time for cheese this was it, with the reduction of muffins we need to increase the cheese levels to flatten the curve, Ancient Basset Saying.

Biscuit Dance Tuesday brought to you by Miss Lilly, The Warden wanted to issue a disclaimer that this video may cause eye twitching, not suitable for all viewers especially those with issues. Before you do the biscuit dance it's best if you can prepare the dance floor in advance by yanking your blankets off the lounger, once that's done go grab a biscuit, spit it out and start spinning it around the floor.  If the biscuit slides off the blanket just ignore it, keep on barking, feel the energy from the audience, you should have the cheap seats all riled up calling out for more and yelling hey hey. Performing for a fickle crowd can be exhausting but don't give up till you hear the word cheese, that's when all peace and harmony is restored, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: Constantly being watched doesn't bother me, at least it's one way to keep track of where everyone is at all times. Even when I'm outside all by myself I get this feeling that there's a lurker watching over me, I see shadows in the windows bobbing from room to room. Is this weird behaviour, maybe, but when you live with someone who has insecurities it starts to become normal. Even when I'm outside having a private moment I know there is someone looking over their surveillance map marking down the next pickup location. When I decide to come back inside there's always someone to greet me at the door, perfect timing, is this a consequence, I think not.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: ð¶Every move you make every snack you take I'll be watching youð¶ Even though you are living in isolation it's important to keep track of where everyone is at all times, it's for safety reasons, it shows you care and above all else you can monitor shifty shady characters who have tendencies to sneak snacks. I'm advocating that everyone maintains a similar daily schedule, I'm suspecting that there's unauthorized movement during my naps. What if everyone wore an alarm device that could detect movement, similar to The Wardens ankle bracelet, even during captivity it's important to maintain your entrepreneurial creativity.

Dad was getting concerned when he saw my nose running but The Warden assured him it was just drool, every day she cleans up little puddles of drool on the floor beside the chair. It seems that every time anyone coughs, sneezes or clears their throat it's a cause for concern, you start doing a checklist to see if you're alright, all this just reinforces the need to stay inside and isolate. It'll make you feel better if you spend more time throughout the day giving extra belly rubs and scratches. If you find yourself feeling anxious it could be a sign of a cheese deficiency, offer more cheese and don't wait for others to have to beg, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: Burying a biscuit in the spring comes with consequences, don't blame me for something that is beyond my control, here's what happened. After The Warden finishes her morning cleaning ritual she gets ready to go outside to do a daily deposit pickup, I immediately grab a biscuit and follow her out. I head directly to the garden and start digging a hole to drop my biscuit in, then I cover it up and tamp it down, as one does, it's a process. This is where it turns ugly, after we get back inside, The Warden starts looking around, then she starts chanting for someone to give her strength and proceeds to cleans the floor again, did I happen to mention that she has issues. There are times when you need to take a deep breath and go directly to the fridge, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

media.title: Throwback to the time when my brother came home and I did a crash and bang to get him up in the morning, I would slip past security, go downstairs, gently and quietly open the door, then jump up on his bed, the good ole days. What really woke him up was The Warden trying to convince me not to go downstairs, she said I sounded like a herd of elephants, isn't she fun to have around. There was only one thing that could keep me from seeing my brother, it's located in the fridge, second shelf on the left. Don't hesitate to offer cheese, it helps prevent a cheese deficiency, it calms the nerves and lifts your spirits, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: During incarceration or isolation it's important that the kitchen staff remember to provide comfort food, it helps calm the nerves and reduces barking sessions. It starts out with  kitchen noises, then the smell wafting through the house, in about 20 minutes dad starts sniffing and heads to the kitchen, that's about the time I make my move to wherever dad is, it's about spending quality time together. Another tip during lockdown is to ensure your cheese levels are maintained, do not hesitate to bark if you start to feel depleted, Ancient Basset Saying.

media.title: A risk assessment was done and it was determined that we needed to stock up on essentials, that meant my gravy coated biscuits plus a few food items. The Warden decided to make this trip following all the safety measures, going at off peak times, wearing protective gloves, staying a safe distance from others and getting only essentials. Of course I got a special chewy and four extra boxes of biscuits, there were more boxes available but only took enough for spring biscuit burying requirements, didn't want to be labeled a hoarder. Make the time you have together special, so stock up on essentials, chewies and cheese, comfort food such as roast simmering in gravy and of course gravy coated biscuits, Ancient Basset Saying.

There are times when shared spaces become complicated, I usually start out on the couch curled up at one end in a tight little ball but as you know eventually you'll need to stretch and rotate. This is a great time to relax your muscles, they can't always be tight, toned and in a six pack formation, let them hang loose and relaxed. Now remember, you are only responsible for you, if you happen to have a snooze and start a little shimmy action and that leaves someone teetering on the edge, that's on them. If you are sharing space do it with someone who will sacrifice a little more room for you and have experience in teetering on the edge, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: Keep your friends close and your gravy coated biscuits closer, Ancient Basset Saying. When I carry my biscuits around and they become moist with slobber do I care, not really, when they leave gravy stains on the furniture is it a concern, naw, if my moist biscuit sticks to my blanket do I get riled up, can't say I do, would it bother me if we had a shortage of gravy coated biscuits, damn right it would bother me, it would become a national emergency and I will not except fake substitutes. The staff are monitoring the supply situation closely and within the next week dad will assign to make a trip out into the great unknown, he also has a list of essential food items but my biscuits are at the top of the list.

media.title: Well, it happened again, someone's nerves were frayed, here's what went down. It was later in the evening, I found my squeaky ball, somehow it ended up under the couch 'accidentally' and I started barking (as one does), I barked until eventually The Warden showed up, her voice was elevated and said 'that's enough' in a harsh tone. Trust me, I got the message and quickly got up on the couch with dad, neither one of us made eye contact. The Warden went back to her cave, under her weighted blanket, not to be heard of again. Dad and I shared some medicinal cheese before we called it a night. Going through an uncomfortable event can lead to a cheese deficiency, go to your cheese provider immediately, it's important for your overall wellbeing, Ancient Basset Saying.

Nothing to see here, move along, biscuit burying is a private matter and your map highlighting my sites is not necessary or appreciated. Every day in the last week I've buried at least two biscuits per day in the garden and retrieved three which I brought back inside, there was a bit of a fuss. Apparently the staff gets a little edgy when you bring in a biscuit covered in dirt and then do a yank and drag while barking. It costs nothing so just sit back and enjoy the free entertainment, don't worry about a little dirt scattered all over, plenty of time to do some stress cleaning while I'm napping.

Throwback to a few days ago when an unnamed source (dad) stated loudly that someone (me) needed a bath, now this is where the conflict begins, my next official bath is technically scheduled in the summer of 2023. Bath season begins June 1st and ends September 15th, with the exception of rainy days or slight cloud cover, preferably with full sun exposure between the hours of 1-2 pm, must provide adequate rolling opportunities outside in the grass immediately following bath. In order to bridge this gap in the schedule The Warden sprayed a soft cloth with a special scented spray and gently rubbed me down all over with special attention given to the neck folds. As a side note, I live in a household with people who have issues, I smell lovely, just ask those that sniff me.

Almost every day at almost the same time I go to the bottom of the stairs, start fake digging up the carpet, add in a few barks, wait for someone to say 'what's she doing', then once I've gotten everyone's attention I take the long trek back up the stairs. You may ask why, I say why not, is it because I lack attention or could it be because my cheese levels are low, in either case there is a remedy, lather me with scratches and rubs while repeatedly saying what a good girl I am and above all else go to the fridge, second shelf on the left and get me some cheese. If you're encountering some behaviour that appears to be let's say a little strange, there's a solution, second shelf on the left, Ancient Basset Saying.

There are many ways to practice social distancing, one effective way is to not make eye contact, it sends a strong message, especially to those who are always up in your business. If you are in lockdown and in a safe environment you will need to once again establish contact with your treat providers, this can be quickly accomplished by barking, it usually gets results, you do what works. Out on our walks we've noticed other forms of distancing, reaching for their phone, taking a wide berth to avoid contact, keeping their head down and shoulders hunched. At home in lockdown it's alright to stick close and shadow their every move, it's also important to keep calm and serve cheese, Ancient Basset Saying.

There's a hint of wildlife in the air, birds chirping, rabbits hopping and worms popping up, so lets all get ready to roll. It's time to activate the sniffer, bury your biscuits and bark until you hear the constant hey heys. So far I've buried several biscuits in the garden, this time of year the security guard at the door isn't frisking me on the way out and didn't do a check under the lip flap. The best burial sites are close to the fence line or along side the house, I don't worry about using up my ration of biscuits because they will get replenished throughout the day, it must be the biscuit fairy. It's still cold outside, just above freezing, but the snow mountains are disappearing and the dry grass is perfect for rolling.

Mixing things up, keeping it fresh, taking my yank and drag while barking to a whole new level. The Warden tossed two pieces of a muffin on my blanket, freshly made oatmeal muffin, which I would normally eat but I got the calling to do a yank and drag. It was a coordinated effort to keep both pieces on the blanket at once until one good yank took a turn and a piece fell off. Looking back maybe I should've used only one blanket instead of two, what if the muffin pieces were placed closer together, did I bark enough, maybe the hey heys distracted me. Forget about regrets, seize the moment, bark loud and proud, never say would've, could've, should've and eat more cheese, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: We are now in lockdown (self isolating) or in the language of The Warden, we are under house arrest (without the ankle bracelet). Dad has been assigned as the chosen one to venture out for supplies when needed under strict rules of social distancing, he will undergo intense interrogation upon returning, then follow a decontamination procedure. We are currently stocked with the necessities, aged cheese, treats, medicinal evening juices, roast simmering in gravy and fresh filtered water with ice. All visitors will still be barked at but will be screened before entering, once they've entered I can then jump up on them. This is all about the safety of our future, for ourselves and for those we come in contact with, please stay safe my friends.

Your grass doesn't have to be green in order to roll on it, actually dead grass has a long lasting aroma which lasts just as long as a fresh worm roll, it's a personal choice. We are starting to get lots of rain and the snow is disappearing so the worms will be popping up from the ground soon, the birds and I will be competing to be the first to get the worms. When the family is home and self isolating it's important to give them a purpose, that's where I come in, you can never get enough attention. It's important for the family to know where you are at all times, if they can't see you then at least let them be able to smell you, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to a number of years ago there was this nice neighbour lady who spotted me out in the front yard, she asked The Warden if she could take me for a walk, after checking her references and doing a background check final approval was granted. The lady got all dressed up in her walking gear planning for a marathon event, so we headed out at a good pace until we hit the corner, had to stop for a prolonged sniff, eventually we inched along, there was no tugging or yanking on the leash so I got a lot of sniffing done. Once we turned onto another street I decided it was time to go back home so I took control and charged back home. When we got back the lady was trying to explain what happened on our short walk, of course The Warden already knew, she explained that when walking a Basset it's not a marathon it's a journey with a lot of gentle coaxing.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: Be prepared, that's the rule of order in our house (now), there was an incident. I went for my daily sniff and walk with dad, nothing out of the ordinary until I did my daily deposit, dad went to get the deposit bag and came up empty. Here we were a few blocks from home, dad looking all around, me just sniffing, when all of a sudden we had to rush back home, grab some deposit bags and return to the scene of the crime before he got arrested by the scoop your poop police on the charge of bend and pretend. Unlike The Warden who has a whole routine of preparedness, minimum of three bags, each one opened and tested, then inserted into the left hand pocket, you never want to get caught licking your fingers to open a poop bag in polite society. If you really want to be prepared consider having a supply of two kinds of bags, one for the daily deposit and the other for the good girl cheese, Ancient Basset Saying.

It was a great day yesterday, the weather was a high of 12 and I stayed outside in the front yard for over three hours, I barked at four people including The Warden. The driveway was warm, perfect for sunning, it was also clean because The Warden came out of hibernation and swept the driveway. The car also got a good cleaning, apparently there were footprints all over the car seats and slobber marks on the windows, I believe dad was the last one in the car, just saying. After spending all that time outside The Warden thought that I would smell like fresh linen, instead she thought the smell was more like a hint of worm.

title: Motivational Monday, I'm becoming inspired by the warmer weather, the snow mountains are slowly disappearing and you can feel the sun heating up the ground (briefly). I'm  hoping today I can stretch out in the driveway and soak up a little sun, you just gotta believe. Of course this means The Warden will be tinkering around, she is coming out of hibernation and looking for things to clean. I'll be watching for anything that moves and needs to be barked or maybe sniffing the grass, before you know it it'll be worm rolling season. Soon it'll be the season where you don't have someone chasing after you to dry off your feet and underbelly.

media.title: I can now claim victory after a hard fought campaign to increase the number of blankets on my lounger, I'm now up to three multi coloured blankets, it's a small victory but I'll take it, thanks to everyone for their support during this difficult journey.  #internationalwomensday  As you can see burying my gravy coated biscuit becomes easier when I have a choice of coverings. It also helps with the yank and drag while barking, I can yank off two blankets at once leaving one left as a shield over the lounger, plus it brightens the decor giving the room a splash of colour. No matter what your struggles are continue to fight for what is right, bark your truth, Ancient Basset Saying.

Don't worry about me out here all alone while it's freezing cold with a wind chill factor whipping around my delicate frame (I'm not that fluffy). The Warden was buying time because I suspect she was sneaking snacks while I was outside, trying to wipe crumbs off her face, as if I don't know, I have the best crumb detector ever and I will be smelling her breath the first chance I get. As soon as they try to avoid eye contact or divert attention elsewhere you know there's been suspicious activity, fortunately I was given a treat so the situation was stabilized. If you think you can hide or sneak a snack between naps, think again, I'll hunt you down, Ancient Basset Saying.

The Warden was getting a little concerned about me barking at the window wells, she was probably having flashbacks to the time when I was trapped in the window well chasing a mouse, so we had to investigate. I stayed firm overlooking the window well and barking while The Warden armed herself with a shovel, the snow mountains were covered in ice and difficult to manoeuvre but she was on a mission. Yes, she uncovered the threat, it was a small pile of wet leaves, certainly worthy of being barked at every day. Confront your fears for they are only scary if they are unknown, once you know you can move on and bark at what you know, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to every moment when someone leaves their warm seat unattended, it's a calling card, I can't help myself, it's saying take me I'm yours, so I'm left with no other choice but to seize the moment and hop up on the chair. I love the moment when The Warden comes around the corner and looks at me, she stops in her tracks, has a cheap seat remark (her favourite, oh for heaven sakes), she immediately goes to the fridge, I can hear the cheese bag opening (second shelf), she returns knowing there's absolutely no way I'm moving unless of course it's the golden nugget (aged cheese) she holds in her hand. Don't struggle over the little things, if there's an easy solution then take that option, it's usually on the second shelf, Ancient Basset Saying.

Apparently I had to get a new collar because my original one was too tight, as a side note this is the extra fluffy season, try not to judge. Before I could be fitted for the collar I had to spend some time getting acquainted, first there was a round of barking (not seen) which was done at a safe distance, there were also a few remarks from the cheap seats 'oh for heaven sakes'. There was sniffing, chewing, tossing around, the usual stuff until eventually The Warden tried it around my neck (briefly), it was a perfect fit (came in a large size). How do you know it's the perfect fit, it's when your neck folds are allowed to drape naturally, slightly disguising the trappings of a controlled restraint, making the colour and design a non issue.

Let's call this Tasty Tuesday for our weekly #tot I happened upon an opportunity too good to pass up, just as The Warden was doing the final tuck of the blanket on the couch I seized the moment. I completely ignored the huffing and puffing sounds and didn't make direct eye contact, not to worry, I cleaned up all the crumbs and the slobber marks can be wiped up with a little elbow grease. It's all about giving back, The Warden needs a purpose and here I am to give a helping paw, if spreading a few crumbs or giving someone a reason to clean up makes them feel important and maintains their control issues, then I'm your gal. We are like two peas in a pod, working together in harmony, one has a purpose the other has a mission and at the end of the day we can look back with a smile and know all is right in our world.

For your Monday Morning Magical Moment you will get to experience the disappearance of the red blanket, this video comes with a noise warning for those with issues. It's a moment that was captured during my 'get some attention that I greatly deserve' hour of the day. For some reason the video was cut short and you didn't get to experience the full ramped up version of the ongoing, never ending, eye twitching, nerve fraying, barking session that everyone loves to hear. Barking may not be for everyone and for those that have a low tolerance level you might want to consider having cheese available for the offender, Ancient Basset Saying.

Some ask why I always have a blanket on my lounger, easy answer, it's to help bury my biscuit, but try not to yank the blanket completely off before you start your burial ritual. Now if you ask someone else (who has issues) why they cover the lounger with a blanket it's a completely different story, it's to protect the lounger from gravy stains, to prevent wear and tear, to contain the smell and can easily be washed and refreshed. Due to multiple yank and drag while barking issues The Warden started adding more blankets to help accommodate my burial rituals but somewhere along the line things changed, it got complicated, she developed more issues and now we're back to one blanket. All things can be less complicated if you just offer cheese, Ancient Basset Saying.

Sometimes getting the attention you deserve takes time and patience. Making eye contact is crucial, if there appears to be a lack of interest then you need to up your game, take it to the next level, you know what I'm talking about, barking. Yes they'll try all kinds of devious maneuvers, hiding behind a book, pretending to have a quiet moment, looking in every direction except at you, shameless behaviour. Just know you are not to be blamed for excessive barking if they don't drop everything and focus completely on you, they are responsible and need to own it. If they feel the need to control the situation there's a simple solution, offer cheese, it has a calming effect, Ancient Basset Saying.

I was traumatized and needed cheese to calm my nerves, here's what happened.  I went to the back door, scratched three times as one does in an emergency situation, I was immediately let out only to discover the deck was a skating rink. I inched along, slipping and sliding, looking over my shoulder (thinking 'what the hell), I retreated several times but would bravely try again, looking over my shoulder. Finally dad came out in his slippers, sprinkled ice melt all over the deck and stairs so I could safely make my way down to the ground. Yes The Warden was overseeing the whole mission and was prepared with the recovery cheese. Sometimes you have to step out of your comfort zone to get the mission done but with cheese your traumatic experience becomes a faint memory, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to me tethered to the front yard tree, the open road just steps away and the occasional worm scent catching the breeze. Not to worry, I'm not going anywhere, I'm in charge of keeping The Warden on the straight and narrow, I find that barking helps to distract her and keeps her focused on me.  She gets a little edgy with excessive barking but still has to maintain a sense of composure, so every once in awhile I'll hear hey hey in between the barking, she can't help herself, she doesn't want to be that lady who loses her dignity by yelling, so eventually she just takes me inside. In you need to be in control of any situation or to maintain a sense of order, carry cheese, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: Sometimes it takes a little extra work to get your lounger just right, first of all I had to untuck all the hospital corners, then I had to circle around until the music stopped, just kidding, I circled around until I got the feeling that it was time to stop and drop. It's a lot of work and preparation to finally settle in for a nap, this can also considered as part of my daily exercise routine, that's how I'm able to keep such a slim figure with great ab definition. Comfort comes in many forms, do what you want when you want, even if it means yanking the blanket completely off the lounger but probably not because of the lovely smell and those few scattered biscuit crumbs.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: Choosing a location to eat your gravy coated biscuit is not as easy as one would think, this particular spot presented itself as soon as dad stood up. Stealing a warm seat is always your first choice, a close second would be placing the biscuit on your lounger and doing a yank and drag while barking. After that it could be almost anything, I've placed a biscuit in the corner and barked at it, this gets the cheap seats all riled up (a personal favourite), I've jumped up on a chair covered with a freshly washed blanket, it's a blank canvas ready for a slobber design sprinkled with biscuit crumbs, another crowd pleaser. Don't limit yourself and become predictable, mix things up, write your own story, create some mystery, make it a cheese giving moment, Ancient Basset Saying.

Did you know that barking from an elevated snow bank can be heard just as loud as from ground level, sometimes the obvious gets pointed out by those with barking issues. Did you know that dropping a daily deposit on top of a snow bank can cause feathers to be ruffled, I found this out, The Warden had to use a shovel to do the extraction. Did you know that I think about cheese more than I receive cheese, it empowers you if you have a giving spirit, it also helps to free the mind of repetitive thinking and of course helps prevent a cheese deficiency, Ancient Basset Saying.

There's a slight hint that spring is on its way, it's above freezing and the sun is shining, this could all turn ugly at a moments notice but I'm being hopeful. I'm also hopeful that when I go inside there's a welcoming committee holding a platter of cheese, if you're gonna dream you might as well dream big. Shimmy Shaking Momma once had a dream of traveling the world singing and dancing until they told her she has no talent, the only thing stopping her now is the restraining order. Don't let others tell you it can't be done, bark until you get what you want, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: I was charged with excessive barking and fraying ones nerves, I'm counter suing for neglect and causing ones cheese levels to deplete. It all started in the bedroom, I was barking at the corner behind the door, the door accidentally closed, fortunately a first responder was onsite and set me free. Part two, I immediately went to the other side of the house and started a round of yank and drag while barking, I was getting a little hoarse from repeatedly barking, all of a sudden a raised voice yelled 'that's enough'. I immediately froze, there was tension in the air, I waited a respectable cooling off period  before I went to find the source of ones frayed nerves, once there I immediately offered my ear as a soothing mechanism to calm everyone down. It's a classic case of a cheese deficiency which leads to excessive barking which is a symptom of neglect, keep your cheese levels high in order to prevent frayed nerves, Ancient Basset Saying.

Why do I bark, it's a frequently asked question, you do what works. It may look like I'm barking at nothing and I am but that's the whole point, what's really happening which you can't see,  is the eye twitch, the shifting in the seat and wait for it, yes the turning of the head and the glaring look, that's all I wanted, a little attention. Now for part two, that's where I'll head directly to the backdoor, give an urgency scratch, listen for the first responder to come running and patiently wait for my treat, it's a process, you do what works.

title: Throwback to my teeny tiny days when I was just a little slip of a girl, over time a few things have changed. When I first came to my new home I wasn't allowed on the furniture but that rule was modified and within hours I was provided with the lift service. Eventually I was able to jump up by myself, the whole family gathered around clapping and praising my accomplishments, I could do no wrong and was often rewarded. So over the years I have found rules will change as we all change, I can no longer jump up on the bed but once again I have the lift service, all you have to do is look over your shoulder and help is waiting just a step away.

When I got up on the couch for my evening snuggle, starting with a neck and ear rub all I heard was 'gross or geeze' (mumbling sounds) apparently my gravy dippers had a few leftover tidbits from dinner or as I like to refer to it as snacks for later. There's only one solution for this, keep your hands moving in a small circular motion around the neck, chest and ear area, that way you never need to worry about crusty little tidbits, it'll all blend in and provide a beautiful fragrance that will enhance the overall experience, Ancient Basset Saying.

media.title: There are times when you need to have a conversation about what you want, I'm not barking out demands, I'm quietly trying to get the attention I deserve, of course if this doesn't work I'll ramp it up until I'm heard, sometimes you have to take it to the next level. All that needs to happen at times like this (at least once a day) is for them to drop everything, call me over, a little sweet talk, lots of love'n and a trip together to the fridge for some aged cheese. You don't ask for much, your needs are so few, that's why when the need for cheese strikes, probably caused by a cheese deficiency, you need to ask for what you deserve, Ancient Basset Saying.

Playing fetch in the snow is a lot different than playing fetch in the summer months, first off I don't do fetch unless someone else does the running around, if you want me to play those are my rules. If you toss a snowball in the snow what do you get, you get snow, so you see where this is going, it's a pointless game that leads to barking and nose shoveling. Every once in awhile The Warden will mix things up and toss a hat or a mitt just to keep it interesting but I still don't do fetch. You can't blame a girl for barking, if you want an interactive game try a cheese circuit but keep it a tight circuit, Miss Lilly Saying.

Be ready, be prepared, it's more than watching, it's about 'what if' someone stops at your house, you gotta be ready to make your move. First off you do not hesitate, if it looks like someone is getting close to the house you raise the roof by barking and howling, if anyone is in the driveway you run to the door, jump up, make some noise and be ready to pounce. Stay focused, ignore all distractions, there will be those who try to dampen your enthusiasm, you'll hear hey hey or something like that, you really can't hear anything because of all the noise and jumping around. It's all about being prepared, you get one shot, do not miss your chance to be a first responder, Ancient Basset Saying.

Doing home security takes you places where some fear to go, not me, there's a varmint that's invading our yard and I'm on a mission to find out where they're getting in and out of. The easy route would be to follow the hopping prints but I don't do easy, I'll climb mountains, I'll sniff the entire fence line, whatever it takes, depending on the weather conditions of course. The yard is covered with evidence and while shoveling the tidbits have landed on the snow mountains, making them look like a snow cone covered in tasty treats. This adds an additional work load for the staff trying to pick up what's being laid down, but they are on a mission and will never give up until the last tidbit is bagged and tagged.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: Love comes in many forms, your lounger without hospital corners, your blanket that hasn't been washed in a week, your paw prints visible all over the floor and no one rushing to clean them up, the little clinking noises in the kitchen as breakfast is being prepared, yes these are all signs that you live in a home where you are loved. This is all before I even open my eyes, once I wake up my every move will be watched, I'll be appreciated with a few hey heys as I do the yank and drag while barking and to top it all off I'll be given treats just for being me. Nothing says you are loved more than a little sweet talk followed by a platter of aged cheese, Ancient Basset Saying. Happy Valentines Day my friends â¤ï¸

It's time to throwback to the urban jungle when the sun was shining, the barking was loud and the sniffing was endless, the good ole days. You can only do this if you are a teeny tiny slip of a girl with little paws so you don't damage the foliage and also to prevent the use of the little ugly fences. Remember when The Warden tried to restrict my access to the gardens by using fences, eventually she decided to just let me roam free and hoped I wouldn't sit or lay on the plants or maybe she just gave up. It's better to let others do what they do best without fencing them in, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 6mm f/2

media.title: I wasn't considered as a contestant in the Westminster Dog Show, so I'm exposing the controversial findings behind the show. I will not perform without my own room for naps, I will only walk around in circles by a handler who has aged cheese and finally I will not have a bath when it's not even bath season. Being just a slip of a girl with a big personality is what I have to offer, so what you see is what you get and I smell lovely. Be who you are not what others expect you to be, Ancient Basset Saying.

One winter activity is a game called Keep-Away, where you have an object you keep from someone else getting, usually played with two but you can adapt to your own rules. With the warmer weather The Warden tossed her hat off and now let the games begin (it can also work with a mitten). Everything was going along great until I got distracted, it happens when your nose is to the ground and you start searching for the perfect spot, added excitement will do that to you. Another added feature to this game is excessive barking, this is where it enhances the crowd participation and they start chanting hey hey. When playing in any sport related activity be sure to give it your all until you get distracted or there's treats, Ancient Basset Saying.

exif_data.lens_model: iPhone 11 Pro Max back triple camera 4.25mm f/1.8

media.title: I got another sleep station (lounger) which is located beside dad's chair, it provides him with easy access while giving me rubs and scratches. It's been here for a couple of weeks but it's taken me awhile to adjust to the change, yes I laid on the fringes of it, did the yank and drag while barking with it, there was an adjustment period. Things have settled down and now I can climb up, get comfy and give dad the opportunity to embrace the moment of being the chosen one. I'll start out on the couch with The Warden, we have our routine, eventually I'll make my move over to dad, not just because of the snacks, well yes it's because of the snacks but also because this is our routine. It's important to make yourself available not just for the snacks but to be apart of the family and because there might be snacks, Ancient Basset Saying.

For my opening number I'd like to perform the yank and drag while barking, it's a crowd pleaser and always gets a few hey heys from the cheap seats. I might recommend that you use the fireplace today for a couple of reasons, first off it's -22 and secondly I'll be using all throws and blankets as props for my yank and drag while barking. Don't let a few hey heys get in the way of showing your artistic side, when you're in the moment just block out all distractions and don't, I repeat, don't make eye contact with the audience. Once you've exhausted yourself and your barking becomes a little strained that's your sign to rest your vocals and take a nap before the next curtain call. This theatre tip is brought to you by the one and only, a little slip of a girl with a big personality, Miss Lilly.

title: No reported injuries or excessive moaning and groaning after the last cleanup of the snow storm, it took a couple of hours and now thankfully there's a place I can go outside because our sidewalks aren't clear yet and the snow banks are like small mountains. It'll be a quick in and out today though because I woke up to -19, enough to freeze your daily deposits on contact, which is great for the pickup crew. Not to worry, with everyone spending more time inside they can spend their time fussing over a roast simmering in gravy while I nap, I can also follow The Warden around making sure she's not sneaking snacks, it'll be a full day. If you have an opportunity to spend more time together make it a special moment to remember, cheese makes a lasting impression, Ancient Basset Saying.

media.title: Round one of the winter storm has been cleaned up, now we are getting ready for round two. I usually do my inspection after each cleanup, the snow crew stands off to the side waiting for my seal of approval, it helps build their confidence and inspires them to go out again, especially if I tour the whole yard. It has been noted that the rabbits have also returned, the daily deposit pickup crew have added additional time to their time cards because of the extra droplets having to be picked up. I'm proud of the work done by the snow crew on my behalf, they should be rewarded with a roast simmering in gravy and it would only be polite for me to join them. Always give praise to those that deserve it, with praise comes the benefits of the rewards, Ancient Basset Saying.

Throwback to the day when my brother and I were spending some quality time together, there was a wannabe onlooker trying to get attention but we ignored her. Yes I was moaning, I do that for inspiration, it's considered a hypnotic suggestion that keeps the hand in motion. One other tip, not used in this clip, would be the use of the other hand to hold my leg up in order to get full access to the belly, one hand to rub the other to support the leg, it's a winning combination. How do you measure a great belly rub, it's by the pile of hair left on the floor and floating in the air and of course by the onlookers eye twitching (the larger the pile of hair the faster the twitch). It's about the quality of time spent together and an attitude of hair in the air and we just don't care, Ancient Basset Saying.

I'm not here to be judged, I'm here to explain, there was an incident (it was warranted) and this is how it all went down. You ever get this feeling when you know someone is up to something, I was just coming out of my nap and realized it was unusually quiet, The Warden was up to something. I started checking out each room and there she was, hanging up a new shower curtain, I immediately got in the attack position and started howling (as one does with something new). Her first response was 'oh for heaven sakes' (isn't she witty and charming), now I have to make an adjustment with my sensibilities. Once the curtain was hung I inched in closer to investigate the threat level, I nudged it around with my nose, howled once more and walked away. Don't assume everything is status quo, make your own assessment and when in doubt start howling, Ancient Basset Saying.

You ever get that feeling where you're trapped and isolated, I got that feeling from a failed yank and drag. Let's go back to the beginning and examine what went wrong, I was innocently wandering around, minding my own business when I noticed a blanket hanging off the bed (it wasn't aligned correctly). So I had a choice to make, do I pass it by or try to help and fix the problem, it's all about doing the right thing, if you see something that's out of place you step up to the plate and do something. While doing the yank portion of my yank and drag while barking, I got trapped, fortunately the first responders were in the vicinity, apparently enjoying themselves at my expense. In order to reduce the stress of a failed yank and drag while barking eat a small portion of cheese, helps calm the nerves, Ancient Basset Saying.

Do you ever get that lonesome howling feeling when nobody stops by to visit, you might catch sight of the neighbour stirring around but that's it. Winters can be a lonely time because you're inside a lot, you're just waiting for someone to ring the door bell and then they don't. Yes there's always The Warden, she's easy game, I can always rile her up or I can scratch at the back door and try to get an unscheduled treat, if you don't try you'll never know. In order to beat the winter blues you should eat more cheese, you're probably feeling a little down because your cheese levels are low, eating more cheese will lift your spirits and prevent a cheese deficiency, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: The surveillance cameras captured a dark foreign substance on top of a snow bank in the backyard, The Warden has been monitoring it for several days and decided to bring in a professional (dad) to have it removed. You have to have perfect weather conditions in order to climb on top of a snow bank and leave a mysterious package that's put under surveillance for several days, I got lucky. The extraction was almost flawless, dad went in all gloved up (poop bag on hand) but he was wearing his slippers, apparently this was a controversial decision and he got 'the look'. Don't be afraid to try new adventures, climb new heights, sniff new grounds, you never know what will happen, Ancient Basset Saying.

media.title: Some dreams are worth remembering and there are others dreams that turn into nightmares. One of my favourite dreams is where I'm running free, no leashes or collars, everyone on my street is chasing me yelling 'cheese cheese', dad is in his slippers trying to catch me while The Warden looks on clutching the cheese bag. There are others dreams that go down the wrong road, the screeching noises and the tossing of tassels, that's Shimmy Shaking Momma having a Proud Mary Moment preparing for her no talent tour, some dreams are known as flashbacks but with cheese you learn to move on. Whatever you may dream know that everything can be made right again with cheese, Ancient Basset Saying.

While out on patrol I heard crunching noises, this is the sound an intruder makes while walking on crunchy snow so I alerted the neighbourhood, as one does in the face of danger. As it turned out it was someone doing a deposit pickup in their own yard and yes barking was necessary. The Warden didn't even give me a warning with her hey heys, I'm still in recovery so I'm allowed a few indiscretions, probably when I go inside I'll be rewarded with aged cheese. I'm considering extending my recovery time, I find that adding more cheese and roast simmering in gravy to be beneficial to my overall well-being, it may even be considered a lifestyle change, for health reasons of course.

Throwback to last week when I had 6 teeth removed, recovery is  going well for me and The Warden (she's been hovering over me more than usual). During my recovery I'm not allowed any gravy coated biscuits, I can only have soft food and soft treats, fortunately cheese is on the 'can have' list. Another rule is no yanking or pulling with my teeth, so no hospital corners are applied to my lounger, a blanket is just casually tossed on top because you know I'm still gonna do the yank and drag while barking, also there will be no biscuit dance until my mouth is healed. It seems like there's a lot of 'can't do's' but I have been getting lots of attention, extra scratches and rubs, a whole lotta sweet talk and some cheese without having to beg or whine. When going through a difficult time it's recommended you eat a little extra cheese, Ancient Basset Saying.

Caution, the level of danger is high, do not attempt this without advanced training or a rock ledge that is cleared to walk on.  A small backyard rink has formed and it's important to avoid stepping on it, safety first, falling through the ice would be devastating because it's wet and I don't do wet. I tested the edges and it appears to be frozen but don't be fooled by appearances, back away, best to sniff along the fence line, that's probably where the varmints were anyway. As a side note, do your business on the flat grassy areas, it's better to manoeuvre around and you can focus, also the deposit pickups are less dangerous for the staff.

Take pride in your yank and drag while barking, it was a struggle but I eventually yanked the throw off The Wardens chair. What makes this a total success was the eye twitching, by the time The Warden came on the scene, she came running because of all the barking, I had dragged the throw across the room and was getting ready to settle down for a nap. Once I spread myself out over the throw there was nothing that could get me off of it, except maybe a small crane or a platter of cheese. If you are wondering why anyone would yank and drag a throw across a room, it's obvious, I have a cheese deficiency. If you want to prevent an eye twitching event such as the yank and drag while barking, serve more cheese, Ancient Basset Saying.

I'm just a teeny tiny slip of a girl, careful you don't trip over me as I follow the sun spot across the room. There are others who won't notice me right away, some will see the chew marks on the chair legs, or the hair stuck to the fabric on the furniture, maybe the dried slobber pooled on the floor or the tumbleweed of hair floating across the room but if you see only this little slip of a girl then you can clearly see this house is a home where you are accepted and loved for who you are. Our doors are open, even if you can't sing or dance and lack talent, it doesn't matter, we welcome you as you are. Bark and howl like no one is listening, shed your hair like you just don't care, beg and whine just because you can, it's about being who you are, Ancient Basset Saying.

Don't be afraid to try out alternative methods to get the scratches you deserve, once you've established it's not a threat or harmful to your delicate frame. This new device was Basset tested before applied, it was sniffed thoroughly and barked at, you can never be too careful. For those with weak wrists and who have a tendency to tire easily this might be something to consider, of course it lacks the personal touch which enhances the overall experience. Nothing is better than the old fashion method of your staff wiggling there fingertips over your belly abs, now that's what you call heaven.

title: When company comes over it's important to make them feel special, your home should be warm and inviting, turn on the fireplace and offer belly rubs. Sometimes they get a little distracted with all the idle chatter so discretely give out signals that your belly doesn't rub itself, the occasional whine or moan will encourage their focus on important matters, lift your leg to allow full body access if needed. Once all the initial chitchat is over it's time for the hostess to offer a beverage and some meaningful snacks, make your guests feel special and important, bring them their own individual cheese platter so they can share with those they are giving belly rubs to. Remember when you have guests over offer up your best aged cheese and a bowl of fresh filtered water with ice, Ancient Basset Saying.

media.title: I've been pondering, if I was to be judged what category would I fall under, besides the Hound category (too predictable). My first thought would be in the Toy category because I'm just a tiny slip of a girl, not one you can carry around in a handbag though, my dignity wouldn't allow it, I like to have my feet planted at all times in case I get that restless feeling, what if the fridge door opened or the doorbell rang, I gotta be ready to pounce. It definitely can't be the Sporting category because I don't do fetch but if it involves cheese I could maintain my focus and possibly jump through hoops if they were at a reasonable height. These are just a few pondering moments brought to you by Miss Lilly to be continued at a later date after a previously scheduled nap.

Throwback to one of my greatest adventures ever, the adrenaline was pumping, a small crowd had gathered and The Warden was having a full blown meltdown. She started yelling out instructions, 'get her outta there, get her outta there', no one was listening until they realized that in order to save one they'd have to save both, long story short, in order to calm down The Warden the spectators had to lift me out of the window well. Yes, I was air lifted out, the mouse was captured and live released and The Warden had to be sedated after she was assured that we were no longer under threat of a mouse attack, it was the best day ever.

title: I was accused of making a faux paw, I made a three scratch alert at the back door signaling an emergency situation. The Warden came running, as I knew she would, except I wasn't dancing on the spot waiting to go outside, I was laying down and facing the other way, this is where the huffing and puffing starts. Yes I was warned about making false scratches, blah blah blah, after the first couple of words you might as well save your lecture for someone who cares, I'm here for one reason and only one reason, a treat. Do you blame me for laying down, I had to wait her out, let her go on and on about making false claims and how I don't deserve a treat, you know the old saying 'you don't reward bad behaviour', finally she started making her closing remarks and headed for the treat cabinet. Sometimes good things happen to those that wait, Ancient Basset Saying.

media.title: Word of caution while out patrolling in your winter wonderland, it's -21 so limit your sniffing time outside. Keep an eye on your exit routes and be prepared to evacuate at a moments notice, also be mindful of the warm reception you'll get upon your return inside and the special treats you'll receive for all your hardships. As a side note you'll notice the snow along the fence line has been tamped down in order to help avoid an avalanche, it also keeps the rock ledge free of debris, Basset Winter Tips.

title: Hard times, I've known a few, take for example yesterday, nature called and I had to make a trip out into the great unknown, a wilderness expedition, fortunately I was able to find my way back sniffing out my own paw prints. Should I be rewarded for my act of bravery, well if you must but nothing too fancy, maybe a small reception line as I cross the threshold, to be greeted with a fluffy heated towel whispering sweet words of encouragement. Once inside a small but tasteful display of aged cheese, an assortment of deli meats and if it's not too much trouble a large roast simmering in gravy, it helps calm the nerves after a trying experience.

Every evening I share the couch with The Warden, first thing I do is check to see if she has snacks which usually turns out to be a disappointment (she has issues, doesn't like to be watched while eating). Once I've established there's no food I'll snuggle in along side her, inside lane (don't want to fall off the edge), after a while I'll need to stretch and rotate so I'll go to the end of the couch. This is where it gets tricky, as I'm snoozing I'll continue to stretch my legs while shifting my body, totally unaware that as I'm doing this I'm pushing The Warden to the edge of the couch (not responsible, I'm sleeping, totally unaware, legally not liable). It's in your best interest to learn the art of teetering on the edge when sharing your space with a tiny slip of a girl, Ancient Basset Saying.

The calm before the storm, the snow crew is resting up and getting ready for the next wave of a massive snow fall. Notice the fine details, rock ledge around the garden all cleared off for me, the snow mountains are taking shape and all the daily deposits have been located and removed. Except for one that didn't quite get noticed in time, it was a colourful incident, language that was unbecoming was used and an extraction team was brought in to remove deposit remains from the tread of ones snow boot, it was a scene. Note to those assigned to daily deposit removals, during a snow storm it's best to be 'Johnny on the spot' instead of waiting for the freeze, Ancient Basset Saying.

I present to you my evidence of no wrongdoing, I'm being accused of leaving dirty paw prints all over the floor, now looking at this evidence does the paw fit the crime. Without any due process it was automatically assumed those were paw prints, look closely, they could be size 7 toe prints, maybe the evidence is a little smudgy but that's what you get with amateur evidence collectors (AEC). Have I in the past left dirty paw prints, yes of course, who hasn't, but there are others who have also left prints, example, remember when dad wore his slippers outside while chasing after me, you guessed it, slipper prints, I rest my case. Stand up for your rights and bark out the truth, as seen through your eyes, Ancient Basset Saying.

media.title: Throwback to the attack of the furminator and the sunny lazy hazy crazy days of summer. Back when there was a little pep in my step, a little glide in my stride, when it didn't take much to get The Warden all riled up, oh the good ole days. All I had to do was bark a little and like a shot she would come running to see what all the fuss was about, now that's what you call good service. Don't sit back and wait for everyone to come running to you, sometimes you gotta bark a little to get the attention you deserve, Ancient Basset Saying.

It's taken some time but I finally got the heating pad off dads chair, I mean it accidentally fell on the floor, which technically meant I could explore my options. First of all it was definitely out of place which created a barkable moment, anything new or out of place deserves to be barked at, I like order. Of course the barking alerted security who immediately became concerned about the risk level of the heating pad, forget about my safety and well-being, anyway, I was fine after The Warden returned the heating pad to dads chair and called me over to reassure me that everything was alright. One way to calm the nerves is a small platter of cheese for me and an evening juice for The Warden, it's about doing the right thing, Ancient Basset Saying.

title: Not every gravy coated biscuit gets the yank and drag while barking, some are set aside to be enjoyed at a later time. It's like having a little surprise waiting for you, let's say I'm having a nap, which is exhausting by the way, and when I wake up all I have to do is stretch a little and there it is, a little tasty snack. There are also times when I walk around with my biscuit trying to decide where to eat it and then I get distracted, it happens, especially if someone in the room looks like they're vacating their chair, you might want to consider relocating your biscuit again. Now if this was a story about cheese instead of a gravy coated biscuit it would have a completely different ending, one I'm sure you could all relate to.

media.title: In the midst of rain, freezing rain and snow don't let a few 'hey heys' deter you from expressing yourself. I've been hibernating inside due to the rain, I don't do wet, so once it stopped I needed to stretch my legs and let everyone know I'm out and about again. The yard maintenance crew is still working to prepare the backyard, I prefer to see exposed grass while sniffing, it's important to boost their morale while they work, they seem to be a little edgy so I find that barking helps speeds things along, I think that's a smile on their face or it could be frozen, hard to tell. It's important in extreme weather to offer your support when you can, weather permitting, the sooner they get done the quicker they can get your treats, Ancient Basset Saying.

I have certain expectations now, it's been raining a lot and I don't do wet, so each time I come back inside I expect to see the staff holding a paper towel, bent over in the ready position, whispering sweet soothing words, dabbing the rain off my back and then giving me a full body rub. Would I prefer a warm fluffy towel, it would be an upgrade but we don't yet have a heated towel rack installed by the back door, it's probably on the same work order as my accessible fridge. There was a time where you would have to chase me around the room before I'd let you dry me off but times have changed. Word of advice, if you have to go outside in the rain and there's a paper towel rub down offered, embrace it, it's all part of your benefit package, Ancient Basset Saying.

The Treat Debate, when should I get a treat, these major decisions are left in the hands of people with control issues, we need to take a stand and demand more treats for no reason. Full disclosure, cheese and roast simmering in gravy is not considered a treat, it falls under the category of lifesaving sustenance. Currently treats are given when I go outside, do my business and then come back inside to be rewarded, it's demeaning. I'm being put in a position where at times I have to whine or to perform the yank and drag while barking, all because I want a measly little treat. There are also categories of treats, the good stuff, the subpar tokens which will be eaten if that's all there is and finally the crap which you might as well bag up and give away. Treats are meant to be a positive experience so save time and money and offer only the good stuff, Ancient Basset Saying.

When trying to get the attention you deserve it's important you stare until direct eye contact is made, once that is done feel free to ramp it up. They will try to appear disinterested but deep down are truly honoured that they are the chosen one, being barked at is a sign you are officially a member of the pack, can't you just feel the love. If you find that they are persistent in trying not to engage just keep barking, maybe throw in a moan, that always gets their attention, their maternal instincts will kick in and will want to make everything feel better. You can always hope that their tolerance level is low and they go for the quick fix and offer cheese, this is your win win.

Throwback to my fond memories of the rib roast bone I got to chew, notice how I chewed within the lines, there were strict guidelines to follow, I had to chew on the assigned blanket. After I was finished with the bone The Warden draped this blanket over my lounger, it smelled lovely and I even got to snack on a few leftovers. Even though the bone was rinsed and the excessive fat cut off it was still a tasty memorable treat, I can still recall dad yelling from the other room 'don't cut off all the good stuff', I don't think he saw her cut off all the good stuff and then rinse the bone. Sometimes you have to lighten up and leave all the good stuff on the bone, Ancient Basset Saying.

I got to run free in the wide open spaces without any restraints or surveillance cameras, of course when we got home dad had to give a full account under some harsh interrogation by The Warden.
