As a side note, because she also provides great service it's important to let her caress your ears, it helps calm her nerves.

media.title: I was just sitting in the driveway minding my own business when I noticed that the neighbour set up a collapsible canopy, didn't think anything of it until he decided to fold it up, that's when things took a turn. I was curious as one would be, I inched over to their driveway, got real low in the attack position, hackles raised, ready at a moments notice if things turned ugly. I inched a little closer than raised the alarm, I howled until the neighbour came running to see what was happening. He quickly assembled the canopy in its carry case as The Warden issued a few apologies and gave me a few tugs on my carefully measured line. Being associated with the neighbourhood watch I was well within my howling rights, just keeping the neighbourhood safe.

title: Sometimes The Warden has all these great ideas, who am I to dampen her spirited enthusiasm. She thought one of my chairs smelled a little, somewhat like I do after rolling on a worm, so her solution was to sprinkle it with baking soda, let it absorb for 20 minutes then vacuum, it made her feel better and it only took 20 minutes of waiting before I got my chair back. I think her nose has a distorted sense of smell after years of sniffing cleaning products, if she started sniffing other earthy type things maybe she would be in a better place and wouldn't have so many issues, just saying.

I don't want to be the bearer of bad news but fall is creeping up and before you know it this will become a barren wasteland, so enjoy your urban jungle and gardens while you can. Yes when all of this disappears there'll be plenty of room to bury your biscuits and kick up a little dirt, all the fun stuff that gets The Warden all riled up. Right now she's getting her garden tools ready for the cleanup, she's resisting the urge to use her Dyson outside but for some reason she has no trouble using the broom to sweep the driveway, she doesn't want to appear as though she has issues, it's a little too late for that I'm afraid (they know).

media.title: There are times where it's nice to have a quiet peaceful moment, away from all the hubbub, the glare of the flashing lights, the constant humming of the Dyson and the potential threat of a Proud Mary Moment. I need time to recharge, reflect and anticipate which might seem like a lot to do while napping but it's necessary to hone your basic Basset skills, such as the constant sniffing, barking, full on greeting (which includes jumping up), of course the yank and drag while barking, or listening for anyone tiptoeing into the kitchen trying to sneak a snack.

Throwback to last week when dad gave me a rib roast bone, he spread out one of my lounger blankets on the floor for me to dine on, in accordance with all the rules and regulations as dictated by The Warden. Here's where dad went off the rails, he didn't cut of the excess fat or the spicy coating, nor did he rinse it with water before he gave it to me, he bypassed all these rules, he was freestyle'n. Under intense interrogation by The Warden dad revealed what happened, she watched me like a hawk looking for any symptoms from eating an unregulated bone. All she witnessed was me being content, happy and snoozing on my lounger, what more could you ask for.

title: Eventually I made my way to the lounger which is currently placed in front of the fireplace, I had a bit of a struggle with the yank and drag while barking, the hospital corners were tucked in too tight and I couldn't quite yank off the blankets. I completely ignored the hey heys as I circled around looking for a loose tuck, this is a sign that The Warden is on the mend, order is being restored not ignored. Now if only more focus and attention was given to the more important things such as a small roast simmering in gravy or a cheese platter, I need sustenance, when you start slipping out of your lounger it's an indication your being deprived of meat and cheese, just saying.

media.title: Waiting and watching for the kids to head back to school, wondering what's in their backpacks, it's their first day so probably lots of snacks. If I was allowed to mix and mingle I could probably tell you exactly who had cheese and a meat sandwich, I wouldn't totally ignore those who had only fruits and veggies but I wouldn't linger either. The Warden won't let me outside in case I jump up on the little ones without them bracing themselves, she'd probably yell 'careful she's heavier than she looks', so in order to avoid a potential lawsuit she keeps me inside, it's clear she's only thinking of herself.

There's an adjustment period required before I come to terms with the new fireplace and bookshelves, you can't just slap something together in my space and expect me to embrace it right off the bat. Yes, there will be some excessive barking for awhile so save your hey heys, I'm gonna need to empty the tank on this one. Of course I don't bark at it every time I enter the room, that would be crazy, I just bark once a day just about the same time as The Warden decides to settle in and relax. Now that I think about it it's really not my problem, if The Warden didn't sit down I wouldn't bark, all evidence is now pointing in another direction, once again I have been vindicated.

When securing your territory it's important to identity all those who have crossed your path, pay particular attention to any unknown predators. They are running wild this time of year getting ready for the winter season, I've seen rabbits, chipmunks, squirrels, the elusive cat and some hovering sky predators who drop down stealing my driveway worms. Now of course there's the familiar scents of the known, dad, Contractor Tim, the neighbour and let's not forget The Warden who just finished sweeping the driveway. Once I've sniffed the whole area I can now rest assured that everything is right in my surrounding kingdom, then I'll soak up the remaining summer sun and nap, at least until I spot any movement.

There it is, the sound of the garage door opening, which means dad is home, now before you get totally wound up for a full knock him down greeting make sure you are fully prepared. You've got time, no need to rush, first stretch out, do a few lunges and as soon as you hear him walk up the stairs start heading for the door doing a light prance. By now your tail should be fully activated with a helicopter twirl, your knees are bent slightly ready to jump up and start with a bark/whine combo for the full greeting affect. From the cheap seats someone is calling out 'here she comes, brace yourself', isn't she fun to have around.

Contractor Tim is inside the house and I'm on the outside, which presents a problem, he either needs to come out or I'm gonna have to go in. Only one problem, The Warden, I'm on a tight leash with a whole list of outdoor protocols to follow, first off no barking outside.  Outrageous, it's my constitutional right to voice my opinions in an open forum, let the record show that I have had no barking complaints issued against me. Nows probably not the time to mention someone else's shady past so I won't. As a side note, my bark is barely above a whisper, I could hardly be heard above the hey heys.

Throwback to yesterday when I had to witness another crisis, The Wardens phone was dying, she called emergency services (phone help centre) and was told to bring the phone in stat. She cradled it in her arms on life support (portable charger), fortunately the phone doctor was able to transfer all the data to a new phone, crisis averted. The whole time she was chanting, it's okay we'll just start all over, it's gonna be alright. The good news was it distracted her from the construction and I wasn't having to pose every second for a picture. Can we not get through a day without all this drama, this is what happens when you done stop and take time to nibble on a platter of cheese.

title: I got lucky and was able to slip past security and into the room where the workers left all their tools, they even had blankets which covered the floor. While what does one do with a blanket on the floor, you grab a biscuit and do the yank and drag while barking. All I could hear above the barking was hey hey, apparently The Warden didn't approve of me skirting the blanket around the tools. I was quickly ushered out of the room while she tried to hide all the evidence of me on their blankets, I think one blanket she tried tucking with hospital corners (hard to hide her issues). Some day soon order will be restored, you just gotta believe.

media.title: Escaping from the chaos inside the house, I needed a retreat to the urban jungle where life isn't so complicated. There are workers again today finishing up the bookshelves, barriers have been erected, furniture all out of place and my water bowl has moved. Now from The Wardens distorted point of view, there's dust all over and the house needs a good cleaning, I get the feeling she misses my yank and drag while barking or stealing her chair when she gets up, you know, the good ole days.

This is not the way to start the day, something new and out of place. I'm sensing chaos today, the bookshelves are being installed this morning and Contractor Tim will also be on site. The Warden is constructing a barrier to keep me away from all the action but I'll bark, it's a given, it's who I am.  Now in order to calm the situation down may I recommend some aged cheese given at regular intervals, it has a calming effect, because of the traumatic situation a larger dose is recommended, for medicinal purposes only of course. This is all happening before my first pee, it's gonna be a long day, pray for me.

It was a harrowing experience, let me set the scene. I was out for a sniff and walk when all of a sudden I saw something up ahead of us move in the grass, I immediately put on the brakes and got in the attack position. I inched forward never taking my eyes off the predator, all of a sudden it made a move so I jumped back, the adrenaline was flowing, I was now being threatened so I had to make my move. With my head down, hackles up, I pounced with the full weight of my delicate frame, it turned out to be a tissue flapping in the breeze but it could've easily been a life threatening predator, never let your guard down, today a tissue next time who knows what comes across your path.

title: Summertime bath, this method of airing out saves on water which is important during the hot weather, we must all do our part to conserve water. Here's how it's done, stretch out and expose your underbelly, also include your ears in this exercise, let the fresh air drape over you. If you find it more comfortable to lay on your side then just remember to stretch and rotate. Even though you may have a blanket it's recommended that you lay directly on the grass to get that earthy scent, wiggle around a little, somewhat like a shimmy shake, by the time you have finished your summertime bath you'll be smelling like fresh linen with just a hint of worm.

media.title: How do you judge the wellness of someone who has a broken wing, by how well they do hospital corners. The Wardens recovery is getting better each day and is now doing physio, as part of her daily routine, besides doing arm exercises, is to practice tucking in my blankets. It's becoming more difficult for me to do the yank and drag while barking if I can't get the blanket yanked off the lounger. In order for me to recover from a failed yank is to nap but not to worry, before you know it I'll have that blanket yanked off and I'll be dragging it across the floor barking up a storm, you can count on that.

Throwback to when my brother and I decided to team up, put our heads together and get some quality work done. When you're contemplating new ideas it's important to take a moment for a neck rub, try not to get distracted by the slobber and if your wrist gets sore just switch hands. If you lose focus I'll give you a nudge to keep you on track, this is what you call team work. Now only if that someone who is lurking in the shadows would consider preparing a healthy snack (platter of cheese) instead of thinking about when they can discretely power up the vacuum.

Waiting for contractor Tim, he's now become part of the family, he understands the family dynamics.  He knows that the ladder goes to the left of the fireplace, that I need a full two minutes of his complete undivided attention, we do a howling duet and he likes cheese. The Warden likes him because he brings his own high powered vacuum, he's constantly cleaning up and fussing around, yes he fits right in. Dad looks forward to when contractor Tim shows up because he gets to talk about golf, each and every putt, long drive, other assorted shots taken at each and every hole during a full game of golf.

It's the little things that count, like the placement of your water dish against the backdrop of a garden of zinnias in full bloom and let's not overlook the full size ice cubes in your bowl of fresh filtered water. Of course stay on grassy side of the garden to avoid any hey heys, it somehow breaks the ambience of your outdoor experience. Never ever pass up a chance to sniff out a budding worm sprouting up out of the ground for a little dab on the neck, just imagine the aroma of a worm and zinnias, great combination for anyone in close proximity, as you nuzzle up with jowls dripping wet with water and smelling so lovely.

Just another trip to the backyard so I thought, not much to see, except wait, the gate was open and there's no security personnel guarding access. So I casually go to the opening, look over my shoulder and I'm free, I immediately head to the front of the house, the world is mine to seize. I see a few neighbours out so I charge over, ducking and weaving, excited about my newfound freedom. They were also excited to see me and we all played follow the leader back to my front door. Dad came immediately to the door when he saw me with a couple of friends, he thanked everyone and admitted he left the gate open. The Warden didn't require CPR, breathing into a paper bag helped, in addition to her medicinal evening juices.

The ladder was moved again which created a barkable moment, here's how it all started.  I was doing a yank and drag while barking with two blankets from my lounger, I was on a roll, the blankets were skirting all over the floor while at the same time collecting the light dusting of sanding which was all over the floor. I was yanking the blankets with my back to the ladder when I accidentally bumped into it which startled me, I had no choice but to bark and paw at the floor. It was unavoidable as you can imagine, so I would appreciate a little understanding while I deal with the situation, and throwing in a few hey heys is going on deaf ears, I hear nothing while barking.

title: There's a couple of small pointers when you're in the area of the front gardens, for those of you who do listen. First of all stay on the grassy side of the rocks but if for some reason you get sidetracked do not dig in the dirt. There's also this thing about not laying amongst the flowers and definitely do not stretch and rotate. Short story but memorable, I once sneaked past security and buried a treat under the flowers, with a little touch up, smooth out the dirt and remove the broken flowers the garden was as good as new. The flowers are a lot like me, we're both delicate and add a lot of colour to ones life.

media.title: There are times where you're not quite sure what to do, if you go outside there's a chance you'll be missing out on something inside, but what if, it's a dilemma. I know they want me to pee after sleeping 12 hours, all in good time, wait a second, there's movement in the kitchen, if one hand reaches for the fridge door I'm going in and there it is, the decision has been made, I'm going back in. I'll get to my business eventually, right now it's all about priorities, now if my peeing is important to you may I suggest you grab a piece of cheese and meet me in the backyard, then everyone will be happy.

Throwback to when my brother came home for a blanket intervention, it was successful and I now have two blankets on my lounger. The Warden saw the light (error of her ways) and learned a valuable lesson, even though one is not working at 100% (broken wing plus various multiple issues) doesn't mean others should be impacted. The hospital corners are reinstated on my lounger which means a challenge for my yank and drag while barking, also provides a workout for ab development. As a side note, The Warden didn't have time to straighten out the blanket on the couch before we sat down (free style'n), she wouldn't say anything with my brother there because she wanted to appear cool and relaxed.

Here's my version of events, no embellishments, as told by Miss Lilly. I was strolling in the backyard when all of a sudden I noticed movement in the grass, I approached cautiously as one does, it was a bunny. I got real low, nudged it slightly and when it moved I started howling and barking, this is where the cheap seats gets involved. I could see The Warden bopping from window to window calling for reinforcements, dad ran out, circled around, I snatched up the intruder, it squealed, I dropped it, that's when dad stepped in between us and the bunny escaped. The adrenaline was flowing, I had to sniff the crime scene before we headed back inside to calm The Warden down, after a recounting of events and a glass of evening juice she started to settled down.

title: Extreme hunting, two rabbits were spotted this morning, it's now believed that a family has taken up residence somewhere in our yard. The in-house crime scene investigator who is known to carry evidence baggies has also been on the hunt, I unlike The Warden have decided to sniff out the predators, all smells are leading to the urban jungle. When I first set chase they scurried under the gate but I know that was a distraction to keep me away from where they're really living, well my friends, the nose knows, I'm going into the jungle and we'll see who comes back out.

media.title: I'm laying in a construction zone, yes it may appear neat and tidy at first glance but what you don't see according to our in-house expert with issues is a light dusting of sanding (technical term used in the construction world), also floating hair and slobber, it's important to mark your territory when claiming ownership. I've barked at every stage of this process, each and every tool used (especially the measuring tape), the mudding and taping, the ladder and power vacuum. It's an exhausting process and I'm preparing for this week when the bookshelf builder comes to do the final measurements, you know what that means, new people, probably a measuring tape so I'm resting up and getting ready for another round of barking.

The contractor just left so I have some decisions to make, do I bark at the ladder, the corner or the fireplace. While I'm pondering I'm getting 'the look', you know the look, you've all been there, just as you're getting all worked up into a frenzy someone comes in to dampen the party. I've already barked when the contractor was up the ladder doing a light sanding, that's also about the time I saw The Wardens eye start to twitch, she was coming to her limit, her tolerance level was low so barking may have to be put on the back burner, at least until after a session with the vacuum.

title: My brother came home for a visit and for a quality checkup on me, he was concerned about me when he heard I had only one blanket on my lounger, yes news travels fast. There was a heated discussion amongst the staff about my need for multiple blankets, for example, doing a proper biscuit dance, doing a yank and drag while barking, plus a nesting tool when preparing for a nap. After a period of time and a few evening juices everyone came to an agreement that another blanket was to be added to my lounger, sometimes interventions are required in order to see the light.

media.title: Once upon a time I used to have at least five blankets on my lounger and now over time it has been reduced to one blanket, so what happens on laundry day, I get nothing. The initial blanket gently tossed over my lounger was to keep the lounger clean, after a few yank and drag while barking episodes blankets got added, therefore not an issue come laundry day. Then came the day when The Warden decided to declutter and change the rules for my lounger, apparently doing the yank and drag while barking with five blankets was creating chaos (her version of events).

title: Every once in awhile I like to think back to where it all began, I once was a slip of a girl stumbling around tripping over my ears trying to keep up with my nine brothers and sisters, until one day a family of four shows up, I did everything I could to get noticed but being the smallest I was afraid I might not be noticed. That's when a handsome prince picked me up and declared I was to be the new member of a forever family. I could tell one member of the family wasn't quite sure but it wasn't long before she started issuing orders and organizing my daily routine, that's the day I knew I was going to be alright, that's the day we all came to know her as The Warden.

media.title: Just a partial viewing of my biscuit dance, I accidentally bumped into the film crew which broke my rhythm.  My lounger is temporarily located in the main greeting area so I had to do a yank and drag while barking in a smaller confined area, I need my dance floor to be spacious with all my twists and turns. It's like when Shimmy Shaking Momma starts one of her dance routines, step back and give her room, one tassel goes astray and we'd all have a lifetime of seeing something we can't take back.

title: Every garden needs an eye catching feature, that's why it's important when planning the placement of shrubs and flowers you leave a little extra room for the occasional feature. Now in this particular case, being just a slip of a girl, I can squeeze in at the end of the rock formation. Not to get all worked up about a little dirt, one good roll and it'll blend in nicely, also with your sun bath you'll be smelling like fresh linen by the time you go inside. #gardeningtipsbymisslilly

media.title: It's a sad lonely existence, here I am in the backyard, fenced in with no human contact, except for The Warden but that doesn't count. Once in awhile I'll poke my nose under the gate trying to get a whiff of something, maybe someone will notice me and call the authorities. Yes I might whimper and sometimes I'll bark just to hear something besides the chirping of the birds and the occasional hey hey. If you are reading this please send in a rescue team and free me from this solitary confinement, all I want is a front yard with a view of human existence and maybe a platter of cheese.

When you can't get enough attention at your own house what do you do, you cross over to the neighbours lawn and let it be known that you are being neglected.  Yes I spent a good hour moving between the sun and shade, napping at each station while The Warden was trimming the bushes with one arm. Now I'm ready for some one on one and the only way to get the attention I deserve is to start off with a low level bark and wait for a response, if there's any kind of delay you are left with no choice but to ramp it up.  This is where it gets interesting, it always starts out with a few hey heys and then desperate times calls for desperate measures, she drops everything, calls me back over to our yard with sweet talk and lots of attention, works every time.

title: Did you know that airing out in the sun is equivalent to having a bath, unknown fact but true. It works better if there is a slight breeze, just remember to rotate to ensure full coverage. The smell can be compared to fresh linen where the sheets have been hanging out on a clothes line whipping in the breeze. Now living in an urban setting where there are bylaws about hanging your clothes outside may not have experienced this smell, so the next best thing is to find a Basset that's been sunning outside with a slight breeze and embrace their smell. As a side note maybe avoid smelling the neck area just in case they recently rolled in something stinky.

media.title: Here's the truth the whole truth and nothing but the truth as told by me, Miss Lilly. The Warden and I were getting ready to go outside, naturally I was excited, while The Warden was bent over taking off her slippers and socks I nudged to the front of the line, that left someone face level with my tail. I heard some muffled mumbling and by the time The Warden stood up she had a new hairdo and a flushed face, apparently my tail was whacking her in the face, oh well my bad. As a side note, even though you have a broken wing it shouldn't prevent you from getting a haircut, just saying.

Throwback to a quick reminder when we had cooler weather, a little dusting of snow and The Warden was able to shovel for a couple of hours. This was also when she thought I'd participate in a game of fetch, she'd toss her mitt and start chanting, get it get it, we tried that until her hand turned numb. The rules of winter fetch is to keep moving, where as summer fetch you can stretch out and soak up the sun. As a side note we're hoping The Wardens broken wing has mended by the time the snow flies, she needs to be shovel ready.

Do not, I repeat, do not turn your back on the new fireplace until you let it be known that this is your space and that you are in charge. Any and all attention is to be directed towards me, plus extra treats are to be given during this whole installation process. The Warden has started taking extra deep breaths because they're sanding the drywall today, the contractor is a bit nervous because he's picking up a weird vibe, every time he shows up someone is cleaning, all I can say is welcome to my world. In a way this is a good sign that The Warden is on the mend, the more she cleans the better she feels, before you know it she'll add a little shimmy to her step.

The standards are slipping around here, no hospital corners on my lounger, the new staff thought if you just toss my blanket towards the lounger it'll sort itself out. Where's the challenge in that, it doesn't inspire me to do the yank and drag while barking, oh how I miss the good ole days. Remember when The Warden would get all riled up and start with the hey heys, I'd just keep on barking and dragging the blanket across the floor, I'd fondly look up and see the famous eye twitching, these are the little things I miss. As a side note The Warden is doing much better, she's able to vacuum and do some little cleaning, that's how we gage her progress.

There's an art to supervising workmen at a job site, first off make sure you introduce yourself and let it be known that you are the eyes and ears of everything they do. Once you've exchanged greetings with a few rubs and a couple of 'you're a good girl' let them continue with their required work, I understand work ethic, I live with someone who has issues or as she likes to refer to it as high standards. I can also multitask while supervising, it would be a shame not to soak up the sun while at the same time watching someone else work. I'd also like to point out that The Warden didn't offer a cool beverage or snacks but I did offer them a drink from my bowl of fresh filtered water with ice, it's about giving back, paying it forward.

Word of warning, try not to frighten, knock over or slobber on any guests unless of course they first sign a waiver of all liability. On the other hand there are those guests that embrace the enthusiastic Basset greeting, as long as they squeeze through the door, bend their knees and brace themselves. The Warden is lurking in the shadows chanting, don't let her out, don't let her out, instead of a nice warm welcome, please come in, it's so nice to see you, can I offer you a beverage or a platter of cheese, she has a little work to do in becoming a gracious host.

I was sitting in the front room when all of a sudden I heard a familiar sound, The Warden was attempting to open a package of aged cheese, I immediately went to offer my assistance. She had an extremely large medieval knife and with a broken wing was having a difficult time cutting through the package. I might add at this point her language has become a little more colourful with harsh tones, with the help of her teeth she ripped open the package, it was a proud moment. Now I must say the slices were a little thicker than usual but I'm not one to complain, as a caring bystander I was rewarded several pieces of cheese, it pays to offer assistance to others when they are struggling with the little things.

A staff member offered to assist The Warden with setting up our daily routine outside, he set up a correct height chair for The Warden, laid out my blanket and filled my water bowl. The Warden had specific instructions for the water, tall glass half filled with water then fill the rest of the glass with large ice cubes. The first attempt was just a tall glass half full of ice cubes dumped into leftover water, the second and final attempt was two tall glasses, one half full of water and the other half full of ice cubes, The Warden decided that her broken wing shouldn't prohibit her from managing the little things. The moral of this story is to check your references when hiring new staff.

It's important to remember to keep your body on the grass while rolling, it's so easy to get distracted when you're wiggling around and it could be embarrassing if you ended up on the driveway. It can also be a great way work on your abs, helps enhance the definition, now as you are all aware there is a belly flap which hangs over the abs so at first glance you may not noticed the rippling muscles, trust me, it's there. As a side note The Warden is getting better with each day, she could be more generous with the cheese but I'm working on that.

title: The next phase of barking has begun as the construction of the new fireplace and bookshelves takes another step forward. There's been a lot of changes in the last few days, first with The Wardens broken wing and then with the construction, did I happen to mention that I don't like change. In order to calm my nerves The Warden took me into another room and gave me some medicinal cheese, I was more inclined to stick close to her, of course just to make sure her recovery was going well. Once everyone left and after the cleanup I went in to do a final inspection.

media.title: This is not my usual chair of choice to steal but because The Warden is now using it I feel obligated to occupy this sought after seat. It's a lift chair with a remote and I've spent a fair amount of time barking at this chair when we first got it but over time we've come to an understanding. It's all about choosing the right moment, she made the decision to get up without securing her spot and I didn't hesitate to make my move, forget about the couple of hey heys or the eye rolls, just snuggle in and act like the only thing getting you out of this chair is a crane or a piece of cheese.

Thank you all for sending your prayers and well wishes to The Warden, it's been so helpful and she is already feeling better with all this positive energy coming her way. To help in the recovery we are reminiscing about her almost world tour of singing and dancing (we don't mention it didn't happen due to the lack of talent), we also let her listen to the Dyson until we see that calm look come over her face. Each day there's progress and maybe in the near future there'll be a small roast simmering in gravy and a platter of medicinal cheese.

Update:  I've been promoted to Nurse Lilly, The Warden fell and fractured her shoulder. Here's another version of what happened while under the influence of pain meds, as only The Warden can tell. Buckle up here goes -she accepted the Bottle Cap Challenge, trying for a triple crown, during the attempt of the second cap, leg extended to unheard of heights, twisted around and drop like a lead balloon flat on the floor. At this point we would like to thank the first responders who were quick to respond and able to restore some of her dignity. I'm sticking very close to ensure she follows doctors orders, she must continue with my scratches as it helps build up her strength. Hopefully we'll be back in action and able to touch base with all our friends.

Technically I'm on the blanket so there should be no issues especially with those who have issues with a little hair in the air. Apparently this blue blanket is a super special blanket that acts as a hair magnet, wherever I am on the bed all the hair ends up attached to the blue blanket, amazing when you think about it. Another rule is no eating on the bed but if I happen to slip a biscuit past The Warden I must eat it on the blanket, it has amazing powers to also collect biscuit crumbs and hide gravy stains.

Not every biscuit dance is a complete success, if for example your gravy coated biscuit is too moist it may stick to the blanket, eventually with this one I was able to yank it free. Of course you must have a back up plan if all else fails, this is the one time where making eye contact is in your best interest, The Warden to the rescue. This gives her a purpose and helps build her self esteem, you'll probably have endure while she straightens your blanket and mutters about you being a good girl, in the end it's a win win for everyone.

This morning stroll through the urban jungle counts as another bath, so according to my calculations the next scheduled 'official' bath is now in the summer of 2021. If you reference the Basset Handbook baths are not to be given during the late fall, winter or early spring months, leaving a small window of bath opportunities, of course all this is dependent on the weather. You must have warm and dry conditions so after your bath you can go outside and immediately start rolling, it defeats the purpose of a bath if you roll in inclement weather.

Throwback to yesterday when my friend from the City stopped by to say hello, of course I let him know I was there and available for all his lavish attention. He was working on our street but took time out to say hello, we met him a couple of years ago while we were walking, now that he knows where we live hopefully he'll stop by again. Maybe next time The Warden can offer snacks and a nice cool beverage, it's what polite society would do, just putting it out there.

Just a little dab will do you until the next big roll, in order to keep your scent alive may I suggest you find a little nugget (eg. worm) lean in with your shoulder down and give your neck a good once over. If this enhancement brings others to cover their nose and start babbling incoherently it's a good indicator your mission was a success. Don't hesitate to top it up on a regular basis, just keep your head down and chances are you'll find the smell you want. If you sense that a few hey heys are coming your way then do a quick dab and keep on walking, do not, I repeat, do not make eye contact.

Get the ball, get the ball, that's The Warden trying once again to play fetch with me, what she doesn't understand is that fetch is seasonal and optional. I don't do fetch in the hot weather or if I don't feel like it, understanding of course my version of fetch, you excitedly throw the ball while babbling words of encouragement and then you fetch the ball, repeatedly. Yes of course there's always the chance I'll humour you and chase after the ball, run a few circles around the ball then go off sniffing, this gives you hope that one day I'll actually return the ball, you just gotta believe.

I have a question for you, is it impolite to bury a treat you receive from a neighbour?  Here's how it went down, he came over to our yard, slipped me a treat and The Warden knew immediately what I was doing, searching for a place to bury it. That's when The Warden started to apologize, as she was doing this I was in the garden digging a hole amongst the marigolds. Did you also know that marigolds are top heavy and have a tendency to easily break if you step on them, a little gardening tip. The Warden assured the neighbour that he was not responsible for replacing any flowers.

I was just sitting outside quietly when all of a sudden a car pulls up in front of our house, out gets four ladies all dressed in their Sunday best clutching handbags filled with flyers. I got up to greet them, tail engaged in helicopter mode, I was stretched out at the end of my line and ready to howl, that's when The Warden showed up. Only one nervous lady cautiously approached saying my aren't you friendly, that's when I heard from the cheap seats, careful she's heavier than she looks. That brought on a few teehee's as the lady quickly handed The Warden a flyer, she could tell she needed it, after a few words of getting on the right side of life she departed with no injuries and no flying slobber.

When all you want is a little me time, with no one stalking your every move or prying eyes watching what you roll in or dig up, just when you think you're alone you look up to see these beady little eyes looking out the window. What's the true definition of someone lurking in the shadows, it's called The Warden, she has control issues, so far the therapy isn't working.

The contractor put tape on the wall which I found a little disturbing, did I happen to mention that I don't like change. He started out by using a tape measure which set off a whole new round of barking, that rewarded me with cheese, it helped calm my nerves. Usually The Warden would take me outside to distract me but her input was required, the contractor would stop once in awhile to fuss over me and say everything is alright, it sounds better with cheese.

Throwback to my Canada Day celebration where I was given an almost never before seen fully loaded roast bone. As you may have predicted there were a few rules to abide by, first and foremost stay on the blanket, the staff hovered over closely and made a few adjustments along the way. Now when I say fully loaded it means there was some visible meat on the bone (squinting helped to see it), The Warden cut off all the fat and grizzle, I took advantage of this rare treat and to give thanks I licked the blanket after (saves washing it).

title: The Warden found this plant in her garden and was wondering if it was a weed or a crop growing plant, she has to know whether to yank it out or harvest it (looking for a little extra cash for treats). As advised by my attorney we are 'asking for a friend', this may or may not be in our garden, could be found outside the city limits with the same garden rock formation. Your answer will not implicate you in any court proceedings.

media.title: You ever get the feeling you're being watched every second, it's like they're waiting for the next big moment to happen. We all know The Warden has issues, also has a problem with boundaries and lurking tendencies, this might help us understand why she has night vision goggles. All I need is a quiet moment on my lounger with my gravy coated biscuit, go ahead and watch me eat, I have no issues with that, unlike someone else who doesn't snack because they don't like to be watched while eating.

title: Today is a day of celebration, Happy Canada Day ð¨ð¦, go ahead and kick up a little dirt, howl at the neighbours but remember to be polite, it's a Canadian thing. I'm hoping to celebrate by going for a walk, soaking up the sun, sniffing out the best BBQ's, getting a few hey heys and sharing the day with my family. We live in a great country and are proud to be Canadian ð¨ð¦

media.title: Apparently there was a tornado warning issued last night and we were to take cover, stay indoors and keep low to the floor. At least that's what I've been told, I didn't hear the high winds, hail or the torrential rain fall but I did remember to stretch and rotate over the course of the night. Later this morning, much later, I'll go outside to inspect the exercise yard for any damage, then will head out to the front yard, I imagine that The Warden will have to tidy up the garden just in case a stray leaf got loose.

Lucky day, I found this branch neatly stacked up and ready for disposal but guess what, one good yank and it was all mine. The other branches scattered a bit but not to worry the yard staff were on site and had everything back in order in no time, they'll come back for this branch later after I've chewed on it for awhile. That's the nice thing about well trained staff, they stand back in the shadows with their cleaning tools waiting for their shining moment.

There's me, Miss Lilly, and the blue bucket filled with gardening tools, now it's time to choose who you would like to spend more time with and don't take a lot of time pondering on this because the answer is me. Let's set the scene, you'll set up your chair with my blanket spread out beside you, before you settle in you'll need to refresh my bowl of filtered water with ice. Once you've done that drape your arm over the chair and commence with the scratches and rubs, if at any point your wrist seizes up that's a sign to switch hands. Go ahead relax, read your book and enjoy the nice weather, I'll let you know if I need anything else.

Throwback to yesterday when I wasn't included in the great rescue of 6 ducklings that fell through a grate along side the road. I was at the edge of our lawn offering up my assistance by barking, all I got was a couple of hey heys. People were stopping traffic as the mother duck was calling to her children, eventually someone got a large fishing net, removed the grate and scooped out the ducklings. The mother and her children were reunited and waddled off to safer ground. I waited at the edge of the lawn until someone stopped by and thanked me for my community involvement and drawing awareness to bird safety.

WARNING - This video may contain excessive barking. There's going to be an adjustment period before I completely except the new fireplace, right now I find it offensive to my sensibilities. My lounger has also been relocated in order to avoid any further drama, hopefully before the cold weather sets in I'll have made peace with the fireplace. Today the contractor will measure for the cabinets and bookshelves, I'll probably be asked to stay outside, can't understand why I'm not included in the process.

title: This was me yesterday getting lots of praise from The Warden for being so well behaved while the workers were inside installing the new fireplace. Yes I did greet the workers with a full on howl which informed everyone on the street that we were having some work done. I was on a short leash tethered to the front yard tree so I wouldn't be in the way, I'd also like to inform the authorities that I was given no snacks for three hours but I did have a bowl of fresh filtered water with ice, she did this to avoid being locked up, as you see with the evidence provided I was weak from hunger.

I hope you weren't expecting a great rabbit chase because that's all I had in me this morning. Before this I was in bed sleeping, that's when I heard a lot of whispering 'rabbit rabbit get the rabbit', so I meandered over to the door wondering what had The Warden so stirred up, that's when I saw the varmint.  I immediately locked eyes on him, my tail was up and my knees were bent ready to spring into action, The Warden quietly opened the door and I pounced, at least until the end of the deck. Now we all know that the rabbit was long gone, I had just woken up and the excitement had passed. Maybe if this was mid morning I might've attempted a perimeter search, I really don't do mornings.

media.title: Once again the urban jungle comes alive, you can feel the earth trembling and see the plants shaking as a predator stalks the unknown, could it be a lion, tiger or a local predator, squirrel, chipmunk, but no, out of the dark recesses of the jungle pops Miss Lilly, feared by no one. Just a slip of a girl gliding through the urban jungle protecting her exercise yard from all local varmints, we can now all feel safe for another day.

Not every roll is a success, just shake it off and hope no one was watching. When you finally find the perfect spot, you're leaning in for a dab on the neck when you discover there's been a slight miscalculation about where the grass ended but there was no doubt about where my line ended, never thought I'd be saying this but I was saved from falling onto the road by my carefully measured line. If you have one failed attempt at a stinky roll don't be discouraged just get back up and try again.

title: There can be some really intense moments while watching over the homestead, a couple of times I actually had to raise my head. I did do several stretches and relocated to the shade, passed out, then made another adjustment to the sun, busy busy day. At any moment you have to spring to attention, could be a delivery truck, possibly a neighbour moving around and with hopes and prayers maybe someone will stop by for a meet and greet. If things get really quiet I could bark at The Warden, that's always good for a couple of hey heys.

Throwback to the day I was accused of digging in the front garden, how is that possible, especially when it's patrolled with armed security (they carry garden tools and a broom). The Warden found a sizable paw print where the digging occurred, she immediately assumed that I was involved, upon the advice from my lawyer I refused to be interrogated and resumed my nap. Know your rights, stay strong and have your lawyer on speed dial. As a side note the dirt was cleaned up with a broom, good as new or as I see it, a blank canvas.

media.title: As you can imagine there were a few hey heys during my run around, The Warden gets all tied up in knots over a little whispering bark, let me take a moment to point out that we have received no official noise complaints about any barking.  Now I cannot confirm (I've been advised by my attorney) about any other complaints directed at someone else for disturbing the peace, these are all in sealed documents.

This room used to be the library, now it's a barren wasteland, hopefully by the end of the summer it'll be restored to its former glory with a fireplace.  To me it's a blank canvas, a great backdrop to eat my gravy coated biscuits, to do the yank and drag while barking, plus there's more room to drag with the added bonus of a barking echo. As a side note, if you want to enhance and moisten the gravy on your biscuit hold it in your mouth for a few minutes then spit it out, not to worry about gravy stains and crumbs on your blanket, the staff are well trained to deal with adversity.

All dad wanted for Fathers Day was to lay around on the couch and watch golf (after playing a round of golf), so I made the ultimate sacrifice and gave up my spot for him. He made one fatal error though, when he got up to get a snack my heat sensing detector kicked in and I immediately took his spot. He called The Warden to show her what just happened, she was sympathetic and giggled while saying 'sorry about your luck'. Because dad is not gifted in the art of teetering on the edge he decided to let me stay on the couch, Happy Fathers Day Dad.

From out of the urban jungle comes the mighty Miss Lilly setting record speeds, for some this may appear as a complete blur. The Warden also issued a warning about stepping on plants, in all the excitement I might've missed that particular order, not to worry though no harm done. Sometimes there's so much going on all I hear is blah blah blah, unless of course you're yelling cheese, that I hear loud and clear, brace yourself, coming at you full speed ahead.

Happy Birthday to our special little girl Miss Lilly who has filled our hearts to the brim. The Warden wasn't sure in the beginning about taking on such a responsibility, she watched from a slight distance until she realized she was needed. Miss Lilly had a few requirements, she needed lift service up on her new queen size bed and she needed to be surrounded by people that loved her endlessly. Hopefully we have been the forever family that Miss Lilly would have dreamed of.

There are times when being just a slip of a girl you have to bring a little attitude, otherwise you might not get noticed. I don't necessarily need attention all the time just most of the time, when I'm napping please consider this your free time. Trust me, when I do need some attention you'll know, I might bark, howl, whimper or whine, it's all about the little things, scratches, rubs, a little sweet talking, it's about spreading the love and giving you a purpose.

Throwback to when my brother was home for a short visit, we were all set up to enjoy a little sunshine, both of us had our fresh filtered water with ice but the staff refused to provide snacks. I had to remind my brother that it was possible to use one hand for the keyboard and the other for scratches, eventually he adapted and we enjoyed some quality time. As a side note, it's better if you don't wear a harness while sunning, it creates unseemly tan lines.

It's hard to admit failure but The Warden needs to confess that her winter project of growing flowers from seeds was a bust. Not that I'm complaining but I did spend the winter in a purple haze from the grow light under the table barking for nothing. My job now is to comfort The Warden from yet another failed attempt at stardom, her first attempt was to travel the world singing and dancing, it got cancelled due to lack of talent. There's no shame in admitting failure as long as you get back up and try again, I'll be here for her each and every time.

As part of the garden tour you are given a gravy coated biscuit to bury, this comes with the upgraded package, in the standard package no biscuits are included. There are a few guidelines to follow as you walk along the garden path, do not sit on, roll on or dig up any exhibits, the only exception are the weeds which can be removed at your discretion. As a side note, one of the exhibits I accidentally sat on last week have fully recovered, this has allowed my garden tour membership to be renewed.

title: Do not, I repeat, do not make eye contact when stealing a warm seat, now in saying that it's totally acceptable to gloat once you've established yourself. Now if this coveted spot is required again, apparently one person prefers this chair over all the others, then there's a good chance I'll be enhanced during the negotiations, I will not move for anything less than cheese or meat, I'll snub all other treats. Now the funny lady suggested bringing in a crane to lift me out, that's exactly why you do not make eye contact, try not to encourage her, she thinks it's amateur hour.

media.title: When taking your brother for a walk it's important to point out all the popular sites, especially every corner, bush and low hanging tree. He's great to walk with because he doesn't have yanking tendencies, he understands this is a journey not a marathon, you gotta walk a little and sniff a lot, that's the name of my game. Unlike some other unnamed person with control issues and who has a very busy schedule, my brother and I can just meander along, we'll get there eventually.

There I was minding my own howling business when I suddenly got a couple of hey heys, the delivery truck was at the end of the street so I had to howl otherwise they wouldn't notice me. When you're so tiny, just a slip of a girl, there's the chance you'll be overlooked, this is when you have to up your game, let them know you're there and that means howling. Of course The Warden shows up trying to steal my thunder, she's looking around to see if I'm disturbing the peace, when you have a shady background you're always looking over your shoulder, fortunately for me I have no restraining order or outstanding warrants.

title: Wouldn't it be nice if while you were lounging outside in the sun the staff surprised you with a picnic lunch. Just imagine, all along the rock ledge munchies would be displayed, it would be self serve as well as offering bowls of fresh filtered water with ice. There would be a platter of aged cheese with an assortment of deli meat and a small roast simmering in gravy, by the time you finished your gravy dippers would be shimmering and your belly full.  That's about the time I woke up and realized I was dreaming.

Throwback to the day I joined my forever family and when I realized I had some work to do. There were a few expectations or as I later came to realize it was a list of rules, which I now refer to as guidelines. First rule, no getting on the furniture, that suggestion lasted a couple of minutes, that's when the leader of the pack made sure I was provided with the lift service. My overnight accommodations (cage) lasted almost one night, once I started to whimper the leader came to my rescue, over time the pack leader became known as The Warden, she's been working on her control issues since day one, she's a work in progress.

media.title: There's one major hazard while touring through the urban jungle in the morning, it's wet and I don't do wet. Once you've done the tour it's important to make a quick exit, hoping that if you run at top speed the wetness will air dry and if at that point you still feel wet just shake it off. Now at this point I have been advised by my attorney to issue a warning, if you see me running at full speed and I'm heading straight for you, brace yourself for impact, just in case.

I got in a bit of trouble for 'excessive' whining while the family was enjoying a steak dinner, which I wasn't invited to. It started off when I jumped up to see what was on the counter, just a peek, nothing was within reach so no harm done but I got a hey hey. Once everyone was seated I started my rounds, looking for the weak link, they were all savages and wouldn't share so I had no choice but to vocalize (whine), hoping that someone with a heart would share. Eventually, The Warden cut up a tiny portion of steak, which you had to squint to see, although it was nicely displayed on a large plate, so the dinner wasn't a total disaster.

There I was just minding my own business when all of a sudden a varmint runs past me and scurries in the drain at the side of the house. I got low (lower) to the ground, my nose in the drain (my head wouldn't fit), I started pacing back and forth while barking, this is when the calvary arrived. The Warden kept her distance fretting and while dad entered the battle ground, he dismantled the drain, then out popped a chipmunk and made his escape. I sniffed every inch of that area and declared victory over an almost captured invader of my kingdom.

Take your time, stay on course, even if you feel the weight of someone lurking in the shadows. Totally ignore those hovering close by, stay focused and as long as you're not digging up the plants you shouldn't hear any hey heys. Don't worry about getting dirt on your diggers, one stroll across the wet grass you'll be clean as a whistle, if not the staff are well trained to follow your every step with a wet mop, it works well for everyone, they are happy to have a clean floor and a purpose in life.

title: It's a jungle out there, two ducks just wandered out of our garden and I'm not allowed outside to see what they are up to.  Would I chase them, there's a possibility but we won't know now will we because here I sit inside watching the world go by. When I do get outside I'll be tethered to the snowblower on a carefully calculated length of line, so the changes of me getting close to the ducks are slim to none.

media.title: It's that time of year when you find a tennis ball in the garden and The Warden gets all excited about playing fetch. Here's a refresher course in how the game is played, with enthusiasm wait for the ball to be thrown, once it's in the air take off at full speed, pick up the ball, circle around, drop the ball on the way back, run past the thrower and start barking. Now there's a bit of a delay when the thrower goes to get the ball and encourages you to fetch again, this is where you may or may not participate. With all that running around it stirs up some great scents in the grass and you may decide to take the time to sniff and forget all about the game of fetch, it happens.

title: Throwback to yesterday when I was helping in the garden, The Warden thought she should remind me of a few rules in order to avoid the little ugly fences. First off, no sitting or laying on the plants, good to know, might have miscalculated where I sat near the new plant. Then there was the standard rule of no barking (blah blah blah), save your breath, it's gonna happen so get your hey heys ready. One final rule, if I'm going to bury a biscuit in the garden I'm not to dig too close to the plants, now she tells me, might be another miscalculation.

I had to watch this baby bird from inside, mainly because it was raining and I don't do wet, also The Warden wouldn't let me near a baby bird. Several years ago I encountered a tiny bird which I was playing with, once The Warden saw me and the bird she started chasing me around, I had snatched up the bird and in a panic The Warden tried to pry my mouth open, well one thing lead to another. Moral of this story, do not give chase, it only fuels the adrenaline and unforeseen events may occur, The Warden still feels regret over her involvement.

media.title: While on my walk I noticed up ahead a black cat stepping lightly and looking back at me while arching his back. Probably looking for a meet and greet but The Warden issued a warning and held me back, that's when the cat sat down in the middle of the sidewalk staring at us. I kept tugging on the leash to get closer but we ended up taking a wide detour around the cat with the arched back. The Warden was in quite a state, totally intimidated by a little cat who was owning the sidewalk, I on the other hand was being dragged out of reach by a crazy lady trying not to have a meltdown.

title: There's a new strategy for my lounger, due to cutbacks I'm getting only one blanket at a time and as a bonus feature the colour will be a surprise.  Now there is a drawback, if I do a yank and drag while barking that leaves the lounger without a covering, totally exposing it to the elements, hair, slobber and a fresh new scent. Not to worry, it keeps The Warden busy and gives her a purpose, if she's happy we're all happy, now if only her happiness came with cheese.

media.title: It took several attempts to bury my new treat, I started out on the couch, then moved on to an undisclosed location and finally brought it home to this chair. First I had to ruffle up the blanket, try to jam it into the crease and after all this work it was time to settle in for a good chew. You may be thinking why not just start chewing your treat without all the hiding and burying it first, sometimes it tastes better when you put a little effort into, it's the satisfaction factor, if you work hard for something you appreciate it more, ancient Basset saying.

My treat cabinet was moved in order to accommodate the library, doesn't matter, I'll just bark at the books until I get a treat. If I was to design this wall I would've included a double wide treat cabinet, an accessible fridge with a cheese dispenser, a water cooler that offers small ice cubes and a lounger with untucked blankets. These are just a few simple designs ideas created by Miss Lilly.

I decided to try out the neighbours lawn while The Warden was fussing in the garden, no harm done. When I finally got up the grass was flattened but The Warden can fix that with her broom, just a couple of swipes and all was good. Is the grass always greener or are the worms smeller on the other side, not really, but can I get The Warden riled up and maybe get a few hey heys along the way, predictably yes, that's what makes this worth the risk.

title: Throwback to the other day when I was reminded about the seasonal rule of 'no barking at the screens'. During the fall/winter season the window screens are stored in the wine cellar (aka closet) or as I like to refer to it as the 'barking chamber'. So along comes spring and out comes the screens, it should be considered a celebration of nice weather, it's a barkable moment. Apparently The Warden didn't quite appreciate my enthusiasm for the unveiling of the screens, she entered the room with a few hey heys, just as I was getting ramped up.

You know that the warmer weather is finally here when it's time to lay out under the tree. I start by laying flat out in the driveway soaking up the sun, then I mosey on over to the grass and finally end up under the tree on my blanket. The Warden set up her chair, spread out my blanket beside her, that way she could have easy access to me for constant rubs, a few times I had to remind her to continue, either because she had to turn the page or her wrist was aggravated (she worked through the discomfort).

media.title: At times like this, when someone is staring at you, be confident, act like this is actually what you should be doing and you're proud of your accomplishment. You can't help it if you're surrounded by people with issues, I like to bury biscuits, get over it. I'll make you a deal, you can shimmy shake with tassels flying all over and I'll bury biscuits, that way we can all be happy (except for those who witness the shimmy, some things you can't unsee).

Don't worry about me, please I'll be fine, it's just me plus some empty bookshelves and no bed covered in blankets with tucked-in hospital corners. I bet some of you hardly noticed me, just a slip of a girl blending into the floor and then there are those that might be thinking gee-whiz this room will be easy to clean. It's now a barren wasteland with nothing moving except for the tumbleweeds of hair floating by.

I didn't want to report the neighbour but I saw them digging up yellow flowers in their front yard, it was a barkable offence. The Warden came running when I barked, apparently the yellow flowers were dandelions and the whole neighbourhood is looking to destroy the dandelion population. Personally I think dandelions interfere with the worm population which restricts the rolling possibilities, ancient Basset theory, I'm presenting this theory to you as something to ponder on.

title: It's a troubling time, the library is moving, everything is upside down, boxes of books are all over the house, I'm exhausted from barking. Did I happen to mention that I don't like change, it's terribly upsetting when something new is going on, remember the day the doily was added to the table, took me weeks to adjust to that. Now this room is being cleared for the installation of a fireplace and a new library, hopefully the builders will make room for my bed.

I was all set to go outside, I scratched the door which notified the staff who promptly arrived to assist. I then stood in the doorway with my head raised sniffing out any potential danger, once that was done I did an extended stretch, fully stretching back legs, one at a time, this could also be considered a strenuous workout at this time of the morning.  I tentatively took a step onto the deck and with the sun shining on my face I decided to seize the moment. Meanwhile The Warden was standing in the doorway waiting for me to hurry up and go do my business, all in good time, so she went on with her cleaning and came back later, I was still sunning.

media.title: Throwback to that time when The Warden and I were at home, all alone, let me set the stage. It was early morning and all was quiet, I was nestled in bed snoozing, The Warden was in the shower, that's when she noticed the door slowly opening, she tensed, holding her breath, waiting for the psycho scene to unfold. She grabbed the towel and slowly moved to the door, believing you should always face your fears, hugging the wall then peering out, fearing the worst. It was just me, I had nudged the door open a bit then fell asleep while waiting, I didn't realize that taking a shower was such a dramatic event.

title: If we start out sharing the couch there's no guaranteeing your spot will be saved if you get up and it doesn't matter if you were there first. When I first get up on the couch you'd hardly know I'm there, I'm all bunched up in the corner but there comes a time where I need to stretch and rotate. Now if you've mastered the art of teetering on the edge we'll get along just fine. As a special note, if my gravy dipper has assumed the blackout position, it's a warning, do not attempt to move, just back away and let sleeping dogs lie.

media.title: Busy busy day, now that spring is here it's all about getting the gardens ready. First step is slipping past security with your gravy coated biscuit, once you've done that head directly to the garden. Look for a spot close to the bush where you can bury the biscuit, dig a hole, not too deep, drop in the biscuit and start to cover up the evidence, I mean, cover up the biscuit. Once you've done that just walk away, don't look back, totally ignore the hey heys, you have every right to bury biscuits, if this goes to court you'll win paws down.

Hello Monday, in order to help prepare for the week I have a few suggestions, first off check out the fridge. There's leftover steak that needs to be cut up into bite size pieces and nicely displayed on a plate for me. Make sure there's enough aged cheese cut up and put into those little baggies, I love the sound when you open the bag.  All that other stuff, fruits and vegetables, knock yourself out, it's yours. It's important to prepare and plan for the week, the worst possible thing that can happen is if you run out of the essentials. Monday Motivational Tips By Miss Lilly.

Today will be all about The Warden, it's Mother's Day so I plan to make sure she gets her moment in the sun, as I lay next to her. I'll share my bowl of fresh filtered water with ice, my treats are her treats and hopefully there'll be the sweet smells of roast simmering in gravy. It's her special day so let the tassels fly as Shimmy Shaking Mamma has her judgement free Proud Mary Moment. Happy Mother's Day, may your gift today be a few kind words and with those words you can make someone smile.

Kiss me, kiss me now, you know you want to, come on, just a little closer. Next best thing is under the chin rub but take your mitts off because it could get a little messy, there's a tad of drool, come on you got nothing better to do. Update, The Warden did give me a rub and now her black mitts are covered in hair and slobber, so there was no turning back now so she wiped my face and I got a kiss on head, all it took was a little coaxing as I nudged in closer. As a side note the mitts washed up real nice and fluffy, ready for round two.

I had a surprise visit to the vets for a checkup where I was given a glowing review, but I had a couple of concerns, I think I'm suffering from a cheese and gravy deficiency. My overall well being would be greatly enhanced if I was given at least one serving of cheese and gravy per day. The medical research has proven that there's a correlation between happiness and cheese, who could argue with science. By the look of The Wardens downcast eyes I knew that she knew she was depriving me of my daily nutritional requirements.

Throwback to the day when I calmly waited at the door for company to arrive, this is an example of restraint and decorum. Now when the door opens all bets are off the table, this is where The Warden steps in with a warning to brace yourself, she's heavier than she looks and of course don't let her out. It's really not the best way to greet someone with all these instructions to follow, why not just say nothing and let nature take it's course.  After discussions with legal counsel The Warden has been advised to state any potential dangers when entering the premise.

title: It was a good chair stealing day for me, actually it was a double-header. It started out early morning, I was snoozing on one chair when I sensed movement, with one eye open I saw The Warden get out of her chair, I quietly and quickly made my move, before she could block the chair with a book I jumped up and claimed her seat, a proud moment. Later I saw her getting the couched lined up, with her back turned to me I pounced and once again claimed victory, these are special moments that should be celebrated. Not to worry, The Warden has a special weapon to get me to move, it's cheese, therefore it's a win win for everyone.

I decided to enjoy a little me time in the backyard, it's a secured area except for the occasional rabbits, chipmunks, squirrels and chirping birds. There I was soaking up the sun when all of a sudden the hairs on the back of my neck stood up, I looked over to the window, that's when I noticed a shadow, someone ducking out of sight, I've been out here for a few minutes all by myself and now security has raised all kinds of concerns. It appears that the inside security has major control issues and does not trust the surveillance equipment.

Finally a sunny day where I could lay out in the sun then retreat to cool off in the shade on my blanket. My bowl was replenished with fresh filtered water with ice and no varmint slobber. Not to worry, I kept active by barking at anything that moved, rolled on the grass a few times (worms are popping up) and to my delight I heard a few hey heys from The Warden (always looking for attention).

media.title: It's yard sale season, on my walk I noticed one whole street was buzzing with people, I couldn't wait to join in on the excitement.  Of course I had to stay on the sidewalk but a few people came to me for a meet and greet, most were impressed with my ears and ab definition. The Warden was all chatty with her one liners 'watch out for the slobber', 'she's heavier than she looks', 'brace yourself', yes she was on a roll but it was clear that she has issues.

title: Just remembering what could be, currently the garden is in a new beginning, so says the amateur with the garden tools. Because last year was a success without the little ugly fences I've been reassured they will not be installed this year. Of course there are some rules or as I like to refer to them as guidelines, no laying on the flowers or plants and no digging up new growth. I see no problem with any of these rules but I do have a few requirements of my own, there must be ample room to stretch out for sunning and the occasional digging in order to bury a biscuit, I ask for so little.

media.title: Thinking Back Friday, it's a day to think back and reflect on why I have to be tied up like an animal when I'm in the front yard.  Could it be the time I slipped past security and ran up the street, when I turned around there was a posse of people chasing me, which only added to my delight. I was ducking and weaving, going yard to yard, when all of a sudden I saw dad running up the street in his slippers yelling cheese cheese, that's about the time I thought it was time to turn myself in, as you see, crime did pay.

Throwback to the day when I had to report the staff for neglect and humiliation, I was left outside waiting while they were inside yucking it up. Probably hogging the couch and sneaking snacks, meanwhile I'm outside all by myself, starving, sitting on cold wooden boards and not even a drink of water to quench my thirst. The complaint will be dropped and all will be forgiven upon the following demands, a platter of cheese, one small roast simmering in gravy and a bowl of fresh filtered water with ice.

Every day my internal clock tells me it's time to start shadowing The Warden, just to let her know it's time for my supervised visit outside to the front yard. Every step she takes is every step I make (ð¶), now my clock sometimes starts a little early and she's not quite ready but that doesn't deter me at all, being persistent (annoying) pays off. At times she seems to be walking a little slower than usual and I keep bumping into her, it's just a little reminder that 'we' have other plans so put your cleaning tools aside because I've got the call.

Each gravy coated biscuit needs it's own ceremony before it's eaten, this particular biscuit does not include a biscuit dance.  Therefore the hospital corners will remain tucked on the lounger even though the audience has high expectations of a yank and drag while barking. First you moisten the gravy on the biscuit, gently spit out, then begin to eat your biscuit and don't forget to clean up any crumbs, the staff will appreciate your efforts. The next biscuit eating ceremony will have more of a dramatic flair, it's about keeping it fresh, building the anticipation and hoping you get a few hey heys.

When you're too tired to eat your treats, every morning I get a small selection of treats when I first get up and before I go outside, today I didn't make it outside.  Just getting up took some effort but I did make it to my treat blanket and that's where the journey ends until I gather more strength. When you're just a slip of a girl you need extra time to recover from a full night of sleep, so it's recommended that you eat a couple of snacks then rest up before you attempt to go outside. As they say, it's a process, all in good time, life's a journey not a marathon, I eventually made it outside and I'll save the treats for later.

There are times when you know you want to do a yank and drag while barking but are too tired to even put the blanket in your mouth. Look at those neatly tucked in hospital corners on my lounger, waiting to be ripped apart and dragged behind the chair. I have this need to get The Warden all riled up, maybe an eye twitch or a couple of hey heys but I'm also due for a nap, therefore I'll take a rain check on this performance and don't worry I'll be back.

title: Whenever I'm on my walk and I meet someone The Warden will announce 'watch out for the slobber'. There may be times where I'll do a slobber shake and someone will yell 'incoming' or 'take cover', which is immediately followed by 'sorry about that'. It's a lot of fuss about nothing, people love to be part of the action and if there's a little slobber who cares. I'm just a slip of a girl who has a delicate line of drool and a tad of a slobber shake, which should land somewhere below knee level if standing.

media.title: Pillows and blankets can sometimes be used to discourage you from stretching out and claiming this spot as your own. I say embrace the moment, it offers great head support and you can't buy the kind of looks I'm getting, the eye twitch and furrowed brow, priceless. Eventually I shared the couch when I had to stretch and rotate, that's when The Warden made her move, she said it's like laying on a balance beam, one wrong move could turn ugly.

Throwback to the day someone decided to bring a balloon into the house, it didn't go so well. Those were the days before our grow op with the purple haze, before the doily on the table, the days where everything had a place and everything was in it's place, except when I did a yank and drag while barking. I like order, predictability, unless of course it's a platter of cheese, which you can offer at any crazy time or under any circumstances.

My water bowl has been compromised, it was left outside overnight and now there's probably rabbit or chipmunk slobber skimming the surface. I do have standards and if it's not fresh filtered water with ice in a clean dish then forget it, I'm not drinking it. I ask for so little and now the staff are getting lazy, but don't worry about me, forget it now, I'll just sit over here on this cold slab of inlaid bricks, oh please take your time I'm sure you have more important things to do. Right now I can't even bark, my mouth is so dry.

It's a mystery to me how the blanket got dragged off the lounger and stuck to my head, once I got trapped underneath I became disoriented and started to wander, no harm no foul, (**)it happens. Sometimes life throws you a curve ball or the puck gets deflected or a blanket stuck to your head, in each case you have to roll with the punches and dust yourself off, it's life. Not every yank and drag while barking is a success, you get back in there and try again, life's a journey.

title: Being polite is important, I'm trying not to drool on my brothers dessert plate while he's still eating, I patiently wait until he's finished before I go in for the clean up. I might've nudged his arm a few times, stared deeply into his eyes and offered a couple of whimpers but at all times I remained polite. The plate was spit polished clean, not a crumb in sight but of course The Warden swooped in to gather up the dishes to wash them again, it's her need to feel important and to maintain her control over others. While she was doing all her fussy clean up it gave us a chance to have a nap.

Not everything goes according to plan, we'll do a cute little photo shoot featuring Miss Lilly with her Easter headdress (bunny ears). As it turned out she wasn't tired enough to endure a costume fitting and decided to chew the prop, so lesson learned, wait until the star of your feature is tuckered out and offers no resistance. Take a moment today and give thanks to all those small moments that make you smile, add them all together and feel the happiness, Happy Easter â¤ï¸

media.title: Returning to the scene of the alleged crime, this is supposedly where I buried a treat, the samples collected by The Warden have not tested positive for treats but did confirm rabbit droppings. Shame on you for thinking I would sully your sacred garden, well except for that one time you caught me on the surveillance tapes. I also have my own version of being in the garden that one time, the digging is for aeration and the said treat is for soil nutrition, case closed.

title: All I want for Easter is World Peace and a spring worm to roll on. No need to complicate the message, we need peace and a fresh worm so we can stick our legs in the air and wiggle around like you just don't care. Even after a rain the driveway now has worms, the trick is to get in for a quick dab of worm on the neck before The Warden starts chasing you away and yelling hey hey. Of course there's the threats of a spring bath but I'm not due for a bath until the summer of 2021 and besides you should never threaten a bath on Easter, just saying.

media.title: Throwback to the day when I had only one thin uninspiring blanket on my lounger, it was hardly worth burying a biscuit in. These were hard times my friends, no hospital corners, can't even imagine doing a yank and drag while barking, The Warden wasn't even on standby looking to straighten and tuck in. I'm just a slip of a girl blending into a bland world, in order to be creative I need colourful blankets, the audience deserves so much more.

title: There are times where howling is required and a delivery truck up the street is one of those times.  He heard me and made a special stop to fuss over me, he called me his sweet girl and gave me a treat, which I immediately buried in the garden.  The Warden watched from a distance and was thankful he left before I buried my treat, it's not shameful behaviour to bury such a cherished gift, it should be considered an honour. The Warden is just jealous he didn't call her sweet girl and give her a treat but she also didn't howl, howling wins once again.
