media.title: Here's how it really happened, while casually walking past the table (my tail was swishing) the doily accidentally slipped off, true story. At this point there was nothing else I could do except go get a treat and dine on the doily, who wouldn't. Now I suppose you're wondering how someone with issues would handle such a situation, she didn't bat an eye or say one hey hey, maybe she's been sitting too close to the purple haze, could she be mellowing out.

What's so annoying about barking under the grow op table, the acoustics are great and it helps stimulate plant growth, maybe The Warden should stand under the grow light, it might help with her tolerance level. I only go under the table once a day until I get a couple of hey heys or I get distracted by something else. I suppose I left out the fact that I usually go under the table at about the same time The Warden decides to sit down and relax, it could be just a coincidence.

Please don't judge, my abs are resting. That's why naps are so important, it gives your body a chance to completely relax, your muscles need to lay flat out, especially if your abs are extremely defined. In this resting position you can feel the tension leave your body, not a care in the world, unless of course the fridge door opens, that's when I spring into action. As a side note, cheese helps build ab definition, it's been medically proven.

title: We are now in double digit weather (+13), the grass is warm and I can almost smell the worms in the ground, yes it's that time of year to start rolling in the grass. The Warden made the sacrifice and let me stay outside in the front yard for three hours, under her supervision of course. While I lounged on the grass and driveway she was huddled in the garage, dressed in full winter attire plus blanket and spent her time reading. You can be assured that my every move was documented, noted and filed away for future reference, once a lurker always a lurker.

media.title: It's Friday, I had a great sleep and last night the Leafs won, now you may approach for my morning greeting. There'll be belly rubs, neck scratches, stretching, a lot of sweet talk, someone will get up close and personal with kisses all over my face, she's needy and has low self esteem so I indulge her. This is my start to the day, hopefully your day starts as good as mine.

Throwback to the day all my wishes came true, I started with a platter of aged cheese and a deli assortment, later in the day after my nap I had a small roast simmering in gravy, then I woke up and realized it was all a dream. I looked around and saw a couple of dry biscuits and someone hovering over me, that's when I decided to go back to my dream, maybe the next time I wake up it won't include someone wearing tassels.

title: May I present to you, new this year, Basset Garden Ornament, featuring the sultry Miss Lilly. Requires room to spread out in the freshly turned over dirt, digging may be expected and don't be surprised if sprouting plants get laid on. This backyard retreat has an open garden policy, no little ugly fences are permitted, all plants and shrubbery must be of a hardy nature, able to sustain the gentle trampling of the delicate Basset paws. Miss Lilly is just a slip of a girl and would make a great ornament to any garden setting.

media.title: With the warmer weather comes more rolling opportunities, I picked up a scent on the driveway that made me go in for a dab on the neck, but wait, the neighbour has company. It wouldn't be neighbourly if I didn't at least go over with a warm greeting, I'll start with a low whimper and if that doesn't get their attention I'll ramp it up and bark. In the background from the cheap seats you'll hear a few 'hey heys', a cautionary 'no jumping up' and the ever popular 'careful she's heavier than she looks'.

Caution: when you see me curled up in a tight little ball with tail to nose, do not approach, I repeat, do not approach, slowly back away as quietly as possible. This position is called 'do not disturb under any circumstances', forget about idle chatter and sweet talk, just bottle it up for later. If possible hold off on any noise related chores or activities, please respect my sleep boundaries. Once I start to stretch and rotate that's an indication you can approach, this would also be a great time to start planning the daily snack choices.

One of my blankets has moved to the great outdoors, it was freshly washed, no hair or slobber, so now it's time to make it my own. I won't need it when I'm sunning on the driveway but I'll definitely need it once we start sitting under the tree. This is when The Warden sets up her chair and spreads out my blanket beside her, she needs to have a sense of purpose. Now if only she can start to serve snacks while we lounge, that would be what's called having a purpose (she stays out of trouble if she keeps busy).

I'm patiently waiting for something to bark at, I'm also under heavy surveillance, I can't make a move without The Warden ready to pounce on me, she's also pretty quick with the hey heys. Some may think I'd get in the gardens and kick up a little dirt, well I tried that and it didn't go so well, security was first on the scene and proceeded to secure the area with barricades (little ugly fences). Not to worry I'm formulating another plan at this very moment.

title: All I heard was blah blah blah, something about time to come inside, there were a couple of hey heys, whatever. The sun is out, the driveway is warm, there are workers next door, so actually I'm quite busy and I find all that noise a bit distracting. The Warden was cold, it was -1 but with the sun shining the driveway was perfect for lounging, so she can either join me or find something else to do, I'm just not ready to go inside yet.

Throwback to the good ole days when I yanked The Wardens robe out of the closet and dragged it all over the house. There was one glitch while yanking, the shelf came loose, knocked the iron on the floor and this created a series of events. The good news was I got to keep the robe for a few days, I accessorize it with lots of hair, a bit of slobber and a fresh new smell. The funny thing is I haven't seen this robe since and as far as I know it's never been worn by The Warden, maybe it's time to revisit who should really own the robe.

media.title: The major decluttering at our house has now impacted my space, I have been reduced to three blankets on my lounger instead of five, when will this madness end. This summer I'm requesting an additional blanket for my outdoor lounging, so maybe one of these blankets can be recycled and reused. Everything is under scrutiny, if it doesn't serve a purpose or have an emotional attachment it's being removed, probably making room for more bookshelves (Houston, we have a problem).

After a lot of ripping around, doing a yank and drag while barking and watching the staff tidy up my lounger it's time to settle in for a quiet moment. I'll be keeping a close eye on the staff though, sometimes they have a tendency to wander and get into things that I don't know about. The kitchen is a good example, they have a history of 'light fingers' if you know what I mean. Even though they have a shady past with a sorted history it's important to give back to society by keeping them employed and off the streets, I'm doing my bit to keep the neighbourhood safe.

Is it really funny when someone yells 'look look there's cow outside' and of course you run to see a cow (don't know what a cow is), that's when the giggling starts, April Fools! I suppose for some this might be amusing, for others maybe an eye roll but for me I had high expectations, it was a chance to finally meet a cow. At least I can be thankful she didn't say a delivery truck full of cheese, that would've been down right cruel. Now as a side note, the cut off from trying to be funny is brunch, after that it's not funny.

There's a couple of things I have trouble with, first off I don't like going outside on someone else's schedule, secondly once I steal a freshly warm seat, I'm not moving. Having said that The Warden found a way to motivate me to move, there was a break in the weather and she wanted me to go outside to take care of business before it rained, plus she wanted her chair. First thing I heard was the fridge door open, then the cheese bag, oh yeah the sweet words I love to hear, who wants cheese, I immediately forgot about why I wasn't moving and went outside. It helps the process if The Warden goes outside with me luring me with cheese along the way.

What happens when dad leaves his pjs on the floor, well let me tell you. First off I get a gravy coated biscuit, drop it on his pjs then drag them across the room into the wine cellar (aka closet) all this while barking. Of course this draws the attention of someone with a low tolerance for barking and has a high frequency of eye twitches (her 'look' loses it's impact with the twitching eye). Not to worry, after a couple of hey heys The Warden picked up the pjs, dusted off the biscuit crumbs, rubbed in the slobber, nicely folded them and placed the pjs on the bed (no telltale signs of the great adventure they've just had).

It's Friday, which means either the end of the week or the beginning of the weekend, so I'll prepare for both. After a long gruelling week of day to day activities it's time to recharge before the weekend and of course after the weekend I'll need to recharge for the week. There's always the hope and dreams of a roast simmering in gravy presented on a large plate, it's been awhile since my gravy dippers slithered across a plate.

title: Throwback to the day the little dog up the street got loose, I was outside lounging when all the excitement started. She was running around in circles, going from yard to yard and heading my way with the rescue team hot on her heels. It was total chaos, people yelling and there she was heading right for me, I got down really low and joined in on the fun, she had me running around in circles. She made one mistake though, she ran in our garage and up the stairs, that's where they finally got her, it was a whirlwind of activity but I'm happy to be a part of all the excitement.

media.title: I'm trying to develop a new line of drool, starting with one line which comes in varying lengths, simple yet eye catching. This particular line immediately caught the attention of one of my admirers, their first reaction was to capture the drool to use as a moisturizer but held off because of it's beauty, dramatic and highlighted by the sun. Two lines of drool would be too much, overstated, keep it simple and classy.

It might only be -1 but with the sun shining on the pavement it's called a wonderful day. Eventually I'll move to the corner of grass close to the driveway where it's also warm, before you know it I'll be rolling on worms, that's when you know spring has finally arrived. The snow has finally melted in the front yard and The Warden has already cleaned the garage and will soon be getting out the yard tools for spring cleanup, the warmer weather is slowly coming our way.

There's one word I absolutely hate more than anything, it's 'stay', whenever I hear this word I totally deflate, my head and shoulders drop, my tail goes down and I slink off to the front room, all alone for which seems to be forever. There are other words that rub me the wrong way but aren't quite as harsh, let's take 'no' for example, this might appear on the surface to be the final say but I sometimes find it's negotiable, amazing what a little whimper can do or if you give 'the look'.

It's a lovely spring day with just a dusting of snow, the snow mountains are slowly disappearing and the ice rink which was an added feature this year has almost melted. I discovered a plastic bag trapped in the ice which has caused great concern, as soon as I can get close enough (brave enough), I'll pounce on that bag and rip it to shreds, something to look forward to later on.  I've also discovered a biscuit which was buried along side the mountain, once it's thawed a bit I'll try sneaking it back inside.

You just ate something didn't you, I know you did, it was ham wasn't it, I'm sure it was ham. By avoiding eye contact does not clear you of the crime, you have been charged with sneaking into the fridge and not sharing. You should know by now that eating anything from the fridge needs to be shared with others (me), I'm deeply offended that you would do this while I was napping. All will be forgiven if you return to the fridge and get me a piece of ham, that way we can put this whole incident behind us and hopefully you've learned your lesson, think before you sneak.

title: The Warden is imposing a new rule, no slobbering on her suede tasseled slippers, this might have to be negotiated down to a mere request. Due to the location of said slipper, under my chin, I can't be held responsible if I'm overcome with a slobber shake. Maybe just maybe you could wear the slippers draped in slobber as a badge of honour, that  shows you have a carefree attitude, you can go with the flow, you're easygoing, not someone wound up so tight with way too many issues, just saying.

media.title: Throwback to the attack of the furminator, you know that little needle like brush they rake across your back and then end up with a yard full of hair. It was payback time, The Warden set the brush down for a second on my outdoor blanket and I made my move, that was until I got distracted on the grass, sometimes you just catch a scent and you have to follow your nose.

Why do people hang flyers on your door and then just run away, it would be more polite to do a meet and greet. It would give me a chance to politely jump up on you, after of course The Warden tells you to brace yourself, something about liability.  That's also why you won't see a sign that says Beware Of Dog, it would be admitting that you knew there was a problem, especially if you didn't brace yourselves.

Enjoying a quiet moment in a sun spot, there are times where you need to dial it down a bit, take a step back and stretch out on your lounger.  Later I'll do the yank and drag while barking, probably go bark under the grow table and definitely go to the back door and pretend to want out. But for now I'll rest while I contemplate my next move, I don't want to become too predictable, it takes the suspense out of my next performance, it's about building the anticipation and keeps the audience wanting more.

The pondering moments of Monday, it's about setting up your daily schedule that includes plenty of time for a few quiet moments. Don't get caught up in the hustle and bustle of those around you, people who are this busy usually means they have issues. Pick a sun spot that's close to the window just in case there's movement outside, that's when you can raise the alarm by howling, barking and/or whimpering, it's always nice to have choices.

What better way to celebrate St Patrick's Day then with a round of scratches, the kind of rub down that floats hair in the air, the one that makes the eye twitch. I'm hoping it's a lucky day filled with extra treats, a large roast simmering in gravy, a platter with an assortment to cheese, a long sniffing walk and back to back naps. Oh to be so lucky, it's all about believing in your dreams, if you're gonna dream always dream big.

There are some things that I don't think need to be discussed openly, I discretely tooted which wrinkled a few noses, hands were waving in the air and fingers were pointing. I wasn't sure what all the fuss was about The Warden called foul, I know she has issues but she's making a mountain out of a molehill. It's impolite to point out ones passing of 'air' if it was done with discretion, I have my dignity to maintain and besides I really don't know what all the fuss was about, I dealt it so you deal with it.

title: This isn't right and shouldn't be here, this is what happens when the staff gets lazy and now it's up to me to sound the alarm. Maybe it's the purple haze from the grow light that's making everyone chill out, I'm waiting for the next phase where they get the munchies and start ordering in pizza. Who knows what this place would look like if it wasn't for me doing regular patrols in order to maintain some sense of discipline, these people are out of control.

Throwback to when I didn't have a care in the world and could just lay around soaking up the sun. The Warden made sure I had fresh filtered water with ice, my outdoor blanket was spread out and the little reminders to rotate in and out of the sun, yes the good ole days. It's important to have well trained staff that are attentive, it helps take the burden off you and you can devote your time to the little things. The only thing missing was a platter of cheese with a deli assortment but that's what dreams are all about.

media.title: Beware, danger alert, everybody stand back, there's thin ice, we need to rope this area off. I was out sniffing around when all of a sudden the ice broke from underneath me, I somehow managed to save myself in the nick of time before I went under, this is where The Warden will say there was only an inch of water but it was me at the edge of danger scrambling to save myself. I'm issuing a warning to all, especially if you are just a slip of a girl, stay away from the centre of the ice, keep to the edges when you're out sniffing.

Biscuit Burying Tuesday, make sure you take your time and do it up right. Use all the blankets at your disposal and don't worry about gravy stains from your gravy coated biscuits, the staff are well trained and will wash your troubles away. It's not necessary to do a biscuit dance every time, mix it up, be unpredictable, there are times when you want to slow it down and just bury it. Ignore all outside distractions unless of course they make a move towards the fridge, cheese trumps gravy coated biscuits, there's definitely a pecking order.

A little Monday attitude for you, just to get the day started. This isn't the full on attitude just a glimpse, you can't expect a high performance each and every time, it's about building the anticipation, keeping the audience wanting more. For this particular performance there was no hey heys, no twitching eye, all I got was the occasional glance which was hardly worth the effort. Sometimes you have to know when to walk away, don't look back, just walk out and drop the mike, see you later alligator, curtain closed.

How to deal with a time change, first off, don't get up, unless of course you smell bacon or hear the fridge door open then it's a must to get up and investigate. If they are being lazy and don't make a big breakfast to celebrate the time change then wait until brunch, by this time your body should have made the necessary adjustments. Make sure you double down on your naps throughout the day, you don't want to risk being sleep deprived, as a special note make sure you stretch and rotate several times during your extended naps, this helps to maintain your physical fitness level.

Every day I get under this grow table and bark, I find there's a echo that hits the table which helps stimulate growth. The purple haze you see is not for mood lighting it's from the grow light, which probably raises a whole lotta questions, The Warden is attempting to grow zinnias from seeds, at least that's what she told the officer. I'm just uncomfortable with this whole setup, I don't like change, there's a place for everything and everything should be in it's place, good lord I'm starting to sound like The Warden.

In honour of International Women's Day we will celebrate the little things that are often overlooked and sometimes not appreciated. What good would the yank and drag while barking be without hospital corners and the remaking of my lounger several times a day. My bowl of fresh filtered water with ice replenished every sip I take, these are the little things that sometimes get overlooked. We also honour those savouring moments when we have a roast simmering in gravy with a chaser of aged cheese. Today we spread a little love to women for all the little things they do to that sometimes go unnoticed.

Throwback to the warmer days when you could walk through the garden and kick up a little dirt. What happens in the dirt stays in the dirt, especially if you bury a biscuit. The current state of the garden is covered in snow and ice and it's impossible to bury anything, so I'm taking a few minutes to reflect on the good ole days in the dirt. Not to worry about bringing dirt into the house, the staff are trained to deal with these occasional circumstances.

Throwback to yesterday when I spotted a workman across the street, so it turned out to be a busy afternoon. Not only did I finally get to see someone I also was able to get in a cardio workout, the steady stream of whining works on the upper body while the continuous movement of the tail is great for the abs. During the winter months it's important to adapt your physical fitness training to your indoor environment, this particular exercise could apply to any movement seen outside, take advantage of anything that moves. After a strenuous workout it's important to nap, helps with the recovery process.

It's about preparation and setting the mood for when you eat your gravy coated biscuit. First of all you have to set the stage, in my case I yanked a couple of blankets off my lounger while barking, this gets the audience stirred up for the next act (there was eye twitching and a couple of hey heys). Now that you have everyone's attention you savour the moment, let them anticipate your next move, draw them in, before you know it they'll be dripping with drool. Make sure you eat your biscuit before they get distracted and start thinking about the cleanup.

I prefer to do the yard inspection after the snow removal crew has put the finishing touches on their masterpiece.  It was just enough snow to cover all the rabbit prints but I could still smell 'hare' in the air, I'd say there were at least two, light brown and strong teeth (according to all the bark they've been eating off the shrubs). Now The Warden has her own detective ways of making an identification, she's collecting evidence in poop bags, two different dropping samples, different sizes and colour, it all adds up to two rabbits, case closed.

title: It was a bit of a struggle but I finally yanked the blanket off the chair, with no help from anyone else, just a few hey heys from the cheap seats. It's a large blanket making it difficult to drag between the chair and doily covered table, again with no help thank you very much. Who are these people that can just sit back and watch while someone is struggling to do the yank and drag while barking. I eventually had to give up and once I did that look who shows up to the party, The Warden, she steps in to do her cleanup routine which will nicely set the stage for round two.

media.title: I would like to report some suspicious activity, there's a shady lady lurking around in the kitchen, a possible break and enter into the fridge, could be a theft of the aged cheese on the second shelf. Assistance is required to apprehend suspect, approach with caution, has a history of being armed with cleaning supplies, reinforcements may be required if she starts to shimmy. If any cheese is found please leave on a large plate near the water bowl, trust me, I'll make sure it's properly recorded and put into evidence.

Here's a sign that I'm not going outside, if my shoulders are behind the door and my nose is the only thing sticking out, that's a sign. I will not go out before my time, so go ahead and babble on with your words of encouragement, maybe even threaten a boot to the butt, I'm still not budging. Ok, let's take a step back, there is one way to get me outside, first of all put on your coat, hat, mitts, boots and take a step outside on the deck, now here's where things get interesting, you must be holding a substantial piece of cheese, that'll work.

title: Throwback to the day when I discovered that burying large quantities of biscuits in the furniture was a federal offense. This was a bit of a setback for The Warden who thought she had complete control only to discover the inmates had taken over. This resulted in a complete shakedown, all the furniture was torn apart and resulted in a thorough inspection of every nook and cranny. This was awhile ago and we are happy to report The Warden made a full recovery and can now speak openly about this event under the advisement of her caregivers.

media.title: It's important to be a good listener even if you're not, because there's gonna be that one time where they might say something worth listening to, instead of the usual blah blah blah.  I fondly remember that time when I was asked if I wanted a piece of cheese, hello, of course I wanted cheese, please do say more. I don't mind that soft lilting voice whispering sweet nothings, it probably means they have low self esteem and need me to reassure them that they are worthy of my devotion.

We just added another feature to the backyard, a pad of ice, not quite big enough for a pickup game of shinny but we can do a little slipping and sliding. Backyard tours are available upon request, the most notable is still Mt Warden, snow banks which I refer to as the upper deck (great for daily deposits) and now we have an ice rink. Refreshments will be provided at the end of each tour, a platter of cheese with deli assortments, a bowl of fresh filtered water with ice and one gravy coated biscuit, come one come all.

The Warden is taking issue with my choice of location while doing my business, I currently have a preference for using the snow bank in the backyard. I personally don't have any issues, so not my problem. Her preference would be to pickup deposits from the ground and not climb a snow bank, I can't get involved with someone else's issues, if I start now it'll become my life's work and I don't do work. My advice, just settle down, take a deep breath and wait till spring.

title: I had to let everyone know I'm once again in the front yard, it's been awhile but today was +2 and it's time to shake things up. Unfortunately no one was around except The Warden who was sweeping the garage and making sure everything was in its place. Of course there were a few hey heys as I got tangled around the tree, then around a bush and for excessive barking but overall it was successful outing even though there was not a soul in sight.

media.title: Now if we can return our attention to the latest book on how to raise the modern Basset in an urban setting, let's focus on page 134 which explains how cheese can enhance ones overall good health and happiness. With a generous portion of cheese per day you'll notice immediately a decrease in begging tendencies which will increase the overall happiness within the family. The studies have shown a more relaxed atmosphere, with less eye twitching and an increase in scratches and rubs. A warning was issued that extra hair in the air may incite the over use of the Dyson.

This time it's for real, dad is in the driveway talking to a neighbour and they are yucking it up, probably at my expense. At this point I want you to notice how composed I am, no jumping up and scratching the door, my barking is restrained to a medium range and the helicopter tail means I'm about ready for takeoff (keep your distance, may knock you off balance if too close). Fortunately dad wrapped it up and we were able to go for a much needed walk.

Throwback to when the urban jungle was in full bloom, the good ole days of running around free as the breeze or as free as you can be within the confines of the fenced yard. Not to worry though I can always escape those prying eyes amongst the plants, it's my sanctuary, my getaway from the constant lurking of those who hide in the shadows, you know who you are, come out come out wherever you are.

title: Follow the evidence, there's a space behind the neighbours shed and the fence where predators could enter our yard, I followed the tracks and possibly solved the mystery of how rabbits were sneaking into the yard. They're also making a mess and nibbling on the tree, hopefully no permanent damage is done and are just doing a little trim work. It's been really cold so I'm able to walk on top of the snow and make this great discovery, now it's up to The Warden to secure the yard. My work is done and sniffing has once again paid off, now for payment I deserve not just a lousy treat but a small roast simmering in gravy.

Sometimes you just throw caution in the air like you just don't care, keep on scratching till you're covered in hair. I had the best rub down from The Warden just before she was set to vacuum, there was hair in the air and her eye wasn't even twitching as she fondly looks over at her Dyson. Did you know that if you walk in a pile of hair it clings to you and scatters all over, this is a fun fact brought to you by The Warden.

media.title: I saw a rabbit, it's still unclear how they're getting in the yard but The Warden has a few theories. At each exit point and around the fence line it is closed off by the snow and no visible tunnels are seen, therefore, one theory is they're jumping over the fence. I know it sounds crazy because their legs are shorter than mine (at a quick glance their legs were a blur), but there's one problem, I keep sinking in the snow which makes jumping impossible at least for me. The Warden pointed out that I may be a tad heavier by just a 'hare' (hair, she's trying to be funny again).

I like to help where I can, especially if it's laundry day, as soon as I see sheets or clothes on floor it's biscuit dance time. I grab a gravy coated biscuit, drop it on the dance floor and then let's get this party started, you'll hear a lot of barking and a few hey heys. Of course there are a few rules, most of them can be ignored, a few rules can be bent but there's one rule that's hard to break and that's getting a biscuit up on the bed. I require the lift service to get up on the bed and security (The Warden) won't let me up if I have a biscuit, she has a tendency to dampen the moment.

title: Well it's happened, we are now living in a grow house. The Warden collected seeds over the past summer and decided to try and grow flowers, it's been six days and all seeds have poked through the dirt. It's hard getting used to everything being out of place, plus there's a grow light and who knows when there'll be a knock on the door from the authorities wanting to inspect our plants. The Warden has no idea what's she's doing, it's about figuring things out along the way and hoping for the best.

media.title: The snow crew just finished the final cleanup after three days of snow, now there's lots of room to run around and as an added bonus the rock ledge has been cleared. Mt Warden has just about reached its limit according to city bylaws, apparently if it gets any higher we will require a building permit. Due to time constraints and lack of artistic vision The Warden was unable to create a snow sculpture, I suppose after two hours of shoveling your creative energy freezes up.

There are many ways to show that you love and care about others, my family spends hours shoveling the backyard so I have a place to sniff and roam around, they lay out a selection of treats for me to choose, I get lift service to my bed at night, they cheer me on with hey heys at each and every performance and they offer plenty of scratches and rubs no matter how much hair is scattered, this is what family is all about.  Happy Valentine's Day to all my friends on IG who generously share their love, their time and their humour with us.

The whole truth and nothing but the truth, this is how it went down. Dads dress shirt was laid out for work and somehow ended up on the floor, that's when I made my move.  I dropped a gravy coated biscuit on the shirt and started the twist and shout, otherwise known as the yank and drag while barking, formally known as the biscuit dance. It was a lengthy drag, out one room into another, after that I settled in and ate the biscuit. This was when The Warden showed up and noticed the gravy stain on the shirt, may I suggest that today you wear a sweater or a vest, due to the cold weather of course.

It's time for cold weather shenanigans, something the crowd loves, at least according to all the rave reviews and the hey heys. The Warden was expecting a little quiet time so I muffled my barking by doing it under the blanket, there should be no complaints now, it's like a quiet whisper in the breeze. Sometimes you have to adapt your performance to accommodate a fickle audience but never let this dampen your enthusiasm. Deep down you know they love everything you do so why not give them what they want.

If you require my assistance this morning take a number, leave a message, don't call me I'll call you, slowly back up and tiptoe on out or just contact the staff and they'll address all issues. Monday's are about setting the pace for the week, put all your cares on the back shelf and take the easy road. If you want to introduce some casual conversation then schedule me in for brunch, by then my tolerance level has elevated.

That's right, that's the spot, keep scratching till there's hair in the air and The Wardens eye starts to do the jitterbug. How do you know it was a great scratch, when it looks like tumbleweeds of hair floating across the floor, yes after this session The Warden had to break the company rule and get the vacuum out (it's not polite to vacuum when there's a social gathering). My brother came home for a short visit, I took him on a long walk and he gave me lots of special attention.

Be on the lookout for a long chewy stick, last seen on the lounger in the reading room. This was a recently purchased stick and soon after the initial chew it disappeared. The Warden has done a thorough search of all furniture, looked in all known hiding spots and even checked in the weather boots. UPDATE, after an exhaustive search dad reported that I was last seen on the couch enjoying my chewy stick until it was all gone, a tired looking Warden said 'good to know' (crisis averted).

All signs lead to this side of the house, there's a hint of rabbit in the air, looks like they've dug their way under the gate again, hopped along the snow bank (leaving a small deposit) and finally landing in the yard, rabbit infiltration case solved. I would've extended my search to the gate except I keep sinking into the snow and I didn't want to risk getting stuck which would've caused a panic situation by The Warden, besides I don't want to distract her from getting my treats ready for when I come inside.

Throwback to yesterday when the staff refused to once again crawl around on the floor and retrieve one of my newly found squeaky balls, it was stuck under the chair. The first several times were filled with great excitement and enthusiasm with our heads locked together looking under the furniture, all this while barking of course. Could it be they're getting old and lazy, not as limber as they once were, can't tolerate sudden outbursts of barking, is this what's happening, next I'll find them napping covered in a blanket. I've got this feeling that suddenly my squeaky balls will once again disappear, it's just a feeling.

title: I like to bend the rules, just enough so the rule maker can see the error of her ways. As you know by now I must lay on the blue blanket while on the bed, does one paw count or would you like to amend the rule to say every hair from the tip of my tail to the end of my ear must be on the blue blanket. I would like to amend the laying on the blue blanket rule myself, if the warm spot is outside the blue line then I am within my rights to choose an alternative spot. There should also be a nesting clause or a stretch and rotate amendment, unless the bed has full coverage of said blanket then you can kiss the blue blanket rule goodbye.

The milder weather has come and slowly Mt Warden is turning into a hill. The yard has also become a skating rink so The Warden had to spread ice melt (Safe Paws) in order to avoid anyone from slipping and falling. Also discovered under the snow is an alarming amount of rabbit droppings, we are under attack. The Warden is looking for a vacuum designed for pickups of this nature, a small reward is being offered.

media.title: Guess what I found, one of my favourite squeaky balls, every once in awhile they disappear for some unknown reason and then like magic they reappear. Could it be that I like to hide the ball under things, while at the same time barking, then wait for the rescue team to show up and help recover the lost item, apparently this wears thin after the first few times. My personal favourite is when the ball is trapped under the furniture and we're all down on the floor, head to head, searching, while I'm barking, tons of fun.

title: The neighbour sent us a picture of a sky predator that was lurking close by, The Warden immediately went into action and became a drama queen, she wanted me to wear a sign 'do not attempt an inflight pick up, she's heavier than she looks'. She said it was a precautionary measure, with the extreme cold weather food will be scarce and from a distance I might look like a tasty morsel. Being just a slip of a girl does have it's drawbacks but not to worry, The Warden has her laser beam eyes peeled to the sky looking for any signs of danger.

media.title: I had a late night performance, Dad was playing bridge and I stuck around to entertain, also they were having half time snacks which turned out to be cheese and fruit (dads lifestyle choices). When everyone arrived I did the usual greeting of barking, jumping up and then I decided to do laps around the house, everyone thoroughly enjoyed this. The Warden came out for this act, she said it sounded like a herd of elephants, she was surprised that a little slip of a girl could make such a dainty sound, isn't she fun to have around.

You can't expect to nap away the day during this cold snap so in order to liven things up I'm attempting a yank and drag while barking, except I ran into a stumbling block. The hospital corners are holding firm which is making it a little more difficult than expected, but not to worry the audience loves what I've done so far. If you're getting 'the look' at any point just cover your eyes and ignore, eventually the cheap seats will start chanting hey hey, that's when you up your game.

Throwback to yesterday when The Warden thought it was Thursday, it's all the extra shoveling that's throwing everything off. We've named one of the snow mountains after the cleanup crew, Mount Warden, hopefully this will inspire her to shovel another day. I'm still limiting my time outside due to the cold weather but in order to get extra treats I have to make the effort to appear as though I want to go out, I'm finding that the staff are not as generous after a couple of failed attempts to actually go outside.

Throwback to when dad helped someone with math and they gave him a cheese parcel as a gift for extra tutoring, well I was also there, who do you think was barking and jumping up (The Warden had to restrain me) but nonetheless I was there. I believe I was the inspiration and motivation to work extra hard to achieve better marks, jumping up and barking does pay off. At no time did I mention that I liked cheese but if you need extra help in math I know someone who can help and really really likes cheese.

title: I know the rules, whenever I lay on the bed I must make sure I'm on the blue blanket (blah blah blah), not to worry I've got this covered. Of course the odd stray hair or two might accidentally fall into forbidden territory but it's nothing the staff can't deal with, they are well trained in such matters. Now all bets are off if I do a stretch and rotate, once I do a few circles around it's hard to predict where I'll end up, it's like throwing the dice, you take your chances.

media.title: Just a reminder when the temperature is -21 it's important to keep your outdoor fitness training to short bursts, as an athlete you'll want to do a mini marathon so you might want to consider doing this inside. Also while selecting just the right spot when nature calls do not prolong your sniffing, pick a spot close to the door, this also helps the lurker when they do their daily deposit pickup. This is your Monday helpful hints brought to you by Miss Lilly.

There was a little bit of movement on the street, one neighbour was shoveling the driveway and the little dog up the street was walking her staff. I would also like to point out my contained excitement, there was no jumping up on the door, no smearing the glass with slobber, not once did I howl or bark, I maintained complete control and kept my dignity. I like to be the example of model behaviour and in such cases should be rewarded accordingly, The Warden will often say you shouldn't reward bad behaviour, so wouldn't you all agree this behaviour should be rewarded with some aged cheese, your vote of confidence would be greatly appreciated.

After filing an official complaint about my broken biscuits the Company send us coupons to help us overcome any undue distress. The Warden had to explain that I would only eat whole biscuits and would disregard all others, it's not that I'm fussy I just have standards. Several boxes had a large number of broken biscuits which was unusual and worth letting the Company know, these gravy coated biscuits are the only biscuits worth eating and using for my biscuit dance, all others are not worth a second glance, I just know what I like.

I finally made an escape and had a brief moment of freedom but it was so cold I only did one lap around the driveway. There was a delivery and when The Warden opened the door I wiggled my way past everyone, I was on the freedom trail. Besides the cold weather I had the mail lady and The Warden both yelling cheese cheese, who could resist the sweet sounds of cheese. It was a 30 second moment of adrenaline fueled excitement, I was out in the real world exploring the great unknown, there wasn't much to see except ice and snow.

Throwback to last night as told by The Warden, she was sleeping soundly, probably dreaming of cleaning, all of a sudden she bolted upright at the sound of me howling, it was 2:21 am, her heart was pounding and she was teetering on the edge of the bed. She looked over at me and there I was curled up in a tight little ball sleeping like a baby. I'm not sure I howled, she was probably having a nightmare about vacuuming when all of a sudden it broke down, the eerie silence woke her up.

title: Great news, the large oversized doily has finally been removed. I approached with caution and slowly but surely it started slipping and sliding off. It can't be considered a full on yank, due to the delicate nature of the material I had to use a more gentle approach, that is until it hit the floor then all bets were off. There were a couple of hey heys from the cheap seats, probably congratulating me for a job well done.

It's been only short visits to the exercise yard and as you can see the snow crew were able to make the yard accessible, we are still in a deep freeze -23 so we have to limit our time outside. The good news is everything is frozen solid so when The Warden does her rounds for pickups it's one quick scoop and no fuss. I haven't been able to go on any walks for a few days so I've been taking a few extra naps and providing The Warden with a bit of entertainment.

Oh no, oh no, what the....This is what The Warden was muttering when she discovered her winter boot filled with kibble. This happened so long ago I almost forgot about it and unfortunately I think it'll take The Warden a little bit longer to get over this one, it's a slight setback but with time we expect a full recovery.  In lieu of flowers please send cheese, it pairs nicely with the wine she'll be drinking.

media.title: Another round with the offensive table cloth, I still haven't tried to yank it off yet but I've tried almost everything else. The barking helps me focus, I'm also stating loud and clear that the table cloth needs to go, it has no function and it looks like a doily, if you're asking yourself what is a doily then I've made my point, nobody knows what a doily is (except The Warden who thinks we should bring back the crocheted vest).

Due to the severe cold weather I'll be scheduling an extra round of indoor shenanigans later this morning, after my extended morning nap of course. The Warden even gave up her chair, willingly I might add, to keep me occupied while she fusses around. I also think during this cold spell it would be nice to fill the house with the sweet smells of roast simmering in gravy, it adds to the ambience, just putting it out there, laying the ground work, hopefully she's picking up what I'm laying down.

What do you do when you see the door to the wine cellar open, you enter and start barking, classic move. Why The Warden gets all riled up is beyond me, the wine is safe behind the door but still worth barking at and now that the calvary has arrived I won't be getting trapped inside. What you can't see is the gravy coated biscuit in the dark corner, it's for emergency purposes only, the response team is taking longer and longer each time I get locked in behind the door.

I bet all you saw was a blur as I ran around the yard, I actually did a few more laps around the yard but the film crew was fumbling with the equipment. Careful when you take those tight corners that you don't spin out, use your back legs for maximum speed and when you finish remember to shake it off, helps with the recovery.  This was a throwback to yesterday when we had a light dusting of snow, in the next few days we're expecting a mountain of snow so the staff will be extra busy and I'll be monitoring their progress from inside.

The Warden came in early to check on me and while she was kissing on me I detected a slight hint of chicken, sautÃ©ed in garlic and lightly seasoned. Just to be sure I continued to sniff her breath even though she was clamping her lips tight I confirmed it was chicken.  There's a sense of betrayal, while I was fulfilling my quota of sleep she was in the kitchen cooking chicken, unattended, who knows what else she was doing. Can't a gal have a moment of peace without someone sneaking around and snacking on chicken.

I noticed amongst my selection of gravy coated biscuits that a few of them were broken, I don't like and won't eat broken biscuits. Each day The Warden sets out four biscuits, lately I've noticed half biscuits, these biscuits don't count, so you might as well box them up and return them to the store or give them away to someone who cares because I won't eat them. You can't even do a proper biscuit dance with a half biscuit, the idea is insulting, I'm starting to question the competency of the staff.

While watching out the window I finally saw some movement, up the street I spotted a delivery truck, that's when I started howling and that set off a series of events. The Warden came running all in a panic, her cleaning supplies flying all over, at one point I thought we'd have to call in the medics. That's when she realized I was just excited to see someone, with this extreme cold weather I've been inside more and not able to go out and do a meet and greet. Talk about overreacting, I haven't seen her get that all stirred up since her last Proud Mary Moment.

title: Not everything goes according to plan, sometimes you have to adapt or pretend this is exactly what I was hoping for. This started out as a yank and drag while barking but I took a wrong turn, instead of going across the floor I ended up on my lounger and then things turned ugly. There was a bit of a struggle and a couple of hey heys from the cheap seats until they realized some assistance was required.

media.title: Stealing The Wardens chair is a rare event and I take great pride when it happens, especially when she stands up and I slip in behind her and boom I'm on the chair. Sometimes I think she deliberately lets me do this, for example, I'm doing a little barking (for no reason) and she wants some quiet time, she'll get out of her chair without placing a book on the seat, that's the first clue, the second clue is when she says to dad 'watch this', that's when I make my move. Once I'm in this chair there's only one thing that'll get me outta here, cheese.

Just finished another round with the table cloth, it clearly shouldn't be there and no amount of barking has convinced The Warden to remove it.  She's feeling quite confident now because I've yet to yank it off and surprisingly nothing has fallen off which would definitely set off a whole new round of barking. The Warden has been decluttering, getting rid of anything that doesn't serve a purpose, well look no further, that table cloth is offensive and serves no purpose except to annoy.

title: Throwback to my early years and where it all began, one of the first rules was no sleeping on the furniture, after a couple of whimpers The Warden stepped in and insisted someone offer me a lift up. Another rule I was to sleep at night, all alone in the dark, in a cage with the door locked and placed in a secluded area of the house. After a session of whimpering and heart-wrenching cries I heard the sweet pitter patter of someone coming to comfort me, I was rescued that night and found my rightful spot on the queen size bed. I found a wonderful family who listened to me and understood what I needed.

media.title: Somehow I got trapped in this freshly washed sweater, it was draped over The Wardens chair, I happened to innocently walk by when all of a sudden it latched onto me, it was like static cling gone wild. There was a bit of a struggle but the one arm of the sweater wouldn't let go, I was trapped, a victim of circumstance. The backstory to this sweater was it had to be washed due to excessive hair all over it, well The Warden might have to pick a few more hairs off, it'll keep her occupied and maybe work up an appetite for both of us.

Taking it easy kinda Tuesday, it's freezing rain so if you're looking for me look no further. Later on I'll probably do a yank and drag while barking just to get The Warden riled up, she likes to be included in the daily activities. I'll try to squeeze in all my required naps and of course I'll be encouraged to go outside, this is where it gets tricky, I'll go out if you go out. It's important that the staff go out ahead of me just to make sure it's safe, if it's slippery we'll need some ice melt (pet friendly), please note I'll only be going outside if it's an emergency.

I walked into the room and noticed something different, I don't like change but there it was draped over the table. Why does The Warden feel the need to change my space, it'll probably take a few days to get accustomed to something new. Now you're probably wondering why I just don't yank it off, well before I do that I have to know exactly what I'm dealing with, so far it hasn't made any sudden moves, I'll circle around and go back for round two.

title: While out on patrol we finally figured out how the critters were getting into the exercise yard and dropping parcels all over. The Warden blocked the gate with snow which seemed like a great idea until there was clear evidence that the critters figured out how to tunnel through the barrier. I think more thought needs to be put into this creative idea, first of all the snow is melting and it also appears they've figured out a way around this. Bless her heart for trying but stop embarrassing yourself.

media.title: There was an incident, while on patrol I noticed the door to the wine cellar (aka closet) was open, very suspicious, The Warden has a rule that this door is to be closed at all times. I was left with no other choice, I nudged the door open and went in, I proceeded to bark at the corner while backing up and somehow the door closed. I froze, all was quiet and dark, just me alone with the wine and some hanging clothes (which can be frightening if seen wearing in the daylight). Usually when I'm barking the staff immediately come running, this time I had to wait, all alone, in the dark.

The snow removal crew did a great job cleaning up the exercise yard after the snow storm. I was just wandering around when all of a sudden I get this feeling of being watched, the hairs on the back of my neck are sending me signals, when I look up I can clearly see someone ducking or should I say lurking. No need for alarm, it's just The Warden with her map of the yard, she's marking where there's a parcel for the next pickup, she doesn't like surprises.

Throwback to those days when I could do no wrong, according to my diary. I've kept a diary not just to be used as evidence but also to reflect on the good ole days when the cheese and roasts were plentiful and my gravy dippers were crusty . While browsing through my diary it's clear that there were no barking incidents or jumping up on anyone, but let me see, yes, there were a few shimmy shaking moments, sad really, not noteworthy, possibly cringe worthy.

The new year started off just right, I was given a piece of cheese, The Warden was trying to disguise my tick and flea pill, but hey, it's cheese and cheese goes with everything. I also don't want to reveal any deep dark secrets about my family but here goes, dad and I shared cheese last night, he fell off the diet train or came to his senses. As his lifestyle coach I want to be supportive of his food choices and sharing a morsel of cheese is taking a step in the right direction.

I've been asked what my New Years resolutions are and after much pondering and reflection I've decided this is the year of health and happiness. First off I need more cheese, it makes me happy and it helps with ab definition. I will also avail myself to continuous rubs and scratches, this helps reduce tension, especially for those with twitching eyes. It's all about giving back, being kind to others, having good manners and as The Warden will often say 'be the reason others smile'.

The Warden decided to put together some of her favourite pictures from over the past year (she has control issues). Over the past year no one was arrested (thanks to our legal team) and no one escaped, well only if you don't count that time I slipped past security and ran around the yard until someone yelled cheese. The Warden had a few meltdowns but with the proper care she eventually snapped out of it. Thank you for sharing your time with us and following along on our daily adventures.

Getting the full treatment, what you have to do is relax and let the hands do the work. Don't worry about the little things just embrace the moment, it's all about me. Try not to get distracted by others lurking in the shadows unless of course they're heading towards the fridge, then of course be on high alert. The Lurker was carefully timing her cleanup while also trying to maintain her carefree don't care attitude.

And so it begins, dads on a diet, why must I suffer when he makes irrational decisions, who in their right mind makes a choice to not snack. He must be serious because he's not waiting for the start of the new year, he even announced that there's no more cheese before bedtime (he actually said it out loud). The Warden is an enabler, she got rid of all the offending food choices. If you're reading this and feel compelled to help someone in need (I'm starting to feel weak), please send emergency cheese before it's too late.

On laundry day The Warden meticulously aligns the bed cover on the floor so she can just slide it over the bed when ready, this is where I come in, it's the perfect opportunity for a yank and drag while barking. Yes, the alignment is now a little off but the entertainment value is priceless. The look on The Wardens face is also worth it, especially the eye twitching, gets me every time, worth every bark.

Showing my brother the yank and drag while barking, it was a little more work than expected because it was a heavy blanket and he showed some resistance. This was his first experience and wasn't familiar with the whole routine, fortunately no toes were nipped as I was going in for the final yank. Overall I think he was impressed, especially with the finale where I was cloaked in the blanket while still barking (did you happen to notice he didn't once say hey hey).

If you look real close you may see a little extra fluff on my back, that's from a great scratch, what you can't see is The Warden having thoughts about dancing around with the vacuum (no tassels involved). She's trying to act like she's relaxed and carefree (hairfree) but she's waiting for that moment where she can nonchalantly drag out the Dyson (she's still looking for a vacuum that doesn't make any noise).

All I wanted for Christmas was endless scratches and attention, the occasional rest if your wrist seizes up is understandable but please do continue. My gravy dippers are at the ready, it's Christmas so I'm expecting a large plate which is ideal to get maximum coverage, if there's too much gravy not to worry, one rub down on the couch will rectify that (maybe this year The Warden won't chase me around with a wet cloth). May your Christmas be as blessed as ours is with family and friends.

'Twas the night before Christmas, when all through the house, not a creature was stirring....wait... what was that...'rollin' rollin' rollin' on the river...sounds like someone is working up a Proud Mary Moment, she's starting out slow and easy, next she'll try to recruit backup singers, better buckle up things are gonna get a little crazy. One piece of advice, when Shimmy Shaking Momma gets into a performance, step back so you don't get hit in the eye with a tassel.

My brother is home and he said the nicest thing, he said I smelled nice, The Warden said 'what', her true colours are showing (she has issues). Needless to say I'll be sticking close to those that say I smell nice, unless of course there's movement in the kitchen, it's all about priorities and my assistance may be required. For the record I do smell lovely and after lots of rubs and scratches you don't even have to wash your hands.

Dear Santa, if you're watching this please know I only do the yank and drag while barking at the request of the family. They have this constant need to be entertained and I try my best to fulfill my family obligations, of course at my own personal expense. As you know throughout the year I've done my best to listen attentively, hardly ever beg (unless feeling weak from hunger) and have buried many biscuits outside as part of my giving back to nature program. I admire you and hold you in high regard for all you've done (please note this is not considered sucking up).

title: Your immediate thought is look what I've done, I'd say you're jumping to conclusions, yes there's evidence of me doing the yank and drag while barking, but come on, does this look like something I'd do. It was dad, yes he had a crazy moment, he went off the rails, we know one thing for certain, it wasn't The Warden, no tucked in corners, this would be complete chaos in her world. Now if we can sit down over a confessional platter of aged cheese I'll tell you what really happened, but only after the first bite.

Throwback to when I became one with nature, I was free from the confines of the little ugly fences, free from the prying eyes of those that were lurking in the shadows. Those were the carefree days of wonder, the anticipation of being chased out of the sacred gardens, The Warden looking around then yelling hey hey, yes those hazy lazy crazy days of summer, how I miss you.

media.title: I woke up early this morning so I could move from my queen size bed to my day lounger, as I struggled to get from one room to another I decided to stop for a drink of water, this is where it gets ugly. The water was from yesterday, tepid, stale (past expiry date), lined with slobber, I just looked up at The Warden in disbelief, what kind of household is she running. To her credit she quickly got a clean bowl and filled it with fresh filtered water with ice, I found it refreshing and was able to continue my journey to the next room where I immediately went back to sleep, it's all about the little things in life.

Nobody and I mean nobody likes their lounger to be neat and tidy, aligned along the wall, all four blankets tucked in tight, freshly laundered not a hair in sight, where's the fun in that. It might take a little work but it's well worth the results, there may be a few hey heys along the way, if you're lucky an eye twitch, don't worry about biscuit crumbs, slobber, hair, just keep yanking those blankets free and start dragging. It's a wonderful feeling to freedom and a sense of complete control. Not to worry, The Warden is eagerly waiting in the wings waiting for her moment to gain complete control (she has issues).

A fourth blanket has been added to my lounger, it was freshly laundered and properly tucked in using hospital corners, now for the initiation ritual. I could've tried yanking only the new blanket off but where's the challenge in that, if you're gonna do something then do it to the best of your ability. This is another yank and drag while barking, a great way to start your week off with motivation and inspiration.

Leave the audience wanting more, there's great anticipation, will the headlining performer bark up a storm as the crowd yells hey hey. Setting the stage is critical, untucking the hospital corners, the gravy coated biscuit waiting in the wings, all this planning but the mood suddenly shifts, maybe it's time to just eat the biscuit and settle in for a nap. Not every performance is high drama, sometimes you just have to dial it back and take the easy road.

You're not going to believe this one, while I was napping The Warden snuck into the laundry room, closed the door and snacked on a piece of ham. How do I know this, well when she opened the door I was sitting there waiting for her and wanting an explanation. There was the smell of ham wafting in the air, you can't disguise that, I might have missed the opening of the ham bag because of the distance and I was snoring but there was no disguising the smell of ham. It was shameless behaviour and washing your hands and flossing your teeth after does not hide the fact that you were cheating, plain and simple.

After a light dusting of snow I'm checking for any unusual tracks in the yard, so far I've only discovered my own tiny paw prints. On the other hand, The Warden is on a poop recovery mission, she has a shovel as she lightly skims the top of the snow looking for buried treasure. It appears to be a time consuming mission at the rate she going but she's determined to leave no poop behind. As for me, one sniff around the yard is enough, time to go inside for one of my scheduled naps.

Throwback to the time I was called stinky, smelly and filthy but it was said in such a pleasing soft lilting voice that I wasn't offended. It's how you present the message that matters the most, it's the sweetness in your tone almost like it's dripping with gravy, the gazing into your eyes with a caressing vibe that oozes like aged cheese. If you want your message to be heard then say it in a tone we can all relate to.

It's not as easy as it looks but sometimes you have to up your game. This biscuit dance was taken to the next level, try to yank the blankets off the lounger between two obstacles while at the same time balancing two nuggets, only if you dare. There's a certain degree of concentration involved in the art of extreme biscuit dancing, plus you have to remember that barking helps keep the audience engaged, nothing like a few hey heys to keep the dance alive.

Maintaining your composure when someone appears in the driveway is good manners, according to The Warden this was a good girl day. In the past I might've expressed a tad bit of enthusiasm, jumping up against the door, scratching, barking, whining while barking, pacing, hair flying in the air, you know the usual stuff. Some have called it a 'fright scene' making anyone who approaches wary of being attacked, that's why The Warden issues a warning to brace yourself. I've been known in the past to jump up on people and fling a bit of slobber, that's all behind me now, I've matured (at least today).

When you live in an environment where others have issues that frees you up from all worries, I don't have to worry about hair in the air, why, because someone else has that problem, no sense having two worry about the same thing. Do I worry about slobber, never, how about smelly blankets, nope not once. My only concern is the frequency and distribution of treats and cheese or roast with gravy, but this is another story for another time.

When the struggle is real, sometimes you just gotta take a break, put the shenanigans aside, it'll all be there after a much needed nap. There's the freshly laundered blankets on my lounger, nicely tucked in using hospital corners, the gravy coated biscuit has it's name at the top of my dance card, the audience now sitting at the edge of their seat waiting for the opening bark, anticipating a yank and drag, yes, hold on to your tickets, the next show will be announced in the foreseeable future, coming back louder and with a few more added surprises.

Choices choices, so many choices, I have the audience now what performance should I entertain them with. I could do the expected yank and drag while barking of the blankets loaded with nuggets, maybe steal the chair that was just vacated (obvious choice because I think they're coming back) or I could jump up on the chair and attempt to yank the throw off (always a popular favourite). Of course there's one final choice I could make, ignore all of the above and just have a nap, in order to perform any of these activities you must be well rested, the audience deserves only the best.

Let me set the scene, The Warden was lining the couch with pillows to reserve her spot, two thirds for her, one third for me, then she left. Well here's an opportunity, I jumped up on my third of the couch, lowered my head and plowed the pillows off the couch, now this is where it gets tricky, there was a glass of water on the coffee table that fell over from a flying pillow, that's when things turned ugly. I was a victim of unfortunate circumstances but lesson learned, never leave a glass of water unattended.

title: Throwback to the hazy lazy crazy days of summer, seems so long ago, all that time spent soaking up the sun, waiting patiently for someone to stop by, getting my water refreshed with ice and watching The Warden fuss around the yard. Those were the days, and these are the memories that will get me through the long cold winter months, I'll be napping just as much but only inside and it'll be on a freshly stolen chair.

media.title: There I was having a quiet moment, minding my own business when I heard The Warden making a bit of a fuss, which isn't unusual, she started circling around something on the floor, saying what what, it appeared to a white blob, shiny, bubbly consistency, she reaches down and touches it, that's when she said gross, it was a mound of slobber. Oh yeah, that must've been when I did a slobber shake, at least no one slipped and the only casualty was The Warden who scooped it up with her bare hands (another drama queen moment).

Keep them guessing, be mysterious, unpredictable, that way you maintain your control over them. They were anticipating the yank and drag while barking, the untucking of the hospital corners, the moment when the nuggets go flying off the lounger, leave your audience wanting more, sometimes you just gotta step away and let the anticipation build, every great show should end with the crowd yelling hey hey.

Dad took me on a long walk at the golf course, don't tell The Warden that I was off leash, she has control issues and this might send her over the edge. I enjoyed every sniff plus the taste of freedom, there was not one yank or hey hey. I did stick close to dad though, he needs to be supervised, can't have him wandering off into the wilderness, according to my sniff barometer there's danger lurking off in the distance, that's all the more reason to stick close.

You ever get the feeling you're being watched every second of every minute, well I do. Not just from the surveillance cameras but from up above in the trees or on the rooftops, there's a whole chattering of conversation and it's probably not flattering. When I look up at my house I can see this head bopping from window to window, oh I wonder who that could be, but then again if I didn't see her I'd have to investigate to see what's going on, she could be sneaking snacks.

There comes a time in the day when you require an undisturbed nap, all the meals are done, no more snacking or fridge visits, just quiet time to reflect on the day before you go to bed, cannot stress enough the importance of a nap before you settle in for the night. The Warden finally got up off the couch which allowed me to stretch out, her version is she was teetering on the edge and got up before she fell off (always the drama queen).

I've been going through some tough times, not everything is as easy as it looks, The Warden must've glued this throw to the chair. This was a slight setback but I'll regroup and try again later, where there's a will there's a way. In order to do a proper yank and drag a larger platform or surface is recommended, by doing this on a chair there's the danger of falling off, it's considered extreme yanking, not to worry after a nap I'll figure out a way.

Throwback to when the Urban Jungle was in full bloom, it's a little getaway, a place to go and recharge, where barking and digging are allowed, actually anything goes because you wouldn't catch The Warden crawling through here. As a side note wandering through the jungle after a rain or the early morning dew is not recommended, too much like a bath.

There's the smell of rabbit in the air with just a hint of chipmunk and let's not overlook those pesky squirrels. The rabbits come out under the cloak of darkness and the squirrels run along the top of the fence or are in the trees, chattering at you (aka mocking you). The only thing The Warden can do to the squirrels is her hissing thing which only gets them all riled up, as for the rabbits they scatter at the sight of anything that moves. Usually when I'm on patrol and do a few barks that sorts out all the critters, they clear the area, except for one large critter yelling hey hey.

It's a delicate maneuver to try to master a biscuit dance with five nuggets on a blanket, it's recommended you do a slow yank and drag while barking (aka slow waltz). There's tension in the air, will the nuggets remain on the blanket, will the eye twitching Warden intervene, try to maintain your focus while at the same time work the audience, you're not truly doing your best performance unless you get a few hey heys.

There they all sit, everyone at the table, chatting, laughing, having a good ole time, passing food around, then there's me, sitting all alone on the fringe, watching each lift of the fork as they chew their food, guarding their plates for fear something might drop on the floor, in a way it's kinda selfish, it's all about them, what about me. On a sad note I didn't get one drop, not a crumb, after a few circles around the table I decided to go lay down due to weakness from hunger.

What's the one thing you're not to do while in the backyard, it's called barking, go ahead and do all the hey heys you want, just don't care. It's called Freedom Sunday, time to bark it out, tell it like it is, the neighbours are probably saying 'oh that's just Miss Lilly letting The Warden know she's in charge'. When the neighbours are mowing the lawn or using the snowblower not once does The Warden yell over and say 'hey hey knock it off', same principle different scenario, just saying.

It was a slow saunter to the door kinda day, head down, a couple of stretches, then I heard this whisper 'rabbit rabbit', that's when I saw him staring directly at me, we were both frozen looking eye to eye. I inched forward, mesmerized, this is what I've been smelling around the yard, I got into the attack position then I made my move, like a flash I hit the ground and started sniffing. By the time I looked up the rabbit was long gone, it escaped under the gate, at least now The Warden knows where to build the next snow mountain, this might keep the critters out for the winter season.

We had to shorten our walk due to colder weather -10, it's still great sniffing weather but I was encouraged to keep moving (I was given the yank). Actually I was fine, but l wasn't sure about The Warden, she was unrecognizable under all those layers, I knew it was her by the hey heys (she's predictable). The great thing about the colder weather is you don't have to worry about someone chasing you around trying to wipe the dirt and mud off your belly.

title: Throwback to when my brother was home and I got to share my couch with him. He was watching hockey and I was watching him, waiting for him to mention going for a walk. It's our special time together, he let's me lead and I get to show him the best spots to sniff, he also understands that when I put the brakes on it's time to stop and sniff, he's not into yanking he'd rather discuss it first.

media.title: Another snow day which means a busy day for the snow crew making the yard green again. The Warden has been busy picking up after the bunny convention held in the backyard, apparently it's easier to pick up frozen poop using the two bag method, one bag used to pick up the other bag used to deposit. Sometimes you don't need to know all the details but she's babbling on so I just let her have her moment in the spotlight.

Sometimes you have to shake things up to get what you want, that would be a little extra attention (when feeling neglected). It took some time but I was able to yank three blankets off my lounger, drag them across the room, all this with a biscuit on top of the blanket. Just to ensure your audience is still being entertained take a peek then follow up with some barking, once you hear a few hey heys you know you have completed a successful yank and drag. Time to settle in and watch the staff scurry around and reset the scene for another round.

Sometimes being just a slip of a girl you have to justify an unflattering picture taken by amateurs. Same picture, different angle, you could probably see my ribs and ab definition, I'm in a relaxed state with my fluffiness enhanced. Embrace your curves and hire new staff with some talent and make sure you check their references.

title: Instead of taking one of my gravy coated biscuits outside I decided to try burying one nugget of my food, after several attempts I just decided to eat it (getting past security was a breeze with one nugget). As you can see the exercise yard has been cleared of snow and the snow mountains have been established, also the tops of the rock ledge are clear and now accessible. The staff has done a commendable job keeping the yard available for sniffing and personal business, it's all about keeping your clientele happy and free to roam.

media.title: The snow crew (The Warden) is cleaning up after the first big storm, she starts with the deck first because if it's covered with snow and it's belly deep I might decide to go no further and do my business right there. No sense getting in over your head or in past your knees, I find the staff very accommodating to my needs. Most of the time I'm inside until the finishing touches have been made but I also needed to inspect the progress, yes, it's coming along nicely, another hour and it'll be ready to go.

title: My service has been downgraded to shoddy, the staff refused to move my lounger as the sun rotates the room. Yes, I relocated my lounger to the center of the room (at the time it was in a sun spot) but circumstances have altered, could it be they're becoming lazy. Am I now not considered a priority, are my basic wants and need put on the back burner, I ask for so little, please let this be a momentary lapse and they will see the light and will right the wrong.

media.title: Throwback to any day, every move you make, any bite you take, I'll be watching you. Even when I'm sleeping, making soft snoring noises, I'll know when you move, try opening the fridge door or a cheese bag, that's right, I'll be watching you. Go ahead, sneak a snack, try hiding in another room or behind a book, but guess what, I'll find you, give it your best shot, I'll be watching you.

Due to a conflict with The Warden, she refused to lower the chair(s), I decided to relocate my day lounger to the centre of the room. Actually this turned out better than I thought possible, now if anyone makes a move they will have to go around me, I'll be alerted if they try to leave the room to sneak snacks from the kitchen. One final point, as I am being constantly watched (control issues) from this position they can see every stretch and rotate that I make, also helps me keep track of them.

I'm going to make a suggestion, it would be much easier to access the furniture if it were lowered to the floor, so easy solution, take off the wooden legs, this will save the cost of buying all new furniture. By lowering the chair I'll still have a perfect view outside and I'll be included in all family gatherings. Yes, I understand that you can't chop off the legs on all the furniture but I'm sure with some creative thinking you'll come up with something we can all be happy with.

Queen of the 'hey heys' is at it again, one quiet little bark and she gets turned inside out, the neighbours probably can't even hear me. Now if you know who were to start singing then I could understand the noise complaints but my faint tiny bark amounts to a whisper in the breeze, I'm sure no one would ever complain. Just relax, dial it back a notch, enjoy the beautiful fall day and embrace the sweet whispering sounds of a quiet bark.

We will remember those brave individuals that have fought for our country so that we can have peace and for those that continue to serve, there is no greater honour, we will take a moment on this special day to say thank you. A special thank you to my brother who currently serves for Canada, we appreciate the sacrifice you make each day for all of us. ð¨ð¦

I've been busy getting ready for winter, stocking up on the supply of buried biscuits, it's about being prepared for the harsh winter season. It won't be long before the ground is completely frozen and I'll have to bury my biscuits in the snow. The Warden is also getting ready, she calls this flannel season, that explains the new flannel shirt plus all the winter accessories are ready to go, hats, mitts, scarves, boots, coats and sweaters. I travel light, I carry an extra layer of fluffiness, just put on my harness, grab the leash and off we go.

title: Wanna go in the car, I love this question, it's a family adventure, nothing but good times, until we ended up at the Vets. It was my yearly checkup, first thing, step up on the scales, here we go again being judged by my weight, they didn't take into account my winter fluffiness.
