I'm just one head shake away from breaking this party up, I wonder why The Warden keeps backing up, come on, sit down and give me a neck rub. All that yard work you've been doing has made your hands a little dry and I have the perfect solution, drool moisturizer, I'm here to assist in any way I can.

Throwback to yesterday when a delivery guy made a special stop to see me, I might've been howling at him up the street. We did the initial meet and greet, then I started running around in circles, The Warden said I was showing off. I barked until I lost my voice, this happens when I get excited, I also gave him the complete once over, he smells nice. This was the best day ever and he promised to stop by again to see me.

I met a baby for the first time, I approached cautiously, sniffed her, then her arms began flapping and she started making noises, I immediately ran to dad for reassurance. I gathered some courage and tried again, I licked her ear while she patted my head, now it was time to show her how to untuck the blankets on my lounger while at the same time barking, impressive move, she started to cheer me on, finally someone understands and appreciates me.

This is all about setting the stage before you indulge in your gravy coated biscuit, sometimes the smallest pleasures require a little extra work. Yes, it took some time to yank the blankets off and get right down to the actual lounger but it was definitely worth it. As a side note, over time you're actually not bothered by the little red light of the surveillance camera.

All in good time, I'm just building strength before I make any kind of movement, after a full night of sleep you can't expect me to be all chatty and up in your business. It's about easing into the day, any sudden movements might create a setback, naps are the backbone to creating a productive existence, these are Monday morning pondering thoughts by Miss Lilly.

The exercise yard has taken a beating over the winter, the grass has dried up and there's yellow spots everywhere. I decided to help where I can and provide biscuit nourishment to stimulate growth. There's only one problem, I have a limited supply of biscuits and this yard is in desperate need of a total makeover, they might want to consider professional help.

title: It's been a while since I've seen one but there it was, a bunny. I immediately assumed the position, body stretched out low to the ground, right front paw raised, tail in a darting straight line, like a rocket ready to explode. That's about the time I realized I was on a leash, instead of the greatest hunter ever I resorted to sniffing each and every possible step the bunny might have hopped to. Until we meet again mister bunny.

media.title: Nothing to see here, you do your thing I'll do mine and I noticed my blankets needed a little adjusting. That twitching eye is writing it's own book, now take a deep breath, back up slowly, tiny steps to the kitchen, open the fridge door, get a piece of cheese and toss me a slice, now don't you feel better.

Throwback to the one day when I maintained my composure, I was low key and genteel. I might've been known to ramp it up at times with full on howling, whining with my full slight delicate body scratching up against the door. Only the brave would dare to come close to the door or even the house, to date I'm happy to report that we've had no intruders or unwanted solicitors.

It's in the early stages of the sunbathing season, don't judge, the shadows of the tree are distorting my ab definition. I got lucky and a workman on the street stopped by for a visit, I might've been making a bit of a fuss by barking but he couldn't resist. The Warden apologized for the slobber on his shirt, he looked down and said not to worry, it wasn't slobber it was lunch. Lesson learned, sometimes it's best not to say anything at all.

Even with the smallest of chores you can somehow find a way to incorporate a workout. Now that spring has sprung it's time to tone the body, actually my body is already toned and what you are seeing is my winter layer of fluff. Once my fluffiness falls off you'll see the evidence of all my strenuous workouts, slimline and rippling abs.

title: Leave a message, all calls will be returned at my convenience. I like to leave the mornings open in order to prepare for something because you know something will come up. This is considered the thoughtful phase of the morning, I'm thinking about getting up or maybe not, should I stretch and rotate or just ride this one out. Monday Morning ponderings by Miss Lilly.

media.title: Have you ever gotten so excited that you barked so much you lost your voice, yes it's happened.  My uncle stopped by for a visit and I started jumping and barking even before he reached the door and then I ramped it up when he came in. He started questioning my lack of care, clearly I wasn't getting any attention and probably deprived of treats given my tiny little frame. I eventually exhausted myself and then maintained a sense of decorum.

title: Busy day, I was watching all the trucks come and go while cleaning our street, one driver even stopped to say hello. The Warden was also busy, she can't sit still and watch someone else clean so she started fussing around. I was exhausted from keeping an eye on all the activity, so it was a good thing this carpet was just laying around, I couldn't resist trying it out.

media.title: Did I happen to mention that I don't like change, when I do a room search I don't want to see change, but there it was, a new shower curtain. I approached slowly, head down, each step measured, before I got too close I barked and pawed at the floor, no reaction, so I went in for a sniff and flicked the curtain with my nose. Once I neutralized the threat I did another round of barking then slowly backed out, I returned later and repeated the whole process again. The curtain and I have come to an understanding, it's my house, my rules and I'll be back.

Throwback to last year when I decided to take charge of my own personal grooming requirements. There comes a time in everyone's life where you call the shots, you step up to the plate, you deal the cards, you take charge and run the show.  Not a lot of grooming got done that day but I think I sent a clear message.

Spring cleanup on the yard has started, lots of dry grass to roll in, the trick with this is to wait until there's a nice little pile started then dive in and roll, that way you maximize your efforts. Once you have full body coverage just give a few shakes and the grass falls right off, don't let others dampen your spring spirits by their huffing and puffing or eye twitches, just let the good times roll.

I decided to bury my gravy coated biscuit inside, the exercise yard is like a wildlife sanctuary, I've seen ducks, squirrels, birds, chipmunks and who knows what's popping up out of the ground. Does this mean I won't ever bury something outside, that's crazy talk, of course I will, it's just this one biscuit at this particular moment where I'll choose to dine inside.

title: All of a sudden I heard this big commotion, The Warden was rattling on about ducks in the backyard, so I went to investigate. Sure enough there were two ducks in my exercise yard, when I showed up they flew the coop and left some poop, so naturally I spent a fair amount of time tracking each and every step, also captured a little of their unforgettable essence.

media.title: The Warden found my squeaky ball, you know the one that likes to go under the furniture, once it's hidden I bark until someone fetches it. The fun only lasted for a short time and then as if by magic the ball disappeared again. It's not a difficult game to play, you just have to be limber, extend your whole body at times, try not to get distracted if you find dust and tolerate the continuous barking next to your head as you're reaching for the ball, simple rules to follow.

Some would say I had an unfortunate incident, I beg to differ, it was the best ever first spring roll on something so delicious. The Warden made an unkind remark about making her eyes water and wanting a breathing mask. She immediately got a cloth with a fresh spray and gave me the once over, then she brushed me, due to her ongoing issues the reaction was a little over the top but I did get a full body rub.

Well she did it, The Warden placed my blanket on a different chair which makes it impossible to yank off, of course she'll say it's her blanket but we all know what's hers is mine. What's also impossible is for her to use the blanket without me attempting to yank it off her, so why play these silly games, just give me the blanket and call it a day.

title: Throwback to the great discovery of the hidden biscuit stash, The Warden is still having flashbacks. The problem was she thought I'd like biscuits that weren't gravy coated, that was her first mistake, her second mistake was not checking deep inside the couch and chair. Since this incident I have been under constant surveillance and the furniture gets a regular pat down. Lesson learned, don't try substituting my gravy coated biscuits.

I'm being accused of being overly excitable, have I jumped up on someone, yes, have I knocked anyone over lately, no, have we been sued for personal injuries, not yet. The Warden figures with time and maturity my greetings will be made with all four paws on the ground, I don't see it, but who am I to dampen her dreams. I'm just a slip of a girl who is happy and spirited or as The Warden always says, careful she's heavier than she looks.

media.title: I'm hoping to get outside today, well, The Warden is hoping I get outside to stretch out my legs. I had to go out in the freezing rain a few times and when I came in I immediately went to the pat down station (Warden holding a paper towel). This is a duel purpose station, I get a full body rub down plus the benefit of being dried off, once this service is completed I'm then offered a complimentary treat.

title: I'm joining a Class Action Lawsuit against the groundhog who predicted we'd be having spring about now. He pokes his head out once a year, makes a big splashy announcement then disappears, now you know why he disappears. Well it's time to be accountable or time to step aside, see you in court Mr. Groundhog.

media.title: Today's activities will all be scheduled indoors so buckle in because it's gonna be a wild ride, of course that's between naps. It's freezing rain mixed with snow which isn't pleasant and eventually I'll have to do a quick in and out, so I'll wait until The Warden clears a path and gives the okay before I venture out. On a positive note this gives The Warden plenty of time to spend in the kitchen.

It's laundry day, I'm just trying to help where I can, there were a few biscuit crumbs, a heap of hair and a tad of slobber, just enough to warrant being washed. It took a little maneuvering to get all three blankets off at once, but once you untuck those hospital corners and yank a bit they just slide right off. As the saying goes 'many paws make light work'.

title: Face your fears, even on Friday the 13th, that's what I did when I dragged The Wardens blanket off her chair. It took a little yanking, a lot of barking and when she finally showed up I was definitely rewarded, I got the shoulder heave, a little muttering, and, drum roll, the eye twitch.

media.title: Throwback to the day I faced The Wardens greatest fear, I came eye to eye with the mighty beast that took the great one down. My adrenaline was at an all time high, I was trapped in a window well surrounded by danger, ducking and weaving while trying to anticipation each move. The only real danger was The Warden hyperventilating while the rescue team was preparing an evacuation.

There was a mouse in the house which created a major spectacle, contrary to what some may say it was tiny and only one.  At this time I would like to thank the First Responders (dad) who calmly restored order, on the other hand The Warden has surrounded herself with cleaning supplies and refuses to hand over a bottle of bleach. We're expecting a full recovery and should be able to receive visitors within days.

This is the one chair I've been hesitant about getting up on, it's dads lift chair, so for my first attempt I'll bring a comfort treat, a gravy coated biscuit. It'll be a short visit just in case the chair decides to make some strange moves and if it does I'm outta here. Dad will never know I've been here, I cleaned up all the crumbs and The Warden will take care of the hair and slobber, just routine cleaning maintenance.

Sometimes it takes a little extra effort to get what you want, some things are definitely worth the effort, especially my gravy coated biscuits. Ignore the other biscuit on the lounger, it's a veggie biscuit, I'll have to wait for the cleaning staff to remove it when they do a full service, which should be any day now, I'm noticing some crumbs, hair and slobber, hard to get good help these days.

The Warden was trying to inspire me to chase to ball, she actually used the word fetch, she keeps trying. I humored her and ran around the ball until I got distracted, there's a chance a worm is working it's way to the surface, I desperately need something to roll in. The birds are pecking at the lawn which is a good sign that rolling season is finally here.

Well it happened, I got snatched up and given a bath, an arrest warrant has been issued. I have rights and they have once again been violated, I wasn't officially scheduled for a bath until 2021. Just to set the record straight my smell was not offensive and did not cause breathing problems or other health related issues. The Warden may now be looking at her second restraining order, see you in court.

title: While on our walk someone asked if I was a wiener dog, they also didn't mind if I jumped up because they were dog people. Now think about it, they're dog people and asked if I was a wiener dog, I may look tiny, just a slip of a girl, but as The Warden always says, I'm heavier than I look. They were really friendly people just misinformed.

media.title: Throwback to when my brother was home last weekend, we spent most of the time studying and working on the computer, fortunately he can do this with one hand. The Warden kept changing the blanket on the couch, my brother didn't seem to mind a little hair buildup, I think he's used to all the fussing and the twitching eye. It was a memorable weekend with lots of scratches, walks and roast simmering in gravy.

Think twice before you set your sweater down, while on patrol I noticed something out of order, a sweater draped over a chair, with one yank it easily slipped to the floor. This is where it got exciting, a chase pursued, I managed to drag the sweater safely to my lounger, there was some muttering going on but at this point I didn't care, I was home free.

The Art of Untucking your Lounger, sometimes it requires a total dismantling of the blankets, not to worry, the staff are trained in remaking the lounger with hospital corners. Take pride in these small victories, all your hard work and training has paid off, the true victory is when you see the eye twitching, yes, my job is now complete.

title: Moving is not an option, I've rightfully stolen this spot and I expect to totally own it until the next available spot opens up, you move you lose. I need today to catch up on my naps, all day, well at least until gravy time. Not to worry about waking me if there is gravy, I'll know, this is where instinct kicks in.

I woke up early, there was excitement in the air, I was stretching and meandering my way to the front room when all of a sudden I heard, hurry hurry, look, it's a yard full of bunnies. I actually ran to the window, ready to bark and howl, that's when I heard it, the giggling, April Fools!  I calmed down and then I did see it, the Fool. Happy Easter my friends â¤ï¸

media.title: Good things will come to those that wait patiently, who don't jump up and no barking or whining. I'm expecting better than good, I want great, how about an Easter bunny that hops to our house with an assortment of aged cheese and a small roast simmering in gravy (large basket). If the bunny comes baring these gifts then I'll guarantee no harm will come, if not, all bets are off.

I got my nails butchered (trimmed) in preparation for the Easter Weekend, it was the worst ever (every time is the worst). Dad left me alone (3 minutes) with some crazy clipper person. On the way out we attracted a small crowd, all the ladies fussing over me, loved my ears and rotating tail spin, dad seemed to be enjoying himself also and was chatting up the ladies. Dad told mom I was like a rockstar attracting all sorts of attention, that would make him my entourage.

Throwback to the day I buried two biscuits in the garden, one after the other, it was a successful day. I had an accomplice, it was dad, I would grab a biscuit, he'd open the door and yell to The Warden 'here she comes', twice in a row. That's also when she announced I would get no replacement biscuits, I'm to make better decisions with how I use my biscuits, by the way, I made the perfect decision!

I'm ready and waiting, I've warmed up your reserved spot and your blanket, my gravy dippers are ready to be rubbed, all you have to do is move the pillow and slide on in, careful you don't teeter over the edge. If you could also bend at the knees so I can have room to stretch and rotate, wouldn't want to cramp up. By the look of that twitching eye you may need to rub both my ears.

title: It's a beautiful sunny day with a high of seven and the sun is in my face as I glance over my kingdom (exercise yard). The Warden found two biscuits under the snow sculptures after the snow melted and made a big production of picking them up in a poop bag, she was worried I was going to bring them inside, which isn't a bad idea, nothing better than getting The Warden all riled up.

I'll be working from home today, don't call me I'll call you, I need quiet time to think, just leave a message. If by chance you are already home please wear soft soled slippers, no talking, no sudden movements, no vacuuming, quiet dusting only and definitely no kitchen noises.  Unless of course you are cooking something for me then please feel free to disturb me at any time.

media.title: Clean up in aisle two, The Warden made a mess of the snow sculptures, now they are considered snow splats. She could be having a creative moment or doing a scientific experiment, hard to tell where she's going with this, all I know it makes for great sniffing.

There are two problems with these new biscuits, first of all this ones broken and it's not gravy coated. It's a lame attempt at being cheese flavoured, not aged cheese, just plain regular mild minimal tasting cheese, hardly worth the effort. I'm not fussy but I won't eat broken biscuits, maybe it can be returned and if you're going to return the cheese flavoured ones you might want to throw in the veggie ones also, because I'm not eating them either.

Spring has officially arrived, I can smell it in the air, the birds are chirping, the snow is slowly disappearing and when I rolled on the grass some of it stuck to my back. There was a bit of a fuss when I came inside, I thought The Warden wanted to chase me, she was really trying to wipe off the grass before it got all over the place, it was a failed attempt, there was grass scattered all over, oh well another sign of spring.

title: Throwback to the early days when the family thought they could teach me to play fetch. I thought it was fun to have the ball roll under the furniture then bark at it until someone retrieved it. The funny thing was after awhile all six balls disappeared, apparently this wasn't what they had in mind when they wanted to play fetch.

Spring is in the air, it may be -3 outside but I found a sunny spot by the rocks to soak up the sun. There's no budding plants yet, at least none that I've seen while digging around in the garden. A real sign of spring is when the little ugly fences go up and my access has been revoked, apparently stepping on new growth is frowned upon.

media.title: Just a quiet moment inside, just me, my gravy coated biscuit and the lurking shadow of The Warden. She bought me two different kinds of biscuits to try out, cheese and vegetable. The last time she tried this I ended up just burying them instead of eating them, so needless to say she's watching my every move while trying not to be obvious, in other words nothing has changed.

As a frequent chair stealer I think I deserve a Rewards Card so I could gather points towards a gift of my choice. For each steal I would get one point, for a total of 10 points I would get a reward, a list of redeemable awards would be set up by me, in all fairness I've earned these points. I'm declaring one point at this moment for stealing The Wardens warm chair.

title: If at first you don't succeed try again and again, with each biscuit comes a new set of obstacles but nothing I can't overcome. I did manage to get past security twice in a row with a biscuit so I have to make good use of my time. You ever get the feeling you're being watched (are the hairs on the back of your neck standing up), so I had to make a quick decision and relocate my biscuits several times.

Gonna get a little wild today, shake things up, of course after several naps.  I'm hoping all St. Patrick's Day festivities are in the afternoon, a perfect day would be to let me loose so I can run up the street and chase the kids. That's not going to happen so let's settle for an early dinner and let my gravy dippers celebrate in a large plate of roast with gravy. Happy St. Patrick's Day everyone ðâï¸

media.title: Dad laid out my biscuits for the day, five instead of four, he apparently doesn't know about the four limit per day or he understands the cruelty of the rationing. Plus they were just tossed on the scatter rug and not laid out in a straight line, this is starting out to be a great day. I vote for dad to be in charge of all treat distributions without any interference from The Warden, she has control issues.

title: Throwback to the early years when they thought I could be trained with treats, only to discover I'm not treat motivated. Unless of course you carry cheese or chicken in your pocket, then I'd follow you anywhere, I won't listen to anything you say or do anything you want but I'll follow you. I'll sit when I'm tired, I'll might listen to you when you call me, will roll over for a belly rub and I'll watch you play fetch over and over again.

media.title: Even though we are still getting snow there are signs of spring, with temperatures just above freezing there's just enough loose dirt to bury your biscuit. Not to worry about a little dusting of dirt on the rock ledges, The Warden will think it's the squirrel, that is until she reviews the surveillance tapes, by then I'll have distracted her with something else.

title: Just doing a tour of the exercise yard and checking out The Wardens Snow Sculptures, she has titled them 'The Canadian Rockies'. To date she has received no Winter Festival invitations to showcase these masterpieces, sculpted using only your basic shovel. This seems to be going down the same road as her singing career, cancelled due to lack of talent.

media.title: No need to rush into the day, take your time, if you start out with enthusiasm then discover you ran out of gas, or maybe you can only untuck one corner at a time, then you need a nap, time to recharge before the next battle. Your biscuit burying shenanigans are just as good or even better after a nap.

It's a time change, everything is off schedule, The Warden is running around in every room changing clocks, I've decided not to move until the day sorts itself out. I adapt better with the comforts of the sweet smell of roast simmering in gravy, everything is better with medicinal gravy. As a side note, do people still have clocks in every room at every advantage point, just wondering.

Hint hint, I'm sitting by the door and staring at you, now look at the clock it's time for my walk. I like predictability, a regular routine, none of this flim-flam whenever kinda schedule, so whatever you're doing will have to wait till later. It's not like you don't notice me or feel the intensity of my glare, so before I take this to the next level, let's shake a leg.

title: I'm issuing a challenge to The Warden to up her game in snow sculptures, start getting creative, don't just pile up the snow in little mounds (sometimes mountains). I say put down the vacuum and bring out the sculpting tools, you can dust off the snow, clean your tools, consider this as a new form of therapy.  Just make sure you dress warm and I'll come out every once in awhile to check on you.

Throwback to the early years before the furniture was covered in blankets and I was provided lift service up on all the furniture. There were times while walking I got the yank and pull, not much has changed with that except now no one can pick me up and carry me. The Warden says I'm heavier than I look, it's just that I'm more mature now and only require assistance getting up on my queen size bed.

media.title: It's been almost five weeks since dad had a hip replacement so I'm being careful to walk slow and not get distracted.  Actually dad said going at this pace only encourages me to sniff more so he has to keep me moving has part of his therapy. I sometimes (always) get excited when I see anything moving, that's probably why we go out when there's no action outside.

Sometimes you have to adapt to your situation when everything doesn't go as planned, burying biscuits works better when your blankets aren't tucked. If my lounger wasn't so heavy it would be upside down and possibly in another room by now.

What do you call it when you're too tired to eat your duck strips, it's called Monday morning. I barely made it to my blanket, rough morning so far, it's hard to function without a good 12 to 14 hours of sleep. I'll rally round eventually, when I do I'll have a drink of fresh filtered water with ice, make sure my four biscuits are lined up for the day and finally make sure everyone is where they should be.

The snow removal crew (The Warden) has been busy clearing my exercise yard, now I have my work cut out for me, here a sniff, there a sniff, everywhere a sniff sniff. Locating buried biscuits under a mountain of snow will take some time but I did find some rabbit evidence. There was also an invasion of birds as soon as the grass was exposed, I quickly cleared the flock just by poking my head out the door, this is a sure sign that spring is just around the corner.

I've excepted the challenge of the #disneylookalike from @bassethoundmommy who captured this picture while visiting the Royal Princess Merida. The Princess and I have a lot in common besides the high forehead and alluring eyes, she loves cheese, a roast banquet and is surrounded by a handful of faithful servants. The release of this rarely seen picture was approved exclusively by members of the Royal Family. I'm issuing an open invitation to my friends to join in on this challenge.

The last biscuit I buried was in the garden and I might've got a tad dirty,  according to all the fuss someone made, so this time there shouldn't be any complaints. The Warden is working on dismantling my snow mountains, shoveling the snow and spreading it all over. Now it's the perfect height, makes a nice platform for burying biscuits.

Throwback to the days when life wasn't so complicated, you'd wake up at brunch to a modest offering of cheese, the staff would surround you catering to your every need, the sweet lingering smells of roast simmering in gravy, and then you'd wake up, realizing it was only a dream. Instead you would find someone hovering close by, waiting for you to make a move so they could wash your blanket, oh to have those simpler days of the sweet smell of unwashed blankets.

title: The results of the Hurricane Fur Wizard is in, the miracle brush that was advised to remove hair does not work on Wool. Therefore if you are a guest who is wearing wool you will forfeit the offer of a complimentary brush down, enter at your own risk. This is a slight setback for The Warden, she's now reverting to the old fashion method, take some hockey tape (or whatever tape is available) wrap around hand, sticky side out, then pat down the hairy clothing item, repeat if necessary. This method might not be appropriate for all guests, ask before you start the pat down.

media.title: One of the many House Rules is I have to lay on my blanket when I'm on the bed, I can live with that. Now The Warden wants to make an amendment to the original rule, my whole body must be laying on the blanket. She didn't factor in the nesting tendencies, she'll have to go back to her think tank and come up with a better idea or just learn to relax.

Dad had company and I offered to be a footrest, it's important to make your guests feel comfortable. He probably won't notice his hairy socks until he gets home, let's just consider this as a gift from me to you. The Warden also choose to not offer a complimentary brush down when he was leaving, she didn't want to be known as that creepy lady with the twitchy eye.

Just having a quiet moment, there's no movement, no kitchen noises, no one sneaking snacks, just me and the surveillance cameras. It's important to know where everyone is at all times and to know exactly what they're doing, if someone moves I'll be up in a flash, especially dad, he's feeling much better now and can get his own snacks. As part of his health care team I need to access his snack intake, each and every treat I'll be there.

What could be better than a freshly washed blanket, well, one that's not freshly washed. Blankets are always better when they smell familiar, something you can sniff out in the dark. Blankets need to be personalized, a touch of hair, a smattering of drool and the ever popular remnants of biscuit crumbs. Come on and curl up with me and my blanket, you know you want to.

Be afraid, be very afraid, this warning has been issued to all predators who choose to violate my exercise yard. The Warden has found incriminating evidence which is now being collected in crime scene bags (poop bags). I don't need to see the evidence, it's in the air, I can smell the furry little creatures, according to the size of the evidence these are disturbingly large animals. The eye twitching is also an indication of the violation.

This was the first time I was able to walk dad since he had a hip replacement (20 days ago), we had to take basset steps, small steps and short sniffs. I've moved my blanket to beside his lift chair so he can easily reach down and do his rub and scratch therapy. I sleep beside him at night just so I can keep an eye on him, the good news is he can now reach my treat cabinet and let me outside at all hours. The Warden is hovering around and making special treats for dad, forgetting all about his lifestyle choices, at least for awhile.

Persistence is a virtue, don't be deterred by the first NO, even if it's said in a firm voice. Circle around and try another location, stare deeply into their eyes, staying low to the ground gives the impression of a weakened state, you can only be revived by a special treat. Try whimpering at first, remember low energy, a head tilt should sway the vote your way, eventually they'll weaken, it's just a matter of time. I'm a professional, I've studied human behaviour my whole life, if one tactic doesn't work try another.

It's gonna be a biscuit burying and nap day for two reasons, first because it's going to rain all day, secondly, we just finished a busy long weekend with my brother being home. The conditions are perfect for napping with the pitter patter sounds of rain, and you know one thing is for sure, I'm not going outside again today. I was coaxed out earlier this morning with the promise of a treat, it worked.

title: One last walk with my brother before he leaves for home, one more vigorous scratching session and the end of a gravy weekend. The Warden is busy preparing a care package for him to take home, I'll be sending a little reminder of our time spent together, hair and drool all over his coat. Chances are slim he'll get out the door without a brush down and a wet cloth fixing his coat before he heads off to the big city.

What could be better than one hand softly caressing you, giving you a deep ear rub, scratches up and down your back, well what could be better, that would be two hands, the other hand rubbing your belly and massaging your neck line. I'm going to take it even a step further, there's a third hand (move over and make room for another person), this hand will be offering you your favourite treats. This treatment will be considered the Deluxe Package. As a side note, did you know that caressing a basset ear has a calming effect.

It's a gravy weekend, my brother is home for the weekend, this also means lots of scratches and hair in the air. Very little nudging required, he seems to know I'm close and available for unlimited attention, he sometimes slips up and uses two hands when he's working, it's a slight faux pas but the situation corrects itself with some strong hints of moaning and nudges. It's gonna be a great day, the roast is simmering in gravy, extra walks and The Warden catering to our every need.

media.title: Let's make this an Olympic Hound Sport, bury the biscuit in the snow mountain and see how fast I can sniff it out. Now if you really want to make this a gold medal competition I dare you to place a small roast (still warm) in the snow, this mountain will soon become a tiny mound scattered all over and the prize will be devoured in no time, wait, better time me, it's an Olympic event. Come on Warden it's a dare, let's do it.

Throwing it back to a few years ago when The Warden thought she was in control, when every hair was swept up as it gently fell to the floor. As she tried to touch up all the spots I chewed on the furniture or the constant searching in the cushions for any buried biscuits. Those were the days, now she just drinks more and stares off into the corner, at the same time she lovingly scratches my back while watching the hair float in the air.

title: Nothing says love more than hot sizzling bacon strips in the morning, turn up the heat at lunch to a smouldering piece of chicken covered with cheese, on to the ultimate display of a romantic dinner, lights are dimmed, the savouring smells of roast simmering in gravy, your gravy dippers hang in anticipation. This is what love is all about, doing something special for those that you love and care about, it's all about the little things, be thoughtful and kind each and every day. Happy Valentines Day my friends â¤ï¸

media.title: We have a special offer today, free snow, come one come all, take as much as you want. The Warden put a sign out front but it got buried under the snow. I'm proposing another marketing strategy, we offer a free roast beef dinner for every truck load of snow removed, featuring me, Miss Lilly, as a special dinner guest.

title: Talk to the paw cause all I'm hearing is blah blah blah. Yes I can feel that 100 watt glare but save it for someone who really cares. Come to me gently if you please but it is highly recommended that you be dangling some cheese. This morning message is my Monday Vibe.

I almost got lost in the backyard, the snow mountains have taken over, I had to sniff my own tracks to get out of this maze. The good news is the surveillance cameras can't see my every move, which makes The Warden nervous, what does she think is going to happen. Even if I did try an escape over the snow mountains I'd have no where to go, if you can believe this, no one else shovels their backyard.

media.title: For some reason The Warden likes to tuck in 'my' blankets on 'my' lounger, how's one to bury their biscuits under these constraints. May I suggest that each blanket be gently toss allowing the freedom of movement, or on a whim could be yanked off and dragged around the room.

I'm under interrogation, The Warden has launched an investigation into why I would scratch the door to go out, then when everyone drops what they're doing and rush to my assistance, I would turn away and walk towards the treat cabinet. In my defence where is it written that I have to get my treat after I come in not before I go out. This has nothing to do with rewarding bad behaviour or using treats as a training tool but if you want to consider that I deserve a treat for just being me, let's go with that.

Extreme winter fitness, do not try this without proper training. While doing the agility course you can also scout for possible biscuit burial sites, remember to bark out your whereabouts to the rescue team in case an evacuation is required. It also helps to be light on your feet, you can't afford to sink and get buried in the snow, do this before you have a big meal.

Some may say I have a few diva tendencies, not true, I'm just confident, I know what I want when I want it. Do I require a lot of attention, of course, but who doesn't want to be pampered, petted and scratched. Do I deserve aged cheese and a small roast dripping in gravy, most definitely, this girlish figure needs to be maintained. I'm just a slip of a girl living the simple life.

Gravy coated biscuits are Tongue Out Tuesday Treats, take your time and savour the moment. Don't sweat the small stuff like messing up your lounger, forget the slobber and biscuit crumbs, ignore the hair in the air, if you have great housekeeping service then these little things miraculously get taken of.

I'm joining in on Hangover Monday, even though I slept through the Super Bowl, didn't see the halftime show, I feel it's important to support those that did. Now with any hangover (so I heard) it's important to start the day with a big breakfast, bacon, sausage, ham and cheese, with a side order of gravy. After you finish eating it is highly recommended that you have a lengthy nap before you officially start your productive day.

Let's break this down, it's cold outside, I'm ready to come in, as I'm sauntering up the stairs, licking my lips in anticipation of a treat, and you can see me, right, then what's the deal with the delay. Hello, I'm here, what are you waiting for a written invitation, did I happen to mention it was cold outside. Yes, that's The Warden having a little fun, isn't she special to have around.

Yesterday, Wiarton Willie the Ontario groundhog, has predicted another six weeks of winter, and if you recall so did the Basset Almanac back in the fall. The groundhog pops his head out of his hole, makes this big splashy announcement, then disappears. I'm out everyday in the harsh elements, so who knows best, some hog in a hole or me.

As part of the home security detail it is my responsibility to investigate the possible infiltration of varmints.  The Warden has seen signs of rabbits and has collected evidence in poop bags, my job is to find out how they got in the 'exercise yard', they must be sneaking in under the cloak of darkness. The Wardens mission is to scoop the poop, not to bend and pretend, keep the yard safe.

Throwback to my baby days, remembering when my new family choose me out of a litter of nine. I was the smallest, tripping over my ears with each step, trying to get noticed in all the excitement. Finally my new brother picked me up so I wouldn't be trampled on again. It was a family of four, two brothers, a mom and dad, they were nervous and had no idea what they were getting into, I definitely had some work to do with them, especially the one with the twitching eye.

Waiting and watching for anything to happen, hoping to see a delivery truck, maybe someone walking, the neighbour could at least shovel the driveway, is anyone out there, anyone. Another cold and snowy day, everyone must be inside napping, I'll watch for awhile and then I might as well join in on the napping.

What could be better than a freshly washed blanket, well, a blanket that was not freshly washed. In no time at all this blanket will be perfect, all it takes is a whole lot of hair, a blend of slobber and drool, add a few biscuit crumbs and after a few naps it will smell oh so lovely.

I'm a very good listener if you have something worth listening to, but I'm even better at anticipating your every move. Now if you make a move to leave your chair I have some decisions to make, do I steal the chair or take a chance and hopefully you'll lead me to the kitchen. If it was a fake move and your not leaving your chair, well that's alright, I'll wait, you know you're gonna move eventually.

Nothing to see here, move along, take a step back, another step, keep going until you reach the fridge, now open the fridge and slowly open the cheese bag. That's right, cheese in hand, now walk towards me, faster, faster, almost here, now place the cheese at the end of the couch, cause that's the only way I'm moving out of your spot.

I like the people around me to have a routine, to be predictable and when I wake up from a nap they'll be gazing at me while dangling a piece of chicken (I dreamt this). Why can't they just stay home, unless of course it's to go for a walk or get groceries. There's lots to do at home, especially in the kitchen, why can't we just hang around together all day, surrounded by the sweet lingering smells of a roast simmering in gravy (my version of aroma therapy).

I've had to be selective when going outside, we've had some freezing rain which left the grass crunchy. The Warden even had to de-ice (pet friendly) some of the lawn so I wouldn't slip and fall, safety first, fortunately no one slipped or fell. If I did get wet (hate getting wet) then I could expect a paper towel pat down, which I really don't mind, it's a vigorous rub down, extra scratching session, sometimes you gotta take the good with the bad.

Throwback to when my brother was home and he spent the afternoon coding with one hand. The other hand was completely devoted to me, I only had to remind him a couple of times to keep his focus on the scratches, he's good at multitasking. We worked well together, he cracked the code and I left enough hair on the couch to make The Wardens nose flair and her eye twitch.

WARNING WARNING:  Please be prepared to adjust sound, this video comes with annoying barking. There's something different in the house and upon further investigation it was deemed to be barked at, or at least until The Warden stepped in and made dad put the offending item on the floor for further sniffing. Eventually the said item was climatized to the environment and the annoying barking ceased.

How to prepare your biscuit before you start to eat it, first of all find a good location to bury it. Having multiple layers of blankets helps the process, cover completely, tap occasionally and sneak a peek to ensure it's still in place. The final tip would be to moisten the biscuit before you eat it, this helps enhance the gravy flavour which is coated on the biscuit.

There's nothing like a freshly washed blanket that's spread out ever so gently across the bed, that's when I asked for a lift up. This is like a blank canvas, clean as a whistle, but first I need to make a few nesting adjustments before I settle in. Rake up the corners, circle around a few times, a nice dusting of hair and an added bonus of a slobber sling, it's now a masterpiece.

Here's how it really happened, dads pjs were laying on the floor and I was looking for a place to bury my biscuit, as luck would have it I saw the perfect opportunity. You gently place the biscuit on the pjs, start yanking and doing the biscuit dance and before you know it you've dragged the pjs out into the hall. That's when The Warden showed up, wanting to know what all the excitement was about. Subsequently the following warning was issued, if you don't want slobber and crumbs on your pjs then don't leave them laying on the floor.

You ever get the feeling that you're being watched, where the hairs on the back of your neck are sending you a signal. I'm just minding my own business, taking in a few sniffs, when I look up and see these beady little eyes zeroed in on me, yep it's The Warden. She really needs to get a life, maybe try spending more time in the kitchen, hone in on those skills and not lurking out the window.

All visiting guest can now get a complimentary brushing to remove any unwanted hair from their clothing, The Warden just bought a Hurricane Fur Wizard. Most people will say don't worry about it but there are those that will quietly sit and start plucking off the hairs, you know who you are. You are also offered the option of using the brush yourself or an assistant will be provided, The Warden, she has an eye for detail.

title: There should be no rules about how many times you want out or how long you stay out, I want out when I want out for as long as I want to stay out, it's quite simple. Do I expect a special treat each time I come back inside, yes, do I get a treat each time, no. There's no consistency, poor training, just because I went outside briefly, several times in a row, shouldn't mean I'm denied another treat. The Warden is in a position of abusing her power over treat distribution.

It's flannel season, this also happens to coincide with gravy season, if only I saw more gravy than I do flannel. At night I get to sleep on flannel sheets, of course I have to wait until someone gets up for a pee or until the early risers start their day. There's nothing like snuggling into a fresh warm spot on flannel sheets, especially on a cold morning as I drift off to sleep dreaming of a slow cooked roast simmering in gravy.

media.title: When you're under rations (4 biscuits per day) it would be nice if I was given a little privacy and space while I build the anticipation of savouring each and every biscuit. Yes, I had to give 'the look', you know, back off and don't look at me, message sent but not received. This is just an example of what I have to deal with, now if you change this biscuit to cheese then you can look all you want, be my guest.

I don't have a problem with Monday's or any other day, I have a problem with mornings. Every day should start at around brunch, beginning with the sweet sizzling sounds of bacon. If you need to be up before brunch then you should speak in hushed tones, tiptoe in soft soled slippers and absolutely no shimmy shaking music or breaking into one of your Proud Mary Moments.

All our snow has returned with a little extra for good measure, The Warden is just finishing up the final details of the cleanup. Their work is done and mine has just started, I now have to reacquaint myself with each and every square inch of the fresh snow. ð¶Here a sniff, there a sniff, everywhere a sniff sniff ð¶

title: I'm a risk taker living on the edge of danger, what seemed like a good idea at the time turned out to be a little too risky. We had a lot of rain and some mild weather which made my snow mountains hazardous, fortunately I saved myself while others stood back and watched me sink. Actually what really happened was I thought I could do my business on the upper deck, not a good decision.

media.title: The Warden decided to reserve her spot on the couch, most of the time it works but not this time, I plowed the pillow off. Now the fun part of this is waiting for the reaction, wait, wait, now there it is, the shoulders drop, the twitching eye and finally the piercing look. This is the best part of all, how to get me to move, it's called the 'cheese motivator', it works each and every time.

Throwback to our winter wonderland when the lawn snow removal crew were getting ready to complete the job. I was barking with the hopes that someone would come outside to chase me around the snow mountains. Usually I see a pair of beady little eyes watching my every move, The Warden must be getting all winterized before she steps out. One thing I know for sure, the surveillance cameras will be zeroed in on my every move.

I did a howl of all howls, the family came running all in a panic, The dramatic Warden said my howl was hair-raising, blood-curdling, spine-tingling, bone-chilling, well I did reach deep inside for this one. When dad and The Warden finally got to me (within seconds) I was looking out the window, there it was, a strange truck parked at the neighbours, they were having company. Nothing wrong with notifying the family of any movement in the neighbourhood, it's a security measure.

title: We had another big snow storm and the snow removal crew have been working overtime in order to clear my yard, there were drifts over my head, also the extreme cold snap is now over, it's only -2. The Warden dropped her mitt so I took advantage of the moment plus I was able to stretch out my legs and get a little exercise. This is great sniffing weather and with it not being too cold I get to stay outside much longer.

media.title: I challenged dad to a nap-athon and I'm not talking about a short snooze, this will be the marathon of all naps. While napping you may do a brief stretch and rotate, snoring, body twitching and rapid eye movements are also acceptable. No prolonged grooming or potty breaks allowed, once you leave the bed you are automatically disqualified. I'm still napping, dad was disqualified because he had to work.

A decision had to be made, according to the Basset Almanac we are expecting another ton of snow, therefore do I bury my biscuit outside or abort my mission. There's the ever looming threat of the snowblower tossing my biscuit into the neighbours yard, never to be recovered again.  Sadly two of my biscuits got lost in the last snow storm so I have to make smart decisions, when your biscuits are rationed every one counts.

I was on my way outside when all of a sudden I heard this bark from the neighbours yard and they don't have a dog. It was the size of a timber wolf, only it was golden in colour, so I slinked back inside with my tail tucked. The Warden got all dressed to come outside with me, she was my secret weapon and regained my confidence. In rare cases The Warden is allowed to do the Shimmy if it's used in self defense only, her dancing and singing can scare almost anyone for miles.

title: A lot of excitement on the street, there was a backhoe and a lineup of trucks removing the snow from our street. I started out barking thinking we were getting company but no one came to the door. I loved watching the kids on the street slide down the mountain of snow but it's all gone now, no company, no mountain, no kids playing, this all added up to a nap.

media.title: This is me out for my supervised walk with dad under the watchful eye of The Warden. As long as I have my leash on there's no need to wear a tracking device or ankle bracelet. I do have unlimited access to the fenced in backyard but in this weather it's only for a brief moment. As a side note, due to the snow banks and short legs you are limited in your choice of spots to do your business, just keeping it real.

I finally got my sutures out, the Doc was happy with the progress, except for one concern, I still have a slight cheese deficiency but with a daily dose of aged cheese I'll be right as rain. It's important to follow the doctors orders, every day all year long, be proactive and supplement your daily diet with cheese.

It's about the anticipation, creating an atmosphere, building the moment of savouring your last gravy coated biscuit. With the new year comes a rationing of treats or as The Warden likes to say making better lifestyle choices, blah blah blah. Currently two of my biscuits are buried outside in the snow, I've eaten one and this biscuit is the last I'll get today, it's a sad situation.

Off to a great start in the new year, I've dragged my lounger to the middle of the room, buried my first biscuit, stole The Wardens chair and now settling in for a morning nap. Due to extreme weather conditions (-28) I'm planning on some more indoor activities, let's say starting at around brunch, plenty of time for The Warden to prepare a cheese and deli platter.

On this last day of 2017, I would like to take a moment to say thank you to those that followed along with our daily adventures. We've had many laughs and some crazy times, we've also shared some sad moments for those precious souls that we lost but who will be fondly remembered. So from Miss Lilly, The Warden and Shimmy Shaking Mama (aka mom), we say a heartfelt thank you and look forward to seeing you in the New Year.

I've been asking Google Home a few questions, where are the surveillance cameras located, how do I access the fridge, so far I haven't gotten any help. Dads been testing it's math skills, does well in math, The Warden asks for the weather report and how to spell. I'm going to ask Google to put a snack detector on The Warden and dad, then to sound an alarm when they are sneaking snacks.

The Warden had one rule when she allowed me on the bed with a biscuit, I have to stay on the blue blanket she so carefully laid out. While one thing led to another, as I started to bury my biscuit I got a lucky break and was able to bury it deeper than expected. Did you know that if the gravy coated biscuit is moist it leaves marks on the clean sheets, just a little tidbit.

title: Throwback to when my brother was home a few days ago. He's very good at multitasking, one hand for coding on the computer and the other hand to be used exclusively for me. What The Warden saw was the nest I made with the blanket on the couch and the dusting of hair in the air, it was an eye twitching moment.

The lawn snow removal crew has been working overtime, I needed a little room to roam and sniff. It's a bit of an adrenaline rush when someone chases me around the snow hills, I'll go round and round until I decide to just stop, I've had enough, time to go inside. It's -23 this morning so my advice would be to do a quick in and out, your business will be frozen before you make it inside.

media.title: Best Christmas ever, my Gravy Dippers were swimming in gravy with roast. I didn't even mind The Warden hovering in the background holding a wet cloth, 'tis the season. I was so tired after all the excitement that I even slept on the couch instead of my queen size bed, all night, all by myself, in the dark, now that's tired.

title: Merry Christmas my friends!  I'm waiting for my brothers to get up, apparently I can't do a crash and bang wake up call, where's the Christmas spirit with that. Later this morning we'll share bacon, open the gifts Santa left, go for a walk, then a much needed nap. It's gonna be a good day.

media.title: I would like to propose that the chairs at the dinner table be more accessible, maybe install a ramp, I'm missing out when the food is being passed around. I go from person to person looking for the weak link, I try nudging, sometimes a little whining, whatever works, but then there's dad, my go to. He also marvels at how shiny I leave the dinner plates, he often says 'no need to wash this'.

My brother is home for Christmas and we had a little chat, we have a lot in common, he remembers the withholding of treats (until he ate his veggies) when he was young but he doesn't recall the surveillance cameras. I'm also getting lots of special attention and he even slipped me a piece of chicken when The Warden wasn't looking, I'm going to be sticking really close to my brother while he's home.

The Warden says I'm feeling much better now because I'm expressing myself (barking). I find I can't even yawn without the whole family running in to see if I'm alright, which I don't mind but it would be nice if they were dangling a piece of cheese or chicken when they came. Of course this is for medicinal purposes only, it speeds up the healing process.

My first day of recovery went well after having three lumps and three teeth removed, I was even able to eat a biscuit. I also buried a biscuit in the snow, stole three chairs, had chicken with gravy, went for a walk and shared some cheese with The Warden, all in all it was a very good day.

title: The good news is I slept through the night after a full evening of whining, I was so happy to be home. More good news is that on my list of recovery items I'm not allowed a bath or grooming for the rest of this year, I'll try to stretch this into next year. I've been prescribed medicinal roast with gravy (doctors orders), as it helps with the healing process and before you know it I'll be stealing chairs. The Warden is coping well, she's hovering and watching my every move, she's back to normal.

media.title: The Doc sent The Warden a video of me and with my private nurse just to reassure everyone that I'm doing well. In addition to having my teeth cleaned, they are removing three small lumps and two damaged teeth (roots have died). It was decided to take care of all these issues now while I was sedated instead of waiting for a more serious problem to arise in the future. The Warden is also being strong and doesn't need to be sedated, I'm hoping she's preparing my roast with gravy for when I get home.

title: I'm going to see the Doc today, it'll be an all day visit to get my teeth cleaned, they've also been starving me in preparation for the procedure. The Warden is acting a little tense and all she has to do is prepare a small roast simmering in gravy for when I get home. Wish me luck today with the procedure and the roast.

media.title: I've finally sent my letter to the greatest of all, Santa, humbly asking for just a few small things as my needs are very few. A gift basket filled with an assortment of aged cheese, a small roast (no need to wrap), a years supply of gravy, six gravy coated biscuits per day and world peace. Thank you in advance and if I need to take something off my list then take away one of my biscuits per day, five instead of six.

I heard from a reliable source that Santa is coming to my house, I've also been advised that he will only come while I sleep, we'll see, I plan to wait and watch. I may have had a few indiscretions over the year but I can explain everything. When he does arrive I will remain calm, no barking, no jumping up, he's sizeable so I probably won't knock him over, I can do this, I just gotta believe.

title: Burying a biscuit in the snow is less complicated than burying it in the dirt, very basic rule, keep it simple. If you bury with just a little topping it'll be easier to retrieve later, the only complication would be another dump of snow. Try to bury in a mound of snow, you don't want anyone to mistake your biscuit for a 'piece of business'. The Warden is always walking around with a poop bag, her motto, leave no poop behind.

It's way too cold outside so you'll find me, well, wherever you are, you move I'm there. So out of respect for naps please limit all movements unless of course it's to the fridge. Please do not fake move or involve in conversations using key words and phrases which will perk my interest, such as, cheese, walk, leash, who is it, please respect the nap.

media.title: Throwback to Monday when the temperature was -10, making the ground impossible to dig, so my solution to burying a biscuit was to tuck it under a bush. This is called adapting to your environment, never give up, just make the best of what you've been given. As a side note I went outside later and brought the biscuit back inside, there was no dirt on it so there was no fuss from The Warden.

Beep beep, coming through, look out, step aside, fortunately no one was harmed or knocked over during these freight train maneuvers. The Warden just started shoveling the yard, I need plenty of room for my agility training and of course a wide variety of sniffing options for those times when I decide to go out.

title: It's always exciting when there are shopping bags, I like to be front and center with my head stuck in all the bags, today The Warden got new snow boots. I might've got a little too close but I couldn't resist the fur trim, which is now draped in slobber, not to worry, it was easy to clean and besides these are outdoor boots, who knows what you're going to step into.

media.title: In order to prepare for winter weather you might prefer to bury your biscuits inside. That's why The Warden is watching me like a hawk, she's worried about hibernating tendencies where you start to bury food and biscuits in the furniture. She'll frequently pat down the furniture, spends hours online looking for a biscuit detector and is constantly reviewing surveillance tapes.

title: Sharing the couch and reserving the couch are two different things. The Warden strategically places the pillow on what she considers as her entitlement of the couch, I believe in equal opportunity, you move you lose. Here's a tip when sharing, bend at the knees so they hover just over the edge, that way it provides me with a little extra room to stretch out, and makes a nice headrest to maximize the view of the room.

media.title: There's snow on the ground now which makes it easier for me to know who's out and about. Which also doubles the time spent on our walks as I sniff each and every foot or paw print in the snow. The Warden tries words of encouragement but I hear nothing, absolutely nothing, then I get the yank, my head goes up for a few steps until I catch another scent, which sets off a pattern of sniff, yank, walk, repeat.

It's so important to make your guests feel comfortable while visiting, they deserve the Royal treatment. Get to know who's who at the dinner table, does a little nudge get you a piece of chicken sprinkled with cheese, I found the best guest ever and we became inseparable. There was no need to whine and the leering eyes of The Warden were totally ignored, best guest ever.

Throwback to when I took a garden stroll looking for a suitable biscuit burying location, a spot hidden from prying eyes and with a fresh earthy smell. Found it, in amongst the leaves and dying plants, close to the fence where it's easier to toss dirt around. The only thing I couldn't avoid was the direct sight line of the surveillance cameras, or The Warden placing an X on her garden map.

The results of my blood work came back as all good, there's no sign of ticks and it isn't because I haven't had a bath, ticks don't care about smell. I'm surprised the results didn't show a gravy or cheese deficiency, The Warden said the scales are a better measure for this. The Doc was more polite and didn't harp on my curves, it is winter and there's a tendency to be extra fluffy during this season.

There are times when I would like a little extra attention, not all the time, just most of the time. Sometimes you have to ask for what you want, would it be too much trouble to have a cheese platter say mid morning. It's all about the little things that make you feel special, take the time to reach out to those you care about, nothing says love like cheese.

The Warden doesn't appreciate it when I try to yank the blanket off  someone when they're trying to rest, she actually said I was a pain in the a**. Actually I'm in an expressive phase which should be marvelled at and appreciated, she's not looking at the bright side. Now if I could only yank this sucker off then I would settle down for a much needed nap.

Sometimes it's about taking chances, throwing caution to the wind, dare to be different. I saw an opportunity and I seized the moment, The Warden left her chair for a few seconds, that's when I made my move. It's the small things in life that gives you the most pleasure, and making The Wardens eye twitch is one of them.

There's a rationing of biscuits behind these gated walls, I get four gravy coated biscuits per day. If I choose to bury them in the exercise yard then so be it, no replacement and no begging to The Warden. I get a merit treat for good behaviour later in the day, also (don't tell The Warden) dad sneaks me a piece of cheese just before bed. I'm serving some hard time folks with no access to the fridge and limited portions of roast with gravy.

While having my nap I could hear in the background the usual kitchen noises, not fridge related, then all of a sudden it got quiet. Unusually quiet, so I got up to investigate, there was The Warden licking the beaters covered in cream cheese icing. Outrageous sneaky behaviour, I have exclusive rights to those beaters, as a compromise I did get to lick the spoon and bowl. I leave her side for a few minutes and this is what happens, she really needs to be supervised.

Throwback to when The Warden thought I needed some winter gear, that's when I got my trapper hat. I wore it once for this photo shoot then the hat got tossed into my memory box. In this box you'll find my first collar, which probably won't fit around my leg, also a Leaf sweater (never wore) and a few ear accessories. What's not in my memory box is some of my finest memories, like the plate that was used for my roast with gravy, now that's a memory worth savouring.
The Warden said I was 'feeling ones oats', having a little extra pep in my step, actually I was calling her on, to bring her A game, she failed the challenge and brought her D game.

Sometimes on the way to the door I like to do a few leg stretches, just to warm up before I go outside. The Warden constantly praising me as I get to the door, 'good girl, go pee', if there's not any sense of urgency then I'll sit and sniff the air, maybe a little grooming, as the cold air constantly whips  into The Wardens face, she's still trying to encourage me to speed up the process. There are several tactics she'll try, 'get the squirrel' 'rabbit rabbit', I've been there done that, all in good time.

title: I'm putting a positive spin on how I see my new lounger, it's the right height (no lift service required), roomy, location allows me to monitor everyone's movements, within easy reach of chairs in case someone leaves the room and I'm the centre of attention. Also easy access for burying my biscuits and plenty of room to stretch and rotate. Please note that this lounger will only be used for short naps, once after brunch and maybe again late afternoon, all other naps will continue to be on the chairs and couch. This lounger will never replace my queen size bed at night.

media.title: I was soooo close to having the best walk ever, I was doing a meandering sniff-a-thon when all of a sudden I found a chicken bone. Well you would've thought the sky was falling from all the ruckus The Warden was making, 'hey hey, drop it drop it'. Just to stop all the fussing around I dropped the prized bone and gave her 'the look', you know that look, when they get all up in your business. We don't live in a street food friendly neighborhood so this was definitely a gift from above, almost.

Lately I've become suspicious that The Warden has been snacking while I nap, I'm trying to catch her in the act. Just around the corner is the kitchen, so as soon as I hear a crinkle I'll make a surprise appearance. Unless you brush and floss your teeth I can sniff out and determine your snack of choice. I think I'm being taken advantage of, snacking should be prohibited during all naps.

Burying a biscuit when the ground is frozen may seem like an impossible task, but here's a tip, try along the side of the fence line, you can usually dig up a dusting of dirt and debris. You may not get full coverage but this can be a blessing in disguise, next time you're out on patrol you can quickly retrieve the biscuit, take it back in the house, then watch the fun begin. The Warden usually gets riled up when you bring in anything from outside.

There was a bit of excitement yesterday, two workmen showed up and I began doing a massive greeting, barking, jumping up and a full coverage sniff. That's when The Warden pulled out the aged cheese, I was torn, what'll I do, the adrenaline was at an all time high, but there it was, aged cheese. I calmed right down as I politely sat by The Warden, as I ever so gently accepted a piece of cheese.

Sometimes you just need to take a moment to regroup, refresh and ponder your next move. I've done some major battles with my lounger without much success, so I need another strategy, maybe, just maybe, it's not so bad.

Yes, I've heard it a million times 'nobody likes to hear that noise', I really don't know why, it's music to my gravy dippers. I've been trying to relocate my new lounger but have only managed to move it an inch or so and then The Warden slides it back again. I'm not saying I don't like change but everything was just fine the way it was.

Flashback Monday, I'm remembering the small bowl of roast with gravy I had yesterday. Instead of a dinner plate The Warden used a small bowl, she was trying to keep my gravy dippers from swimming in gravy. It sort of worked out for her, she didn't have to chase me around with a wet cloth but I also didn't get to have a snack later on. Pondering moments by Miss Lilly.

Don't judge me, it's drool art, a form of expression. Now come on, kiss me, you know you want to. This is where The Warden looks around to find something to clean up her hot little mess, her expression not mine.

The Warden told me to keep the noise down, what she actually said was 'nobody likes to hear that', isn't she fun to have around. So as best I could I muffled my enthusiasm, while at the same time taking her throw for a spin across the floor. Yes, there it is, the slow building of the eye twitch, my work here is now done.

Scouting out biscuit burying locations isn't as straight forward as you would think. The pile of leaves was a good option until I saw The Warden standing there holding a rake, scrap that idea, next stop, there's some new grass along the side of the house, a good possibility.

Throwback to a picture of me in my first lounger. This was back when it was assumed I would be taking all my naps here, and get this, they actually thought I would sleep here at night, all alone. Well, they thought wrong, unfortunately the lounger didn't work out, I moved on to bigger things (couch, chairs, queen bed).

I had a vet visit, really friendly staff but all I wanted to do was go home. I got two shots, lots of rubs from the Doc, some liver treats and a bandanna. The Doc wanted to know if there was any concerns, The Warden mentioned the constant stealing of chairs, apparently there's no cure for me but The Warden might want to try therapy.

I find the placement of my new lounger to be very restrictive when trying to perform the Biscuit Dance. First of all I had to yank The Wardens throw off her chair, then run to the other room to retrieve my biscuit, place it on the throw and start the dance. The dance floor has been cut off, I can't perform the complete drag and pull, which is essential to the Biscuit Dance.

Move along and if you must clean the floor then follow the chalk outline, keep all movement to a minimum, dial down the music and definitely no shimmy shaking. Let's just say we'll meet for brunch around 10ish, that'll give you time to create a small yet impressive buffet.

With the colder weather I can't really snooze on the driveway so I decided to help The Warden with a little cleanup, that's until I heard some movement up the street. If anyone is out and about I better let them know I'm available for any and all attention, you have to jump at these opportunities, maybe even do a little barking in case they don't see you. That's when The Warden shows up, no jumping or barking, she has issues.

Keeping the lawn clear of all leaves becomes extremely important for The Warden, she wouldn't want to mistakenly step on a little 'business'. So each day I watch as she meticulously picks up all debris in the backyard, leaf bag in one hand and 'business' bag in the other hand.

It's not as easy as you would think to bury a pigs ear in my new lounger. There were a couple of problems, the blanket was hard to maneuver around, therefore making it difficult to bury anything and the lounger is stuck to the floor, impossible to drag or flip around. This could be considered a strenuous workout, so maybe, just maybe, I'll try a short nap, seeing how I'm here anyway.

title: I was surprised when dad decided to take me on a road trip, window down, ears flapping in the wind, catching a few scents along the way. Then we stopped at the Pet Store, several ladies wanted to stop and fuss over me, dad was beaming. That's where all the good times stopped, the torture salon up ahead, all my clickety clackety nails were forcefully removed. I was like an Olympic Sprinter making an exit, no wasting time on idle chatter.

media.title: Apparently, from what I heard, there's a set of rules for playing fetch, someone throws the ball, I'm to run after it, then bring it back to said thrower. Why??

The Wardens Rule number 63, no eating on the bed. Miss Lilly's Rule number one, eat where you get the most enjoyment. The biscuit in my mouth was an oversight when The Warden lifted me up on the bed, when I started doing the biscuit dance it became clear I was in the forbidden zone, which made this biscuit more pleasurable, each and every bite.

There's a slight problem with burying a pigs ear if the blanket is tucked in too tight and the source of the problem, The Warden, does nothing to help. Not to be discouraged over one failed attempt, there are plenty of other options, possibly a chair that's currently being reserved with a book.

title: I'm giving my new lounger a test drive, doesn't mean I like it or it replaces my other options. The Warden always gets suspicious when it's too quiet so she was creeping around and found me lounging. I'm also adjusting to the time change, did you know that roast and gravy helps the adjustment process, just putting it out there.

media.title: Well they did it, I got a new 'bed', I don't think so. The last 'bed' I had a few years ago I would toss and drag it around, anything but sleep on it. Now this new 'bed' I can't seem to move, they also thought if it has my blanket on it then it would become more familiar. One thing for sure it's not going to be called my 'bed', for now I'm calling it 'Lilly's Lounger'.

What to do with a new pigs ear when The Warden won't let you outside, well, I was left with few options. I'll bury it in this chair for awhile but will probably have to relocate, The Warden is suspicious of all burying activities, especially with winter coming, she's worried about me hoarding food. I think The Warden has lurking tendencies, she definitely has trust issues.

Throwback to when my brother was home, I always like to give a few life lessons before he heads back to the big city. It's important to share your space and be comfortable, that's why you take the time to rake back the blanket on the couch. Don't be afraid to share the hair, shows your generosity and remember your drool is cool, gives off that care free spirit, like you just don't care.

This was me last night getting my final instructions on the Halloween protocol. Dad handed out the candy and The Warden held me back on a leash, I got to greet all the kids but I wasn't allowed to mingle or stick my head in their candy bag. The security was extremely tight this year, last year I escaped twice and caused quite a scene, Dad was running up the street in slippers yelling cheese cheese, unfortunately there was no cheese this year.

title: I borrowed The Wardens headdress for my Halloween photo shoot.  She was trying to hide the candy under a blanket in the closet, apparently there's a goblin in our house, I snuck up behind her, grabbed the blanket and ran, that was my trick for a treat. The Warden also didn't like my idea of handing out some roast with gravy instead of candy, we would certainly be the best treat house on the street.

media.title: Due to rain and wind warnings today I'll be scheduling all activities indoors, let's start somewhere around mid morning. One of my favourite activities is stealing anyone's chair, of course there's the hovering in the kitchen waiting for someone to have a weak moment and the ever popular whining for attention. Please note I will only go outside in a moment of urgency, this of course after a few failed attempts at the door.

I could come up with an elaborate story about how the bucket of leaves got knocked over but the simple truth is I was being ignored so I nosed it over. The other fact was The Warden saw me so I pretty much had to fess up.  After the bucket got knocked over the wind picked up a bit and the leaves scattered all over, note to Warden, never rack leaves when the wind is blowing.

I managed to slip past security with a biscuit in my mouth and headed straight to the front garden. It's rare and almost unheard of to get this far, first I get a pat down, tethered up with my line, door opens, garage door opens, then freedom (as far as my line goes). I felt a little rushed because The Warden had suspected something was up, I usually just saunter out, this time I was on a mission.

In order to thoroughly enjoy my gravy coated biscuit it's important to have the right ambience, don't compromise. It's impossible to create a chewable atmosphere if there's a shimmy shaking scene happening, it's too distracting and depending on who's doing the shimmy you could lose your appetite. I only get four biscuits a day so I like to savour the moment, especially if three of the four biscuits are buried outside.

When being lectured about some nonsense it's important that you give the impression you care. Make the appropriate eye contact, they seem to need some reassurance that you're listening, a little head tilting certainly works in your favour and hopefully they will start to feel like they are in control again and reward you for your questionable behaviour.

It's not always about me all the time but there are times when it should be, like now. Did you know that constant rubbing and scratching of my back and neck will help reduce your tension, look at this as therapy. I think The Warden needs to immerse herself in some deep intense therapy, might help with that twitching eye.

When The Warden got up through the night she reserved her spot with a pillow, valiant effort, with a flick of the nose the pillow took a hike over the edge, ahhhh still warm, nice. Now wait for it, here it comes, right on cue, the slight intake of breath, I can almost hear the flutter of the eye, not to worry, there was plenty of room to stretch out across the bottom of the bed and don't forget the your pillow on the floor.

Never feel the need to be rushed, it's all about savouring the moment, feel the warmth of the sun, smell natures beauty, let it tickle your nose and above all else, avoid all eye contact if you are being asked to hurry up. There are some things that can't be rushed, all in good time, we are now on Lilly time.

All of a sudden I looked up and noticed something flying around the driveway, I approached cautiously, head down, advancing slowly, each step calculated, ready to attack if necessary. As first responder it's critical to take these extra steps, once you've made contact with the offender, sniffed it thoroughly, assessed the threat, determined it was not a snack, then I could leave the scene knowing my job as Home Land Security was done.
