title: In order to be productive today you must start the day being well rested, hydrated and a full belly. Actually something sizzling in the kitchen is a great motivator, it puts a spring in your step, nothing gets you out of a chair quicker than bacon. I'm currently waiting for some inspiration before I make a move, looking around at the staff I may be here for awhile.

media.title: You're not going to believe this, while checking out each room, I happen to notice the door to the wine cellar (aka closet) was open, and there hanging up was my blanket (aka moms old ratty housecoat). It's been missing for a few days and ended up in the forbidden room, The Warden has restricted me access to this room, there've been a few incidents of barking and getting locked in this dark hollow space. The good news is with one yank the blanket and I have been reunited.

I'm on a search and sniff mission called Leave No Biscuit Behind. There are several biscuits buried in the snow that need to be rescued.  The Warden has rationed my biscuits, once again, so now I have to hunt for my treats. I'm out in the elements forging for my own food, while The Warden is in a nice warm house looking at me through surveillance cameras.

For today's festivities we will be having a Keg party, instead of green beer we will be serving gravy along with an assortment of meats. There will be a special appearance made by Shimmy Shaking Mama, she'll be showing off her new green tassels. The Warden will keep a low profile, making sure it doesn't get too rowdy or too messy. Happy St Patrick's Day my friends!

It's true, poop does fly, dad was in the backyard with the snowblower clearing a path for me and he didn't notice the little parcels. But The Warden did, she was at the door waving baggies and dad didn't notice. Not to worry, everything was frozen and scooped up later, well, almost everything.

With the snow blizzard I've had to resort to some indoor activities, in this particular event I was going for the Gold in napping, I must say I've exceeded all expectations. The Warden did shovel the backyard, but with the blowing snow and the tarp rattling in the neighbours yard I held out most of the day. When nature called and I was forced to go outside into the elements, it was another record breaking in and out event.

It was me against the squirrel, he was up in the tree swishing his tail, which was a show of aggression, I was looking up and barking, also wagging my tail, which was a sign of extreme happiness. I kept looking back at the door, this is usually where The Warden pops her head out and starts hissing at the squirrel.  I guess extreme cold weather does have it's benefits, it keeps The Warden inside but the hair on the back of my neck tells me she's watching.

It's Monday, I haven't had my full compliment of sleep and you woke me up to see what's on my schedule today. In the foreseeable future it'll be napping, then I'll get up for a tinkle, have a drink of fresh filtered water with ice, check on my food and assorted treats, then probably have another nap. All this could change in a moments notice if the fridge door opens and I hear a crinkle of a bag.

This is the time of year where we 'spring forward' and I lose an hour of sleep, now I have to try to squeeze another nap in my already busy schedule. Another nap means another treat, I probably won't have enough time to bury my biscuits, does that mean I get an extra meal or lose a meal. It's all very confusing, I may just have to nap until the day sorts itself out or until I hear the fridge door open.

Dad said I woke him up when I howled in my sleep, I don't recall, I was dreaming about roasts and gravy or lack thereof. Maybe I have a gravy deficiency which makes me howl in my sleep, it's been forever since I've had gravy, I can only hope that this miracle cure will happen this weekend.

With all these high winds you never know what's going to fly by, especially on recycle day. Mom and I had to chase our recycle bins and I had to alert the neighbours of potential dangers. If only I wasn't on such a short leash, food containers flying all over and not one within reach.

While on our walk I had a beautiful sling of slobber across my face, whenever someone stopped to greet us mom had to announce my slobber, or maybe it was a warning. It's really not something you need to advertise, it was prominently displayed and I wore it with pride. It became a topic of conversation, and if mom wasn't worried about getting her mitts contaminated she would have tried to clean my face.

To celebrate International Women's Day we have several things planned for the day, starting with a few uplifting songs by Shimmy Shaking Momma. No celebration would be complete without a small buffet of our favorite treats. We will also hear some successful and inspirational stories by The Warden, she'll make a short appearance. Enjoy your day and may it be as happy as ours.

After the buried kibble incident The Warden has increased all security measures. Now if I stretch or move she'll be there with a clipboard and check list, as if video surveillance isn't enough. At least she has a hobby and a sense of purpose, I'm just gonna sit back and do what I do best, that is wait for an opening.

Oops I got caught again, The Warden discovered some buried kibble in the couch. The room was immediately evacuated, cushions all over, vacuum working overtime and not a shimmy or a shake during the whole process. It was only a minor breakdown, we're hopeful she'll be able to receive visitors later today.

I helped mom in the kitchen, I was the clean up crew, she was making cream cheese icing and I got to lick the beaters, they were so clean she didn't even need to wash them. It's these special moments together that you have to cherish, she also tried to give me a piece of melon which wasn't so special.

I stayed up late last night with dad, it was card night with his buddies, which also means pizza. It was a quiet night, no hooting and hollering, apparently bridge is a somber game. But I finally got my reward, a tiny piece of pizza, after that I mingled a bit then settled in for a nap on dads feet.

Moms trying out a new technique to get me to stop barking at nothing, that's what she says, there's always a reason to bark. She doesn't like to raise her voice so she starts asking me questions, keeps repeating the questions until I stop to listen. She might actually be saying something that might make sense, what if it involved a treat or we were going somewhere. Sometimes it makes me forget what I was barking at or I just get tired of listening.

I was sitting in the chair snoozing when all of a sudden there was a loud bang on the window, I jumped up, I'll admit it, I was scared. The Warden came running and discovered a Robin had flew into the window. Once I knew the threat was contained I started barking and The Warden checked out the window, probably looking for smudges.  The Robin was not injured and this is just another reason why you shouldn't clean the windows so often.

Moms got the vacuum out again, which comes as no surprise, there is an upside though, I get a good scratching before she starts. When she's done with the scratching there's hair an inch deep on the floor, it's floating in the air and moms tasseled slippers are covered. Mom would love to vacuum me but that's not going to happen, I still give it a wide berth, it hasn't attacked yet and I'm taking no chances.

title: On my walk I ran into my friend Lacy, she has long legs and lots of long black hair. I pulled out all my best moves, bobbing and weaving, running in circles, classic moves, all she did was look at me and walk away. So then I turned my attention to her mom, she bent down to my level and gave me lots of scratches and sweet talk, she loves me, it was a great walk.

media.title: I stayed up late to watch the Oscars but unfortunately I didn't make it past the Red Carpet. There was such anticipation, all the hype and excitement, friends and family, and the winner is, nope sorry, it's someone else. For all you know I could have won, they just misplaced the card that announced, and the winner is, Miss Lilly.

Mom says I'm like a camel with his nose under the tent, I start out curled up at the end of the couch and before you know it I'm stretched out occupying two thirds. Now the tricky part of this for mom is when she wants to get up and come back to the same place, she'll stuff a pillow under my head to reserve, sometimes it'll work, sometimes not.

I managed to slip past The Warden and bury a biscuit in the garden. I know she saw me, every window I looked up at I could see these beady eyes tracking me. You know the feeling where the hair stands up on the back of your neck, where your every move is being scrutinized, that's the feeling I'm talking about. When I went in, there she was holding a wet cloth, apparently it was a preventative measure, by the way, my feet were clean.

Mom and I shared a piece of toast which she said had butter on it. I'm sending a sample to the Lab to see if they can find any trace elements of butter. It's was a rare treat (sort of), I gently took my microscopic piece and stared longingly into her eyes, praying that the next piece would have cheese on it.

The Warden was sorting and stacking the laundry from the dryer, she has a system, stack according to location starting with the top drawer of the dresser. What happened was, there was a sweater at the bottom which I grabbed onto and sent the neatly organized stack flying all over.  You had socks mingling with t-shirts, jeans with pjs, a totally disorganized mess. I'm happy to report The Wardens doing well and we expect a full recovery.

I was out in the yard when all of a sudden I saw a squirrel on the deck, never seen this before, I charged at it, I was a force to be reckoned with, when all of a sudden it flew to the top of the fence and scurried off. The Warden was on the scene in seconds, started that hissing thing she does, which doesn't work by the way. I think what frightened everyone was her vintage wear (aka old flannel pjs).

I've issued a Code Red and locked down this room until I figure out how this floor lamp got here.  Apparently while I was napping The Warden placed the lamp here until it could be taken to the deep dark recesses of the basement, you know that place where nobody likes to talk about. It's a place where things get stored with the hope it'll be used again, but deep down you know this is the end of the line.

I can always tell in the evening when it's time to relax on the couch, the first clue is mom reserves two thirds of the couch, leaving one third for me. The second clue is, mom puts on her lounge wear (aka flannel pjs), that's when I make my move.  Now if she forgets to reserve the couch we're looking at a whole different scenario, I can now occupy the two thirds section, this is what's considered the seat of opportunity, let the negotiations begin.

I'm waiting for a reaction from The Warden, she got up for a moment, her chair was warm and I'm sitting on her book.  This could go one of two ways, I'll definitely get the look, her one eye will start twitching, there'll be a little huffing and puffing and she may walk away OR she'll go to the fridge, get a piece of cheese and sweet talk me off the chair, this being my favourite choice and the one that works almost every time.

There's no doubt I'm a good girl, I hear it each and every day. As soon as I get up in the morning and start my slow meandering walk and stretching to the door it starts, 'she's a good girl', when I come in from doing my business, 'isn't she a good girl', this sets the tone for the day, I can do no wrong.

Some may say I'm the nosey neighbour, always looking to see who's out and about, well, I am that neighbour. If there's movement outside I'll sound the alarm, it'll start with a trilling noise, working it's way up to a full on howl. It all depends on how close someone is to the house, if they are in the driveway I'll be outta this chair, at the door, howling and scratching, as The Warden says, better than an alarm system and enough to frighten most people away.

Now if you really wanted to reserve this chair you should have placed the book in the middle, by placing it to the side is like an invitation. This paperback is like a small pillow, I can work with this, just a minor inconvenience. Oh, hi mom, you look like you want to say something, make it quick, I'm about to settle down in this nice warm chair.

I got up this morning to a bowl of tepid water, I actually had to wait while the staff refreshed my beverage, filtered water with ice. The standards are slipping, no one should have to start their day under these conditions. I happened to notice that someone else got their morning drink on time, mineral water with freshly squeezed lemon, certainly no delay there.

May today be a very special day, be the reason someone smiles today. May all your treats be lined up, your gravy dippers ready and lots of time spent with those that give the best scratches. Happy Valentines Day to all my friends ð¹

During the hibernating season it's important to maintain your nap schedule and get plenty of meat covered in gravy. I currently have a deficiency in gravy and I'm officially filing a complaint. With all the snow we've had I need the strength to go outside and face the elements. You still need to sniff and search for the right location, therefore remember gravy is a necessary ingredient for the winter months.

My biscuits are now being rationed, it's got something to do with my winter insulation, it's really not fair to judge ones girth during the long winter months. With each biscuit I perform a biscuit dance, which I consider to be a form of exercise, therefore there should be no restrictions. The biscuit dance consists of picking up the biscuit, running to my blanket, burying the said biscuit, dragging it across the floor, locating the buried biscuit, then eating it, now that's a lot of exercise.

Shimmy Shaking Mama was considering doing a few gigs on the road, we would start at a Senior Residence, she'd toss a few tassels and I would mix and mingle with the crowd. That was before the venue saw the promotional demo, now everything is on hold and charges are pending.  We've finally come to a plea agreement, no more distribution of disturbing videos and definitely no performances. At least she tried, the only thing holding her back was talent.

I've been pondering, I would like to set up a calendar for bath dates, it's important to be in charge of your own destiny. Now let's see, January, February and March are too cold, April and May too rainy, June is my Birthday month of celebration, July and August I don't smell, September is an adjustment month, October, November and December are officially gravy season and my gravy dippers cannot be cleaned. Well, would you look at that, no available dates for the upcoming year.

On my walks it's been said that my nose is in overdrive, I've been tracking and following each and every footprint and paw prints. Each message centre is brimming with news, everyone is catching a hint of spring in the air, plus some local gossip.  It's been rumoured the small fluffy dog up the street had a hair cut, imagine that in this weather, probably explains the new sweater.

I got in a bit of trouble, I was exercising my freedom to bark at corners, as The Warden says, relentlessly barking. It started out I was burying a biscuit in my blanket, then dragging it around until my butt hit the wall, that's when I turned around and confronted the corner of the wall. It made perfect sense to bark and paw at the floor, I was attacked from behind and had to retaliate. The Warden just needs to settle down and take a deep breath.

When I'm getting ready to lay down I do several circles, there is no set number of turns and where I end up is very random.  Now mom has a different opinion, she says odds are my butt will end up facing the pillow. It's like spinning the roulette wheel, I'll keep circling until I stop, it's not a planned event, it just happens.

Dad and I stayed up late last night to watch the football game, now today I'll be catching up on a few naps, I'm totally off schedule. I went to him several times to remind him it was bedtime but he ignored me, said it was a good game. Dad also went off his Lifestyle Choices and had a pizza, said it was a must for game day, I had to agree with him on this.

The repair to the broken bracket in the wine cellar (aka closet) caused a little excitement. Dad had assessed the crime scene, armed himself with 3 screwdrivers, a hammer, his reading glasses and a $3.00 replacement bracket. I supervised the whole process, barking at the tools and the broken bracket, it was exhausting. The Warden was assigned as the cleanup crew, dad had a celebratory fancy coffee and I napped on my reclaimed blanket.

There was a slight incident, I was in the wine cellar (aka closet) when I spotted my blanket (aka moms housecoat) hanging up. I started to yank it off the hanger when all of a sudden the shelf bracket broke, that's when one of moms antiques (iron) fell to the floor. The Warden was quick on the scene, removed some clothes, actually made a mess, now everything is out of order. This all could have been prevented if my blanket stayed on the floor and didn't get washed, just saying.

Whatcha got mom, maybe we could spend some time together and share some snacks, you know, bite for bite. Maybe you could put your eating issues aside and just focus on the sharing part. Mom likes to eat in private with no one watching her, she has this thing about savouring each bite, she's got issues.

Throwback to when my brother was home.  He completely understands me and follows the seating protocol, he got up for a quick minute and I made my move. He also provided extended scratching sessions, the kind where there's an inch of hair on the furniture and a dusting in the air. You could sense The Warden hovering in the background waiting nonchalantly to make a cleanup move.

The floors look perfectly clean to me mom, you can't worry about every paw print every time I go out and come in. Forget the hair, slobber and biscuit crumbs, it just gives the ambience of that lived in feeling. What you might want to do is check your uptight meter, it needs a little adjusting.

I was doing a little tracking in the snow, each footprint required a sniffing investigation. One set of prints in the open field (aka front yard) indicates a fairly large animal, maybe 70 to 80 pounds, long legs according to the stride, sizeable prints, possibly left about five hours ago, definitely searching for prey. Be on the lookout and stay safe my friends.

I'll be busy most of the day, my schedule is full, don't call me I'll call you. If my eyes are closed it just means I'm thinking, if you hear snoring it means intense thinking. There's a lot of planning that needs to be done, decisions have to be made, later let's meet for a cheese break, with cheese comes clarity.

I happened to be walking past the laundry room just as mom was taking my blanket (aka moms housecoat) out of the dryer. With one yank I was back in action, a quick spin and drag around several rooms, then I scurried to get several biscuits, before you know it the blanket was back in fine shape, covered in hair, slobber and biscuit crumbs.

As I head to the back door each morning I find it's important to do a few leg stretches along the way, mom calls it meandering basset style. Once the door opens you need to raise your head and see if you can catch a scent, you just can't blindly go without being aware of your surroundings. When it feels right then you put your head down and let the sniffing begin, it's all a process.

There's a few things to consider when entering a room, mainly chair selection. First option is always the freshly vacated chair, if all chairs are empty then you have to consider the most desired one by others. There may be times where you have to play musical chairs, someone gets up then your obligated to move. You may be snoozing but if there's any movement be ready to change, it's not complicated just instinctual.

All quiet on the home front, just enjoying a little me time. I call this the time where everything just simmers, in an hour or so it'll all start. First I'll start to hear a little music, then there'll be movement around the house, and all the fussing begins. I know the routine by now, so I don't need to make a move until there's a little shimmy action in the kitchen, that fridge door opens and I'm outta here.

Due to freezing rain I've had to create some indoor activities. This one event won me the triple crown, it started out with my blanket (aka moms bathrobe), then moving on to dads throw which took a lot of yanking, and finally moms blanket. The object of the game was to get all three yanked off each participant, drag and bark around arena (aka floor), the last and most difficult hurdle is to run to the other room, retrieve a biscuit, return to blankets to do a final bark and dance.  The much covenant award was a piece of cheese.

Mom you gotta see this, the guy across the street is loading up the car and he's leaving the outside lights on.  This can only mean one thing, he's going on holidays. Oh look now, it's the girlfriend, she's got a suitcase, I can only draw one conclusion, she's in charge of the treats.

Sitting in small chairs does have some disadvantages, harder to stretch out, gives the appearance of added girth and neck folds are more prominently displayed. On the upside it's a freshly vacated chair, mom got up for a second and I popped right. I'm really just a slip of a girl and this chair is very tiny, which gives the allusion of extra skin folds.

There I was running around at the golf course, meeting and greeting, sniffing and having a grand ole time, then when I got home they threw me in the tub.  There was only a little bit of dirt, a good roll on the couch would have taken care of that. My lawyer has been contacted and an arrest warrant will be issued, these are also repeat offenders so good luck getting out of this one.

I'd like to propose a week of celebration, a time where we can all gather in the kitchen, where the fridge door is always open, gravy is flowing freely, cheese is stacked on platters, there's laughter and a little shimmy shaking.  On top of all this let's not forget there be naps upon naps. This is the time of year to sit back and relax, preferably in a freshly stolen chair. You are all invited to join in.

Coming in from outside I noticed something right away, I inched forward, it appeared non threatening, laying there curled up, upon closer inspection I discovered it was a string. I'll have to speak to the staff, the standards are slipping, it's important to roam the home without all these distractions.

I found out after the attack that the menacing creature was dads shaving brush. I could have sworn it bristled like a small hedgehog, what else could I do, I sensed danger and I dealt with it. I grabbed on, gave a couple of good shakes and those bristles just laid out flat. Another crisis has been averted and regularly scheduled activities can resume.

Once again I slipped past The Warden and headed to the great outdoors with a biscuit. There's a trick to burying a biscuit when the ground is frozen, try digging just under a bush or along the fence. Most of the snow is gone from this corner of the yard so I was successful in digging up enough dirt to bury a biscuit right along side the fence. Another win for team Lilly.

I have my own special treat cabinet unfortunately it's not refrigerated, therefore it's not that special. It holds only dry dog treats, there's quite a variety but I am only partial to the gravy coated biscuits and the chicken strips. Some day I'm hoping to get my own fridge, which will of course be accessible.

If you need me today I'll be stretched out on my newly acclaimed blanket (aka moms housecoat). Mom has awarded me this blanket or shall I say she conceded and that I won this battle. There's a slight tear that happened while I was yanking on it but here's the thing, it's never been worn, it just hangs in the wine cellar (aka closet) for just in case.  I'm now making good use of it.

Last night we had lots of guests and I made sure everyone was greeted properly. As a security precaution I also checked all handbags, no treats were found. The Warden wouldn't let me have any ribs and she told me to settle down. I walked around the table looking for a weak link, usually that would be dad, but nobody caved in. I eventually went and laid on someone's feet, another service provided while visiting our home.

Somehow my ball ended up in the wine cellar (aka closet), I happened to be barking at it, then my backend (aka butt) was wiggling around which then accidentally closed the door. The Warden heard the ruckus and eventually opened the door, her response time seems to be getting longer. When she opened the door I gave her the look, I think she got the message.

I did not make a fuss, cause a disturbance or act in an unbecoming way, this was all coming from The Shimmy Shaking Mama.  Yes I did yank the blanket down, try to bury the ball and maybe make a little noise but this certainly can't compare to the attempts at singing and a little tassel tossing.

Dads lifestyle choices (aka diet) has not affected my quality of life, we are still able to snack on cheese and turkey. He has to overcome a huge obstacle, he was born with a chocolate gene, which I can't have anyway so I'm not complaining. He's exercising, walking and making healthier choices, I'm his support team, especially if there's snacking.

Now the problem with freshly tucked blankets is it's hard to get it ruffed up enough to bury my biscuit. The trick would be to first dig out a nest for a nap, unhinge those neatly tucked blankets. This was a rookie mistake, to be corrected with round two.

I was in the small library (guest room, one bookshelf) with one of the staff (aka mom) when I happened to notice something out of place, I approached with caution, leaned in, head down, paw raised, then raised the trumpet (aka howled). Once I realized there was no movement I proceeded to sniff, nosing it forward until it fell off the shelf, it was a pottery bowl, which the staff scooped up and relocated to a higher shelf. Be warned of objects out of place.

We are in a bit of a deep freeze, very cold weather, so I'm suppose to hurry along with my walks. What they don't understand is that with each snow bank it's like a message centre, I gotta stay on top of the local news. Walk, sniff, yank and pull, sniff, sniff, yank and pull, walk, it's the fine art of walking in the winter.

After my morning outing the hostess (aka mom) graciously displays an assortment of specialty treats (aka dog treats, all natural). I watch as each one is gently placed for easy access, I occasionally lick my lips in anticipation, I sniff, then walk away, maybe later. Now, if the hostess were to display a fine assortment of aged cheese or real meat, there would be no time wasted watching, it would be hand to mouth, direct deposit only.

I was all snuggled in moms chair, snoozing away, not a care in the world.  Then mom showed up, circling around, pacing, seemed a bit agitated, tried sitting in another chair, then left.  That's when I heard the fridge door open, the opening of a bag and then the sweet smell of ham. In two seconds flat I was outta that chair, that's when mom rushed in and said thanks for the warm chair.

I'm just a simple girl with very few requirements, no need to fuss over me. Just give me a bowl of water, a few morsels and the occasional treat. If the water could be filtered, with ice and refreshed several times a day, please. I do prefer aged cheese just in case you were wondering. I like to nap on the chairs in the daytime, the couch in the evening and in the middle of the queen size bed at night. Just a simple girl.

I was casually walking past the stairs when I noticed something, an intruder.  I sounded the four star alarm, got in the attack position and waited for reinforcements. The Warden was first on the scene, by then I was ferociously pawing at the floor. That's when I saw the fear in her eyes, the threat was confirmed, it was dads slippers out of place.

Dad thought he'd use this throw while he was reading in his chair, I had other plans. It was a bit of a struggle and took some time but with persistence I finally yanked it off him. After that I barked and dragged it around, this can be considered as an indoor activity for a rainy day.

I captured moms fur trimmed mitt, I ran with it, shook it, maybe even roughed it up a bit. Mom can sometimes be blind to the threats trimmed in fur, I had to neutralize the offending mitt, for safety reasons.

I was left all alone while mom and dad went to visit grandpa. But don't worry about me, all alone, I'll just be sitting here, waiting forever, wondering if you'll ever come back. Go ahead, leave me, I'll probably be weak from the lack of treats and emotionally distraught, but no, you go ahead.

Happy New Year my friends, may your year be filled with cheese and your gravy dippers get lots of use. Mom wants everyone to sing and dance, shimmy like no one is watching. Let this be the year to make tassels great again. Be the reason that others smile.

I'm exhausted after a good round of barking, we had a small snow blower delivered that required unpacking and assembly. I started barking at the box and continued straight through until it was put together and placed on the deck. This is moms snow blower to help clear the backyard, we're expecting more snow today so there'll be a little barking when she test drives it, therefore I better rest up.

Dad got some new smelly body spray, the sales lady said the women would be lining up. The updated report is there's been no line up, not a wink or even a raised eyebrow. Mom told him to return it to the lady and ask for a refund.

Nothing to see here mom, just move along. I recognize that look, the close scrutiny, almost like you don't trust me. What if there was danger, something lurking under those wrappings, you can never be too careful. Follow your instincts, check out the 'what ifs'.

Apparently I woke mom up in the night by howling, after that she said I sounded like a wild stallion, my lips were flapping, whistling and tail thumping. By now you know she has tendencies to embellish, all I know is I slept like a baby, laying across the middle of the bed, while mom teetered on the edge.

Everybody back up until this area has been secured. So far these objects seem submissive but that could be a ruse, waiting to catch me off guard. There's a heightened alert, it's time for Basset Security to circle around, I'm sure I saw them inch forward getting ready to attack, never turn your back, stay low and be within striking position.

'Tis the season to be generous and that piece of cheese you're holding would be a nice gesture, giving to others always makes you feel better. So if you could just shimmy a little closer, lighten your load, it'll lift your spirits.

Merry Christmas my friends!  Santa left me a letter, he said he found my Christmas list inspiring and if you're gonna dream, dream big. The only thing holding you back is your own imagination. He's assured me there will be cheese and my gravy dippers will get some use. Enjoy this special day of celebration.

'Twas the day before Christmas, the day of complete innocence and giving of good cheer, just in case Santa is checking in. Even the Warden is relaxed and ready, except for that slight twitch in her eye, but a few deep breaths and some dusting she'll be good to go.

Dear Santa, it's me, Miss Lilly.  Hopefully everything is going well. As you review my list over the past year you may have noticed I had a few indiscretions, these can be explained as character building moments and I've learned from my mistakes. If you can see past this, I would like ask for a few things for Christmas, an accessible fridge, an outdoor covered pee-station and a cheese platter. Thank you in advance for your kind consideration. Sincerely Miss Lilly

I was outside just sniffing around when I looked up and saw a lot of commotion inside, this could only mean one thing, company. Like a rocket I was at the door in no time, only to find out it was just mom, her shimmy was on fire, I almost called the fire department. Any time you get new tassels this is what's to be expected.

I just happened to be walking past the wine cellar (aka closet) when I heard this noise, next thing I knew moms housecoat was on the floor, I'm thinking the cellar is possessed and the wine spirits are acting out. Now, about the biscuit crumbs, that's a little more difficult to explain.

The IG authorities have finally contacted us for a lack of postings and to inquire about our wellbeing. There's been no kidnapping or atrocities unless you consider moms latest version of the shimmy an atrocity. It was just an attempt to go off the grid and slow things down. Mom was hoping for a rescue mission from Jason Bourne but please know all is well.  The Warden is looking forward to updating her Rule Book Library (aka another shelf) and Shimmy Shaking Mama is preparing some new routines for the holiday season. I've been going in the wine cellar (aka closet) yanking moms housecoat down, dragging it around, barking at it, then settling down to dine on it with a biscuit, lets say business as usual. Thank you all so much for taking the time to reach out and may you all be as blessed as we are â¤ï¸

I got to play in the snow with the kids, they made a snowman and threw snowballs for me to fetch. Well, I don't really fetch, I just like to run around in circles and jump up, that's just about the time The Warden popped her head out the door and told me to come in. And it wasn't me who knocked over the snowman, just saying.

Mom set her new mitts on the coffee table, they were red with fur trim, that's when I made my move. I snatched one off the table and made a run for it, there was a bit of a chase and tugging back and forth, I also gave it a good shake.  I swear I thought I saw the fur move, I didn't hesitate, it was a safety concern.

All the kids were out playing street hockey and I wasn't allowed to join. They were running around, chasing after a ball, laughing, the parents were chatting and there I was, inside looking out the window. I know how to play hockey, I'd chase the puck (aka ball), bark and run around, but no, I'm just a spectator on the inside looking out.

I don't like the word 'stay', it usually means I'm not included and I'm being left all alone. That's when I go to the front room and sit by the window, all by myself, just waiting forever and ever. I'll nap but it's a lonesome nap, I'll try to remember the good ole days of stealing warm seats and sharing snacks, waiting until they return.

I had a traumatic day yesterday, dad called it embarrassing, I was tortured with nail clippers. Apparently this service is not optional and does not come with a complimentary cheese platter. Afterwards I was given lots of special attention and a dry biscuit, I just wanted to go home.

I was outside, meandering, sniffing, when I spotted a dead worm. I circled around, sniffed again, then I leaned in with my shoulder, going in for a roll.  That's when I heard this tapping, it was the Warden, first tapping on the window, then she pops her head out the door, telling me to get away from there, guess what, another rule, no rolling on worms.

I'm Miss Lilly and I bury biscuits. I have nothing to hide and I'm proud of what I've accomplished. Even with heightened security and the watchful eyes of the Warden, I have done what few could do. My biscuits are now rationed, but we will prevail and bury biscuits once again.
If you like the hat so much mom then you wear it, first of all it's too small and secondly, it serves no purpose. Wait, I know, I could bury it, or would this be on your list of burial restrictions.

I'll be resting for a few days, it was a busy weekend. Watching the removal of my buried biscuits, all the furniture tore apart, vacuum running overtime, the consistent surveillance and then there's the Warden, well that's a whole other story.

The Warden found my buried biscuits in the furniture. The furniture has been decommissioned and thoroughly cleaned. The Warden had a small meltdown but we are hopeful for a full recovery.  She is now using full sentences and the humming has stopped. The only explanation, straight from the Basset Almanac, is that I'm stocking up for a long cold winter.

Dad got up from his chair to go and let me outside for my morning business. I had a decision to make, go outside or a freshly vacated warm chair. It was an easy decision, the chair was so inviting, I can go outside later and dad was very accommodating.

When mom eats a piece of cheese she has this annoying habit of chewing very slow, then pausing before the next bite, who does that. Oh, and she doesn't like anyone to watch her eat, especially if they drool and whine, well it's not exactly a fun time watching her. I rarely see her eat snacks, I wonder why that is.

This was last week and one more biscuit buried in the snow. The snow has all disappeared so I'll be busy relocating the biscuits to the gardens. It might be a bit muddy so the Warden might want to up the meds.

It started out with mom on the couch, snuggled under her throw, then I joined her at the end with my head resting on her slippers. I needed to stretch and circle around, then I slid up beside mom, not to worry, plenty of room for everyone.  Of course mom, you would be more comfortable if you moved over on your side.

I'm declaring my innocence in advance. I've prepared a motion to dismiss, working on my appeal and looking for witnesses, so if anything comes up I'll be ready. Sometimes trouble finds me, it lurks around the corner, so if you continually declare your innocence you begin to believe it.

I'm checking the Basset Handbook on a ruling, the Warden said all business must be done in shovelled areas. This is where we differ, if you're out in the snow sniffing and nature calls, bingo, that's where **it happens. Besides it's not my fault if you don't know where to walk.

Just getting in a little agility training before I go in. Make sure you hug those corners tightly so you don't spin out. Don't be afraid to blaze a new trail, it keeps things fresh and new. After each workout be sure to hydrate and nap.

There was a slight incident, when I entered the hall I noticed something on the floor, it looked to be frozen in fear. I approached with caution, sniffed the offending perpetrator, issued an alarm (howled), then stayed in the attack position until reinforcements arrived (mom). It turned out to be a hand towel, this time, next time, maybe not so lucky.

By taking moms blanket for a spin around the room I was helping dust the floor.  There's also a few doors in the house that need to be cleaned, it's where I open them with my snout, apparently my chops are dirty. Now if all doors were left open all the time this wouldn't happen, it's called preventive maintenance.

I like to start my sprint training with a couple of nose flicks in the snow, then release with a power thrust, show some air under those hops, then stop and shake it out. All calculated to build stamina, don't try this without proper training.

It's a myth that you can't plant biscuits in the snow. Once you get past the Warden the rest is easy. There's no dirt or mud to worry about, the biscuit is preserved by the cold and readily available when the snow melts.

Due to the weather I'll be inside more and feel I need to set boundaries. Usually when mom has a captive audience she feels the need to entertain.  It's like I'm being held captive and forced to watch a performance I wouldn't pay to see, I do have standards.

The wind is blowing, there's a snow blizzard and you want me to go outside, I don't think so. There's at least a foot of snow on the deck and as soon as the door opens the snow pellets my face, think again, no way. Eventually dad shovelled the deck and made a path so the Princess was able to go out.

I'm not thinking what you think I'm thinking, it hasn't occurred to me to move moms book and take her chair. Now I may be thinking of that throw draped across the top of the chair that needs to be yanked off, barked at, then napped on. I'm definitely warming up to that idea as soon as these prying eyes shift in another direction.

We had a guest who looked at one chair with hair on it, then went to another chair, also with hair and then looked at mom, she said, our gift to you. We can be especially generous if you wear black tights or black wool, a gift that keeps on giving.

One of my favourite days is laundry day, it's very important to capture something, run around with, bury a biscuit in it, bark at it and finally make a nest and sleep on it. Let's not forget the real fun of tug-of-war when moms ready to wash them, I hope dads pjs hold up.

I had a little explaining to do, when mom looked out the window to check on me all she saw was an empty collar. I slipped it off and went to the neighbours garden where tulips had just been planted. That's when I saw mom coming across the street in her tasseled slippers. I knew something wasn't right, mom never wears her slippers outside, I immediately went to her and got lots of special attention.  My collar has been tightened.

Before you say anything I can explain, there was a little dust up in the garden and my feet just happened to be in the wrong place at the wrong time. I can see you're calculating the risk factor of me going inside, why don't you just this once throw caution to the wind and step aside.

While security the house I encountered something curled up in a small ball under the bed downstairs. I sent out an alarm, a ferocious bark and then assumed the attack position. Mom got a hockey stick and inched it forward, as soon as it was within reach I snatched it up and shook it. It turned out to be my brothers dirty sock, fortunately no one was harmed during this incident.

Sometimes I just prefer to be oblivious to what's going on.  There's noise, some movement, the sweeping and swishing, the clatter of dishes, it's all familiar yet not worth the effort to even flinch.  Now open that fridge and crinkle a bag, I'm your new best friend.

I always start my walks out slow, nose to the ground, ears dragging and drool dangling.  Once I get past the taking care of business section, I'm good to go. With the cooler weather I've added more spring to my step, more glide to my stride, even added a little rip and tear. I also decided to run for several blocks, a very rare sighting.

When sharing space there are a few rules that should apply, mom has mastered these techniques. First of all you should not be nervous about sleeping on the edge, use your upper body for support. Scrunch up on your side with a slight bend in the knees, always be mindful that you don't teeter over. Always be willing to adjust your position in order to provide maximum comfort for others (aka me).

We had a helping hand from Mother Nature, she came in and swept all the leaves from our yard and graciously gave to others. We also received the neighbours garbage can, at first I thought we were under attack, that's the only reason I barked, it was to save and protect the family.

There's soup being made and I'm waiting for the ham to make an appearance, once it does I'll be front and centre. Why not add the meat first and forget all those veggies, why not just forget the soup part and just have meat. If I ponder long enough I'll turn this soup into a stew swimming in gravy.

It was a great day on the street yesterday, there were pool people, tree trimmers, neighbours out and about. The pool guy came over for a tussle, the neighbour came by for a chat, this all restored my faith in a friendly neighbourhood. The Warden was inside and missed the action, but I'm sure if there was a slight indiscretion she would've popped outta that door like a rocket.

Mom had to come outside and have a word with me, apparently I was bothering the neighbors. Well they were across the street chatting it up and were totally ignoring me, very rude. Ok so I might have howled, whined, whimpered and barked, all this could have been avoided if they were a little more neighborly, just saying.

I'm at a crossroads, should I stay outside or go in and face the music. Shimmy Shaking Momma has turned up the music and is having a Proud Mary Moment. As if Monday's aren't hard enough, I was planning to catch up on my naps today. If she's shaking in the kitchen then I'll risk it.

The Warden won't let me wake up our guests (aka my brothers). I got up especially early so I could do a bang and crash into their room. If I make the effort to get up early then so should everyone else. Besides, the earlier they get up the earlier I can go back to sleep.

With company there's a whole new set of rules. Must allow sufficient seating, no hogging couch. Cannot crash into bedrooms and jump on beds, must not sit and whine outside bedroom doors. I'm more of a live in the moment kinda girl, what will be will be.

Mom has been ripping up the garden, all those plants and flowers that I wasn't allowed to lay on are all gone, nothing but carnage. The good news is I now have full access, for mom this could be considered therapy, she has issues.

Throwing it back to when my brothers started their super hero journey, today they have successfully maintained their super hero status. For me, this was the start of me taking over all the furniture, today I'm happy to report that I now have complete access to all furniture including a queen size bed.  We've come along way my friends.
This is a rare event, I was able to sneak a biscuit past the Warden and bury in the front garden. The trick is to act casual, nothing going on here, just securing the area, keeping the family safe.

Halloween started with me making great sound effects, jumping up on the door, howling and scratching the glass. At one point I slipped past security (aka dad), and was out mingling with the kids!  The kids were yelling Miss Lilly, Miss Lilly, the neighbours were yelling she's over here, over here, then there's dad, running up the street in his slippers with a piece of cheese. Yes, I broke all the rules, but what a night.

I'm expecting a lot of company tonight so I have to be on my best behaviour. There's to be no barking, jumping or sticking my head in Halloween bags. This should not be a problem, I'll be completely composed, sitting quietly in the background, watching all the treats being passed around, you'll barely notice me.  Happy Halloween ð»

Mom called me annoying, I yanked and pulled this blanket off her, used it as dinner plate as I chewed on treats, then dragged it all over the floor.  Let's look on the bright side, the floor got dusted, the crumbs were contained and I had a great place to snooze.

On my walk I met a really friendly lady, all mom noticed was her beautiful black coat, a drool line with a dangling leaf, and me wiggling in closer to jump up.  Mom said black coats are a magnet for hair and one slobber shake could be an accessory attachment which would require forgiveness. Mom didn't say much just a nervous twitch, the kind she gets before a major cleanup.

Must approach with extreme caution, mom you stay back until I determine if this is a friendly. I sniffed the surrounding area then cautiously inched forward, lifting one paw in attack position, I could tell mom was nervous and wanted to do this by the book. It's probably best to give it a wide berth and do not turn your back on it, you just never know.

Throwing it back to when my brother was home and we were having a great scratch and rub session. We ended up with several piles of hair on the floor and a great dusting in the air. The Warden watched on, getting that nervous twitch in her eye, plotting when to nonchalantly clean up.
Just having a little fun with moms freshly washed black fleece jacket. It was missing a few things like my hair, a bit of slobber and some biscuit crumbs, now it's just perfect, ready to wear.

I thought I heard the cheese wrapper, better let me in or this doors coming down.  Once I was in I immediately positioned myself one foot from mom, easy access for mom to reach down with my cheese. Never appear too eager and try not to whimper or inch in too close. Once the cheese is bagged and put in the fridge then you can resume regular activities.

The best seats in the house are always the freshly vacated ones. Especially if there was an attempt to reserve the chair. Mom always tries hard but I try harder, it's about setting goals then going after them. While you're up mom could you whip up a little something, I find bacon very motivational.

I met my friend Bella on our walk, she's little with a big attitude. I tried to get her to play, I was ducking and weaving, twisting and turning, ripping and tearing, move'n and groove'n, showing all my moves and she totally ignored me, everyone else was impressed except little Miss Attitude.

It's been raining for three days now so I'm asking mom to petition the City again to be able to build a Dome in the backyard. Why not, on nice days open the roof, rainy and snow days close the roof, it's a win win for everyone. If this doesn't happen then on to the next option, canopy or large umbrella with personal staff.

I was tired and had no intention of getting up, mom wanted me to go outside before all the rain. It wasn't a convincing argument, that's when the doorbell rang, I flew off the bed, ready for a royal greeting.  There stood mom at the front door, waiting to let me out, not funny mom.

Yesterday started out as a great day, we had early morning guests, the sprinkler guys.  I went out with a full greeting package, howling, barking, running around, jumping up, having a great time.  Then the sprinklers came on and I got wet, apparently I didn't hear mom calling me.

Ok, so I barked at the window screens, they weren't where they should be. Mom was cleaning them for winter, then storing them in the wine cellar (aka closet), that's just asking for trouble.  She just created a barkable situation, if only she kept the door open.

Yesterday I managed to bury a biscuit in the garden. The dirt was loose, dug a small hole, carefully covered the biscuit with my nose, tamped it down, then walked away. The trick is to circle around and casually walk by making sure the site looks undisturbed.  Managed all this without any prying eyes.

One of my blankets may not make it, it's becoming to thin, according to the Warden. It's clearly been the victim of too many washes, it's time to stop this senseless cleaning. Just when you think you've got it smelling just right, with the right amount of hair and slobber, then wham, into the wash it goes.
Stand back mom, a stranger put something up there, let me clear the area first. It took awhile before I could get this close, yes, there was a combo of barking and a slight rumble of a growl.

You'll never guess what, but all the fences have been removed and I'm just having a tour around the yard.  The Warden is preparing the gardens for the winter. Now that I have complete access I'll need to do some of my own winterizing!

Mom had great plans for this blanket, she was going to sit in her chair, read a book and snuggle up with the blanket. I had other plans, first of all I had to get it off mom, drag it all over the room, bark at it, snooze and drool on it. Mom was once again reminded why this blanket got stored in the closet for months.

You can coax me, bribe me, do all your sweet talk but I'm not going outside until I'm ready.  There's no urgency and besides my legs are crossed. When I'm ready I'll go to the door, do a little stretch, sniff the air and if conditions seem right I'll meander outside on my own terms.

It's been said that sharing is caring, and how much you care is how much you share. Now let's say mom is slicing cheese for the week and I'm sitting quietly, bating my eyes, tilting my head, is this not cheese worthy. Yes, mom shared cause she cares.

Mom I need to have a serious talk with you and I'd like your full attention.  Somehow you seem a little distracted, got something on your mind you'd like to share. Now I'm distracted and forgot what was so important.  Why don't we just kick back and share a snack, whatever it was can wait.

It's called turkey hangover, lots of excitement yesterday, so today I'm in recovery.  I had my cousins crawling around on the floor looking for my ball, lots of family participation. My gravy dippers were put to use and the Warden didn't even chase me with wipes, it was a good day.

Today is not all about turkey and gravy, it's about being thankful for many things. I'm thankful for a family who allows me access on all the furniture, plenty of scratches, rubs, treats, aged cheese, fresh filtered water with ice and especially turkey and gravy. Happy Thanksgiving ð¦ð§

Ok mom, let's review your list for our turkey dinner tomorrow. First off, you've got one right, and there's gonna be gravy, lots of it. I promise not to get in line with everyone this time, if you promise some turkey ahead of time. Looks like we've covered all the important issues, good luck mom.

What's up mom, how's things.  I'll be awhile just in case you're wondering. So why don't you go relax and I'll come get you when I'm ready. A better idea would be for you to shimmy to the kitchen and fix a little something up.

I had a scary moment, from the depths of the closet mom brought out an ironing board, I've never seen one before, so I barked at it. Then out came some antique called an iron, talk about throwing it back to old school. I thought wrinkles added character.

Mom did you know dad found the lemon tarts?  He hasn't found the cookies yet so my lips are sealed. These apparently are not on his list of lifestyle choices. Mom said he acts like he's serving a life sentence without any chance of treats.

This is a rare sighting captured in my natural habitat, preparing to eat my biscuit which was just retrieved from its burial site. It was nicely tucked in the cushion, now the placement is very important, the anticipation is building, the preparation is key, savour the moment.

Monday's are about new beginnings, moms favourite born to be wild tie dye t-shirt has seen its final day, it's time. It was a great t-shirt for many groovy years, the final service will be held this Thursday at the regularly scheduled pick up time.

Careful of the angle of your pictures mom, some make me look a little heavier. Keep in mind I'm developing a winter coat and I may appear thicker, it's all an illusion. You may want to consider this as fluffy and yes, shedding is a year round event.

I'm waiting for my favourite delivery guy and the Warden is telling me to keep it down. Well, I'm not going to, what if he doesn't know I'm here.  The Warden says the whole neighbourhood knows I'm here for blocks around. You should never dampen a spirited greeting, neighbours should get out more, mingle and carry treats.

I got in a bit of trouble, I was in the wine cellar (aka closet) barking at a foreign object on the floor, it was a wooden hanger that shouldn't have been there. I could sense danger and was sending out a warning to all that entered. I felt my actions were warranted and should be rewarded, just saying.

What is it mom, you seem a little distracted?  It looks like you have something to say, go ahead, I've never known you to be short on words.  Usually you're all chatty, ready to burst into a song, come on out with it.

Mom found my favourite ball, it was the one I would drag around on my blanket, the one with a very loud squeak, I would toss it around until it went under the furniture, then I would continue to bark until someone retrieved it.  Oh the fun we had as a family, I wonder why it disappeared for so long?

I like to keep my options open when presented with treats, first I always wait to see if there's a second choice, then I make a decision.  I'll either bury it, drag it around on my blanket, ignore it till later or eat it. Life is all about choices, choose wisely my friends.

Mom is always stressing the importance of common courtesies, especially please and thank you. So mom, if you could please step back and give me a little space, thank you. Or, when you get a chance could you slip into the kitchen for a piece of cheese, please and thanks.

Last night we had dinner guests, I lined up with everyone else, 3rd in line, I waited patiently, listened to small talk, inching along, following all the rules of dinner protocol. Then, you guessed it, the Warden cut me from the line, tacky.

The intensity in the art of begging will become everything. Eye contact is your primary focus, never ever take your eyes off the target. Each and every bite requires the same amount of attention. Inching forward may increase your chances, keep any whimpering to a minimum.

It's been said that sometimes I have a big personality, maybe a little sassy, with just a wink of attitude.  In order to get what you want, when you want it, you have to have game, be a leader, and always be open to scratches and cuddles.

Welcome to the fall, this means it's officially gravy season. With the cooler weather this increases the use of the oven, which leads to roasts. Exciting news, my gravy dippers are all clean and ready to mingle and soak up the gravy.

I got trapped in the wine cellar, technically it's the closet with two cases of wine. I just happened to be barking at corner when somehow the door accidentally closed. It was just me, all alone, frightened, scared no one would find me, I could hear mom calling me but it sounded so far away.  I was eventually rescued from this harrowing experience, well two minutes seemed like a lifetime.

It's very rare to have gravy, the kind with just a hint of beef, while your ears are soaking in it. That lingering scent, these are what dreams are made of. Then there's the image of the Warden chasing after you with wet wipes.

There's a struggle here, do I stretch and circle around, can I even open my eyes.  Nope, don't see any of that happening, let's just say my morning is reserved. All official greetings are set for this afternoon.
Everything was going along fine, life was good, when all of a sudden I was snatched up and given a bath.  When I recover I'm filing a report against these repeat offenders.

The fridge repair guy thought I looked a little out of proportion, long ears and body with short legs. Mom said that's how they make loveable and cute in one package. He did fix the fridge but he was no Prince Charming.

I thought I heard opportunity knocking at our door, the fridge broke and I was going to be part of the rescue team to save the food. Unfortunately we had a second fridge and they bought a small freezer. There goes another great plan down the drain.

Guess what, another rule, I'm not allowed to bark and make a 'fuss'. I might disturb the neighbours, this according to the Warden.  Of course this is an old rule which I'm revisiting, it's important to test the boundaries and it gives the Warden a sense of purpose, you know, self esteem issues.

I can never stress enough the importance of a sun nap. Finding that little piece of heaven, allowing it shine on you. Now mom, would you mind moving a little to the right, I need to be completely embraced. Shimmy on over mom.

Mom and I were sitting quietly enjoying the sun, when suddenly a squirrel ran in front of us and up the tree. It was chattering at us, mom was hissing at it, eventually we moved to avoid confrontation, Mom thought it was possessed, and this coming from the one who was hissing.

I'm using today to recover. Yesterday there were workmen here for six hours, all of that should've been nap time, instead I was on constant alert, totally off schedule. All quiet on the home front today, keeping it a shimmy free zone.
The little girl next door had a cute teddy bear, well, I took it and ran. There was a little chase, some nervous laughter, until the Warden stepped in, who gently handed back the somewhat moist bear.

Oh hi mom, thanks for the blanket outside.  If you get a chance could you freshen up my water with ice, and a snack would be nice.  When you get back I'll be due for my scratches and rub session, let's try to stay on schedule today.

Dads a little concerned about suspicious activity in the kitchen, mom was baking a dessert and there's no guests coming. I can explain, there's a nip in the air, winter is coming, added insulation is needed. Dads acting like he won the lottery.
I like to share the couch with mom, she makes a great headrest, also included are scratches and rubs. If she crosses her legs it frees up more space, in case I need to stretch out.

When I'm out on my walk I don't do my business on demand.  It's a process, it's about finding the perfect spot and there's gonna be sniffing, lots of it. You're words of encouragement really don't move things along, just lighten the leash and take a deep breath.
First day back to school for the kids on the street, I'll have to make sure they didn't forget their lunch and snacks. My naps will have to work around the school bus schedule, gonna be a busy day.

The Warden said I stole her chair, I would say the opportunity presented itself. Obviously I'm going to get comfortable, snuggle into this nice warm spot, maybe nap all morning. Some days start out better than others.

Dad had pizza last night and it appeared he wasn't going to share. I actually had to stare him down, almost leaning towards begging. It was down to the very last bite, a smidgen, a morsel, a blink, but there is was, a little taste, one step above a sniff.

Flowers look nice mom, there's a little bend in them when you walk on them but I'm sure they'll spring back. If I play this right I think there's enough room for some digging, just waiting for the Warden to be distracted.

The Basset Almanac is predicting a long and cold winter, so plan ahead.  Stockpiling biscuits and bones strongly recommended.  You may find an increase in appetite, completely normal this time of year, extra insulation definitely required for the months ahead.

Well I slipped past security (dad) and managed to take my bone outside and bury it in the planter. The Warden got wind of this and as you can imagine wasn't pleased, so security has now been tightened.
This new bone has been buried and relocated at least seven times, each location has been compromised, prying eyes. Surely there's something that needs to be cleaned, again.
Excuse me mom, if you could move that little hip routine to another room, I'm trying to nap. Why don't you try the kitchen, that's the room that needs a little more action.
Nothing to see here mom and those windows aren't going to clean themselves. The Warden is worried about the plants I stepped on, we are out in the elements, they'll bounce back.
Dad says there's a mouse downstairs, moms moving and I'm not getting involved. The Great Game Hunter has set a trap filled with peanut butter, mouse 3, trap 0.
Dad and I were helping mom clean, I was napping which in some way is a big help.  Dad lifted his feet while mom vacuumed, mom said something else but I couldn't quite make out what it was.

We had an incident, there was a kink in the coil hose, mom straightened the hose and it came alive.  Water was spraying all over, mom was getting wet, I was running around barking and the neighbours came running to help. Mom finally took control and order was restored.  Beware of coil hoses.

It's just not right that I couldn't go with dad to the bake shop, I was left all alone in the front seat. The windows were open, I had a glass of water and mom was in the backseat, still I was abandoned.
Two drool lines are important on my walks, it's my communicator, hence the saying, are you picking up what I'm laying down. Also the slobber shake is another important source of communication.
On my walk there's one spot I like to stop for a drink of water, it's always fresh and cool. The bowl is large enough for both ears to dangle freely, not to mention the floating of two drool lines.
Better back away mom, gonna need some more time to recover from The Hip weekend.  But you go ahead and do your thing, as long as it's quiet and not in my space.

It's a recovery day, mom and I stayed up late to watch The Tragically Hip concert. We partied like rock stars, a little shimmy action, some evening juice, plus snacks and naps.  It made us proud to be Canadian, eh ð¨ð¦

The Tragically Hip concert is in town tonight, mom and I had big plans to sneak in but they've heightened security.  Maybe someone heard about our plot or was it because the Prime Minister of Canada is coming.

There was a claim I howled in my sleep last night, apparently startling someone awake, making the Warden a little edgy this morning. All I know is I slept like a baby, and now I'm preparing for one of many naps today.

It would be nice once in awhile if dad took me with him to the golf course. I could walk along side him, help chase the balls, share a beverage, chat with the guys and share a few laughs.  Come on dad, it'll be an adventure.

It's been said that I watch people eat with too much intensity. The hand to mouth coordination, the placing of the fork into the meat, the movement of the jaw while chewing, each and every bite. Is it any wonder I lick my lips and drool.
There comes a time when you put your dusters down, lose sight of all cleaners and just breathe. Stretch out, smell the grass and have hope that there's a snack coming your way soon.
Mom got up to get her coffee and this chair immediately became available, nothing like a freshly vacated chair.  This Monday isn't looking so bad after all, I'll be here all morning if you need me.
I got a Sunday kinda feeling, we're gonna to take it slow, ease into the day, nice and easy, Proud Mary style.  Then a little later we'll wind it up just a bit, all shimmies will be on simmer today.

I heard this ruckus coming from inside, mom was yelling out the window at a rabbit. I'll just say the language was colourful and very descriptive, she does know how to spin a phrase.  I didn't want to get involved.
How to tell if you've had a good scratch, by the pile of hair left on the floor.  I was hoping for a knee high pile but someone had other things to do. Not quite Olympic caliber yet.

I have nine days till The Tragically Hip come to Kingston, I'm planning on how to see the concert.  Option one, I have mom distract security at the stage door, I slip past the muscle and head for the backstage. I'm working on option two.

Since when did changing a lightbulb become a major event, only in this house. Out comes the step stool, numerous cleaners, before you know it all reachable lights are now sparkling clean. Not sure anyone will notice though.
Lots of workmen on the street today, there's a crane that will lift a pool over the house. It's like a meet and greet, mom, more ice for my water, it's gonna be a busy day.

If you're looking at this it's probably too late to send in a swat team. Their torture room has a viewing area, for those that take pleasure in seeing others get worked over. Would someone please contact the authorities.
I called shotgun mom, sorry about your luck. I like to sit up front with dad, he always has a glass of ice water that we get to share, mom has this thing about not sharing her water, she has issues.
Mom, why don't we causally walk over to the neighbours, they're  up to something. You start talking and I'll sniff things out, try to act normal, nothing shifty.  I'll head out back towards the BBQ.
We were eye to eye, I was poised, front paw up, fear was in his eyes, I inched closer, then I made my move. Where the heck did that rabbit go, I must've blinked.
Dad made a huge mistake, he wore his slippers outside while testing the sprinklers, in his pjs. Mom said he's losing it, she's now looking for a full care facility.
I was abducted and forced to have a bath, charges are pending. There's lots of evidence, just smell me. My harness also became a victim to this senseless cleaning, thrown right in with the laundry.
Mom said my smell is developing a personality of it's own, it's the loud one in the room. All this coming from the Shimmy Shaking Mamma, need I say more.
If you thought there was gonna be room for two, think again. I'm claiming the couch as mine until further notice. It's a holiday Monday so we're just going to dial it down.

Every once in awhile mom tries some training exercises, siiiit, siiiit. Sometimes I get tired and I sit. Mom is harder to train, I try cheeeese, cheeeese, if she were quicker with the cheese I might sit.
Mom was throwing tennis balls at a squirrel in the backyard, the squirrel was clapping at her efforts. Not much I could do, he was sitting on the fence keeping score, mom 0, squirrel 6.
Thought I help dad write his book, couldn't get past the title. There's no pictures and a bunch of numbers and letters don't count. This is gonna take a lot of snacks before I start page one.
Mom you do realize peddle pushers with tassels are a thing of the past, yes the style may come back, eventually. But in the meantime could you tone it down and try to blend.
I'm helping with a little tree trimming, we might be able to save a few sticks, waste not want not, old basset saying. I've got to hurry before the cleanup starts.
Yes, I took the brush but for a good reason, mom is now cleaning outside, definitely a cry for help.  She said the birds are making a mess, I say look around, we're outside.
I'm thinking it's going to be a morning of contemplating, because I'm not moving any time soon. Oh yes I'll stretch and reposition, but that's the extent of all activity. Welcome to Monday.
I was just looking for shade, found some. Not to worry mom, nothing will get flattened, chewed or peed on.  My aren't those tassels whipping in the wind today.

There should be cooling stations along the walk, with ice dispensers. Also some extra time given for lounging in the shade. Instead of an ice cream truck there should be a treat truck, just a thought.

Keep the AC on mom, gonna be a hot one.  I'll still want to go outside, but instead of water from the garden hose, could I have filtered water with ice, refreshed when ice melts and a side order of cheese please.
This was almost the best walk ever, I had a few minutes off leash, found a dead bird, was leaning into a good roll when all of a sudden, Yank. End of a good story, no happy ending.

Apparently I'm not suppose to sit on the flowers while sipping my water. Well let's just add this little tidbit to the Wardens Rule Book. Pretty soon we're going to have to add a wing to accommodate the library.
I'm waiting for my invitation to the birthday party next door, it's an all girls party, I'm looking to mix and mingle. There should be party snacks and a few belly rubs. I'm still waiting, hint hint.
I'm gonna need a little extra motivation this morning. Happy thoughts only go so far, it's time to bring out those motivational foods, you know what I'm talking about, the snacks that make you smile.
For me cheese is a great motivator, for mom it's music and her interpretive dance. With cheese it's a quick enjoyable bite, wish I could say that about the dance.
It's a jungle out there friends, I'm immersing myself with the elements, becoming one with nature. Also hoping the Warden doesn't catch me sitting on the lavender plant.

There are standards when giving scratches and rubs, I'm hoping one day it becomes an Olympic event. Just think of the training that needs to happen at this level. Mom, you're an athlete now and you must practice.

Something rarely captured on film, in her natural habitat, eating one of her biscuits. All her blankets have been stripped away, eating directly on the coverlet on her queen size bed.  Nature taking it's course.

It's important to stay hydrated during this hot and humid weather, also to limit your activity. There's a bowl of water but I like to mix things up, keep it interesting.  You'll find me under the tree in the cool shade or belly up in the sun.

Mom thought I was getting up close to give her a kiss, I was really checking out to smell if she had eaten any cheese.  She had, it was a mild cheese, not the usual aged cheese.  Because I was being so sweet I did get a tiny taste.
Go ahead and make up the bed around me, or better yet, just ease on out.  Where's the rule that says beds have to be made up at a certain time, let loose, go wild, let the sheets breath.

I got out yesterday and ran up the street. Mom was calling for me, then some guy was helping her.  I eventually came out, ran circles around everyone then sat beside mom.  Found out the neighbour was building a new deck.

I like the neighbours grass, it is greener. Mom says if the grass is to stay green, then I have to stay off it. This just sounds like another excuse to add another rule, lawns are to be shared and enjoyed.

I can see how you would think I'm in a position where the next step could determine an unfortunate outcome.  Not to worry, I'm not foolish, the Warden, I mean Tina, sorry I mean mom, is looking right at me.

I got sidetracked on my way to the backyard.  Might as well catch a few rays and grab some shuteye.  Not feeling terribly motivated, I need some incentive, like sizzling bacon or the opening of a cheese bag.

I shared a snack with mom, it was cheese, aged cheese of course.  She apparently likes to savour her cheese, I like to watch each agonizing chew, I might have whimpered.  Why so slow, just pop it in, one bite for you, two for me, if you want more savour time then up the offer to me.
I think vacuums should be registered and their use monitored. In our house it's used far to much. It may also be contributing to OCD tendencies, maybe we should ban all cleaning devices.

You're going to have to clean around me mom, I'm not moving. I'm using today as a recovery day from the weekend, and please no vacuuming until the afternoon. Go ahead with your happy music but keep it down to a soft lullaby.
Not to worry mom, I'll be right here if you need me.  You're best to sit back and rest today, you might've partied too hard, your shimmy was starting to suffer.
There was a whole lotta sniffing goin on yesterday, I may need to add an extra nap today.  I'll find a central location to keep an eye on everyone, also close to the BBQ.
Happy Canada Day ð¨ð¦ Today we will celebrate with family, there will be lots to eat, music, laughter and some entertainment.  What's a celebration without a little shimmy shaking.
What mom, can't you see I'm being one with nature, I'm blending into the environment. On a side note, laying on my side accentuates my fullness, when I stand up I'm really quite tiny.

Sometimes in life you get lucky, I discovered the perfect spot to plant biscuits. Mom hasn't decided what to plant in here, it's a shame to let it sit unused. Besides, it's the last place anyone would think to look.
I've been violated, dad took me to get my nails done. The only good part was everyone in the store wanted to come over and meet me, mostly women, maybe that's why dad takes me.
It's Monday, it's raining and I had to go out, I really had to.  Needless to say I got wet and someone commented about me smelling like a wet dog.  I take that as a compliment, thank you very much.

The pillows had a mind of their own, all I did was brush by them ever so gently.  Besides, isn't it time to change things up, be a little more care free, live on the edge, get out there and seize the moment, or just lighten up.

Oh hi mom, I thought if I sat on, I mean sat beside the lavender plant, it would rub off some of the smell, that way it could replace the lavender shampoo.  It's an alternative you really should embrace, and it's environmentally  friendly.
Go ahead call me stinky, smelly and wrinkle your nose. It doesn't bother me, it just confirms I've been successful, all my rolling has paid off, I'm now reaping the rewards.
You know mom if you take me shopping with you, I'll be a distraction and maybe it take the focus off what you're wearing. That might work around the house, but please, think of the family honor.

Rub it in, rub it in ð¶. When you find the perfect smell you must lead into the roll with the neck and shoulder. Then wiggle around, using leg thrusts for momentum. Repeat until smell has been thoroughly transferred.
I always stop and sniff at the mailbox, it's my thing. Shouldn't matter whether or not there's mail. So just lighten up on the leash, take a deep breath and go with the flow.
Back away mom, I'm gonna need a couple more hours.  Let's do lunch, then you can fill me in on the schedule. My tolerance level goes up a notch in the afternoon.
Dad, this day is all about you and I would like to share it with you. You know that chair you like, let me warm it up. Later we can snack on your favourite treats together, Happy Father's Day.
Just couldn't make it to the couch, I tried, just couldn't. You just shimmy on by mom, I'll catch up with you in a few.  Fortunately I'm close to the fridge, anything happens I'm there.

The best outdoor water dish is the Hosta plant leaves, right after the sprinklers have been turned off.  Of course if you run through the plants it's like going through a car wash, a little too wet for me but fun.
I might've partied too hard, nothing an extra nap won't fix. Lots of entertainment yesterday, mom had a sip of evening juice, did a little shimmy and set those tassels on fire.
What's that mom, today is my 4th Birthday!  Will this be a catered event, BBQ, chicken, steak, OK, must be a surprise. I'll be close by if you need any help in the kitchen.
We are on high alert, a bird is trapped in the window well and moms major concern is about the bushes. Once I was removed the bird flew away and order was restored to the bushes.
Stayed up late to watch hockey, now it's Monday morning and I can't get up.  I really don't want to get up, so that all adds up to staying right here, I'll stretch and rotate later.
I can hear the music and possibly the fridge door.  Hello, what's with the delay, what could be more important, and mid shimmy doesn't count.
I had a rolling good time, where your smell lingers after you've left the room. Where it enters the room before you do, let the good times roll.  Throwing all caution to the wind.
Why always so suspicious, I'm just admiring the foliage, coming along nicely mom.  It's important to take time and truly appreciate nature, yes, that's what I'm doing.
I found the perfect location to bury my biscuit, on dads yoga mat. No one will think to look there, won't be disturbed for months, at least till after golf season.
Nothing to see here mom, just shimmy along. Yes this is where you usually sit, and that would be a biscuit getting buried. Now I'm going to have to relocate to a more secure location.
Moms a little worried about the rabbits treating her garden like an open salad bar.  I'm all over it, anything moves I'm there, not to worry. Try not blocking the sun mom.
Lady Luck was shining on me, I found an opening in the garden and I nosed my way in. These opportunities are few and far between, seizing the moment.
