I'm trying out the new cover on the bed, I usually don't have direct access, so it took some time to remove my layer of blankets. I think this is gonna work out just fine.

It's a perfect day to fire up the BBQ and throw on some steaks. Now mom if you could do all the trimmings and dad the grilling.  The hard part is in the planning, could you let me know when everything is ready.

I was a judge in a taste testing competition between steak and ham.  The results were deemed inconclusive, therefore I strongly recommend a redo. This time larger pieces and not so close together, plus I'll need to practice.
Nothing to see here mom, just me and a few friends getting rowdy.  You sing and dance, I bark and howl, let's just call it even. Why don't we call a truce and have some cheese, the good stuff.

Oh, hi mom, looking great, love the new tassels you added to your pedal pushers, makes your shimmy come alive. I'm not doing anything, just securing the premises, for your safety, you're my first priority.
With no garden access I actually dug a hole in the backyard to bury my biscuit. Just to clarify, there was a bare spot, no grass. The lawn maintenance staff have left me a window of opportunity.
I need a day to recover from my traumatic experience yesterday. The after bath is like running a marathon, I must've rolled a few miles. The teeny tiny bit of beef helped with the recovery process.

There's an arrest warrant out for two people, one is armed with shampoo, the other is sometimes referred to as Shimmy Shaking Mama. Do not approach, considered dangerous, may give you a bath for no reason.
I've been accused of sniffing each and every blade of grass, well if given the opportunity I certainly would. I'm allowed a fraction of time to give and receive before the heave-ho gotta go.
I'm waiting before I go in the next room, moms having a Proud Mary moment. If it sounds like she's shimmied out I'll make my move.
The gardens are done, the garage is organized and my biscuits are planted, can we all just sit back and relax.  I'll be napping, sunning, sniffing and treat seeking, all in no particular order.
Drool displays are to be appreciated, it's a sign of acceptance. When I do a slobber shake, it's considered a calling card, a true welcome. Do not say, oh gross and duck for cover.

Supervising yard work can be very taxing, keeping an eye on two people that move like molasses. I'm doing double duty, catching a few rays and airing out, or as some may say, getting the stink blown off.
It's a holiday Monday which means another day in the gardens. I never realized how exhausting it is watching everyone work, can we not just relax and play fetch the snacks.
Dad had a great idea, let's put cheese on the new steps to see if I would go up. After exhausting myself barking I did get the cheese, but it wasn't one of his greatest ideas.
I was exhausted watching mom fussing outside yesterday, getting ready for planting flowers today. I'm expecting to be part of the crew today, all paws on deck, there'll be no slackers on my shift.
Moms at it again, another glamour shot of me wearing dirty laundry. Not that I'm opposed to dirty, it's actually my preference. I personally think cleaning is overrated and senseless.
What's with all the closed doors, and asking for privacy please.  Why not an open concept house with no doors, that way I have a clear view of what really goes on.
I'm just having a little me time, no prying eyes, just soaking up the sun, being one with nature. In a few minutes I'll go in and check up on mom, she can be needy at times.
Yes, I heard exactly what you said, actually loud and clear. The problem being did you hear me, I want, what I want, when I want it and I want it now. Was that clear enough.
What did I say about Monday mornings, I don't do them.  Check back in later, much later, wait, don't call me I'll call you.
Its happened, my dad's joined up for yoga, strictly for the stretching. He's wearing track pants, t-shirt and hoodie and ready to set the world on fire, lord help us.
They got me a set of stairs so I can get up on my queen bed. I don't think so, I'm not using them, no way, forget it. I'm partial to the current lift service, it's more of a personal touch.
Take your time mom, don't worry about me. I'll just wait here, thinking about sniffing and sunning, greeting my friends, all the good times I could've had. Oh please don't rush on my account.
There's going to be a local cheese festival, so I'm thinking this should be a family event and we better take the truck. Let's go early, don't want to miss out on any cheese tasting events.
I know she can see, why is she making me wait.  It's probably because she's sneaking snacks, as if I can't tell, those shifty eyes give her away every time.
Do you ever get the feeling you're being watched every minute. Yes mom, I'm still here and no I'm not ready to come in. Now give me a couple of minutes, then maybe I'll want out front.

I'd like this morning to be non eventful and no major discussions about your plans for the week. Right now I'm only handling in the moment kinda thoughts. When I get up then we'll talk about your feelings.
Happy Mother's Day, today is not all about me, it's a day where mom can do what she wants. So hold on, there's gonna be a little singing and shimmy shaking.
Dad's talking about getting a piano, now mom's excited about reviving her non existent singing career. She's a wannabe honky-tonk gal, as you can see I'm thrilled.

Excellent question, scented poop bags or non scented, what to choose. At some point the lavender scented bag smell fades away, and it's not like you keep them around for any length of time. Who really wants to smell poop bags.

Everything's fine mom, nothing going on yet, all quiet on the home front.  There's a house for sale on the street, I'm waiting to greet any potential buyers, you can never be too careful about neighbour selection.

I like to shake things up, be mysterious, unpredictable.  Sometimes I want to sun out front, but I need to check out back and of course what's going on inside. It would make life easier if all doors were just left open.
Sometimes I don't understand all the rush, why always in a hurry. Sitting in the doorway, contemplating, do I go or do I stay.  The boot to the arse doesn't help.
I'm trying to figure out how mom became the Pack Leader of the house.  Maybe it's because of her Rule Books and dominant behaviour, or it's just simply a self declared position.
I was a little disappointed yesterday, the neighbour was grilling steaks and I didn't get the invite. I saw the other guests, laughing and having a good time, what's one more, I like a good time.
If the sun's out, then I'm out!  I prefer the front yard, that way I can keep an eye on the neighbours. Who's getting something delivered, who has company, I'm all over it.
Now mom is singing drinking songs, Tennessee Whiskey and Drink You Away. I gotta keep an eye on her, it could be just another craze or maybe a cry for help.
This is moms sweater I found on the chair, I dragged it around, did a biscuit dance, then ate the biscuit on it.  It's a special day, it's moms birthday, it's all about showing you care.
Still recovering from the Vet visit, I'll need a few days of pampering and undivided attention. When at the vets they offered a complimentary nail clipping, I'd have preferred a cheese basket.
Send help, I'm being held against my will.  This is a hostage situation, location, the vets. There are needles, thermometers and listening devices. Negotiations have begun, snacks are the topic.
I have my yearly visit to the vets coming up soon and I must prepare.  Apparently the vet does not embrace the full figure gal, therefore I'll skip a treat and nap through Monday.

My uncle mentioned that maybe one day I can go hunting with him. Hopefully the hunting camp has a queen size bed, lots of snacks, a four wheeler of course, and I will need plenty of nap breaks. So much to look forward to.
I had to refresh mom on the rules of playing fetch, she throws the ball, then goes and gets it, repeat. Really basic rules, it appears she's having fun, if you like that kinda thing.
I no longer have access to the gardens, mom put up a fence. There should be enough biscuits buried to get a full harvest in the fall, that's when the fence comes down.
Spring cleaning has been exhausting, way too many things to keep track of. I need uninterrupted naps, regular snacks and plenty of undivided attention.
Don't ask, it's been a whirlwind of activity, I just got caught in the middle of it. Sometimes keeping an eye on things has a price, I just paid.
All my blankets have fallen victim to the mass spring cleaning. It's like a frenzy around here, if you sit still for too long you'll get dusted.  Would someone please remove her battery.

I'm in recovery today, dealing with a traumatic experience, I had a bath. Mom took spring cleaning a step too far. Dad actually said I took it well, he obviously doesn't recognize traumatic shock, mom calls it dramatic.
The first signs of spring is always when the ladder comes out and mom starts washing windows. The ladder also happens to be in the biscuit patch, mom has no sense of boundaries.
If you see mom let me know, she has this thing about planting biscuits in her garden. It's really the family garden, I've done my share of the work out here. It's like she has eyes everywhere.

I got in a bit of trouble for barking last night and dad had to raise his voice. It was 6 pm, I was tired and wanted to go to bed. Apparently too early for everyone else, so I just napped until bedtime.

Surprise surprise, there's a new rule, no howling on the back deck at 6:00 am. I'm not normally up at this time so I was unaware of these restrictions. Dad thought it was funny, Ruler Of All had a few concerns.
Come on mom, what did we say about non food related activities in the kitchen.  Why don't you slide or shimmy into another room.  Before you do could you grab a piece of cheese!

I thought mom put this pillow here for my comfort, she thought she was reserving a spot on the couch. We all know how this is going to end, so why don't you save yourself some time and get the cheese!

I like to do Monday's, Proud Mary style, Nice and Easy. Now in saying that, I just got you know who, all stirred up and ready to do some classic Tina booty shaking. It's a little early for that mom, tone it down, nice and easy.
This is mom trying to be clever, reserving her chair with a book.  This is me overcoming all obstacles, adapting to new circumstances. Yes, I think this will work.
Sometimes you have to try something new, step out of your comfort zone, live on the edge. Then there are times when you just want to snuggle in and have a nap.
I got to lick the beaters when mom made cream cheese icing. She said it's to go on the carrot cake piled a mile high. Sometimes mom exaggerates, she calls it painting a picture.

There's a special corner on my walk that I have to stop at. Oh you can try to coax, yank or pull but I'm not moving.  This is my message centre, I receive the latest news and I always drop a little tidbit.
I did a slobber shake on my walk and dad got hit on the forehead. In all fairness mom did yell 'incoming'. Dad is 6'4", so mom thought the slobber distance was quite impressive.
It's the offer to help that's important, that's why on laundry day I'm available. I like to bury my biscuits in the clothes and drag them around. Well, it's important to also have fun.
It's Monday, we had a snow storm and I'm tired. Add all this up and there's only one conclusion, I'm napping. Maybe when I get up the snow will be gone and so will Monday.
Nothing to see here mom, I'm not doing anything. Yes I can see the garden is a little stirred up, could've been the Easter Bunny or the squirrel. I'll keep an eye on things, you can count on me.

Dad made a mistake and spilt beef juices in the oven.  The mistake was he didn't spill it on the floor, I could've helped with the cleanup. It looked like mom went to her happy place, she said no problem.
Mom told me there were cows in the front yard, I've never seen a cow so I was excited.  Then the giggling started, April Fools!  Somehow makes sense, you know, mom, fool.
I'm waiting for a delivery, not that I'm expecting anything, I just like to meet and greet.  Yes I know the protocol, no jumping up, no howling. I'm more of a in the moment gal, we'll see.
I'm not digging if that's what you're thinking. Just passing through, everything looks fine. Why always so suspicious, don't you have things to do.
What mom, are you looking at my wrapped around, artfully displayed drool. Just put the cloth away and stop calling me a hot mess. Sometimes you just gotta let it be.
If there's turkey call me, if there's cheese I'm available, otherwise dial it down. Let's say around noon we do brunch and catch up. By then you'll have my full attention.

Happy Easter my friends!  I believe I'm in good standing and shall be rewarded accordingly.  There's the promise of turkey with gravy and a cheese hunt. I didn't see the Bunny but mom said there's enough evidence in the backyard to prove he was here!

Just another day of being on my best behaviour, in case anyone is taking notes. If there's anything you need Easter Bunny don't hesitate to ask. Just covering all bases, not asking for special consideration.
Dearest Easter Bunny, I welcome you with open paws. There will be carrots and lettuce when you arrive. Thank you in advance for any cheese surprises, aged cheese preferred, if you have a selection.
Getting rested up for the Easter Bunny.  Really hoping this Bunny isn't keeping a list like Santa. I've had a few indiscretions I'm hoping can be overlooked.

There's hints this open garden concept is coming to an end.  I've got biscuits buried but moms concerned about the digging and mud. These biscuits may have to be brought back inside, I've got some work to do.
Surprise surprise, new rule, I'm not to pause in the doorway when going outside.  Sometimes I like to ponder, maybe do a stretch, try to catch a scent.  What's the rush, step back and relax.

If you don't mind I'd like to stay napping for awhile, but please, go do what you gotta do.  I can manage quite well, just make sure the water is fresh, my food dish is full and the treats are laid out.
Mom, were you asking a question or expressing an opinion. I've got things to do, biscuits to bury and naps to take. Unless of course this is a snack break.
I confess, I chewed the wooden hanger. I'm not confessing because of moms relentless pursuit of justice but to let you know I was lacking certain nutrients, more cheese would help.
Mom, before you start your line of questioning, I think I'm entitled to a phone call.  I find myself in somewhat of a compromising situation.
Happy St. Patrick's Day ð. All festivities will begin in the afternoon, that includes all singing and dancing. ð¶ðð¤
I'm waiting for a guest to arrive. Dad said his friend has a title like me, mine is Miss and his is General. He's very important but in this house mom still out ranks him.
Mom says that when you share snacks there should be no glaring, licking of lips or whining, so far mom hasn't done any of this.  If only she wouldn't linger with each bite.
Ok mom, it's Monday and I'm really not into this chipper stuff.  Don't you think it's a little early for your song and dance routine.  I'm all about easing into the day.
My sleep is all screwed up, they left me sleeping on the couch last night.  I got up at 1:30 am disoriented, had to pee, find the bed and to top it off we have a time change.  I'll be awhile.
Ruler of All, mom, has declared that I can't bury biscuits in the muddy garden. Apparently this isn't a new rule, must be in volume three, section six hundred, of moms rule book.
I rarely get to sit in moms chair, she reserves it with a book when she's not there. I found an opportunity and seized the moment. I plan to make the most of this.
We had another delivery, instead of sit and stay, I went on a sniff and snoop adventure. The mail lady found me up the street and mom was waving a piece of cheese, it was a good day.
Sometimes I just need a quiet moment, I'm thinking of maybe getting up, but then again maybe not.  I might just continue napping  until I get a clearer picture.
Yes, I'm comfortable, why do you ask. It's all about finding a good location that allows me to keep an eye on several people at one time.
It's probably best you not use up a lot of words this morning, I'll be unresponsive until about noon. I'll I'm picking up right now is blah blah blah.
I think I could teach math, I just need the right tools. Let's say I had five pieces of bacon and ate three, that would clearly leave two. The trick is to start out with easy examples, and use props.
I can't figure out why mom is baking, and I mean a lot. This is not a part of dads lifestyle choices, and he's doing a lot of hovering.  I think I saw him drooling.
As mom says, if you're gonna dream, dream big. Be the best you can be, set the example. I'm going to have a nap, dream about great adventures, filled with treats, surrounded by all my friends.
This is me as a baby, when I needed help up on the furniture. At night I slept in a cage, but eventually I graduated to a queen size bed. The early years of training mom and dad.
Why is it I have to be a witness to some creative new dance craze.  Yep, you guessed it, moms revival of the twist, not a pretty sight. But of course, I get front row seats.
Mom tried to trick me with a piece of turnip, like I couldn't tell it wasn't ham. I gently took it and politely spit it out. Nice try mom.
Sometimes mom treats me like a baby, that's okay, it's Monday and I don't care. Go ahead wrap me up and coo away, I'm not going anywhere. See you on the flip side of noon.
Today is about getting ready for the Oscars. I'll prepare with my usual naps, be attentive in the kitchen and look for a warm seat. I'm sure I'll sleep through it but at least I did prepare.
I've been accused of hogging the couch. We had a routine, I would gracefully take a sliver of space at the end and mom would stretch out. Now I'm stretching out and apparently someone's not happy.

Mom said I was howling in my sleep last night, I don't recall, maybe someone's being dramatic. You look like you could use a nap mom, I always find my morning naps are the most important ones of the day.

Yes, I was in the closet again, barking behind the door, the next thing I knew the door closed. It was dark, I was alone, I could hear mom calling for me. Maybe that's not a good place to hide a biscuit.
I'm just a simple girl, very low maintenance, easy to please. Yes, I like fresh water three times a day, with ice of course. Nothing fancy for me and please no fussing.
I encourage others to sing and dance, it's very uplifting. But mom singing RESPECT, now that's on a whole different level. I say give me some respect and tone it down.
I'm doing a tag team on my naps this morning, which means I'm not engaging. But you go ahead with your business, just keep it quiet and stay out of the kitchen.
I'm waiting for a little action in the kitchen, there's slight movement, it could potentially lead to something. I may also have a little shuteye, patience is a virtue my friends.
It's now raining outside, so I think we should get creative with indoor activities. How about you hide a piece of cheese and I find it. Before we start I'll need to sample the goods.
Mom, what are the chances you could shovel the sidewalks so we can go for a walk. Yes, I can see it's almost over your head, but if you start now, then maybe later we can walk.
There are times when it pays to be a good listener. Sometimes there's key words that get your attention, other times it's just a lot of noise.
Go ahead talk all you want, I'm not going outside. All I see is snow and no where to go. But thank you for the generous path in case of emergencies.
Mom, while you've got the fridge open, could you please get me a piece of cheese. It's on the second shelf, next to dads fruit and yogurt.  No hurry, I'll wait.
You better back it up mom, as you can clearly see I have no intention of moving.  Also, I'd prefer no distractions, unless it's the sound of something sizzling.
Sending a little extra love today to all my special friends. Thank you for taking the time to share and care. May all your dreams be covered in cheese. Happy Valentine's Day ð¹

I just had the best back scratch, the one where you don't want it to ever end. I do a little nudging just to keep the momentum going.  You know the one, the one where you leave an inch of hair on the floor.
Mom, did you know that the statistics clearly show, if you did less cleaning and more cooking, you lead a longer and happier life. Just a little tidbit to chew on.
The delivery man said I was the best alarm system ever. Mom was also impressed when I obeyed the command to sit and stay. Overall I scored really high, so if you're keeping track this is noteworthy.
This may look like I'm sitting in a sun spot, but it's really the glow from my halo. There are times when I should really be referred to as Saint Lilly.
I responded to what I thought was a distressed call, but nope, just mom belting out Chain of Fools. Somehow this song seemed appropriate.
If you want to talk to me send a letter, by the time it gets here I'll be up. I make no promises of any communication until at least noon, but as I said, no promises.
Nothing going on here yet, I'll wait it out though. Usually this is a high traffic area on a Sunday, at any moment I expect to hear the rattle of pots and pans. Positioning is key.
Dad called me a Diva at the spa. Apparently expressing oneself is frowned upon. I really don't care what anyone thought, I was being tortured.
I was helping make the bed, it was exhausting. I tried to bury a biscuit, that didn't go over to well so I took a time out. Mom will come back eventually.
Hello I'm Miss Lilly, and I rolled in something nasty. Personally, it doesn't bother me. This should really be, Hello I'm Mom, I have cleaning issues.
It's taken me three years to capture a duster, I can now finally claim victory. It's all in the timing, I caught mine when it was slivering around the baseboards, that's when I made my move.

Hello, I'm Miss Lilly, waiting for the final results of National Ground Hog Day. This varmint will predict how much longer our winter will last. Maybe if they slipped him some cheese we'll get favorable results.
I don't really want to talk about it and stop looking at me. Baths are senseless and they stink. Nothing will make me feel better, well, that piece of cheese will help the healing process.
Moms making soup and I'm waiting for the chicken, which is always last. I know the routine, shred the veggies first, then add the chicken. The best things are worth waiting for.
Mom do you have a permit to use a staple gun. I'm not sure about this whole Martha Stewart business, maybe you should stick to your song and dance routine.
Excuse me mom, but you're in my sun spot. Just step back, a little farther, keep going and going. While you're in the kitchen could you get me a piece of cheese.
Let me know if you see the warden coming, I mean mom. She has a few issues about burying treats in the bed.
In order to conserve energy I'd like to recommend that you not wash my blankets. It's a sacrifice I'm willing to make. More energy should be spent in the kitchen.
Found a mitt in the yard, well, I took it from mom. She was busy picking up rabbit balls and I seized the moment.
I look at Mondays as a day to catch up on my naps, and a day to prepare for the week. Sometimes you see more clearly if you are rested, never underestimate the power of a nap.
Let me get this right, so you're saying that when we have dinner guests over, I'm not included in the seating arrangements. While there's definitely something wrong with this picture.

Lots of plans today, a whole list of things to do, it's gonna be busy. In anticipation of getting started, I thought I would take some time to plan and organize. No sense rushing into this and getting all bent out of shape!
Thank you for sharing your story mom, now if you're done I'd like to continue some important business. This thoughtful look will be glazed over in a minute.
The good news is I found my ball in the snow, the bad news is I lost it again. Someone may have threw it while shoveling the snow, not mentioning any names.
Mom, is it possible we can discuss more options on my menu. I would like to be involved in the selection process, and it's time I took on more responsibilities.
Well, we lost another sock while doing the laundry. Mom said it went to sock heaven, which is apparently behind the washer/dryer. No cursing, nothing, moms practicing don't sweat the small stuff.
I'll be expecting a quiet morning and afternoon, then maybe pick up the pace this evening. Don't sign me up for anything that involves movement.
Ok, so you're saying this was your chair, and you'd like me to move. I think not, you got up, I moved in, as simple as that. Now if you'd like to negotiate, I'm open to that.
I'm testing out the shovelled area, I think it'll work out. Lots of room to sniff, an obstacle course for agility training and enough snow to bury a few treats.
I helped mom shovel the driveway, she would toss the snow around and I supervised. It's important to know snow shovelling protocol, she tossed, I barked.
When I'm napping there should be a rule, no moving around. I believe someone is sneaking cheese when I sleep. So everyone just sit still until I'm ready to get up.
So you're telling me that snow blizzard has completely covered my yard. Mom will you, you know, make a path for me to, you know, when I need to go out.
We are under attack, there's a piece of plastic trapped under some ice and I can't get it out. Better call someone in to have this removed immediately.
I've got a Monday kinda thing going on, and I'm going to do nothing but nap until I'm inspired. As you know cheese can be very inspirational.
Today will be about long naps, the pursuit of cheese and neck rubs. Oh I'm sure there'll be some mama singing and booty shaking, but let's hope that'll be an afternoon activity!

I'm going to try something different, I may try running two naps together. It's raining outside, so won't be going out, no cooking in the kitchen, so won't be needed there either. The makings of a great plan.

Dad finally gave me a piece of cheese, but only after I had a bath. It helped me recover from the traumatic experience.  After my bath mom said I left a small sandbox in the tub, apparently I was dirty.
I had an opportunity to seize the moment, I buried a biscuit in the snow. There are rules about treats being buried outside, but sometimes you just have to live on the edge.
There's something strange going on around here, very strange. Dad is now snacking on fruit, what's with that. We used to have some quality time together sharing cheese.
It all started out so innocently, first the humming, a little head bobbing, the shoulder roll, then into a full tilt boogie. Mom really should give a warning before she bursts out with Proud Mary.
You want me to what, get up and go out, not happening. Two reasons, it's Monday and it's freezing outside. So stop all that crazy talk, and ease on outta here.

Mom had lunch with her girlfriends and I wasn't invited. I would love to eat at a restaurant, order from a menu, chat with the gals. But no, go ahead without me, leave me home all alone, for hours upon hours.
I'm told there are a few things I need to work on, for example, my greetings. I'm overcome with excitement, I howl and jump up. Apparently these traits are not very becoming.
Well, it looks like we'll be singing and dancing into the new year, moms embracing good vibes as a New Years resolution. This will blend in nicely with her groovy tie-dye, born to be wild t-shirt!

Happy New Year to all my friends. Thank you for sharing your time with us, for making us laugh and sometimes cry, for your spirited exchange and always your love. We look forward to sharing another special year with you â¤ï¸
Mom, could you soften up the snow, it's a little too crunchy to walk on. I can't find a good spot to do my business. Or maybe we could revisit the canopy option again.
I'm not wearing this hat, but go ahead and amuse yourself. Someone really needs to get a hobby that doesn't include me.
Dad, excuse me dad, if you're waiting for turkey leftovers get in line. I've been here awhile, so might as well get comfortable. There are rules about lines, no butting in!
Mom, dad, please sit down, we need to discuss my limited fridge access. We are fortunate to have plenty, there is caring and sharing. We just need to broaden the definition of sharing.
What do you mean there's no more turkey, just open the fridge and no one gets hurt. Today I may need to add another nap or two.
I hope your day is filled with fun, laughter, treats and good memories. Make your day special for you and those around you. There's certainly gonna be some booty shaking and momma singing!
Tis the season for tolerance, go ahead have your fun. I'm setting out for Santa, a salmon sandwich, a glass of evening juices (just one glass) and some treats for the reindeer.
Mom look what I found under the tree, and it's got some treats inside. I was looking for my ball, which happened to roll under the tree, and one thing lead to another!

Mom, can you tell me the story about what a good girl I've been, how I'm the sparkle in your eye, how I fill your heart, and mom, could you say it a little louder in case Santa is listening, love you mom.

There's been several sightings of Santa, according to the local pee-mail. Another pee-mail warning against false reports. This isn't the time to be playing pee-pranks. It is violation against the pee-nal code to spread false information, especially about Santa.

I tarnished my glowing reputation, I went sniffing in the wrong direction. Now dad's upset and may report to Santa. I'm under suspension of any off leash, so okay, but do you have to squeal to the big guy.
I'm on my best behaviour, and some of my best moments are when I'm napping. Not that I'm nervous with only six sleeps, thirty nap and forty treats away until Santa comes. Not that I'm counting!

Dear Santa, as you probably are aware, I've had a very good year. Actually my report card is glowing, but to say any more would be gloating. Please have a safe trip to my house, I will have a surprise for you and your reindeers.  Love Miss Lilly
What could be worse than one bath, that would be a second bath. I found the best spot ever to roll, and according to some, I stunk to high heaven. Needless to say I'm sulking with moms socks.
I thought I would share with you a picture of Miss Lilly as if done in a painting. Thanks for your help @ozarks_bassets
Help save me from these people. They double teamed me and gave me a bath.  All lathered up with some smelly stuff, then they wouldn't let me outside to roll, now that's cruel.

I'm waiting, you know I like to be on time.  When I go on walks I like to do the meet and greet thing, or as some say, a little schmoozing. Throw in the sniffing and chasing, I'm looking at a full schedule.

Hold all plans until further notice, I need to ease into this Monday. There will be no booty shaking, momma singing, none of that.  Then around noon, let's crank it up, just a tad, and move around just a little bit.
Dad had no problem finding the car at the train station, I was leaning out the window, and howling. Of course, everyone else knew where we were, I told mom it was better than texting!
I had every intention of getting up, I stretched, I circled around, stretched again, that was it. So now plans have changed, I have every intention of staying right here. Always be open to change.

I met the mail lady at the communal mailbox. I got a chance to sniff out the mail she was distributing. Mostly just flyers, envelopes, definitely no treats. My tail sent a few envelopes flying, but no harm done.
I guess you wouldn't call me dainty or lady like, when I drink my water, so I'm told. Maybe you could say, I drink with enthusiasm, and great sound effects.
The Victoria Secret models were on display last night. I got a little swagger, I could strut the dog walk. It's really all about the after party, and what they eat, that's where I'll be headed.
Any grocery bag that is on the floor, gets my full attention. Well, any bag, of any sort, gets my full attention. Just being inquisitive that's all, anything new is gonna get the once over.
I'm just not available, I'll admit it, I'm tired. So if you want to chat, catch up on the news, or just blah blah blah, it'll have to be later. Much later!

I wasn't going anywhere near the coyote decoy at the golf course, it's eyes were on me. I stick real close to dad, always checking to see if he's moved.  It keeps the geese away, I can understand why.
Dad took me to the golf course for a walk. Great place to chase squirrels, sniff and run around. I thought the second time around we could've used a golf cart, apparently that wasn't an option.

I'm thinking the angle of this picture tends to make me look a little heavy.  I'd say, yes, I have curves and a little insulation, but come on, it's winter. You may want to hone up on your picture taking skills.

I'm thinking about my wish list for Christmas. I don't need to include any necessities or sustainable things, such as cheese, bacon, chicken etc. These are all considered necessary for my well being. I might have to nap on this.

Yes, it true, I slept most of yesterday. It was raining, and I don't do rain. Oh I tore it up a bit inside, but overall I extended my naps. No harm done, I slept all night and now am commencing my first nap.
'Hello, it's me ....' Adel, oh I mean Miss Lilly. I tell mom that some songs are better left to the professionals, but no, moms got to put her spin it. Sorry Adel!
Oh it's Monday again, where should I begin. Maybe do a little dance, or bust a move, now I'm feeling it, I'm in the groove. Or maybe it's the kind of beat, that just makes me sleep.

Dad had is boring friends over to play bridge. I tried to entertain, my squeaky ball was at full pitch, I dragged a blanket around while barking, some of my finer moments. I don't know how they couldn't notice me.
I got caught going through the recycle bin. This wouldn't have happened, if I was given an opportunity to clean the chicken broth containers. Someone clearly wasn't thinking.
Dad called me a drama queen. He took me to get my nails done, then left. I was put on a platform, noose around my neck, then attacked with torture devices.  It was the worst three minutes ever.
I wish mom would eat salmon sandwiches more often. It's my favourite, I get as close as I can, I may drool, I lick my lips, I glare. Can't figure out why she doesn't eat them more often.
I'm just curious, why does mom put a book on her chair every time she gets up. It's breaking my rhythm of chair surfing. I'm also missing out on a fresh warm indent.
I'm very disappointed, let me tell you why. We had a family dinner, self serve, and I was third in line. This is where mom told me to get out of the kitchen. Who appointed her Queen.

I woke up this morning, thinking I'd be okay, then I realized it was Monday, oh please go away. Give me back my weekend, with those long lingering naps, then we won't have to deal with this Monday crap.
Do these wings accentuate my curves?  Most of the time I'm a little Angel, no trouble at all. Those other times, well, nothing really noteworthy comes to mind.

I'm preparing for winter by having an increased appetite. Don't want to get caught on a cold snowy day, with a thin frame, I need an extra layer to stay warm. This is a known fact, has been studied for years.

I was choosing my favourite cheese, it was between a two or a four year old cheddar. There was a clear winner, paws down, it was the four year old cheese. I like to be able to smell my cheese before I see it!
Today is a day of indoor activities. This morning I'll have a planning session, don't worry about the closed eyes, all part of the master plan. And the snoring, that's just the wheels turning.
Mom was swearing again, this time at a turnip. I'm not offended, as it involved a vegetable, now if was directed at the chicken, different matter. She really needs help, lack of control issues.
I rescued my rib bone from the garden, I couldn't wait for the spring harvest. Like many things, it started out as a good plan. Now on to plan B, I'll nap first, it helps formulate a plan of action!

So what you're really trying to say, it's Monday. It's like a sad song, the weekends gone. So what that means is, I'm gonna sleep, unless I hear the word treat. So if you don't have ham, then I suggest you scram!
I finally got this new throw off moms chair. By the time I dragged it around and buried my ball, with a lot of animated enthusiasm, I was exhausted. I also added a personal touch, hair and slobber.
Our thoughts and prayers to our friends in Paris. We have all felt the impact and hope for the safety for those involved. Together we all stand strong.
Yes, I'm getting up, eventually. I'm not on no fast track. But you go ahead and create your little whirlwind of activities.  I have my treat meter set for noon.
You may think I'm going outside, but I'm not, it's raining. But don't let me rain on your parade, you can go do your Fred Astaire routine, don't forget your umbrella âï¸

I'm in a dilemma, there's ham in the oven and I want to be close, or there's mom belting out You Ain't Nothing But A Hound Dog. Let's see, ham or, ear piercing, booty shaking mom. Well, it's all about the ham, I'll suffer!
The roast bone I had from Sunday is now planted in the garden. Hoping for a spring crop of prime rib bone bushes. Forget that flowery stuff, let's grow something with a little meat on it.

I've got a Monday kinda vibe, the kind that just doesn't jive. If you're planning for me to engage today, wait till noon, by then I'll be okay. I have a few hours to fill the gap, which I'm going to do with a nice long nap.
I have to conserve energy, there's a roast in the slow cooker and I've been promised a bone. I'm surprised by this generous offering, there's been mumblings about my figure.
There was a terrible ruckus coming from another room I had to investigate. I couldn't believe what I was seeing, mom singing 'Hanky Panky' while doing the Twist!  I may be permanently scarred!

Just a little yogurt on my ear, no big deal, just leave it alone. What you can do is back away with those wipes. I happen to have no issues with this, clearly you do, therefore your problem not mine. I strongly recommend therapy!
So let me understand something, the Canadian Government changed their Cabinet Ministers, will this in any way change my Treat Cabinet Policy. I don't think I can handle anymore cutbacks.
What...What, is there something on my face?  When you're out and about, strutting your stuff, this little line of drool is a confidence booster. It gives you swagger, it's all about the details!
I had to give mom 'the look'. You know the look, where your standards are being violated. After a walk, I expect fresh filtered water with ice! That's not asking a lot, I mean, come on!
Hello Monday, so we meet again, like a long lost friend. Maybe next time you'll give me call, then I'll let you know, I'm not available after all.

I'm taking my extra hour today by having another nap. It'll be a tight squeeze, but it's manageable. It was busy with Halloween, so today I'll just dial things down. For today just sit back and relax, I'm savouring the moment.
Trick or treat my fellow goblins and gremlins!  May tonight be all about the good treats, a bounty covered in cheese. Let there be  chicken tenders and beef jerky all doused in gravy. ððð
Our recycle bins went flying down the street, from the heavy winds. Next thing you see is my dad, in his pjs and slippers, running after them. Dads pjs are now trending in the neighbourhood.

My moms friend George Clooney, just added a basset hound to his family. Now this is where I'm to clarify, George never met my mom. This is someone who has everything, well almost, he's never met my mom!
It's been brought to my attention, that I'm a bit of a drama queen. Well, I do have a dramatic flair, and I am titled 'Miss'. So when it's all broken down, I suppose I do have some tendencies.

I'm going to organize my day without any complications. There will be no drama, hysterics, or belabouring. There will be laughter, high spirits, good karma, naps and treats. You are all welcome to join in!
Yes, I'll rally round and be engaging, later, much later. I'm just not feeling it, but you go ahead and be all chipper, the rest of us will just be honest.

I have my own special way to tell time, it's a simple formula really. It consists of five naps and seven treats per day. Depending on the circumstances there's room for flexibility, especially with the treats.

I think it's important to not be oblivious of others while you're eating. If you feel a penetrating stare with each bite, then there's a reason. It's actually very simple, I'm starving and you need to share.

Please do not disturb this dream. I'm in a land of cheese, aged of course, and with every step I stumble upon a new found treat. The sniffing is endless and my naps are only disturbed by wafting and lingering smells.
Why the big fuss when I get a little vocal inside.  Mom has this thing about inside and outside voices. Maybe she should consider some of her choices, like singing, and take it outside!
Mom what are you wearing, are you trying to channel your groovy days. A t-shirt that says 'Born To Be Wild', please, the only thing wild about you is your hair!
Ok, there's nothing to see here, so if you don't mind, everyone just move along. There has to be some element of surprise when planting treats!
There's no nice way to say this, but go away Monday. Mom said I had quite the girth. Not sure what that means, but throw a little gravy on it and I'll give it a try!
Dad and I went to the dump, I think it was to get rid of evidence. Mom ripped up all the plants and bushes, apparently getting ready for winter!  I think she has issues.
I have my Saturday plans all laid out, how about we meet for lunch and review the rest of the day. If you could just dial down the adrenaline, it's interfering with my personal space.
Mom calls me her little Angel, for I can do no wrong. I'm gentle, sweet, loveable, kind and beautiful. Just a reflection of my upbringing, the other side of the coin will be shared at a later time!
Not sure what the big deal is, I buried a treat in the garden. It's called planting a harvest for next spring. Without the fence I might have taken a few liberties!

Mom said I don't have the option to be fat and lazy. Well then I'd like to know what my list of options are. You know the Iron Dog option ain't happening, I'm thinking something closer to fat and lazy.
Mom tell me why that guy called me a wiener dog. I don't fall in the food category. If this guy fell in the food category, he'd be called pizza face!
It's a holiday Monday and I'll be here for awhile. Let's say around noon we have a turkey sandwich with stuffing and no crust, if it's not too much trouble.
Thank you to all my followers and friends. You've been so kind, generously shared your ups and downs, and most of all made us laugh and just plain feel good! Happy Thanksgiving ð¨ð¦

It's our Thanksgiving weekend!  I have so much to be thankful for. A weekend filled with great anticipation and expectation. They'll be turkey, gravy, stuffing, these are what great dreams are made of.
I don't see why my blanket needs to be washed all the time. Smells fine to me, the hair, the slobber, also not a problem. Maybe someone needs to address their own issues first.
I don't think moms flannel pjs can make it through another season. Calling them vintage or distressed does not make them fashionable. Sometimes you have to make a small sacrifice and move on.
Just doing some daydreaming, mom said if you're going to dream, always dream big. Moms dream was to sing and dance, the only thing that got in the way was talent!
Ok mom, look me in the eye and tell me why my treats are being monitored. Giving treats is a way of showing your love, denying me treats is sending the wrong message!
Why can't we have a Monday where we get a happy kinda feeling. Where you want to belt out a song, and do a little soft shoe, or in moms case a contorted jig!
This better be important, I'm not ready to receive the day. I'll need to finish my nap, pull myself together, then a full round of greetings will be granted. So if you don't mind!
Clear the schedule, today I'm freestylin'. I'll be in the middle of the action, the distraction or whatever else comes my way. Or let's say I'll be ready in a moments notice.
Mom, I saw this guy outside in shorts and it's mitten weather! Oh wait, it's only dad, it's ok, nothing newsworthy. Dad can do things like that, mom said he's a trendsetter!
Happy first day of mittens!  At least that's what mom says.  Next it'll be a whole line of accessories. I'm just fine, leave me out of this madness, as some say, I'm very well insulated!
It was raining, I had to go out, and I couldn't find the perfect spot. When I came in, mom blotted me with paper towels, then told me to suck it up buttercup! I'm not going out again!
Must you wrinkle your nose when I come in out of the rain. If you had put up a canopy we wouldn't be having this conversation. I think your sense of smell is tuned to a different station.
I have a tight schedule this morning, so if you need anything, well, it'll have to wait. Let's just plan to meet up at lunch, a salmon sandwich would be nice, thanks.
Mom, Dad, I want to say thanks for the piece of steak you gave me. Today I'm going to repay you by being sweet and adorable.  I won't be getting into any trouble, just wake me if you need anything!
There was a fairly large box on the floor with two corners chewed  off, this is where all eyes were  turned to me.  Option two, there are varmints loose in the house. Your choice, you choose!
I was just minding my own business, when out of nowhere I heard this loud ear piercing noise, oh that was just mom singing! Hopefully this doesn't break any noise violations!
Today I suggested we try something different, this is not what I had in mind. Hope you're enjoying yourself, go ahead laugh it up! What I do for your amusement.

For the record, I was not afraid of the grasshopper.  I went in close to investigate, then he suddenly jumped over my head. I got into an attack position and started barking, there was a slight scene. Look whose scared now grasshopper!

Sharing should be an automatic response, you know, sharing is caring. So in order to avoid, begging, staring, whining, barking or other creative tactics, just give it up.  Let the sharing spirit move you!

I'm not getting up today, mom raised her voice at me for being over enthusiastic. She has issues with loud noises or something like that, she might want to seek some help. It's not right to dampen ones spirit!
I'm glad it's Sunday, and I'm glad I get the whole couch to myself. Of course I'll share, as you can see there are a couple of corners available. If you provide a chin rub we'll get along just fine.
Here's a simple house rule, when you're making chicken soup, wake me up. Now if you're cooking beets let me sleep!

There seems to be a situation here, my ball is on the table and I can't reach it. Without any further questions about how it ended up on the table, I would ask for some assistance. It's now your move!
Go on ahead mom, I'll catch up in awhile!  I just need a break, what's the hurry anyway. It's you that's always wanting to stop and smell the roses, now start smelling!

I'm ready for battle, mom is chasing a wasp with a flyswatter. That's when I heard it "wack", and there it lay belly up!  I did a full investigation, poised in attack position and a full round of barking! We eliminated the threat!
Pardon me, just getting up and around. You may think I sleep a lot, but no, I'm in a contemplative state. I have a lot to do, it's just all about pacing yourself!
It's Monday, I'm tired, I got drool on my face, and I just don't care. Maybe by noon I'll clean up and start to care, or maybe I'll wait for Tuesday!
Mom if you could turn off the rain today it would be much appreciated. Take the morning to figure it out, then when I get up we could go for a walk. Getting wet is not an option today!
I was a little inconvenienced this morning, it was raining and I really had to do my business. Next time  maybe you could put up a canopy, nothing elaborate, just a little shelter would be nice.

I was thinking of getting up, had every intention of moving. Then I thought, what's the hurry, slow it down, it'll be there when I get up. It's all about priorities and mine right now is to finish what I started.
Why can't we have shampoos that smell more enticing, maybe along the lines of sizzling bacon,  pot roast and gravy. This might make the spa experience something to look forward to!
I recovered from my bath, after the torturous bath, I went for a walk and roll. Mom said I spent more time with my paws in the air instead of on the ground. Recovery is a process.
I'm living with people who delve into cruel activities.  I had a bath, which was totally unnecessary, and the hovering flies meant nothing.
I'm holding out for bacon today, there will be no begging, non of the usual antics. There will be an expectation, all guests have the right to a big breakfast. This is something dreams are made of!

Hello, I'm Miss Lilly reporting from under the dining table. So far nothing, not a darn thing has dropped or been offered. Tough crowd!  Excuse me while I make another round, maybe try some nudging and a small whimper!

I'm sensing the perfect combination, long weekend, houseguests, party, this can only mean one thing, bacon!  The only thing that could go wrong is if they throw in a bath, therefore I'm keeping a low profile!

We are #1 on a top ten list of the Stinkiest Dogs!  It doesn't get any better than that. Now in order to maintain and celebrate, I suggest we get out there and start rolling, lets do one for the team!

We were tagged by @triciamonster to list 5 facts about my mom/dad. This is about by dad:
1.  Taking long walks 2. Reading 3. Golf 4. Solving equations 5. Sneaking treats (my personal favourite). I'm going to tag @ladymaethebasset @ikahandaja @hessm24 to tell us 5 facts about mom/dad.
I'm not getting up!  If you are going to the park, I'll take under consideration. Throw in some cheese than you have my attention.
Day 1 of black and white challenge. Thank you @triciamonster  I would like to nominate @baskett.thebasset @alfredthebasset
I didn't get to go to the neighbours party, it was a family event. And by calling the neighbour lady 'mom', apparently didn't qualify me as family!
Wait a second, did you see what's going on down the street. Looks like a party of some sort, could be a BBQ. Mom, get the leash we're going for a walk!
Mom has this great idea that we would play fetch. She would throw the ball, then I would watch her fetch, interesting concept. Who am I to judge!
Move it, hurry up, let's go, you know what, I'm just not feeling it. You go ahead and I'll be along eventually. Oh yeah, go ahead and say rabbit, I'm on to that one to!
I'm not really afraid of the dark, I'm just inspired to walk close to mom and dad, for their safety. The smells are different at night, they are not those lingering ones.
It's Saturday and I'm sure you've got lots of plans, so go ahead, I'll catch up with you later. But if you really want my attention, you rattle those pots and pans!
Quick let me off the leash, we are under attack, there's a piece of plastic floating down the street. It's recycle day and a little windy, which in some circumstances can cause concern!
Come on mom, let's get going, those bunnies aren't going to chase themselves. I have things to do, bunnies to chase, grass to sniff, let's go let's go!
I met a Great Dane on my walk, I said hello to his knees, we touched noses, then I ran circles around him! All in all I thought it went well!  Happy National Dog Day â¤ï¸
I don't like the word 'stay ', it always means I'm not invited. I think we should be embracing the word inclusive. Give me one good reason I can't go golfing!
There's just something about being bright and chipper on a Monday morning. Don't impose this kind of behaviour on others. Be cautious, tread lightly, be weary, but of course, smile ever so gently!
There should be a house rule, when making cream cheese frosting, I get to lick the beaters!  It should be a reportable offence, mom, you are now on notice!
Hello, it's just me, Miss Lilly. Just doing a little undercover surveillance on the current bunny situation. I gotta try something different, mix things up, but know this, I'm coming for you!
It Monday, I have a full schedule today. Just going to take a moment to prioritize my list, and you know you are at the top of the list!
I was worried about my competition until I realized the picture on this blanket was mine!  It was my first IG picture.
This next book is called "Wild", an adventure along the Pacific Crest Trail. There's a lot of buzz about this book therefore I'm onboard!

Still making the final decision for my next book selection. Tomorrow by noon I will announce my choice. Today is the day I submit my latest idea. How about golf courses open their memberships to the whole family. Just think of the long walks and the chasing of squirrels!  Yes, I think I'm on to something!!
I think we can all agree on something, vacuums are noisy creepy crawlers. Inventors unite and come up with something that is hound friendly.
Decided on a detective story by Michael Connelly "The Burning Room". I like the cat and mouse chase. Day 5 B+W.

I was tagged by @beatricethebasset to share five facts about my mama: 1. Loves to laugh 2. Loves to read 3. Works out 4. Listens to jukebox oldies 5.  Favourite movie When Harry Met Sally. Now I would like to tag @spike.the.bassethound @albert_lord_basset @winstonthebasset It's your turn.
It's Sunday morning and I have no plans so far.  I always make myself available if someone needs help, it's all about the offer!

This is what really happened, I saw my treat bag at the edge of the counter. In order to secure its safety I jumped up to nudge it. This is where mom comes in. No treats were consumed during this incident.
I'm a little busy right now, I have reserved this time to catch up on a few things. I'd really appreciate it if you would call first, then maybe I could squeeze you into my busy schedule!

This little ribbon of drool is nothing, just a teaser. Once I get walking that's when the real adornment starts. I shake it to and fro, round and round it goes, careful where you stand, cause I don't know where it will land!
It's going to be another super hot day, so my expectations and yours may differ!  I want to go out, but then I want back in. I'm thinking maybe some indoor activities much later in the afternoon!
Monday Monday why so blue, is it because we hate you!  If only there was something to look forward to, then maybe we would appreciate you! Titled:  Monday Blues.

Mom, when you're telling a story it's important to get it right. I saw the bunny, everything in that moment froze, I tore off in a flash.  Around a tree, down alongside a house, I was bobbing and weaving or just plain dazzling. If it wasn't for the fence it would have been a completely different ending!
Contrary to what some may say, I don't smell every blade of grass. Yes, I may linger at times over a good piece of news and you should respect that!  Do I yank your book away!
This isn't what you think, I'm just gathering evidence. This section of the garden is beyond repair at this point, so a little sunbathing shouldn't present any problems.
#tbt  I'm just a young pup, a barely developed sassy attitude. Watching mom and dad trying to anticipate my every need, yeah, this is going to work out!

For the record, I was so close to catching a bunny I saw his fur quiver. I was poised, front foot up, tail in attack position, then action. Of course he knew I was on leash, which clearly gave him the advantage.
All clear mom, I haven't seen hide nor "hare" of anything. Mom dumped all the dog hair from the vacuum into the garden, haven't seen a bunny since! Of course it could be the extra patrols.
You shouldn't be required to do anything on a Monday, everyone knows that. I'm napping right into Tuesday. Ok, there may be the occasional treat, but that's it!

I happened to pickup a baby bird that fell out of the tree. Dad was chasing me in his pjs, mom was yelling get some cheese and a neighbour came out in his pjs to watch the excitement. It was an unfortunate incident for the baby bird.
I'm laying in the ruins of the garden, the plant by my head should have fill this area. Oh well, now a great place to sun, oh I mean to protect and get rid of all varmints!
Mom said the reason the bunnies are giving me the slip, is because they can smell me coming. I'm not sure I like the sound of that, and this better not be a prelude to a bath.
I'm thinking good ideas are only good ideas if they are good. I have a little more thinking to do on this theory.
Come here bunny, here bunny bunny, I have a nice treat for you. We can play together, share some snacks, nothing to worry about. Get your furry little ass out here!!
All clear, just finished garden patrols. I'm now officially a threat to the bunnies, I've entered their safe haven. In the mornings I get to lick the water of the plants, that's call a bonus!
On my walk someone asked what was on my nose, like they didn't know what a wrap around line of drool was!  Probably a good thing they weren't there when I did a shake and sent it flying all over!
You don't have to tell me it's a Monday, I'm picking up on that vibe. Even though it's a holiday, Monday is still a Monday!
Now that I have garden access, it's important to familiarize myself with what I'm protecting. Behind this plant is where the bunny goes, step aside everyone, I'm going in!
I now have added responsibilities in the garden. A section of the fence has been removed to allow me access. I'm to chase away the rabbits. All in good time, they'll be there when I get up!

I thought everything was going great, a family trip to the pet store. Then wham, a surprise nail clipping. I saw mom hiding in the aisles, ducking down, not making eye contact. I'm a bit of a drama queen but it was the worst three minutes ever!

Mom and I were sharing a special moment. She would bite off a piece of apple for me, I would ever so gently accept it. That was until she got up and realize I was spitting out the apple. Didn't want to spoil the moment!
I suppose I could make up an elaborate story about how the flower dust ended up on my face, but I won't.  Or I could use moms line, I was just embracing the moment!  No harm done!
What do you mean I'm attracting flies!  Of course, this is all leading up to a bath. When I enter a room I like to make an entrance, but mom said it shouldn't be my smell that enters first!
If it's Monday morning and you see my eyes closed, I'd suggest you ease on out of the room. The saying, let sleeping dogs lie, all started as a result of a Monday morning.
Yes, there are a few things I have to work on, I'm told. My greetings are a little over the top, my inner spirit running wild. Apparently, I shouldn't jump up or howl, or a combination of both!

Weekends are about pacing yourselves, don't go all out at the start. You have to ease into it, savour each moment, these moments turn into memories. As mom keeps saying, embrace the moment, my specialty!
I'm doing some weekend planning, sometimes you just have to be open to new ideas. With your paws in the air you just might catch some inspiration!

Mom says I have an internal clock, of course it doesn't work until later in the day. It seems to know when mom wants to sits down and relax, and I want to play, lets hide the ball under the furniture!
I like to help around the house, if it wasn't for my hair and slobber on the floor, what would you have to clean up. Love is shown in many ways!

It was total chaos yesterday, my old bed was removed in preparation for my new queen size bed!  The good news was I found a ball and a biscuit.  Of course I had to bark every time something was moved out of place, it was exhausting!
I'm having Monday kinda thoughts, if you know what I mean. It's go away, leave me alone, move along kinda thing. By noon I'll be my sunny self.

Bunny chasing is exciting, either they are very fast or I'm too slow. I'm on high alert on my walks, the word rabbit is highly motivating, I think mom uses it to keep me moving along. Sometimes I like to lay down and rest.

Just trying to get a little shuteye here, so just go on about your business. I'm sure you have some words of wisdom or lifestyle choices or life lessons, and you'll have my full attention later, much later.

Today's plan is to keep it simple. Starting off with my nap, leading into a stretch of sunbathing and of course helping with chores around the house. It's important to always be available if help is required!

Mom has a special way to communicate. Lets say, for example, I'm a little too enthusiastic, mom just gives me "the look", and if necessary points her finger at me. I seem to know what that means. Dad thinks moms possessed!

I forgot all about my bath when I saw a rabbit. Mom let go of the leash, so I was on a full on adrenaline chase. There was prey in the air, an abundance of furry little creatures. Throw in a chipmunk and you have a great walk!
I like to kick back, relax and catch a few rays. There will be day dreaming of bunny chasing, treat begging and a whole lotta sniffing. It'll be a full day!  #TongueOutTuesday

Let's talk about what you refer to as the "walk". It should be referred to as the "yank and pull", with the occasional drag. And of course, thanks for the generous lingerings, while I try to get the lay of the land!
It's fly hunting season, so I've been a little busy. There will be casualties and windows are in the middle of the war zone. Any good battle will result in slobber all over the windows and screens!
Did you just say treat, because that's what I heard. Now that you have my attention we should probably discuss meal plans for today. I'd like you to be open to some new ideas!

There's been rumblings, hints and suggestions about a bath. I'm just fine the way I am, it's not my problem but yours, so you deal with it. And that fancy schmancy shampoo, well you know what you can do with that!
#tbt Some times you just need to throw on a ball cap and set your pretty aside!  Go Jays Go â¾ï¸
Sometimes you just have to sit back and relax. Just watch the crazy go by. Speaking of crazy, if you're done with your picture taking, just move along.

Sorry mom, can't come in just yet!  There's scandalous activity at the neighbours and my attention is required!  One lady moving out, another one hoovering in the wings, this one is too busy to notice me yet!
By my calculations we are five naps and seven treats away from Tuesday. Therefore, 25 naps and 35 treats away until the weekend!  Of course it's a rough calculation, circumstances may change!

I like to greet everyone with the same enthusiasm.  It's a whole body greeting with a lot of moving parts, sometimes it can become quite vocal. That's all just part of my charm, mom calls it irresistible!
Happy July 4th to our friends across the border ðºð¸. In celebration I think we need to fire up the BBQ and have a beverage!  Hate to miss out on a party!

I've got a busy day, neighbours need to be watched, gotta catch a few rays, but first I must prepare. You can't go into this blindly, planning is key to any successful day, which of course, starts around noon!
Who decided that we should no longer have full service gas stations in the area!  I don't get a free biscuit and mom has to figure out how these contraptions work!
Happy Canada Day ð¨ð¦ðð. As a day of celebration I would certainly expect maybe ribs, burgers or steak. Just throwing it out there, these things don't plan themselves!
If I keep watching maybe my friends will come back!  Mom, did you know the neighbour has a new lady friend. I'll let you know if I see any suspicious activity.

Today is all about recovery from the weekend. I showed my pug friends how to sniff out the best smells, not sure about their technique!  I especially liked showing them how to get drool all over your face! Some of my better qualities!
My visiting cousins from Toronto. They are big city visiting the suburbs of Kingston. I shared my couch and treats, I even let Abby wear my bows!  @pugs_in_the_city
I like outdoor activities but if you think that little pool and hose are on my list forget it. Go have your fun, I'm not moving.
Oh excuse me, I'm just getting ready for our guests!  As they say, you caught me without my makeup on!  No idea what that means, just something us girls say!

Wait a second, did I hear right, I'm expecting guests?  Well let's get going, we need to stock up. Ok, here's the list:  treats, bacon, cheese, ribs, more treats!  I'll start with a nap, I'm sure I'm forgetting something. #tbt

Please continue, you were saying. @rowdy_blue has asked to see a #noseyshot and @jogibearandboobootoo asked for #superupcloseselfie. I have tagged others if you would like to participate. Thanks so much!
I'm making time to catch up on a few books that are piling up. A favorite author of mine is Harlan Coben, it's a 'who done it' called "Stay Close". Never disappoints.
Another book with a lot of buzz is Still Alice by Lisa Genova. It's about a portrait of Alzheimer's, always important to stay informed. You just never know!
You thought you had it goin' on, you knew what's what, then you got a Basset. "It's a Basset Thing".

I was nominated to share 20 facts about me @bassetcalledrory 
1. DOB Jun.15,2012. 2. Wt 45 lbs. 3.  Eyes like fathers. 4.  Looks like grandma. 5.  Likes "aged" cheese. 6.  Have right of way if washing floors. 7.  Fresh water twice daily with ice. 8.  After walk expects 3 chicken strips. 9.  Don't like anything out of order. 10.  Hates bath. 11. Is a drama queen when nails are done. 12.  Allowed treat after one fake pee. 13.  My choice where I sleep. 14.  Calls shot gun in truck. 15.  Expects walks on time. 16.  Likes to sleep till noon. 17.  Option to invade personal space. 18.  If snow not cleared off deck than pee zone. 19.  Allowed to lick plate if covered in gravy. 20. Expects help up on furniture shouldn't have to give the look. 
Would you like to share 20 things
@tawny.tee @zoe_the_basset @olivethe_basset
Today is about reflection, where I've been, where I'm going.  EXCUSE ME, cheese over here, always helps with the process!
I'm just taking today to think about tomorrow! If I need you I'll let you know.
Today I'm going to sit back and watch the crazy go by!
Relax, chill out, have a seat. I like to model good behaviour!  That's my gift from me to you.
I'm all tucked in for another read. Can't resist James Patterson featuring Alex Cross. Never disappoints!
Just me and a friend, hanging out and catching up. Thinking of ways to get treat. Faked a pee once and it worked, may try that again!
If you want to laugh or just want to feel good then read "Still Foolin' 'Em" by Billy Crystal. It's even worth a second read.
Tis the season. This is for their amusement only!
Day 2 B+W. Any book by Mitch Albom is worth reading, he is a gifted writer. My favourite is Tuesdays With Morrie.  His books are like a measuring stick for life.
Did you ever start out to go some place and just forgot where you were going. Just give me a few minutes, it'll come to me.
Today will be about making decisions. What do I like best, cheese or chicken strips?  If you give me both it will help with the process!!
Don't come to me on a Monday morning with a math question. I work for the Idea Dept. and I'm working on one right!  I'm in the pondering zone.

Thanks for the nomination @bassetcalledrory I'm just contemplating life, waiting for the next big idea! To share what your doing at this second I nominate @floppy_pete @_sgl_glass @maple_sadie_basset_sisters #whatimdoingthissecond #mylife
I might have had a spirited romp inside, then I get, if you choose the behaviour, then you choose the consequence. So I was given a chew stick to calm down, life is good!

The sky's are making thunderous noises and crackling light bolts. Therefore I'm not getting up until all is clear. Dads golf course closed because of the downpour, so we should be able to hang out together. #TongueOutTuesday
Did I happen to notice the freshly waxed floors, they are in consistent need of praise. Yes, I noticed, but do I care. Oops that was my inside voice!
I'm doing a little research right now, please knock before you come in. Give me a couple of hours, working on an idea.
I'm going to change the face of Monday, shake things up. I'll be move'n and a groove'n. Of course this'll start in the afternoon, there's a lot of prep work required to make any change.
The next book selection is by James Patterson, from his "Private" collection. This one is "Private India". Always a great read, love all his books.

Today is the first day of summer and Fathers Day!  So this day is all about you dad, lets forget about my bath. I say we have a big breakfast, watch golf all day and nap. This is all for you of course!

Lets set the record straight, I sleep the required amount of time and nap in between. Napping is a time of reflection, planning and overall good health. We all do it, I just do it with me eyes closed and a tiny bit of snoring.
What's with these slow cookers?  I call it a slow torture device. All day those lingering smells, to what end, nothing.
I'm reading American Sniper by Chris Kyle. Very insightful, a view into something most of us wouldn't normally have access.
I'll be busy today, it's laundry day. I like to contribute to the household chores, every little bit helps. Many hands make light work, or as mom say, many paws makes more work!
It's important to be aware of your surroundings, as soon as someone gives up their seat, I'm there. The indents and warmth are key!

Wishing all my IG friends a happy and healthy new year!  Thanks for being so generous with the good times, and sometimes sad.  You have made us laugh and warmed our hearts.  Glad to be a part of your community!! ðð
Caught me in the power seat!  I swear my thought process changes in this chair. Don't come to me with a problem, come to me with a solution. See what I mean!!
I ask you, is it ok to say "you stink", even if it's said in that sweet lilting voice?  What's with that!  You don't get to smell this good without working at it!
Another favourite author, John Grisham. I started with The Firm and never looked back. Always thought provoking. Never disappoints.
What's with the scheduled treats?  It's not like I'm asking for full access, but we could start there!  Something about my weight, blah blah blah!!!
Some books are not for everyone. This book was recommend by someone close. Looked at the introduction, then lost interest. Then got tired.
Enjoying a little warmth from the sun. Decided to read Private Vegas by James Patterson. I love his Private collection.
You have about 30 seconds to give me the purpose of this hat. And do it with a straight face.
It's Monday morning, apparently the festivities are starting early. My inside voice is saying get a life!
For our young readers, John Grisham, has come out with books featuring Theodore Boone. An enjoyable read, very entertaining.

We were nominated by @lifewithbuck and @rowdy_blue to share a #blackandwhite and a #whatareyoudoingrightnow photo. Miss Lilly is napping, like most days until about noon. I would like to nominate, if you would like:  @willowthebasset @remy_the_basset_ @babyrufuss
When I look out the window, I wonder why everyone gets pizza delivered and we don't?  Even the guy across the street gets pizza, must be game night with beers.

"Little Doggie" who now is 26+ years old, comes out each Christmas season and placed in the Christmas tree.  In the early years it's ears were chewed on, it's has been wash and mended many times over. It was a favourite toy now brought out each year to be honoured.
In a perfect world there would be treats at the end of every rainbow. Happy Friday â¤ï¸
Yes, I'm creeping into Monday. I get my Creep'n on when I know if someone is leaving me alone. Don't know why I can't go, I'll try to blend in, won't be any trouble.
At our family dinner my uncle asked where was the meat in the lasagna, and what's with the green stuff. All good questions, but why ask for ketchup?
#tbt. This was back in the good olÃ© days when I was allowed to share space in the gardens. A few flowers were sacrificed in the making of the picture!

I'll be unavailable till further notice.  I have a couple of naps to catch up on. And don't choose this time to sneak cheese or a piece of ham, because I'll know. #tongueouttuesday

Happy Super Bowl Sunday ðð! For the record I have no involvement in the deflate-gate.
I like to have fun and be silly, especially with my ball. Yes, sometimes it goes under the furniture and I have to ask for help. Apparently how I ask is questionable!
Make no mistake, I'm listening. I'm reading a book by Chevy Stevens called That Night. It's a new author to me. I'll let you know.
Happy Valentines Day â¤ï¸â¤ï¸ will love you unconditionally!
Happy Friday the 13th!  Be careful what you lick outside, we are in a deep freeze. Stay safe and warm.
Never give up on someone just because you don't like the results!  There's always next year, Go Leafs!!
There's a family wedding today, I'm ready in case I get the call!  I'm available if the bride needs anything!
I was asked by @triciamonster to post a #blackandwhite photo, thank you. Would you like to post a picture: @dukethebassethound @dukebasset @mackthebasset
I'm tired, if you don't make eye contact, then they might go away!  At least until I hear movement in the kitchen!
Yes, I like to think I'm a good listener, I just don't always agree. Incentives will help support your view!

We were tagged by @gotmaryd1011 to tell our nickname for Miss Lilly. It's not really a nickname but she hears this in almost every sentence, "you're a good girl ", and she is!  We'd love to know your nickname @ohio216girl @lucyandelvis14 @mollithebasset
When I'm ready to get up, I have two words I'm going to use, please and thank you!  Please may I have a treat, thank you!  Don't forget to use the look, you know the "look"!!
This is how I deal with the day, I get up, deal with what I have, then make the best of it!  Now off for a walk!
It's Monday morning, face your fears then move on!  I was nominated by @melmoer for a stop drop selfie. I will nominate @missbassetpumpkin @bruinthebasset @winnie.the.hound for a stop drop selfie.

It's Friday my friends!  Always be thoughtful of what you say, you never know, it could lead to a treat!
Merry Christmas to all my IG friends. Looking forward to sharing time with everyone.
Not sure what's so funny this morning. These people need serious one-on-one help!
It's Sunday, a day set aside to reflect on priorities. Sometimes we forget we have a choice. Right now I'm tired, I choose to sleep a little more before my next nap!
I watched the Red Carpet!  Thought I'd do a Glamour inspired photo shot, Glam by Miss Lilly!
It's Saturday, and you want to know what's on my agenda! Nothing, absolutely nothing!
Yes, I am grateful, my mom shovelled a portion of the yard so her Princess could have a royal poop!  Yes I'm very grateful!
I have things to do, places to go, people to meet, just not now!

Groundhogs shouldn't get a vote!  This year their popularity vote is zero. Unless they have something nice to say don't come out!
I'm all ears, say what you gotta say. Sometimes if you just listen you'd be surprised what you learn!
Yes, another red carpet for the Grammy's. I choose a subtle look, wanted to blend in. Listen to what makes you feel good!
With age comes wisdom, moms quote after my birthday. Meaning I suppose there will be certain expectations (blah blah blah). I'm thinking that probably wasn't the mature thing to say!
I find that with a title comes responsibilities. Yes, "Miss" can open doors, I can't always rely on looks and personality, of course they are my first option!

Pardon me, just getting up and around. I'm not at my full potential until the afternoon, so hold all complicated issues till then. #tongueouttuesday
I'd like to discuss my benefit package, and I mean the fine print. The part that mentions all treats, inclusive is the key word, to me that means bacon and pizza.
Saturday's are kind of busy, catching up on things that need to get done. I'm taking my time to put a list together, this usually takes till noon. Until then I'd like some quiet time.
When someone says no more treats, I hear treats. When they say walk in half an hour, I hear walk. Someone has to work on their communication skills.

It's hump day, I just need a few more minutes. Everyone wants a piece of you, all in good time!
Another mitten day!  I'm missing my long walks, which really means not getting as many treats!  You just have to be more creative during these cold and snowy days.
This book by Stephen King was on the top 100 books of the year for 2014, thought I'd give it a try. I'm halfway through and I can see why it made the list. Good read!

Apparently, I can't have a special treat unless my walk is substantial. I get a chicken strip for a moderate walk.  The Treat Police have now set standards. A five minute sniffing walk falls short of getting my Texas Taffy.
I like to laugh but sometimes these people are a little over the top, not everything is funny, as you can see! I find they're easily amused.

All I could hear was "there's a deer in the yard, look, look", and of course I ran to have a look. This was followed by a giggling 'April Fools '. Look whose laughing.

I'm dreaming of spring, of long walks and trips to the park. I surround myself with inspiration!
Let's change how we think about Monday's!  Why not have bacon on Monday, something to look forward to, I like that 'Bacon Monday '. Has a nice ring to it.
Happy Friday!  I find if your interested you become interesting, if you're bored you become boring!  You choose!
Someone come and look at this, the guy across the street is ironing! Who does that?
The easiest thing about exercise is finding an excuse not to, the hardest thing is showing up. Just do it!  On that note, happy Monday!!

With being inside more I've had to change my strategy, numerous fake pees don't work. I've added a few dance performances, one I call the biscuit dance. â¤ï¸
Yes, I have lots to do. Looking for the next available recently vacated seat, the endless monitoring of hidden treats. Let's not forget the kitchen watch. Yes, my plate is full. Happy Hump Day!

I refuse to look at you. I thought I was going to get treats and we ended up at the vets for a booster shot. And to top it off he said I was too heavy. So now dad and I are on treat restrictions and increased activity.
Last night I might've partied like there was no tomorrow. Today I will recover like a basset, no chair is safe!
